name: account
summary: Used in the accounting section in chart of accounts.  Not related to patient accounts in any way.

columns.name: AccountNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: AcctType
columns.summary: Enum:AccountType Asset, Liability, Equity,Revenue, Expense

columns.name: BankNumber
columns.summary: For asset accounts, this would be the bank account number for deposit slips.

columns.name: Inactive
columns.summary: Set to true to not normally view this account in the list.

columns.name: IsRetainedEarnings
columns.summary: This will be set true for exactly one account, and it can't be changed.  On the Balance Sheet report, this special account will also contain the sum of all expenses and income for all previous years.

name: accountingautopay
summary: In the accounting section, this automates entries into the database when user enters a payment into a patient account.  This table presents the user with a picklist specific to that payment type.  For example, a cash payment would create a picklist of cashboxes for user to put the cash into.

columns.name: AccountingAutoPayNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PayType
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.

columns.name: PickList
columns.summary: FK to account.AccountNum.  AccountNums separated by commas.  No spaces.

name: activeinstance
summary: ActiveInstances are used to track OD sessions.

columns.name: ActiveInstanceNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: ComputerNum
columns.summary: FK to Computers.ComputerNum

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to Userod.UserNum

columns.name: ProcessId
columns.summary: Windows Process ID of the Open Dental instance

columns.name: DateTimeLastActive
columns.summary: Last datetime that was activity was recorded

columns.name: DateTRecorded
columns.summary: The time at which we recorded DateTimeLastActive. This is not a TimeStamp column because we need to update it even if nothing else in the row changed.

columns.name: ConnectionType
columns.summary: Enum:ConnectionTypes Used to distinguish the connection type.

name: adjustment
summary: An adjustment in the patient account.  Usually, adjustments are very simple, just being assigned to one patient and provider.  But they can also be attached to a procedure to represent a discount on that procedure.  Attaching adjustments to procedures is not automated, so it is not very common.

columns.name: AdjNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: AdjDate
columns.summary: The date that the adjustment shows in the patient account.

columns.name: AdjAmt
columns.summary: Amount of adjustment.  Can be pos or neg.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: AdjType
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: AdjNote
columns.summary: Note for this adjustment.

columns.name: ProcDate
columns.summary: Procedure date.  Not when the adjustment was entered.

columns.name: ProcNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum.  Only used if attached to a procedure.  Otherwise, 0.

columns.name: DateEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

columns.name: StatementNum
columns.summary: FK to statement.StatementNum.  Only used when the statement in an invoice.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

columns.name: TaxTransID
columns.summary: (Deprecated) Holds the Avalara transaction ID associated with this adjustment so that we can track reported adjustments. Not editable in the UI.

name: alertcategory
summary: A grouping of alert types that you can subscribe to. The alert types are stored as AlertCategoryLink rows attached to each category. Users can make their own custom categories by copying existing ones.

columns.name: AlertCategoryNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: IsHQCategory
columns.summary: False by default, indicates that this is a category that can not be edited or deleted. When a copy of a category is made, the copy changes this value from true to false.

columns.name: InternalName
columns.summary: Name used by HQ to identify the type of alert category this started as, allows us to associate new alerts.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Name displayed to user when subscribing to alerts categories.

name: alertcategorylink
summary: Each row is an alert type for an alertcategory. Users can change which types are attached to custom categories.

columns.name: AlertCategoryLinkNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: AlertCategoryNum
columns.summary: FK to AlertCategory.AlertCategoryNum.

columns.name: AlertType
columns.summary: Enum:AlertType Identifies what types of alert this row is associated to.

name: alertitem
summary: Any row in this table will show up in the main menu of Open Dental to get the attention of the user. The user can click on the alert and take an action.  The actions available to the user are also determined in this row.

columns.name: AlertItemNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Can be 0 or -1. -1 indicates show the alert in all clinics.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: What is displayed in the menu item.

columns.name: Type
columns.summary: Enum:AlertType Identifies what type of alert this row is.

columns.name: Severity
columns.summary: Enum:SeverityType The severity will help determine what color this alert should be in the main menu.

columns.name: Actions
columns.summary: Enum:ActionType Bitwise flag that represents what actions are available for this alert.

columns.name: FormToOpen
columns.summary: Enum:FormType The form to open when the user clicks "Open Form".

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: A FK to a table associated with the AlertType.  0 indicates not in use.

columns.name: ItemValue
columns.summary: Like description, but more specific. When set use ActionType.ShowItemValue to show this variable within a MsgBoxCopyPaste window.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to Userod.UserNum.  Will only be shown to that specific user.  0 is all users.

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: Date this row was added to the database. Not editable by the user

columns.name: AlertReadNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: AlertItemNum
columns.summary: FK to alertitem.AlertItemNum.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

name: alertsub
summary: Subscribes a user and optional clinic to specific alert types.  Users will not get alerts unless they have an entry in this table.

columns.name: AlertSubNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Can be 0.

columns.name: Type
columns.summary: Deprecated.

columns.name: AlertCategoryNum
columns.summary: FK to alertcategory.AlertCategoryNum.

name: allergy
summary: An allergy attached to a patient and linked to an AllergyDef.

columns.name: AllergyNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: AllergyDefNum
columns.summary: FK to allergydef.AllergyDefNum

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

columns.name: Reaction
columns.summary: Adverse reaction description.  When importing from eForms, this is where the allergy name goes for "Other" when there's no match.

columns.name: StatusIsActive
columns.summary: True if still an active allergy.  False helps hide it from the list of active allergies.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: To be used for synch with web server for CertTimelyAccess.

columns.name: DateAdverseReaction
columns.summary: The historical date that the patient had the adverse reaction to this agent.

columns.name: SnomedReaction
columns.summary: Snomed code for reaction.  Optional and independent of the Reaction text field.  Not needed for reporting.  Only used for CCD export/import.

name: allergydef
summary: An allergy definition.  Gets linked to an allergy and patient.  Allergies will not show in CCD messages unless they have a valid Medication (that has an RxNorm) or UniiCode.

columns.name: AllergyDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Name of the drug.  User can change this.  If an RxCui is present, the RxNorm string can be pulled from the in-memory table for UI display in addition to the Description.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: Because user can't delete.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: The last date and time this row was altered.  Not user editable.

columns.name: SnomedType
columns.summary: Enum:SnomedAllergy SNOMED Allergy Type Code.  Only used to create CCD in FormSummaryOfCare.

columns.name: MedicationNum
columns.summary: FK to medication.MedicationNum.  Optional, only used with CCD messages.

columns.name: UniiCode
columns.summary: The Unii code for the Allergen.  Optional, but there must be either a MedicationNum or a UniiCode.  Used to create CCD in FormSummaryOfCare, or set during CCD allergy reconcile.

name: apikey
summary: Used to keep track of Customer's API Key and Developer's name. Just a copy from OD HQ for convenience.

columns.name: APIKeyNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: CustApiKey
columns.summary: Customer's API key.

columns.name: DevName
columns.summary: Developer's name, exactly as they entered it in FHIR developer portal.

name: apisubscription
summary: A subscription by an API client that requests events to be fired for db changes or ui actions. Events are currently sent blindly. In the future, we could support acking for db events, but not very useful for ui events.

columns.name: ApiSubscriptionNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: EndPointUrl
columns.summary: This is the URL endpoint to which events will be sent.

columns.name: Workstation
columns.summary: Name of the workstation that will fire events. Blank if you want all workstations to fire events.

columns.name: CustomerKey
columns.summary: API Key the subscribing developer gave the customer. There can be multiple 3rd parties products for one database, each with their own key.

columns.name: WatchTable
columns.summary: Enum: EnumWatchTable, stored as string

columns.name: PollingSeconds
columns.summary: Frequency of database polling, in seconds.

columns.name: UiEventType
columns.summary: Enum: EnumApiUiEventType, stored as string.

columns.name: DateTimeStart
columns.summary: When the subscription started. This gets updated each time db is polled so that it represents the start of the date range for the next polling.

columns.name: DateTimeStop
columns.summary: When the subscription will expire. MinVal 01-01-0001 if no expiration.

name: appointment
summary: Appointments can show in the Appointments module, or they can be on the unscheduled list.  An appointment object is also used to store the Planned appointment.  The planned appointment never gets scheduled, but instead gets copied.  Also see histappointment, which keeps a historical record.

columns.name: AptNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  The patient that the appointment is for.

columns.name: AptStatus
columns.summary: Enum:ApptStatus .

columns.name: Pattern
columns.summary: Time pattern, X for Dr time, / for assist time. Stored in 5 minute increments.  Converted as needed to 10 or 15 minute representations for display.  There's not a hard limit on this.  When dragging, the max is 6.5 hours.  Within the AptEdit window, it can be set to 9 hours.

columns.name: Confirmed
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.  This field can also be used to show patient arrived, in chair, etc.  The Category column in the definition table is DefCat.ApptConfirmed.

columns.name: TimeLocked
columns.summary: If true, then the program will not attempt to reset the user's time pattern and length when adding or removing procedures.

columns.name: Op
columns.summary: FK to operatory.OperatoryNum.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Note.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: ProvHyg
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  Optional.  Only used if a hygienist is assigned to this appt.

columns.name: AptDateTime
columns.summary: Appointment Date and time.  If you need just the date or time for an SQL query, you can use DATE(AptDateTime) and TIME(AptDateTime) in your query.

columns.name: NextAptNum
columns.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum.  A better description of this field would be PlannedAptNum.  Only used to show that this apt is derived from specified planned apt. Otherwise, 0.

columns.name: UnschedStatus
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.  The definition.Category in the definition table is DefCat.RecallUnschedStatus.  Only used if this is an Unsched or Planned appt.

columns.name: IsNewPatient
columns.summary: This is the first appoinment this patient has had at this office.  Somewhat automated.

columns.name: ProcDescript
columns.summary: A one line summary of all procedures.  Can be used in various reports, Unscheduled list, and Planned appointment tracker.  Not user editable right now, so it doesn't show on the screen.

columns.name: Assistant
columns.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum.  You can assign an assistant to the appointment.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  0 if no clinic.

columns.name: IsHygiene
columns.summary: Set true if this is a hygiene appt. This flag is frequently not set even when it is a hygiene appointment because some offices want the dentist color on the appointments.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable.

columns.name: DateTimeArrived
columns.summary: The date and time that the patient checked in.  Date is largely ignored since it should be the same as the appt.

columns.name: DateTimeSeated
columns.summary: The date and time that the patient was seated in the chair in the operatory.

columns.name: DateTimeDismissed
columns.summary: The date and time that the patient got up out of the chair.  Date is largely ignored since it should be the same as the appt.

columns.name: InsPlan1
columns.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum for the primary insurance plan at the time the appointment is set complete. May be 0. We can't tell later which subscriber is involved; only the plan.

columns.name: InsPlan2
columns.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum for the secoondary insurance plan at the time the appointment is set complete. May be 0. We can't tell later which subscriber is involved; only the plan.

columns.name: DateTimeAskedToArrive
columns.summary: Date and time patient asked to arrive, or minval if patient not asked to arrive at a different time than appt.

columns.name: ProcsColored
columns.summary: Stores XML for the procs colors

columns.name: ColorOverride
columns.summary: If set to anything but 0, then this will override the graphic color for the appointment. Typically set to the color of the corresponding appointment type (if one is set) or a color manually picked by the user.

columns.name: AppointmentTypeNum
columns.summary: FK to appointmenttype.AppointmentTypeNum. Make sure to update ColorOverride to the corresponding color associated to this appointment type when changing the appointment type.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: Priority
columns.summary: Enum:ApptPriority 0 for normal appointments, 1 for ASAP.

columns.name: ProvBarText
columns.summary: Text that is superimposed on the provbar at the left of each appointment.  One character per 10 or 15 minute increment, not per 5 min.

columns.name: PatternSecondary
columns.summary: Time pattern, X for secondary provider time, / for spacing. Stored in 5 minute increments.  Converted as needed to 10 or 15 minute representations for display.  This could be Dr or Hyg, depending on if the IsHyg box is checked.  Does not have any effect on appointment length.  Probably same length as Pattern, but no guarantee.

columns.name: SecurityHash
columns.summary: Holds the salted hash of the following appointment fields: AptStatus, Confirmed, AptDateTime.

columns.name: ItemOrderPlanned
columns.summary: One-indexed order of patnum specific planned appointments. Column moved from the deprecated table plannedappt.

columns.name: IsMirrored
columns.summary: If true, then this appointment will show a duplicate mirrored on the secondary provider's operatory. The length of the mirror will be based on the provider time set for the secondary provider, so it won't be the same size as the original. The user can use the IsHygiene checkbox to flipflop which provider is secondary, so which color and length the second appt will be. Default for new appointments is based on ApptMirrorSecondary. The mirrored appointments can be set to show/hide using ApptView.ShowMirroredAppts.

name: appointmentrule
summary: For now, the rule is simple. It simply blocks all double booking of the specified code range.  The double booking would have to be for the same provider.  This can later be extended to provide more complex rules, such as partial double booking, time limitations, etc.

columns.name: AppointmentRuleNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: RuleDesc
columns.summary: The description of the rule which will be displayed to the user.

columns.name: CodeStart
columns.summary: The procedure code of the start of the range.

columns.name: CodeEnd
columns.summary: The procedure code of the end of the range.

columns.name: IsEnabled
columns.summary: Usually true.  But this does allow you to turn off a rule temporarily without losing the settings.

name: appointmenttype
summary: Appointment type is used to override appointment color.  Might control other properties on appointments in the future.

columns.name: AppointmentTypeNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: 0 based

columns.name: Pattern
columns.summary: Time pattern, X for Dr time, / for assist time. Stored in 5 minute increments. Convert as needed to 10 or 15 minute representations for display. Will be blank if the pattern should be dynamically calculated via the procedures found in CodeStr.

columns.name: CodeStr
columns.summary: Comma delimited list of procedure codes.  E.g. T1234,T4321,N3214

columns.name: CodeStrRequired
columns.summary: Comma delimited list of procedure codes that are required for this appt type.  E.g. T1234,T4321,N3214.

columns.name: RequiredProcCodesNeeded
columns.summary: Enum:EnumRequiredProcCodesNeeded 0=None,1=AtLeastOne,2=All

columns.name: BlockoutTypes
columns.summary: Comma delimited list of Blockout Types (definition.DefNums where definition.Category=25) this appointment type can be associated to.

name: apptfield
summary: These are custom fields added to appointments and managed by the user.

columns.name: ApptFieldNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: AptNum
columns.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum

columns.name: FieldName
columns.summary: FK to apptfielddef.FieldName.  The full name is shown here for ease of use when running queries.  But the user is only allowed to change fieldNames in the patFieldDef setup window.

columns.name: FieldValue
columns.summary: Any text that the user types in.  Will later allow some automation.

name: apptfielddef
summary: These are the definitions for the custom patient fields added and managed by the user.

columns.name: ApptFieldDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: FieldName
columns.summary: The name of the field that the user will be allowed to fill in the appt edit window.  Duplicates are prevented.

columns.name: FieldType
columns.summary: Enum:ApptFieldType Text=0,PickList=1

columns.name: PickList
columns.summary:
The text that contains pick list values, each separated by 
.  Length 4000.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Zero based ordering for the items.

name: apptgeneralmessagesent
summary: When a general message is sent for an appointment a record of that send is stored here. This is used to prevent re-sends of the same message.

columns.name: ApptGeneralMessageSentNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ApptNum
columns.summary: If true then we need to consider the subject in an autocomm object

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum for the corresponding patient.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum for the corresponding appointment.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: Generated by OD. Timestamp when row is created.

columns.name: TSPrior
columns.summary: This was the TSPrior used to send this reminder.

columns.name: ApptReminderRuleNum
columns.summary: FK to apptreminderrule.ApptReminderRuleNum. Allows us to look up the rules to determine how to send this apptcomm out.

columns.name: SendStatus
columns.summary: Indicates status of message.

columns.name: ApptDateTime
columns.summary: The Date and time of the original appointment. We need this in case the appointment was moved and needs another reminder sent out.

columns.name: MessageFk
columns.summary: FK to primary key of appropriate table.

columns.name: DateTimeSent
columns.summary: DateTime the message was sent.

columns.name: ResponseDescript
columns.summary: Generated by OD in some cases and HQ in others. Any human readable error message generated by either HQ or EConnector. Used for debugging.

name: apptnewpatthankyousent
summary: When a reminder is sent for an appointment a record of that send is stored here. Only want to send new patient thank yous once per patient.

columns.name: ApptNewPatThankYouSentNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ApptNum
columns.summary: Foreign key to the appointment represented by this AutoCommAppt.

columns.name: ApptDateTime
columns.summary: The Date and time of the original appointment. We need this in case the appointment was moved and needs another reminder sent out.

columns.name: ApptSecDateTEntry
columns.summary: The Date and time of the original appointment.

columns.name: TSPrior
columns.summary: This was the TSPrior used to send this reminder.

columns.name: ApptReminderRuleNum
columns.summary: FK to apptreminderrule.ApptReminderRuleNum. Allows us to look up the rules to determine how to send this apptcomm out.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum for the corresponding appointment.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum for the corresponding patient.

columns.name: ResponseDescript
columns.summary: Generated by OD in some cases and HQ in others. Any human readable error message generated by either HQ or EConnector. Used for debugging.

columns.name: DateTimeNewPatThankYouTransmit
columns.summary: Generated by OD. Timestamp when EConnector sent this ApptNewPatThankYouSent to HQ. Stored in local customer timezone.

columns.name: ShortGUID
columns.summary: Generated by HQ. Identifies this AutoCommGuid in future transactions between HQ and OD.

columns.name: SendStatus
columns.summary: Indicates status of message.

columns.name: MessageFk
columns.summary: FK to primary key of appropriate table.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: Generated by OD. Timestamp when row is created.

columns.name: DateTimeSent
columns.summary: DateTime the message was sent.

name: apptreminderrule
summary: This is called eServices Automated Messaging Rules in the UI. These are used to track the automated generation and sending of appointment reminders andv confirmations. Users are allowed to define up to two reminders and one confirmation (per clinic). These can be sent out any number of Days, Hours, and/or Minutes before a scheduled appointment. PRACTICE - Appointment Reminder Rules will be saved and edited with clinicNum=0. This denotes the "Defaults" when using clinics, but for a practice the defaults become the practice rulesCLINICS - When using clinics, each clinic has a bool "IsConfirmEnabled" that determines if a particular clinic has automated reminders/confirmations enabled. If not, no reminders will sent out for the clinic. If enabled, and no rules are defined for the clinic, then the clinic will attempt to use the defaults that have been defined with clinicNum==0. If a clinic enabled and has at least one AppointmentReminderRule defined, then NO defaults will be used for that clinic.REMINDERS - reminders are sent out using the ApptComm system implemented DerekG. These used to be stored as preferences for the practice only. Now users are allowed to define them on a per-clinic basis. Reminders should be considered one way communications should not be desingned with a customer response in mind CONFIRMATIONS - confirmations are sent using the new automated-confirmation system implemented by RyanM (proper) and SamO (backend). Confirmations are intended to allow end patients to respond to OpenDental via text or email and automatically confirm, or set to a desired status, the appointments on schedule.

columns.name: ApptReminderRuleNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: TypeCur
columns.summary: Enum:ApptReminderType

columns.name: TSPrior
columns.summary: Positive value indicates time BEFORE appointment that this rule should be sent. Negative value indicates time AFTER appointment that this rule should be sent. GeneralMessage: will always be negative (occurs in future). Allowing GM before appointment is prohibited since it would simply be duplicating eReminder behavior.

columns.name: SendOrder
columns.summary: Comma Delimited List of comm types. Enum values of ApptComm.CommType. 0=pref,1=sms,2=email; Like the deprecated pref "ApptReminderSendOrder"

columns.name: IsSendAll
columns.summary: Set to True if both an email AND a text should be sent.

columns.name: TemplateSMS
columns.summary: If using SMS, this template will be used to generate the body of the text message.

columns.name: TemplateEmailSubject
columns.summary: If using email, this template will be used to generate the subject of the email.

columns.name: TemplateEmail
columns.summary: If using email, this template will be used to generate the body of the email.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  Allows reminder rules to be configured on a per clinic basis. If ClinicNum==0 then it is the practice/HQ/default settings.

columns.name: TemplateSMSAggShared
columns.summary: Used when aggregating multiple appointments together into a single message.

columns.name: TemplateSMSAggPerAppt
columns.summary: Used when aggregating multiple appointments together into a single message.

columns.name: TemplateEmailSubjAggShared
columns.summary: Used when aggregating multiple appointments together into a single message.

columns.name: TemplateEmailAggShared
columns.summary: Used when aggregating multiple appointments together into a single message.

columns.name: TemplateEmailAggPerAppt
columns.summary: Used when aggregating multiple appointments together into a single message.

columns.name: DoNotSendWithin
columns.summary: The time before the appointment in which this reminder should NOT be sent. E.g., if this value is 2 days, and an appt is created one day in the future, a reminder will not be sent.

columns.name: IsEnabled
columns.summary: Enables/Disables the ApptReminderRule.

columns.name: TemplateAutoReply
columns.summary: Used when auto replying single eConfirmations.

columns.name: TemplateAutoReplyAgg
columns.summary: Used when auto replying multiple patient eConfirmations.

columns.name: IsAutoReplyEnabled
columns.summary: Enables/Disables eConfirmation auto replies. Only for when the patient responds positively via text.

columns.name: Language
columns.summary: When set, matched by text against the patient's language. Typically eng (English), fra (French), spa (Spanish), or similar. If it's a custom language, then it might look like Tahitian. Empty string implies that this rule uses the default language of the practice.

columns.name: TemplateComeInMessage
columns.summary: Used when inviting patient to come into office.

columns.name: EmailTemplateType
columns.summary: Enum. The Type of email for the template.

columns.name: AggEmailTemplateType
columns.summary: Enum:EmailType The type of email for the aggregated template.

columns.name: IsSendForMinorsBirthday
columns.summary: Boolean false by default. Controls if birthday messages will get sent to a minor for their birthday.

columns.name: EmailHostingTemplateNum
columns.summary: FK to emailhostingtemplate.EmailHostingTemplateNum. If used, rules fields will be based from the template.

columns.name: MinorAge
columns.summary: When IsSendForMinorsBirthday is true, this is the age that defines what a minor is.

columns.name: TemplateFailureAutoReply
columns.summary: Used when auto replying to appointment confirmations that failed.

columns.name: SendMultipleInvites
columns.summary: Enum:SendMultipleInvites . Whether we are able to send multiple invites.

columns.name: TimeSpanMultipleInvites
columns.summary: Used in conjunction with CanSendMultipleInvites. We will not send an invite if a patient has visited Patient Portal within this timespan.

name: apptremindersent
summary: When a reminder is sent for an appointment a record of that send is stored here. This is used to prevent re-sends of the same reminder.

columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.summary: Foreign key to the appointment represented by this AutoCommAppt.

columns.name: ApptDateTime
columns.summary: The Date and time of the original appointment. We need this in case the appointment was moved and needs another reminder sent out.

columns.name: DateTimeSent

columns.name: TSPrior

columns.name: ApptReminderRuleNum
columns.summary: FK to apptreminderrule.ApptReminderRuleNum. Allows us to look up the rules to determine how to send this apptcomm out.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum for the corresponding patient.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum for the corresponding appointment.

columns.name: SendStatus
columns.summary: Indicates status of message.

columns.name: MessageFk
columns.summary: FK to primary key of appropriate table.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry

columns.name: ResponseDescript

name: apptview
summary: Enables viewing a variety of operatories or providers.  This table holds the views that the user picks between.  The apptviewitem table holds the items attached to each view.

columns.name: ApptViewNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Description of this view.  Gets displayed in Appt module.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: 0-based order to display in lists. This is unique per clinic. So this does allow duplicate numbers if they are in different clinics.

columns.name: RowsPerIncr
columns.summary: Number of rows per time increment.  Usually 1 or 2.  Programming note: Value updated to ApptDrawing.RowsPerIncr to track current state.

columns.name: OnlyScheduledProvs
columns.summary: If set to true, then the only operatories that will show will be for providers that have schedules for the day, ops with no provs assigned.

columns.name: OnlySchedBeforeTime
columns.summary: If OnlyScheduledProvs is set to true, and this time is not 0:00, then only provider schedules with start or stop time before this time will be included.

columns.name: OnlySchedAfterTime
columns.summary: If OnlyScheduledProvs is set to true, and this time is not 0:00, then only provider schedules with start or stop time after this time will be included.

columns.name: StackBehavUR
columns.summary: Enum:ApptViewStackBehavior

columns.name: StackBehavLR
columns.summary: Enum:ApptViewStackBehavior

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  0=All clinics.  This appointment view will only be visible when the current clinic showing is set to this clinic.  Within the appointment edit window, this setting is used to filter the list of available operatories.  Also used in conjunction with 'OnlyScheduledProvs' (when enabled) in order to filter the visible operatories within the Appt module.

columns.name: ApptTimeScrollStart
columns.summary: Time the appointment module's view will scroll to on load.

columns.name: IsScrollStartDynamic
columns.summary: If set to true, the appointment view scrolls to the first scheduled operatory start time or the first scheduled appointment.

columns.name: IsApptBubblesDisabled
columns.summary: If set to true, the appointment view will not show appointment bubbles.

columns.name: WidthOpMinimum
columns.summary: Zero is default and old behavior.  For any larger number, appointments won't shrink past that number but they may be wider.  Instead of getting narrower, a horizontal scrollbar shows up.

columns.name: WaitingRmName
columns.summary: Enum:EnumWaitingRmName - Shows how patient name is displayed in the waiting room. Defaults to Last, First.

columns.name: OnlyScheduledProvDays
columns.summary: If set to true, then the only days that will show in Week view will be days that have providers scheduled or an appointment scheduled.

columns.name: ShowMirroredAppts
columns.summary: Default false. See Appointment.IsMirrored and Pref.ApptMirrorSecondary

name: asapcomm

It contains a link that patient clicks on to schedule via WebSchedASAP. The entry first gets created in this table. Then, separately, the rows are consumed by a listener thread on the eConnector which handles the actual sending.

columns.name: AsapCommNum

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: FK to the object for which this communication was made. Usually AptNum or RecallNum.

columns.name: FKeyType

columns.name: ScheduleNum

columns.name: PatNum

columns.name: ClinicNum

columns.name: ShortGUID
columns.summary: An identifier that is used to communicate with OD HQ regarding this communication item.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: When this communication item was entered into the database.

columns.name: DateTimeExpire
columns.summary: When this communication item will expire.

columns.name: DateTimeSmsScheduled
columns.summary: The date and time when a text message is scheduled to be sent.

columns.name: SmsSendStatus
columns.summary: Enum:AutoCommStatus The status of sending the text for this communication.

columns.name: EmailSendStatus
columns.summary: Enum:AutoCommStatus The status of sending the email for this communication.

columns.name: DateTimeSmsSent
columns.summary: The date and time a text message was sent.

columns.name: DateTimeEmailSent
columns.summary: The date and time an email was sent.

columns.name: EmailMessageNum
columns.summary: FK to emailmessage.EmailMessageNum. The email message that was sent to the patient.

columns.name: ResponseStatus
columns.summary: Enum:AsapRSVPStatus How the patient has responded to this communication.

columns.name: DateTimeOrig
columns.summary: The date and time of the appointment when this communication was made or the date and time of the recall date due.

columns.name: TemplateText
columns.summary: The template that will be used when sending a text message.

columns.name: TemplateEmail
columns.summary: The template that will be used when creating the body of the email message.

columns.name: TemplateEmailSubj
columns.summary: The template that will be used for the email subject line.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Any notes regarding this communication item.

columns.name: GuidMessageToMobile

columns.name: EmailTemplateType
columns.summary: Enum:EmailType Type of markup for the template.

name: autocode

The user only has to pick composite, for instance, and the autocode figures out the code based on the number of surfaces, and posterior vs. anterior.  Autocodes also enforce and suggest changes to a procedure code if the number of surfaces or other properties change.

columns.name: Description

columns.name: IsHidden

columns.name: LessIntrusive

name: autocodecond
summary: AutoCode condition.  Always attached to an AutoCodeItem, which is then, in turn, attached to an autocode.  There is usually only one or two conditions for a given AutoCodeItem.

columns.name: AutoCodeCondNum

columns.name: AutoCodeItemNum

columns.name: Cond

name: autocodeitem

columns.name: AutoCodeItemNum

columns.name: AutoCodeNum

columns.name: OldCode

columns.name: CodeNum

summary: AutoComms are sent a certain number of days in advance. Clinicpref called eConfirmExcludeDays handles excluding weekends, and this table handles excluding holidays. So AutoComms only go out when office is open. (First iteration currently only applies to eConfirmations)

columns.name: AutoCommExcludeDateNum

name: automation

columns.name: CommType

columns.name: MessageContent

columns.name: AppointmentTypeNum

columns.name: PatStatus

columns.name: CompareField
columns.summary: Enum:AutoCondField

columns.name: Comparison

name: autonote

name: benefit
summary: Corresponds to the benefit table in the database which replaces the old covpat table.  A benefit is usually a percentage, deductible, limitation, max, or similar. Each row represents a single benefit.  A benefit can have a value in EITHER PlanNum OR PatPlanNum.  If it is for a PlanNum, the most common, then the benefit is attached to an insurance plan.  If it is for a PatPlanNum, then it overrides the plan benefit, usually a percentage, for a single patient.  Benefits we can't handle yet include posterior composites, COB duplication, amounts used, in/out of plan network, authorization required, missing tooth exclusion, and any date related limitations like waiting periods.Here are examples of typical usage which parallel X12 usage fields shown in this order:CovCat, ProcCode(- indicates blank), BenefitType, Percent, MonetaryAmt, TimePeriod, QuantityQualifier, Quantity, CoverageLevelAnnual Max Indiv $1000: Non General,-,Limitations,-1,1000,CalendarYear,None,0,IndividualRestorative 80%: Restorative,-,CoInsurance,80,-1,CalendarYear,None,0,None$50 deductible: None/General,-,Deductible,-1,5 CalendarYear,None,0,IndividualDeductible waived on preventive: Preventive,-,Deductible,-1,0,CalendarYear,None,0,Individual1 pano every 5 years: None,D0330,Limitations,-1,-1,Years?,Years, None2 exams per year: Preventive(or Diagnostic),-,Limitations,-1,-1,BenefitYear,NumberOfServices,2,NoneFluoride limit 18yo: None, D1204, Limitations, -1, -1, CalendarYear/None, AgeLimi 18,None (might require a second identical entry for D1205)4BW every 6 months: None, D0274, Limitations, -1, -1, None, Months, 6,None.The text above might be difficult to read.  We trying to improve the white spacing.

columns.name: BenefitNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PlanNum
columns.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum.  Most benefits should be attached using PlanNum.  The exception would be if each patient has a different percentage.  If PlanNum is used, then PatPlanNum should be 0.

columns.name: PatPlanNum
columns.summary: FK to patplan.PatPlanNum.  It is rare to attach benefits this way.  Usually only used to override percentages for patients.   In this case, PlanNum should be 0.

columns.name: CovCatNum
columns.summary: FK to covcat.CovCatNum.  Corresponds to X12 EB03- Service Type code.  Situational, so it can be 0.  Will probably be 0 for general deductible and annual max.  There are very specific categories covered by X12. Users should set their InsCovCats to the defaults we provide.

columns.name: BenefitType
columns.summary: Enum:InsBenefitType Corresponds to X12 EB01. Examples: 0=ActiveCoverage, 1=CoInsurance, 2=Deductible, 3=CoPayment, 4=Exclusions, 5=Limitations. ActiveCoverage doesn't really provide meaningful information.

columns.name: Percent
columns.summary: Only used if BenefitType=CoInsurance.  Valid values are 0 to 100.  -1 indicates empty, which is almost always true if not CoInsurance.  The percentage that insurance will pay on the procedure.  Note that benefits coming from carriers are usually backwards, indicating the percentage that the patient is responsible for.

columns.name: MonetaryAmt
columns.summary: Used for CoPayment, Limitations, and Deductible.  -1 indicates empty

columns.name: TimePeriod
columns.summary: Enum:BenefitTimePeriod Corresponds to X12 EB06, Time Period Qualifier.  Examples: 0=None,1=ServiceYear,2=CalendarYear,3=Lifetime,4=Years. Might add Visit and Remaining.

columns.name: QuantityQualifier
columns.summary: Enum:BenefitQuantity Corresponds to X12 EB09. Not used very much. Examples: 0=None,1=NumberOfServices,2=AgeLimit,3=Visits,4=Years,5=Months

columns.name: Quantity
columns.summary: Corresponds to X12 EB10. Qualify the quantity using QuantityQualifier.

columns.name: CodeNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum.  Typical uses include fluoride, sealants, etc.  If a specific code is used here, then the CovCat should be None.

columns.name: CoverageLevel
columns.summary: Enum:BenefitCoverageLevel Corresponds to X12 EB02.  None, Individual, or Family.  Individual and Family are commonly used for deductibles and maximums.  None is commonly used for percentages and copays.

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed.

columns.name: CodeGroupNum
columns.summary: FK to codegroup.CodeGroupNum  The group of procedure codes that apply to this frequency limitation benefit.

columns.name: TreatArea
columns.summary: Enum:TreatmentArea . Only for frequency limitations, ignored for all other benefits. Enforced by the UI. Example 3 fillings per year [mouth]. Tests: 140 through 147. 0 means default.

name: branding
summary: Replaces MobileBrandingProfile. Stores clinic level customizations to the way eServices are displayed to users (colors, logos, etc). Colors use the MaterialColorUtilities package which implements Google's Material Color Utilities for C#. Material Color is a system for generating a theme of color variations based on a single source color. Changes made to the primary, secondary, or tertiary colors on the theme will cause the other colors to change slightly as well. This table is stored in the dental office database, not at OD HQ.

columns.name: BrandingNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: BrandingType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumBrandingType

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic. 0 indicates a global default Branding.

columns.name: ValueString
columns.summary: Stores the value for the branding type. Colors will be stored as JSON Serialized SchemesAndSource, which will hold both light and dark Schemes as well as the source color. Example serialized Scheme: {"Primary": "109, 94, 15","OnPrimary": "White","PrimaryContainer": "248, 226, 135", etc for the 39 generated colors}

columns.name: DateTimeUpdated
columns.summary: The last time this row was updated. Some eServices store relevant rows locally, and will only need to update when this exceeds their locally stored values. Saves calls to database.

The ElectID can never be used by another carrier.  4. If the carrier is attached to any etrans, then the ElectID cannot be changed (and, of course, the carrier cannot be deleted or combined).

columns.name: CDAnetVersion
columns.summary: The version of CDAnet supported.  Either 02 or 04.

columns.name: CanadianSupportedTypes

columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: IsCoinsuranceInverted
columns.summary: False by default.  Determines if the carrier supplied EB08 field of 271 transactions should be inverted for coinsurance percentages. When true carriers sent us insurance percentage so we do not need to invert it, it is already inverted for us.

columns.name: TrustedEtransFlags
columns.summary: Bit flags.  None (0) by default.  Stores trusted user selected X12 transaction types related to this carrier.

columns.name: CobInsPaidBehaviorOverride
columns.summary: Enum:EclaimCobInsPaidBehavior .  When sending X12 5010 eclaims, if not set to Default, then this setting overrides the ClaimCobInsPaidBehavior preference.

columns.name: EraAutomationOverride
columns.summary: Enum:EraAutomationMode UseGlobal (0) by default. Determines the level of ERA processing automation for this carrier. This will override the EraAutomationBehavior preference when not set to UseGlobal.

columns.name: OrthoInsPayConsolidate
columns.summary: Enum:EnumOrthoInsPayConsolidate Global (0) by default. Determines how this carrier requires payments made to ortho claims made by the Auto Ortho Tool. This will override the OrthoInsPayConsolidated preference when not set to Global.

columns.summary: 0-based.

columns.name: WebServiceIsEcw
columns.summary: If set to true, the password hash is calculated differently.

columns.name: ConnectionStatus
columns.summary: Contains the most recent information about this connection.  OK if no problems, version information if version mismatch, nothing for not checked, and OFFLINE if previously couldn't connect.

columns.name: HasClinicBreakdownReports
columns.summary: If set to True, display clinic breakdown in reports, else only show practice totals.

name: cert
summary: A single certification that any employee may complete.

columns.name: CertNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: WikiPageLink
columns.summary: The exact name of a wiki page.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: 0-indexed.  This is a little tricky because a cert can be in multiple categories.  So users can only reorder when they are looking at the entire list of certs not ordered by category.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: If hidden, then this cert won't normally show in the main list.

columns.name: CertCategoryNum
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.

name: certemployee
summary: A certification completed by an employee on a specific date.

columns.name: CertEmployeeNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: CertNum
columns.summary: FK to cert.CertNum.

columns.name: EmployeeNum
columns.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Rarely, a very short note is required.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. The user who made this entry.  Usually some sort of supervisor.

name: chartview
summary: Enables viewing a variety of views in chart module.

columns.name: ChartViewNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Description of this view.  Gets displayed at top of Progress Notes grid.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: 0-based order to display in lists.

columns.name: ProcStatuses
columns.summary: Enum:ChartViewProcStat None=0,TP=1,Complete=2,Existing Cur Prov=4,Existing Other Prov=8,Referred=16,Deleted=32,Condition=64,All=127.

columns.name: ObjectTypes
columns.summary: Enum:ChartViewObjs None=0,Appointments=1,Comm Log=2,Comm Log Family=4,Tasks=8,Email=16,LabCases=32,Rx=64,Sheets=128,Comm Log Super Family=256,All=511.

columns.name: ShowProcNotes
columns.summary: Set true to show procedure notes.

columns.name: IsAudit
columns.summary: Set true to enable audit mode.

columns.name: SelectedTeethOnly
columns.summary: Set true to only show information regarding the selected teeth.

columns.name: OrionStatusFlags
columns.summary: Enum:OrionStatus Which orion statuses to show. Will be zero if not orion.

columns.name: DatesShowing
columns.summary: Enum:ChartViewDates All,Today,Yesterday,ThisYear,LastYear

columns.name: IsTpCharting
columns.summary: set true to show treatment plan controls in chart module.

name: claim
summary: The claim table holds information about individual claims.  Each row represents one claim.

columns.name: ClaimNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  Must always match claimProc.PatNum

columns.name: DateService
columns.summary: Usually the same date as the procedures, but it can be changed if you wish.

columns.name: DateSent
columns.summary: Usually the date it was created.  It might be sent a few days later if you don't send your e-claims every day.

columns.name: ClaimStatus
columns.summary: Single char: U,H,W,P,S,R, or I.  U=Unsent, H=Hold until pri received, W=Waiting in queue, S=Sent, R=Received, I=Hold for In Process.  A(adj) is no longer used.  P(prob sent) is no longer used.

columns.name: DateReceived
columns.summary: Date the claim was received.

columns.name: PlanNum
columns.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum.  Every claim is attached to one plan.

columns.name: ProvTreat
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  Treating provider for dental claims.  For institutional claims, this is called the attending provider.

columns.name: ClaimFee
columns.summary: Total fee of claim.

columns.name: InsPayEst
columns.summary: Amount insurance is estimated to pay on this claim.

columns.name: InsPayAmt
columns.summary: Amount insurance actually paid.

columns.name: DedApplied
columns.summary: Deductible applied to this claim.

columns.name: PreAuthString
columns.summary: The predetermination of benefits number received from ins.  In X12, REF G3.

columns.name: IsProsthesis
columns.summary: Single char for No, Initial, or Replacement.

columns.name: PriorDate
columns.summary: Date prior prosthesis was placed.  Note that this is only for paper claims.  E-claims have a date field on each individual procedure.

columns.name: ReasonUnderPaid
columns.summary: Note for patient for why insurance didn't pay as expected.

columns.name: ClaimNote
columns.summary: Note to be sent to insurance. Max 400 char.  E-claims also have notes on each procedure.

columns.name: ClaimType
columns.summary: "P"=primary, "S"=secondary, "PreAuth"=preauth, "Other"=other, "Cap"=capitation.  Not allowed to be blank. Might need to add "Med"=medical claim.

columns.name: ProvBill
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  Billing provider.  Assignment can be automated from the setup section.

columns.name: ReferringProv
columns.summary: FK to referral.ReferralNum.

columns.name: RefNumString
columns.summary: Referral number for this claim.

columns.name: PlaceService
columns.summary: Enum:PlaceOfService .

columns.name: AccidentRelated
columns.summary: blank or A=Auto, E=Employment, O=Other.

columns.name: AccidentDate
columns.summary: Date of accident, if applicable.  Canada only.

columns.name: AccidentST
columns.summary: Accident state.

columns.name: EmployRelated
columns.summary: Enum:YN .

columns.name: IsOrtho
columns.summary: True if is ortho.

columns.name: OrthoRemainM
columns.summary: Remaining months of ortho.  Valid values are 1-36, although we allow greater than or equal to 0.

columns.name: OrthoDate
columns.summary: Date ortho appliance placed.

columns.name: PatRelat
columns.summary: Enum:Relat  Relationship to subscriber.  The relationship is copied from InsPlan when the claim is created.  It might need to be changed in both places.

columns.name: PlanNum2
columns.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum.  Other coverage plan number.  0 if none.  This provides the user with total control over what other coverage shows. This obviously limits the coverage on a single claim to two insurance companies.

columns.name: PatRelat2
columns.summary: Enum:Relat  The relationship to the subscriber for other coverage on this claim.

columns.name: WriteOff
columns.summary: Sum of ClaimProc.Writeoff for this claim.

columns.name: Radiographs
columns.summary: The number of x-rays enclosed.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  0 if no clinic.  Since one claim cannot have procs from multiple clinics, the clinicNum is set when creating the claim and then cannot be changed.  The claim would have to be deleted and recreated.  Otherwise, if changing at the claim level, a feature would have to be added that synched all procs, claimprocs, and probably some other tables.

columns.name: ClaimForm
columns.summary: FK to claimform.ClaimFormNum.  0 if not assigned to use the claimform for the insplan.

columns.name: AttachedImages
columns.summary: The number of intraoral images attached.  Not the number of files attached.  This is the value that goes on the 2006 claimform.

columns.name: AttachedModels
columns.summary: The number of models attached.

columns.name: AttachedFlags
columns.summary: A comma-delimited set of flag keywords.  Can have one or more of the following: EoB,Note,Perio,Misc,Unsup.  Must also contain one of these: Mail or Elect. Additionally, the Submitted flag is for determining when DentalXChange attachment was submitted.

columns.name: AttachmentID
columns.summary: Example: NEA#1234567 or dxc123456789.  If present, and if the claim note does not already start with this Id, then it will be prepended to the claim note for both e-claims and mail.  If using e-claims, this same ID will be used for all PWK segements.

columns.name: CanadianMaterialsForwarded
columns.summary: A08.  Any combination of E(email), C(correspondence), M(models), X(x-rays), and I(images).  So up to 5 char.  Gets converted to a single char A-Z for e-claims.

columns.name: CanadianReferralProviderNum
columns.summary: B05.  Optional. The 9-digit CDA number of the referring provider, or identifier of referring party up to 10 characters in length.

columns.name: CanadianReferralReason
columns.summary: B06.  A number 0(none) through 13.

columns.name: CanadianIsInitialLower
columns.summary: F18.  Y, N, or X(not a lower denture, crown, or bridge).

columns.name: CanadianDateInitialLower
columns.summary: F19.  Mandatory if F18 is N.

columns.name: CanadianMandProsthMaterial
columns.summary: F21.  If crown, not required.  If denture or bridge, required if F18 is N.  Single digit number code, 0-6.  We added type 7, which is crown.

columns.name: CanadianIsInitialUpper
columns.summary: F15.  Y, N, or X(not an upper denture, crown, or bridge).

columns.name: CanadianDateInitialUpper
columns.summary: F04.  Mandatory if F15 is N.

columns.name: CanadianMaxProsthMaterial
columns.summary: F20.  If crown, not required.  If denture or bridge, required if F15 is N.  0 indicates empty response.  Single digit number code, 1-6.  We added type 7, which is crown.

columns.name: InsSubNum
columns.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum.

columns.name: InsSubNum2
columns.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum.  The fk to the 'Other' insurance subscriber.  For a primary claim, this will be the secondary insurance subscriber.  For a secondary claim, this will be primary insurance subscriber.

columns.name: CanadaTransRefNum
columns.summary: G01 assigned by carrier/network and returned in acks.  Used for claim reversal.  For Claim Acknowledgements, this can sometimes be a series of spaces, which means the number is effectively empty.  This happens when the Claim Acknowledgement is forwarded to the carrier as part of a batch.

columns.name: CanadaEstTreatStartDate
columns.summary: F37 Used for predeterminations.

columns.name: CanadaInitialPayment
columns.summary: F28 Used for predeterminations.

columns.name: CanadaPaymentMode
columns.summary: F29 Used for predeterminations.

columns.name: CanadaTreatDuration
columns.summary: F30 Used for predeterminations.

columns.name: CanadaNumAnticipatedPayments
columns.summary: F31 Used for predeterminations.

columns.name: CanadaAnticipatedPayAmount
columns.summary: F32 Used for predeterminations.

columns.name: PriorAuthorizationNumber
columns.summary: This is NOT the predetermination of benefits number.  In X12, this is REF G1.

columns.name: SpecialProgramCode
columns.summary: Enum:EnumClaimSpecialProgram  This is used to track EPSDT.

columns.name: UniformBillType
columns.summary: A three digit number used on 837I.  Aka Bill Code.  UBO4 4.  Examples: 321,823,131,652.  The third digit is claim frequency code.  If this is used, then our CorrectionType should be 0=original.

columns.name: MedType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumClaimMedType 0=Dental, 1=Medical, 2=Institutional

columns.name: AdmissionTypeCode
columns.summary: Used for inst claims. Single digit.  X12 2300 CL101.  UB04 14.  Should only be required for IP, but X12 clearly states required for all.

columns.name: AdmissionSourceCode
columns.summary: Used for inst claims. Single char.  X12 2300 CL102.  UB04 15.  Should only be required for IP, but X12 clearly states required for all.

columns.name: PatientStatusCode
columns.summary: Used for inst claims. Two digit.  X12 2300 CL103.  UB04 17.  Should only be required for IP, but X12 clearly states required for all.

columns.name: CustomTracking
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Most users will leave this blank.  Some offices may set up tracking statuses such as 'review', 'hold', 'riskmanage', etc.

columns.name: DateResent
columns.summary: Used for historical purposes only, not sent electronically. Automatically set when CorrectionType is original and the claim is resent.

columns.name: CorrectionType
columns.summary: Enum:ClaimCorrectionType X12 CLM05-3. Usually set to original, but can be used to resubmit claims.  Also used in 1500 Medical Claim Form field 22.

columns.name: ClaimIdentifier
columns.summary: X12 CLM01. Semi-unique identifier for the claim within the current database. Defaults to PatNum/ClaimNum, but can be edited by user, and is often modified by the clearinghouse to ensure uniqueness on their end. This also set for PreAuth claims.  The ClaimIdentifier for a PreAuth will probably not match the ClaimIdentifier for a regular claim, which makes ERA claim matching more straight forward for both PreAuths and regular claims.

columns.name: OrigRefNum
columns.summary: X12 2300 REF (F8). Used when resending claims to refer to the original claim. The user must type this value in after reading it from the original claim response report.

columns.name: ProvOrderOverride
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  Ordering provider override.  Goes hand-in-hand with OrderingReferralNum.  Medical eclaims only. Defaults to zero.

columns.name: OrthoTotalM
columns.summary: Total estimated months of ortho.  Valid values are 1-36, although we allow greater than or equal to 0.

columns.name: ShareOfCost
columns.summary: Sum of all amounts paid specifically to this claim by the patient or family. Goes out in X12 4010/5010 loop 2300 AMT segment if greater than zero.  Default value is 0, thus will not go out by default unless the user enters a value.  This field was added for Denti-Cal certification, but can go out for any clearinghouse.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

columns.name: OrderingReferralNum
columns.summary: FK to referral.ReferralNum.  Goes hand-in-hand with ProvOrderOverride.  Medical eclaims only.  Defaults to zero. If set, and the ProvOrderOverride is not set, then this referral will go out at the ordering provider on medical e-claims.

columns.name: DateSentOrig
columns.summary: The original date the claim was sent.

columns.name: DateIllnessInjuryPreg
columns.summary: Date of Current Illness, Injury, or Pregnancy (LMP).  (LMP = Last Menstrual Period)  For use in 1500 Medical Claim Form box 14. Identifies the first date of onset of illness, the actual date of injury, or the LMP for pregnancy.

columns.name: DateIllnessInjuryPregQualifier
columns.summary: Enum:DateIllnessInjuryPregQualifier 3 digit code used in 1500 Medical Claim Form, 'Qual' box of field 14.  Valid values are 431 or 484.

columns.name: DateOther
columns.summary: Another date related to the patient's condition or treatment.  For use in 1500 Medical Claim Form box 15.

columns.name: DateOtherQualifier
columns.summary: Enum:DateOtherQualifier 3 digit code used in 1500 Medical Claim Form, 'Qual' box of field 15.  Valid values are 090, 091, 304, 439, 444, 453,454, 455, and 471.

columns.name: IsOutsideLab
columns.summary: Used in 1500 Medical Claim Form field 20.  Place an 'X' the 'Yes' if true and the 'No' if false.

columns.name: SecurityHash
columns.summary: Holds the salted hash of the following claim fields: ClaimFee, ClaimStatus, InsPayEst, InsPayAmt.

columns.name: Narrative
columns.summary: A note that pertains to all attachments on the claim. Currently only applies to DentalXChange, but could be expanded. 2000 character limit put in place by DentalXChange.

name: claimattach
summary: Keeps track of one image file attached to a claim.  Multiple files can be attached to a claim using this method. DentalXChange uses the term "attachment" differently, referring to a group of images.

columns.name: ClaimAttachNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ClaimNum
columns.summary: FK to claim.ClaimNum

columns.name: DisplayedFileName
columns.summary: The name of the file that shows on the claim.  For example: tooth2.jpg.

columns.name: ActualFileName
columns.summary: The actual file is stored in the A-Z folder in EmailAttachments.  (yes, even though it's not actually an email attachment)  The files are named automatically based on Date/time along with a random number.  This ensures that they will be sequential as well as unique.

columns.name: ImageReferenceId
columns.summary: This is the image Id that DentalXChange gives back after calling addImage(). Storing this will allow users to delete images they sent to DentalXChange.

name: claimcondcodelog
summary: There is either one or zero per claim.

columns.name: ClaimCondCodeLogNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ClaimNum
columns.summary: FK to claim.ClaimNum.

columns.name: Code0
columns.summary: Corresponds with condition code 18 on the UB04.

columns.name: Code1
columns.summary: Corresponds with condition code 19 on the UB04.

columns.name: Code2
columns.summary: Corresponds with condition code 20 on the UB04.

columns.name: Code3
columns.summary: Corresponds with condition code 21 on the UB04.

columns.name: Code4
columns.summary: Corresponds with condition code 22 on the UB04.

columns.name: Code5
columns.summary: Corresponds with condition code 23 on the UB04.

columns.name: Code6
columns.summary: Corresponds with condition code 24 on the UB04.

columns.name: Code7
columns.summary: Corresponds with condition code 25 on the UB04.

columns.name: Code8
columns.summary: Corresponds with condition code 26 on the UB04.

columns.name: Code9
columns.summary: Corresponds with condition code 27 on the UB04.

columns.name: Code10
columns.summary: Corresponds with condition code 28 on the UB04.

name: claimform
summary: Stores the information for printing different types of claim forms.  Each claimform has many claimformitems attached to it, one for each field on the claimform.  This table has nothing to do with the actual claims.  It just describes how to print them.

columns.name: ClaimFormNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: eg. ADA2002 or CA Medicaid

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: If true, then it will not be displayed in various claim form lists as a choice.

columns.name: FontName
columns.summary: Valid font name for all text on the form.

columns.name: FontSize
columns.summary: Font size for all text on the form.

columns.name: UniqueID
columns.summary: Deprecated as of version 17.2. Internal claimforms have been moved over to XML files in OpenDentBusiness.Properties.Resources.

columns.name: PrintImages
columns.summary: Set to false to not print images.  This removes the background for printing on premade forms.

columns.name: OffsetX
columns.summary: Shifts all items by x/100th's of an inch to compensate for printer, typically less than 1/4 inch.

columns.name: OffsetY
columns.summary: Shifts all items by y/100th's of an inch to compensate for printer, typically less than 1/4 inch.

columns.name: Width
columns.summary: The width of the claim form.

columns.name: Height
columns.summary: The height of the claim form.

name: claimformitem
summary: One item is needed for each field on a claimform.

columns.name: ClaimFormItemNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ClaimFormNum
columns.summary: FK to claimform.ClaimFormNum

columns.name: ImageFileName
columns.summary: If this item is an image.  Usually only one per claimform.  eg ADA2002.emf.  Otherwise it MUST be left blank, or it will trigger an error that the image cannot be found.

columns.name: FieldName
columns.summary: Must be one of the hardcoded available fieldnames for claims.

columns.name: FormatString
columns.summary: For dates, the format string. ie MM/dd/yyyy or M d y among many other possibilities.

columns.name: XPos
columns.summary: The x position of the item on the claim form.  In pixels. 100 pixels per inch.

columns.name: YPos
columns.summary: The y position of the item.

columns.name: Width
columns.summary: Limits the printable area of the item. Set to zero to not limit.

columns.name: Height
columns.summary: Limits the printable area of the item. Set to zero to not limit.

name: claimpayment
summary: Each row represents a single check from the insurance company.  The amount may be split between patients using claimprocs.  The amount of the check must always exactly equal the sum of all the claimprocs attached to it.  There might be only one claimproc.

columns.name: ClaimPaymentNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: CheckDate
columns.summary: Date the check was entered into this system, not the date on the check.

columns.name: CheckAmt
columns.summary: The amount of the check.

columns.name: CheckNum
columns.summary: The check number.

columns.name: BankBranch
columns.summary: Bank and branch.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Note for this check if needed.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  0 if no clinic (unassigned).

columns.name: DepositNum
columns.summary: FK to deposit.DepositNum.  0 if not attached to any deposits.

columns.name: CarrierName
columns.summary: Descriptive name of the carrier just for reporting purposes.  We use this because the CarrierNums could conceivably be different for the different claimprocs attached.

columns.name: DateIssued
columns.summary: Date that the carrier issued the check. Date on the check.

columns.name: PayType
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.  0 if not attached to any definitions

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

columns.name: PayGroup
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.  The payment group for this claim payment.

name: claimproc
summary: Links procedures to claims.  Also links ins payments to procedures or claims.  Also used for estimating procedures even if no claim yet.  Warning: One proc might be linked twice to a given claim if insurance made two payments.  Many of the important fields are actually optional.  For instance, ProcNum is only required if itemizing ins payment, and ClaimNum is blank if Status=adjustment,cap,or estimate.

columns.name: ClaimProcNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ProcNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum.  Is 0 for payments by total or for Canadian Carrier Issued Procedures.

columns.name: ClaimNum
columns.summary: FK to claim.ClaimNum.  Is 0 for estimates, adjustments and capitation (CapClaim and CapComplete).

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  Must always match claim.PatNum

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: FeeBilled
columns.summary: Fee billed to insurance. Might not be the same as the actual fee.  The fee billed can be different than the actual procedure.  For instance, if you have set the insurance plan to bill insurance using UCR fees, then this field will contain the UCR fee instead of the fee that the patient was charged.

columns.name: InsPayEst
columns.summary: Actual amount this carrier is expected to pay, after taking everything else into account. Considers annual max, override, percentAmt, copayAmt, deductible, etc. This estimate is computed automatically when sent to ins.

columns.name: DedApplied
columns.summary: 0 if blank.  Deductible applied to this procedure only. Only for procedures attached to claims.  Otherwise, the DedEst and DedEstOverride are used.

columns.name: Status
columns.summary: Enum:ClaimProcStatus .  When setting recieved\supplemental must set DateEntry.

columns.name: InsPayAmt
columns.summary: Amount insurance actually paid.

columns.name: Remarks
columns.summary: The remarks that insurance sends in the EOB about procedures.

columns.name: ClaimPaymentNum
columns.summary: FK to claimpayment.ClaimPaymentNum(the insurance check).

columns.name: PlanNum
columns.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum

columns.name: DateCP
columns.summary: This is the date that is used for payment reports and tracks the payment date. Once a payment has been attached, the DateCP will exactly match the date of the ClaimPayment it's attached to. See the note under Ledgers.ComputePayments. This will eventually not be used for aging. The ProcDate will instead be used. See ProcDate.

columns.name: WriteOff
columns.summary: Amount not covered by ins which is written off.  The writeoff estimate goes in a different column.  This is filled with the WriteOffEst value when a claim is created.

columns.name: CodeSent
columns.summary: The procedure code that was sent to insurance. This is not necessarily the usual procedure code.  It will already have been trimmed to 5 char if it started with "D", or it could be the alternate code.  Not allowed to be blank if it is procedure.

columns.name: AllowedOverride
columns.summary: The allowed fee (not the override) is a complex calculation which is performed on the fly in Procedure.ComputeEstimates/ClaimProc.ComputeBaseEst.  It is the amount that the percentage is based on.  If this carrier has a lower UCR than the office, then the allowed fee is where that is handled.  It can be pulled from an allowed fee schedule.  It is also where substitutions for posterior composites are handled.  The AllowedOverride allows the user to override the calculation.  -1 indicates blank.  A new use of this field is for when entering insurance payments.  On the eob, it will tell you what the allowed/UCR fee is.  The user will now be able to enter this information into the AllowedOverride field.  They will simultaneously pass the info to the allowed fee schedule.  AllowedOverride is never changed automatically by the program except to sometimes set it to -1 if NoBillIns.

columns.name: Percentage
columns.summary: -1 if blank.  Otherwise a number between 0 and 100.  The percentage that insurance pays on this procedure, as determined from insurance categories. Not user editable.

columns.name: PercentOverride
columns.summary: -1 if blank.  Otherwise a number between 0 and 100.  Can only be changed by user.

columns.name: CopayAmt
columns.summary: -1 if blank. Calculated automatically. User cannot edit but can use CopayOverride instead.  Opposite of InsEst, because this is the patient portion estimate.  Two different uses: 1. For capitation, this automates calculation of writeoff. 2. For any other insurance, it gets deducted during calculation as shown in the edit window. Neither use directly affects patient balance.

columns.name: NoBillIns
columns.summary: Set to true to not bill to this insurance plan.

columns.name: PaidOtherIns
columns.summary: -1 if blank. The amount paid or estimated to be paid by another insurance.  This amount is then subtracted from what the current insurance would pay.  When running the calculation and considering other claimprocs, it will ignore any patPlan with a higher ordinal.  So, always blank for primary claims.  User cannot edit, but can use PaidOtherInsOverride.

columns.name: BaseEst
columns.summary: Always has a value. Used in TP, etc. The base estimate is the ((fee or allowedOverride)-Copay) x (percentage or percentOverride). Does not include all the extras like ded, annualMax,and paidOtherIns that InsEstTotal holds.  BaseEst cannot be overridden by the user.  Instead, the following fields can be manipulated: allowedOverride, CopayOverride, PercentOverride.

columns.name: CopayOverride
columns.summary: -1 if blank.  See description of CopayAmt.  This lets the user set a copay that will never be overwritten by automatic calculations.

columns.name: ProcDate
columns.summary: Date of the procedure.  Displayed in Edit Claim window procedures grid.  Currently only used for tracking annual insurance benefits remaining. Important in Adjustments to benefits.  For total claim payments, MUST be the date of the procedures to correctly figure benefits.  Will eventually transition to use this field to actually calculate aging.  See the note under Ledgers.ComputePayments.

columns.name: DateEntry
columns.summary: Date that it was changed to status received or supplemental.  It is usually attached to a claimPayment at that point, but not if user forgets.  This is still the date that it becomes important financial data.  Only applies if Received or Supplemental.  Otherwise, the date is disregarded.  User may never edit. Important in audit trail.

columns.name: LineNumber
columns.summary: Assigned when claim is created as a way to order the procs showing on a claim.  Indireclty goes out in X12 loop 2400. Used in Canadian eclaims (field F07). One based index. Is zero for total payments.

columns.name: DedEst
columns.summary: -1 if blank.  Not sure why we need to allow -1.  Calculated automatically.  User cannot edit, but can use DedEstOverride instead.

columns.name: DedEstOverride
columns.summary: -1 if blank.  Overrides the DedEst value.

columns.name: InsEstTotal
columns.summary: Always has a value.  BaseEst-(DedEst or DedEstOverride)-PaidOtherIns-OverAnnualMax.  User cannot edit, but can instead use InsEstTotalOverride. Recalculated each time TP is viewed, is saved as the value calculated for the last viewed TP. This variable should probably just be moved to memory and removed as a DB field.

columns.name: InsEstTotalOverride
columns.summary: -1 if blank.  Overrides the InsEstTotal value.

columns.name: PaidOtherInsOverride
columns.summary: -1 if blank.  Overrides the PaidOtherIns value.

columns.name: EstimateNote
columns.summary: An automatically generated note that displays information about over max, exclusions, and other limitations for which there are no fields.  Only applies to estimate.  Once it's attached to a claim, similar information can go in the remarks field.

columns.name: WriteOffEst
columns.summary: -1 if blank.  The estimated writeoff as calculated by OD.  Usually only used for PPOs.

columns.name: WriteOffEstOverride
columns.summary: -1 if blank.  Overrides WriteOffEst.  Usually only used for PPOs.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  Can be zero.  No user interface for editing.  Forced to always be the same as the procedure, or if no procedure, then the claim.

columns.name: InsSubNum
columns.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum.

columns.name: PaymentRow
columns.summary: 1-indexed.  Allows user to sort the order of payments on an EOB.  All claimprocs for a payment will have the same PaymentRow value.

columns.name: PayPlanNum
columns.summary: FK to payplan.PayPlanNum.  0 if not attached to a payplan.

columns.name: ClaimPaymentTracking
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.  Connected to the ClaimPaymentTracking DefCat.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

columns.name: DateSuppReceived
columns.summary: The date the claim proc was first set to received or supplemental. If status is set to something other than received/supplemental, this field will be set to DateTime.MinValue if DateSuppReceived is today.  If DateSuppReceived is set to a day in the past and the status is changed from received/supplemental to something else, the field will not be cleared or updated.  Db only field used by one customer and this is how they requested it.  PatNum #19191

columns.name: DateInsFinalized
columns.summary: Date of the first claimPayment for this claim.

columns.name: IsTransfer
columns.summary: Bool, defaults to false. When true, indicates that a claimproc is part of a transfer from a claim.

columns.name: ClaimAdjReasonCodes
columns.summary: Holds a comma delimited list of Claim Adjustment Reason Codes from an ERA. https: x12.org/codes/claim-adjustment-reason-codes

columns.name: IsOverpay
columns.summary: Bool, defaults to false. When true, Status is NotReceived and indicates that the claimproc represents an insurance overpayment OR underpayment. Example insurance has partially paid on a claim, this procedure has still been paid 0, so it's an underpayment. The status column in the claim edit window will show PndSup.

columns.name: SecurityHash
columns.summary: Holds the salted hash of the following claimproc fields: ClaimNum, Status, InsPayEst, InsPayAmt.

name: claimsnapshot
summary: Stores the original insurance writeoff, fee, and expected insurance payment information on claims.

columns.name: ClaimSnapshotNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ProcNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum

columns.name: ClaimType
columns.summary: "P"=primary, "S"=secondary, "Other"=other, "Cap"=capitation. Never "PreAuth" as PreAuths will never be in this table

columns.name: InsPayEst
columns.summary: Expected amount the insurance will pay on the procedure.

columns.name: Fee
columns.summary: Procedure's ProcFee

columns.name: DateTEntry
columns.summary: The date/time that the snapshot was created.  Not user editable.

columns.name: ClaimProcNum
columns.summary: FK to claimproc.ClaimProcNum

columns.name: SnapshotTrigger
columns.summary: Enum:ClaimSnapshotTrigger Stores the trigger to which this ClaimSnapshot was created.

columns.name: ClaimTrackingNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ClaimNum
columns.summary: FK to claim.ClaimNum

columns.name: TrackingType
columns.summary: Enum:ClaimTrackingType Identifies the type of claimtracking row.
