columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to user.UserNum

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is inserted or modified.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Generic column for additional info.

columns.name: TrackingDefNum
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum for custom tracking when TrackingType=StatusHistory

columns.name: TrackingErrorDefNum
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum for custom tracking errors when TrackingType=StatusHistory

name: claimvalcodelog
summary: Value codes for institutional 'claims'.  Can have up to 12 per claim.

columns.name: ClaimValCodeLogNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ClaimNum
columns.summary: FK to claim.ClaimNum.

columns.name: ClaimField
columns.summary: Descriptive abbreviation to help place field on form (Ex: "FL55" for field 55).

columns.name: ValCode
columns.summary: Value Code. 2 char.

columns.name: ValAmount
columns.summary: Value Code Amount.

columns.name: Ordinal
columns.summary: Order of Value Code

name: clearinghouse
summary: Since we can send e-claims to multiple clearinghouses, this table keeps track of each clearinghouse.  Will eventually be used for individual carriers as well if they accept

columns.name: ClearinghouseNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Description of this clearinghouse

columns.name: ExportPath
columns.summary: The path to export the X12 file to. \ is now optional.  Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

columns.name: Payors
columns.summary: A list of all payors which should have claims sent to this clearinghouse. Comma delimited with no spaces.  Not necessary if IsDefault.

columns.name: Eformat
columns.summary: Enum:ElectronicClaimFormat The format of the file that gets sent electronically.

columns.name: ISA05
columns.summary: Sender ID Qualifier. Usually ZZ, sometimes 30. Seven other values are allowed as specified in X12 document, but probably never used.

columns.name: SenderTIN
columns.summary: Used in ISA06, GS02, 1000A NM1, and 1000A PER.  If blank, then 810624427 is used to indicate Open Dental. Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

columns.name: ISA07
columns.summary: Receiver ID Qualifier.  Usually ZZ, sometimes 30. Seven other values are allowed as specified in X12 document, but probably never used.

columns.name: ISA08
columns.summary: Receiver ID. Also used in GS03. Provided by clearinghouse. Examples: BCBSGA or 0135WCH00(webMD)

columns.name: ISA15
columns.summary: "P" for Production or "T" for Test.

columns.name: Password
columns.summary: Password is usually combined with the login ID for user validation.  Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

columns.name: ResponsePath
columns.summary: The path that all incoming response files will be saved to. \ is now optional. Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

columns.name: CommBridge
columns.summary: Enum:EclaimsCommBridge  One of the included hard-coded communications bridges.  Or none to just create the claim files without uploading.

columns.name: ClientProgram
columns.summary: If applicable, this is the name of the client program to launch.  It is even used by the hard-coded comm bridges, because the user may have changed the installation directory or exe name.  Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

columns.name: LastBatchNumber
columns.summary: Each clearinghouse increments their batch numbers by one each time a claim file is sent.  User never sees this number.  Maxes out at 999, then loops back to 1.  This field must NOT be cached and must be ignored in the code except where it explicitly retrieves it from the db.  Defaults to 0 for brand new clearinghouses, which causes the first batch to go out as #1.

columns.name: ModemPort
columns.summary: Was not used.  1,2,3,or 4. The port that the modem is connected to if applicable. Always uses 9600 baud and standard settings. Will crash if port or modem not valid.

columns.name: LoginID
columns.summary: A clearinghouse usually has a login ID that is used with the password in order to access the remote server. This value is not usualy used within the actual claim.  Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

columns.name: SenderName
columns.summary: Used in 1000A NM1 and 1000A PER.  But if SenderTIN is blank, then OPEN DENTAL SOFTWARE is used instead. Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

columns.name: SenderTelephone
columns.summary: Used in 1000A PER.  But if SenderTIN is blank, then 8776861248 is used instead.  10 digit phone is required by WebMD and is universally assumed, so for now, this must be either blank or 10 digits.  Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

columns.name: GS03
columns.summary: Usually the same as ISA08, but at least one clearinghouse uses a different number here.

columns.name: ISA02
columns.summary: Authorization information. Almost always blank. Used for Denti-Cal.

columns.name: ISA04
columns.summary: Security information. Almost always blank. Used for Denti-Cal.

columns.name: ISA16
columns.summary: X12 component element separator. Two digit hexadecimal string representing an ASCII character or blank. Usually blank, implying 3A which represents ':'. For Denti-Cal, hexadecimal value 22 must be used, corresponding to '"'.

columns.name: SeparatorData
columns.summary: X12 data element separator. Two digit hexadecimal string representing an ASCII character or blank. Usually blank, implying 2A which represents '*'. For Denti-Cal, hexadecimal value 1D must be used, corresponding to the "group separator" character which has no visual representation.

columns.name: SeparatorSegment
columns.summary: X12 segment terminator. Two digit hexadecimal string representing an ASCII character or blank. Usually blank, implying 7E which represents '~'. For Denti-Cal, hexadecimal value 1C must be used, corresponding to the "file separator" character which has no visual representation.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  ClinicNum=0 for HQ.

columns.name: HqClearinghouseNum
columns.summary: FK to clearinghouse.ClearingHouseNum.  Never 0.  Points to the HQ copy of this clearinghouse. If this copy is the HQ copy, then HqClearinghouseNum=ClearinghouseNum.

columns.name: IsEraDownloadAllowed
columns.summary: Enum:EraBehaviors EraBehaviors.DownloadAndReceive by default.  This flag is implemented individually within each clearinghouse.  Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

columns.name: IsClaimExportAllowed
columns.summary: True by default.  This flag is implemented individually within each clearinghouse.  Can be overridden by clinic-level clearinghouses.

columns.name: IsAttachmentSendAllowed
columns.summary: Currently only used for DentalXChange's attachment service. This indicates that the user has set up the attachment service and would like to use it in Open Dental.

columns.name: LocationID
columns.summary: A unique identifier provided by the clearinghouse to identify the practice in their system. This is separate from the issue of clinics, where we already enforce only one clinic per clearinghouse.

columns.name: EnableXConnect
columns.summary: False by default. This bool is used to control whether a clinic has enabled XConnect for the clearinghouse.

name: clinic
summary: A clinic is usually a separate physical office location.  If multiple clinics are sharing one database, then this is used.  Patients, Operatories, Claims, and many other types of objects can be assigned to a clinic.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: Primary key.  Used in patient,payment,claimpayment,appointment,procedurelog, etc.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Use Abbr for all user-facing forms.  Description is required and should not be blank.

columns.name: Address2
columns.summary: Second line of address.

columns.name: State
columns.summary: 2 char in the US.

columns.name: Phone
columns.summary: Does not include any punctuation.  Exactly 10 digits or blank in USA and Canada.

columns.name: BankNumber
columns.summary: The account number for deposits.

columns.name: DefaultPlaceService
columns.summary: Enum:PlaceOfService Usually 0 unless a mobile clinic for instance.

columns.name: InsBillingProv
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  0=Default practice provider, -1=Treating provider.

columns.name: Fax
columns.summary: Does not include any punctuation.  Exactly 10 digits or empty in USA and Canada.

columns.name: EmailAddressNum
columns.summary: FK to emailaddress.EmailAddressNum.

columns.name: DefaultProv
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  Used in place of the default practice provider when making new patients.

columns.name: SmsContractDate
columns.summary: DateSMSContract was signed.

columns.name: SmsMonthlyLimit
columns.summary: Always stored in USD, this is the desired limit for SMS out for a given month.

columns.name: IsMedicalOnly
columns.summary: True if this clinic is a medical clinic.  Used to hide/change certain areas of Open Dental, like hiding the tooth chart and changing 'dentist' to 'provider'.

columns.name: BillingAddress
columns.summary: Overrides Address on claims if not blank.

columns.name: BillingAddress2
columns.summary: Second line of billing address.

columns.name: BillingCity
columns.summary: Overrides City on claims if BillingAddress is not blank.

columns.name: BillingState
columns.summary: Overrides State on claims if BillingAddress is not blank.

columns.name: BillingZip
columns.summary: Overrides Zip on claims if BillingAddress is not blank.

columns.name: PayToAddress
columns.summary: Overrides practice PayTo address if not blank.

columns.name: PayToAddress2
columns.summary: Second line of PayTo address.

columns.name: PayToCity
columns.summary: Overrides practice PayToCity if PayToAddress is not blank.

columns.name: PayToState
columns.summary: Overrides practice PayToState if PayToAddress is not blank.

columns.name: PayToZip
columns.summary: Overrides practice PayToZip if PayToAddress is not blank.

columns.name: UseBillAddrOnClaims
columns.summary: True if this clinic's billing address should be used on outgoing claims.

columns.name: Region
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum when definition.DefCat is Regions. A region is a way of grouping multiple clinics. Used in Ins Verification and Tasks.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: 0 based.  Clinics cache is sorted by ItemOrder if the preference ClinicListIsAlphabetical is false.

columns.name: IsInsVerifyExcluded
columns.summary: True if this clinic should be excluded from showing up in the Insurance Verification List.

columns.name: Abbr
columns.summary: Abbreviation for the Clinic's description.  Sorted by Abbr if ClinicListIsAlphabetical is true.  Use this for all user-facing forms. Abbr is required and should not be blank.

columns.name: MedLabAccountNum
columns.summary: FK to medlab.PatAccountNum.  Used to filter MedLab results by the MedLab Account Number assigned to each clinic.

columns.name: IsConfirmEnabled
columns.summary: Clinic level preference. (Better Name is "IsAutomationEnabled" but that conflicts with other definitions of what Automation means. Determines if autocomm should be sent for/from this clinic.

columns.name: IsConfirmDefault
columns.summary: Deprecated. Clinic level preference. If true then this clinic is using the default automated reminder/confirmation settings as defined by the user.

columns.name: IsNewPatApptExcluded
columns.summary: Deprecated as of 17.1, use signup portal. Indicates whether or not the New Patient Appointment version of Web Sched is excluded for this specifc clinic.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: Indicates whether or not the clinic is hidden.

columns.name: ExternalID
columns.summary: Not currently used by Open Dental but is used by other software's.

columns.name: SchedNote
columns.summary: Indicates if the clinic should only be scheduled in a certain way (e.g. ortho only, etc)

columns.name: HasProcOnRx
columns.summary: Defaults to false.  If true, will require procedure be attached to controlled prescriptions written from this clinic.

columns.name: TimeZone
columns.summary: Allows adding timezone info to FHIR datetimes.  This does not actually change the datetime of any field.

columns.name: EmailAliasOverride
columns.summary: Overrides the SenderAddress (aka Alias) for emails sent from this clinic.

name: clinicerx
summary: Tracks which clinics have access to eRx based on ClinicDescr.  Synchronized with HQ.

columns.name: ClinicErxNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  Holder of registration key only for HQ record, in customer record this will be 0.

columns.name: ClinicDesc
columns.summary: Description of a clinic from the clinic table.  Only used by OD HQ.  For customer records, use ClinicNum.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  Is the clinic that is used for accessing eRx.

columns.name: EnabledStatus
columns.summary: Enum:ErxStatus Set to true if the clinic with the given ClinicName has access to eRx.

columns.name: ClinicId
columns.summary: Clinic identifier used by the erx option.  Only used by OD HQ.

columns.name: ClinicKey
columns.summary: Unique key used by the erx option.  Only used by OD HQ.

columns.name: AccountId
columns.summary: Only used by OD HQ.

columns.name: RegistrationKeyNum
columns.summary: FK to registrationkey.RegistrationKeyNum.  HQ only, links to the registration key used to make this clinicerx row.

name: clinicpref
summary: Used to store preferences specific to clinics. Works in conjunction with the Pref table.

columns.name: ClinicPrefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Never 0 because that would indicate HQ, but all HQ prefs are stored in Pref table instead of here.

columns.name: PrefName
columns.summary: Enum: PrefName

columns.name: ValueString
columns.summary: The stored value.

name: clockevent
summary: One clock-in / clock-out pair.  Or, if the pair is a break, then it's an out/in pair. With normal clock in/out pairs, we want to know how long the employee was working.  It's the opposite with breaks. We want to know how long they were not working, so the pair is backwards. This means that a normal clock in is left incomplete when the clock out for break is created. And once both are finished, the regular in/out will surround the break. Breaks cannot be viewed easily on the same grid as regular clock events for this reason. And since breaks do not affect pay, they should not clutter the normal grid.

columns.name: ClockEventNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: EmployeeNum
columns.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum

columns.name: TimeEntered1
columns.summary: The actual time that this entry was entered.  Cannot be 01-01-0001.

columns.name: TimeDisplayed1
columns.summary: The time to display and to use in all calculations.  Cannot be 01-01-0001.

columns.name: ClockStatus
columns.summary: Enum:TimeClockStatus  Home, Lunch, or Break.  The status really only applies to the clock out.  Except the Break status applies to both out and in.

columns.name: TimeEntered2
columns.summary: The user can never edit this, but the program has to be able to edit this when user clocks out.  Can be 01-01-0001 if not clocked out yet.

columns.name: TimeDisplayed2
columns.summary: User can edit. Can be 01-01-0001 if not clocked out yet.

columns.name: OTimeHours
columns.summary: This is a manual override for OTimeAuto.  Typically -1 hour (-01:00:00) to indicate no override.  When used as override, allowed values are zero or positive.  This is an alternative to using a TimeAdjust row.

columns.name: OTimeAuto
columns.summary: Automatically calculated OT.  Will be zero if none.

columns.name: Adjust
columns.summary: This is a manual override of AdjustAuto.  Ignored unless AdjustIsOverridden set to true.  When used as override, it's typically negative, although zero and positive are also allowed.

columns.name: AdjustAuto
columns.summary: Automatically calculated Adjust.  Will be zero if none.

columns.name: AdjustIsOverridden
columns.summary: True if AdjustAuto is overridden by Adjust.

columns.name: Rate2Hours
columns.summary: This is a manual override for Rate2Auto.  Typically -1 hour (-01:00:00) to indicate no override.  When used as override, allowed values are zero or positive.  This is the portion of the hours worked which are at Rate2, so it's not in addition to the hours worked.  Also used to calculate the Rate2 OT.

columns.name: Rate2Auto
columns.summary: Automatically calculated rate2 pay.  Will be zero if none.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  The clinic the ClockEvent was entered at.

columns.name: Rate3Hours
columns.summary: This is a manual override for Rate3Auto.  Typically -1 hour (-01:00:00) to indicate no override.  When used as override, allowed values are zero or positive.  This is the portion of the hours worked which are at Rate3, so it's not in addition to the hours worked.  Also used to calculate the Rate3 OT.

columns.name: Rate3Auto
columns.summary: Automatically calculated Rate3 pay.  Will be zero if none.

columns.name: IsWorkingHome
columns.summary: True if the Clock Event is made by choosing "Available at Home" when clocking in. Will be false if "Available At Office" is selected instead.

columns.name: CloudAddressNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: IpAddress
columns.summary: The IP address the user is connecting from.

columns.name: UserNumLastConnect
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

columns.name: DateTimeLastConnect
columns.summary: DateTime of the last successful login from the address.

name: codegroup
summary: These groups of procedure codes are used in Benefit Frequencies (and Insurance History?). We can't use CovCats because those spans are frequently far too broad.  We often need specific codes. Cached.

columns.name: CodeGroupNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ProcCodes
columns.summary: List of D codes with commas and dashes. No spaces. Example: "D0000-D0999,D2140-D2161,D2750" would mean all exams and xrays, some amalgams, and a crown.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Zero-based. CodeGroups that don't show in either list (IsHidden=true and ShowInAgeLimit=false) get higher ItemOrders so that then are at the bottom of the setup list.

columns.name: CodeGroupFixed
columns.summary: Enum:EnumCodeGroupFixed 0=None,BW,PanoFMX,Exam,Perio,Prophy,SRP,FMDebride,Fluoride,Sealant. Six are used in sheet static text fields (example StaticTextField.dateLastBW), and seven are used in Ins History Window.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: If true, a user will not be able to see this codegroup as an option in the benefit edit form or any grid on FormInsBenefits.

columns.name: ShowInAgeLimit
columns.summary: If true, this codegroup will show in Age Limitations grid. Control of showing in Freq Lim is done separately using IsHidden.

columns.name: ShowInFrequency
columns.summary: If true, this codegroup will show in the Frequency Limitations Grid.

name: codesystem
summary: Used for tracking code systems imported to OD. HL7OID used for sending messages.  This must be a database table in order to keep track of VersionCur between sessions.

columns.name: CodeSystemNum
columns.summary: Primary key. Not currently referenced anywhere.

columns.name: VersionCur
columns.summary: Only used for display, not actually interpreted. Updated by Code System importer.  Examples: 2013 or 1

columns.name: VersionAvail
columns.summary: Only used for display, not actually interpreted. Updated by Convert DB script.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Notes to display to user. Examples: "CDT codes distributed via program updates.", "CPT codes require purchase and download from www.ama.com"

name: commlog
summary: Tracks all forms of communications with patients, including emails, phonecalls, postcards, etc.  Any changes made to this table need to be added to CommlogHist and CommlogHists.CreateFromCommlog().

columns.name: CommlogNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. This will be 0 if Referral.

columns.name: CommDateTime
columns.summary: Date and time of entry

columns.name: CommType
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. This will be 0 if Referral.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Note for this commlog entry.

columns.name: Mode_
columns.summary: Enum:CommItemMode Phone, email, etc.

columns.name: SentOrReceived
columns.summary: Enum:CommSentOrReceived Neither=0,Sent=1,Received=2.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

columns.name: Signature
columns.summary: Signature.  For details, see procnote.Signature.

columns.name: SigIsTopaz
columns.summary: True if signed using the Topaz signature pad, false otherwise.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed.

columns.name: DateTimeEnd
columns.summary: Date and time when commlog ended.  Mainly for internal use.

columns.name: CommSource
columns.summary: Enum:CommItemSource Set to the source of the entity that created this commlog.  E.g. WebSched.

columns.name: ProgramNum
columns.summary: FK to program.ProgramNum.  This will be 0 unless CommSource is set to ProgramLink.

columns.name: DateTEntry
columns.summary: Track Date Created for commlogs. Value for existing commlogs show as blank in the UI. Not editable by user.

columns.name: ReferralNum
columns.summary: FK to referral.ReferralNum.

columns.name: CommReferralBehavior
columns.summary: Enum:EnumCommReferralBehavior Changes how this referral commlog displays within grids.

name: commoptout
summary: The patient does not want to recieve messages for a particular type of communication.

columns.name: CommOptOutNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient who is opting out of this form of communication.

columns.name: OptOutSms
columns.summary: Enum:CommOptOutType The type of communication for which this patient does not want to receive automated sms.

columns.name: OptOutEmail
columns.summary: Enum:CommOptOutType The type of communication for which this patient does not want to receive automated email.

name: computer
summary: Keeps track of the computers in an office.  The list will eventually become cluttered with the names of old computers that are no longer in service.  The old rows can be safely deleted.  Although the primary key is used in at least one table, this will probably be changed, and the computername will become the primary key.

columns.name: ComputerNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: CompName
columns.summary: Name of the computer.

columns.name: LastHeartBeat
columns.summary: Allows us to tell which computers are running.  All workstations record a heartbeat here at an interval of 3 minutes. So if the heartbeat is fairly fresh, then that's an accurate indicator of whether Open Dental is running on that computer.

name: computerpref
summary: Enables preference specific to individual computers on a customer network.

columns.name: ComputerPrefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ComputerName
columns.summary: The human-readable name of the computer on the network (not the IP address).

columns.name: GraphicsUseHardware
columns.summary: Set to true if the tooth chart is to use a hardware accelerated OpenGL window when available. Set to false to use software rendering when available. Of course, the final pixel format on the customer machine depends on the list of available formats. Best match pixel format is always used. This option only applies if GraphicsSimple is set to false.

columns.name: GraphicsSimple
columns.summary: Enum:DrawingMode Set to 1 to use the low-quality 2D tooth chart in the chart module. Set to 0 to use a 3D DirectX based tooth chart in the chart module. This option helps the program run even when the local graphics hardware is buggy or unavailable.

columns.name: SensorType
columns.summary: Indicates the type of Suni sensor connected to the local computer (if any). This can be a value of A, B, C, or D.

columns.name: SensorBinned
columns.summary: Indicates wether or not the Suni sensor uses binned operation.

columns.name: SensorPort
columns.summary: Indicates which Suni box port to connect with. There are 2 ports on a box (ports 0 and 1).

columns.name: SensorExposure
columns.summary: Indicates the exposure level to use when capturing from a Suni sensor. Values can be 1 through 7.

columns.name: GraphicsDoubleBuffering
columns.summary: Indicates if the user prefers double-buffered 3D tooth-chart (where applicable).

columns.name: PreferredPixelFormatNum
columns.summary: Indicates the current OpenGL pixel format by number which the user prefers (if using OpenGL).

columns.name: AtoZpath
columns.summary: The path of the A-Z folder for the specified computer.  Overrides the officewide default.  Used when multiple locations are on a single virtual database and they each want to look to the local data folder for images.

columns.name: TaskKeepListHidden
columns.summary: If the global setting for showing the Task List is on, this controls if it should be hidden on this specified computer

columns.name: TaskDock
columns.summary: Dock task bar on bottom (0) or right (1).

columns.name: TaskX
columns.summary: X pos for right docked task list.

columns.name: TaskY
columns.summary: Y pos for bottom docked task list.

columns.name: DirectXFormat
columns.summary: Holds a semi-colon separated list of enumeration names and values representing a DirectX format. If blank, then             no format is currently set and the best theoretical format will be chosen at program startup. If this value is set to             'opengl' then this computer is using OpenGL and a DirectX format will not be picked.

columns.name: ScanDocSelectSource
columns.summary: Show the select scanner dialog when scanning documents. This can also be set to prevent a couple of issues that can happen after scanning with some Canon scanners. One issue is when the Imaging Module won't load some PDFs. The other issue is when listbox selections won't visually update in other windows like the commlog.

columns.name: ScanDocShowOptions
columns.summary: Show the scanner options dialog when scanning documents.

columns.name: ScanDocDuplex
columns.summary: Attempt to scan in duplex mode when scanning multipage documents with an ADF.

columns.name: ScanDocGrayscale
columns.summary: Scan in gray scale when scanning documents.

columns.name: ScanDocResolution
columns.summary: Scan at the specified resolution when scanning documents.  Example: 150.

columns.name: ScanDocQuality
columns.summary: 0-100. Quality of jpeg after compression when scanning documents.  100 indicates full quality.  Opposite of compression.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  The most recent clinic for this computer.  Determines which clinic is used when loading Open Dental.

columns.name: ApptViewNum
columns.summary: FK to apptview.ApptViewNum.  The most recent appt view num for this computer.  Used when opening with the Appts module in conjunction with ClinicNum if this ApptViewNum is associated to the ClinicNum.

columns.name: RecentApptView
columns.summary: Deprecated.  The index of the most recent appt view for this computer.  Uses it when opening.  This column cannot be dropped due to older versions using it upon opening (prior to calling the update file copier code) so they will throw a UE if this column is ever dropped.

columns.name: PatSelectSearchMode
columns.summary: Enum:SearchMode The search mode that is used when loading the patient select window, and while typing. When 0 the patient select window will use the DB wide pref PatientSelectUsesSearchButton.

columns.name: NoShowDecimal
columns.summary: If true, don't warn user if the region's decimal setting is not 2.

columns.name: ComputerOS
columns.summary: Enum:PlatformOD The current operating system platform for the computer.

columns.name: HelpButtonXAdjustment
columns.summary: Deprecated.

columns.name: GraphicsUseDirectX11
columns.summary: Enum:YN Unknown, Yes, No.

columns.name: Zoom
columns.summary: Default 0.  Typically a bit above 100. Example 120. Below 100 is allowed but rare, like 80. In addition to normal monitor scale set in Windows. 0 is treated the same as 100, or no additional zoom.

columns.name: VideoRectangle
columns.summary: This is x,y,w,h format for the desktop location of the Video window. This is saved each time the Video window closes. If the Video window is maximized, then the form will instead be like this: "100,120,600,800,Max". The rectangle here defines the RestoreBounds when user unmaximizes.

columns.name: CreditCardTerminalId
columns.summary: Holds the value of the last Terminal used in a transaction. Used for PayConnect2 in FormPayConnect2 to set the default value of the Terminal list loading a new terminal payment.

name: confirmationrequest
summary: Requests that have been sent via EConnector to HQ. HQ will process and update status as responses become available.

columns.name: ConfirmationRequestNum
columns.summary: PK. Generated by HQ.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum for the corresponding appointment.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum for the corresponding patient.

columns.name: ApptNum
columns.summary: Foreign key to the appointment represented by this AutoCommAppt.

columns.name: DateTimeConfirmExpire
columns.summary: Generated by OD. Typically the time of the appointment. This is the time at which HQ will consider this unconfirmed and auto terminate.

columns.name: ShortGUID
columns.summary: Generated by HQ. Identifies this AutoCommGuid in future transactions between HQ and OD.

columns.name: ConfirmCode
columns.summary: Generated by HQ. The code that the patient will text back in order to confirm the appointment. If received then it indicates a positive response.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: Generated by OD. Timestamp when row is created.

columns.name: DateTimeConfirmTransmit
columns.summary: Generated by OD. Timestamp when EConnector sent this confirm request to HQ. Stored in local customer timezone.

columns.name: DateTimeRSVP
columns.summary: Generated by OD. Timestamp when HQ updates this request to indicate that it has been terminated. RSVPStatusCode will change to its final state at this time. Stored in local customer timezone.

columns.name: RSVPStatus
columns.summary: Enum:RSVPStatusCodes Generated by OD in some cases and HQ in others. Indicates current status in the lifecycle of this ConfirmationRequest.

columns.name: ResponseDescript
columns.summary: Generated by OD in some cases and HQ in others. Any human readable error message generated by either HQ or EConnector. Used for debugging.

columns.name: GuidMessageFromMobile
columns.summary: FK to smsfrommobile.GuidMessage. Generated at HQ when the confirmation pending is terminated with confirmation text message. Also allows SmsFromMobile to be linked to ConfirmationRequest in OD proper.

columns.name: ApptDateTime
columns.summary: The Date and time of the original appointment. We need this in case the appointment was moved and needs another reminder sent out.

columns.name: TSPrior
columns.summary: This was the TSPrior used to send this reminder.

columns.name: DoNotResend
columns.summary: Indicates whether the user has chosen to not resend the confirmation request when the AptDateTime has changed.

columns.name: SendStatus
columns.summary: Indicates status of message.

columns.name: ApptReminderRuleNum
columns.summary: FK to apptreminderrule.ApptReminderRuleNum. Allows us to look up the rules to determine how to send this apptcomm out.

columns.name: MessageFk
columns.summary: FK to primary key of appropriate table.

columns.name: DateTimeSent
columns.summary: DateTime the message was sent.

name: connectiongroup
summary: Used in the Central Enterprise Management Tool for creating a group of connections.

columns.name: ConnectionGroupNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Description of the connection group

name: conngroupattach
summary: Used in the Central Enterprise Management Tool to link CentralConnections and ConnectionGroups.  Each connection can be in multiple groups.

columns.name: ConnGroupAttachNum
columns.summary: Primary Key

columns.name: ConnectionGroupNum
columns.summary: FK to connectiongroup.ConnectionGroupNum

columns.name: CentralConnectionNum
columns.summary: FK to centralconnection.CentralConnectionNum

name: contact
summary: Like a rolodex for businesses that the office interacts with.  Used to store pharmacies, etc.

columns.name: ContactNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: LName
columns.summary: Last name or, frequently, the entire name.

columns.name: FName
columns.summary: First name is optional.

columns.name: WkPhone
columns.summary: Work phone.

columns.name: Fax
columns.summary: Fax number.

columns.name: Category
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum

columns.name: Notes
columns.summary: Note for this contact.

name: county
summary: Used in public health.

columns.name: CountyNum
columns.summary: Primary Key.

columns.name: CountyName
columns.summary: Frequently used as the primary key of this table.  But it's allowed to change.  Change is programmatically synchronized.

columns.name: CountyCode
columns.summary: Optional. Usage varies.

name: covcat
summary: Insurance coverage categories.  They need to look like in the manual for the American calculations to work properly.

columns.name: CovCatNum
columns.summary: Primary key.  Only used in Benefit and CovSpan tables.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Description of this category.

columns.name: DefaultPercent
columns.summary: Default percent for this category. -1 to skip this category and not apply a percentage.

columns.name: CovOrder
columns.summary: The order in which the categories are displayed.  Includes hidden categories. 0-based.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: If true, this category will be hidden.

columns.name: EbenefitCat
columns.summary: Enum:EbenefitCategory  The X12 benefit categories.  Each CovCat can link to one X12 category.  Default is 0 (unlinked).

name: covspan
summary: Always attached to covcats, this describes the span of procedure codes to which the category applies.

columns.name: CovSpanNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: CovCatNum
columns.summary: FK to covcat.CovCatNum.

columns.name: FromCode
columns.summary: Lower range of the span.  Does not need to be a valid code.

columns.name: ToCode
columns.summary: Upper range of the span.  Does not need to be a valid code.

name: cpt
summary: Other tables generally use the CptCode as their foreign key.

columns.name: CptNum
columns.summary: Primary key. .

columns.name: CptCode
columns.summary: Cpt code. Not allowed to edit this column once saved in the database.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Short Description provided by Cpt documentation.

columns.name: VersionIDs
columns.summary: Comma delimited list of years the Cpt code existed in that have been imported into this table.

name: creditcard
summary: One credit card along with any recurring charge information.

columns.name: CreditCardNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: Zip
columns.summary: Postal code.

columns.name: XChargeToken
columns.summary: Token for X-Charge. Alphanumeric, upper and lower case, about 15 char long.  Passed into Xcharge instead of the actual card number. Used for EdgeExpress as well.

columns.name: CCNumberMasked
columns.summary: Credit Card Number.  Will be stored masked: XXXXXXXXXXXX1234.

columns.name: CCExpiration
columns.summary: Only month and year are used, the day will usually be 1.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: The order that multiple cards will show.  Zero-based.  First one will be default.

columns.name: ChargeAmt
columns.summary: Amount set for recurring charges.

columns.name: DateStart
columns.summary: Start date for recurring charges.

columns.name: DateStop
columns.summary: Stop date for recurring charges.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Any notes about the credit card or account goes here.

columns.name: PayPlanNum
columns.summary: FK to payplan.PayPlanNum.

columns.name: PayConnectToken
columns.summary: Token for PayConnect.  PayConnect returns a token and token expiration, when requested by the merchant's system, to be used instead of actual credit card number in subsequent transactions.

columns.name: PayConnectTokenExp
columns.summary: Expiration for the PayConnect token.  Used with the PayConnect token instead of the actual credit card number and expiration.

columns.name: Procedures
columns.summary: Comma delimited list of the ProcCodes authorized to allow a recurring charge to be processed for the credit card. When empty, ProcCodes will not be considered when authorizing recurring charges.

columns.name: CCSource
columns.summary: Enum:CreditCardSource Indicates which application made this credit card and token.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. The clinic where this card was added. Each clinic could have a different AuthKey and different AuthKeys could generate overlapping tokens.

columns.name: ExcludeProcSync
columns.summary: Only used at OD HQ.  Excludes credit card from syncing default procedures.  False by default.

columns.name: PaySimpleToken
columns.summary: Token for PaySimple.  PaySimple returns a token, when requested by the merchant's system, to be used instead of actual credit card number in subsequent transactions.

columns.name: ChargeFrequency
columns.summary: Stores how often the credit card gets charged for a recurring charge. The card can either be charged fixed days of the month orfixed week days of the month. Some examples of the former are "4th day of the month" or "1st and 16th day of the month". Some examples ofthe latter are "Third Monday of the month" or "Every other Friday of the month". If the first character of this column is a 0, thenthe frequency is fixed day of the month. If the first character is 1, the frequency is fixed week days of the month. The next characteris a pipe for separation. If fixed day of the month, the remaining characters will be a comma-separated list of days of the month.If fixed week days, the next character will represent type of frequency (Every, EveryOther, First, etc.). Then a pipe follows. The lastcharacter will be the day of the week (0 for Sunday, 1 for Monday, etc.).

columns.name: CanChargeWhenNoBal
columns.summary: Set true to indicate the Credit Card in question can be charged when the Patient account balance is $0, which corresponds directlyto a preference called "RecurringChargesAllowedWhenPatNoBal" (true by default) which must be turned on via Module>Account>Misc to beavailable.

columns.name: PaymentType
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Payment type override for recurring charges.

columns.name: IsRecurringActive
columns.summary: True by default.  Set to false to inactivate this specific credit card from the recurring charges (both manual and via the service).

columns.name: Nickname
columns.summary: Nickname or alias. Currently only used in Web API for PaySimple.

columns.name: CardHolderName
columns.summary: The card holder name associated with the credit card. Not used by all merchant services.

name: custrefentry
summary: For internal use only.

columns.name: CustRefEntryNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNumCust
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  The customer seeking a reference.

columns.name: PatNumRef
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  The chosen reference.  This is the customer who was given as a reference to the new customer.

columns.name: DateEntry
columns.summary: Date the reference was chosen.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Notes specific to this particular reference entry, mostly for a special reference situation.

name: custreference
summary: One to one relation with the patient table representing each customer as a reference.

columns.name: CustReferenceNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: DateMostRecent
columns.summary: Most recent date the reference was used, loosely kept updated.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Notes specific to this customer as a reference.

columns.name: IsBadRef
columns.summary: Set to true if this customer was a bad reference.

name: cvx
summary: Vaccines administered.  Other tables generally use the CvxCode as their foreign key.

columns.name: CvxNum
columns.summary: Primary key. .

columns.name: CvxCode
columns.summary: Cvx code. Not allowed to edit this column once saved in the database.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Short Description provided by Cvx documentation.

columns.name: IsActive
columns.summary: Not currently in use.  Might not need this column.  If we use this in the future, then convert from string to bool.  1 if the code is an active code, 0 if the code is inactive.

name: dashboardar
summary: A table just used by the dashboard to store historical AR because it never changes and it takes too long (1 second for each of the 12 dates) to compute on the fly.  One entry per month going back at least 12 months.  This table gets automatically filled the first time that the dashboard is used.  The most recent month also gets added by using the dashboard.

columns.name: DashboardARNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: DateCalc
columns.summary: This date will always be the last day of a month.

columns.name: BalTotal
columns.summary: Bal_0_30+Bal_31_60+Bal_61_90+BalOver90 for all patients.  This should also exactly equal BalTotal for all patients with positive amounts.  Negative BalTotals are credits, not A/R.

columns.name: InsEst
columns.summary: Sum of all InsEst for all patients for the month.

name: dashboardcell
summary: Each DashboardLayout can include multiple DashboardCell(s). DashboardLayout and DashboardCell work in conjunction to form the dashboard layout.

columns.name: DashboardCellNum
columns.summary: PK.

columns.name: DashboardLayoutNum
columns.summary: FK to dashboardlayout.DashboardLayoutNum. This foreign key object will include the 0 based DashboardTabOrder, which is used to place this DashboardCell.

columns.name: CellRow
columns.summary: The row to which this DashboardCell belongs. 0 based.

columns.name: CellColumn
columns.summary: The column to which this DashboardCell belongs. 0 based.

columns.name: CellType
columns.summary: Enum:DashboardCellType Determines what type of control will be docked in this cell.

columns.name: CellSettings
columns.summary: Typically a serialized string that the control will accept in order to change view attributes.

columns.name: LastQueryTime
columns.summary: Not used yet. Timestamp at which the cached data behind this cell was last retrieved.

columns.name: LastQueryData
columns.summary: Not used yet. Cached data behind this cell.

columns.name: RefreshRateSeconds
columns.summary: Not used yet. Frequency at which the cached data behind this cell should be retrieved.

name: dashboardlayout
summary: Each tab in the dashboard has a corresponding DashboardLayout. DashboardLayout and DashboardCell work in conjunction to form the dashboard layout.

columns.name: DashboardLayoutNum
columns.summary: PK.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

columns.name: UserGroupNum
columns.summary: FK to usergroup.UserGroupNum.

columns.name: DashboardTabName
columns.summary: Text shown in the tab header.

columns.name: DashboardTabOrder
columns.summary: Orders the tabs in the tab control. 0 based.

columns.name: DashboardRows
columns.summary: Number of rows for this DashboardLayout. Min value of 1.

columns.name: DashboardColumns
columns.summary: Number of columns for this DashboardLayout. Min value of 1.

columns.name: DashboardGroupName
columns.summary: Groups multiple DashboardLayout(s) together.

columns.name: DatabaseMaintenanceNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: MethodName
columns.summary: The name of the databasemaintenance name.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: Set to true to indicate that the method is hidden.

columns.name: IsOld
columns.summary: Set to true to indicate that the method is old.

columns.name: DateLastRun
columns.summary: Updates the date and time they run the method.

columns.name: DbmLogNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  This is the assigned user dbm log.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: Foreign key to any table defined in the DbmLogType Enumeration.

columns.name: FKeyType
columns.summary: Enum:DbmLogFKeyType The type of log.

columns.name: ActionType
columns.summary: Enum:DbmLogActionType The type of verification.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: DateTime the row was added.

columns.name: MethodName
columns.summary: The name of the DBM that created this row.

columns.name: LogText
columns.summary: The description of exactly what was done.

name: definition
summary: The info in the definition table is used by other tables extensively.  Almost every table in the database links to definition. Almost all links to this table will be to a DefNum.  Using the DefNum, you can find any of the other fields of interest, usually the ItemName. Make sure to look at the Defs class to see how the definitions are used.  Loaded into memory ahead of time for speed.

columns.name: DefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Category
columns.summary: Enum:DefCat

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Order that each item shows on various lists. 0-indexed.

columns.name: ItemName
columns.summary: Each category is a little different.  This field is usually the common name of the item.

columns.name: ItemValue
columns.summary: This field can be used to store extra info about the item. Used extensively by ImageCategories to store single letter codes.

columns.name: ItemColor
columns.summary: Some categories include a color option.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: If hidden, the item will not show on any list, but can still be referenced.

name: deflink
summary: This table holds rows for linking a definition object to another object.  Allows for a many-to-many relationship between definitions and other object types.

columns.name: DefLinkNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: DefNum
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. The definition that is linked to

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: A foreign key to a table associated with the DefLinkType. Uses include:  ClinicNum with DefLinkType ClinicSpecialty, PatNum with DefLinkType Patient.

columns.name: LinkType
columns.summary: Enum:DefLinkType The type of link.

name: deletedobject
summary: When some objects are deleted, we sometimes need a way to track them for synching purposes.  Other objects already have fields for IsHidden or PatStatus which track deletions just fine.  Those types of objects will not use this table.

columns.name: DeletedObjectNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ObjectNum
columns.summary: Foreign key to a number of different tables, depending on which type it is.

columns.name: ObjectType
columns.summary: Enum:DeletedObjectType

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: Updated any time the row is altered in any way.

name: deposit
summary: A deposit slip.  Contains multiple insurance and patient checks.

columns.name: DepositNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: DateDeposit
columns.summary: The date of the deposit.

columns.name: BankAccountInfo
columns.summary: User editable.  Usually includes name on the account and account number.  Possibly the bank name as well.

columns.name: Amount
columns.summary: Total amount of the deposit. User not allowed to directly edit.

columns.name: Memo
columns.summary: Short description to help identify the deposit.

columns.name: Batch
columns.summary: Holds the batch number for the deposit. Does not have a default value. 25 character limit.

columns.name: DepositAccountNum
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Links this deposit to a definition of type AutoDeposit.  When set to a valid value, it indicates that this deposit is an "auto deposit".

columns.name: IsSentToQuickBooksOnline
columns.summary: Bool that indicates of a deposit has already been sent via QuickBooks Online. Defaults to false. Only true when successfully sent from FormDepositEdit.cs

name: dictcustom
summary: Spell check custom dictionary, shared by the whole office.

columns.name: DictCustomNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: WordText
columns.summary: No space or punctuation allowed.

name: discountplan
summary: Discount plans will automatically create adjustments when procedures are completed. The fee schedule associated to the discount plan will be used with the UCR fee schedule in order to determine the "discount". The associated DefNum will be the adjustment type that is used so that users can quickly query adjustments to see discount plan usage.

columns.name: DiscountPlanNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Description of this discount plan

columns.name: FeeSchedNum
columns.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum

columns.name: DefNum
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.  Represents the adjustment type of the feesched plan.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: Set true to hide in Discount Plan list.

columns.name: PlanNote
columns.summary: Note for this plan.

columns.name: ExamFreqLimit
columns.summary: Number of Procedures allowed for a discount plans Exam category.

columns.name: XrayFreqLimit
columns.summary: Number of Procedures allowed for a discount plans X-Ray category.

columns.name: ProphyFreqLimit
columns.summary: Number of Procedures allowed for a discount plans Prophylaxis category.

columns.name: FluorideFreqLimit
columns.summary: Number of Procedures allowed for a discount plans Fluoride category.

columns.name: PerioFreqLimit
columns.summary: Number of Procedures allowed for a discount plans Periodontal category.

columns.name: LimitedExamFreqLimit
columns.summary: Number of Procedures allowed for a discount plans Limited Exam category.

columns.name: PAFreqLimit
columns.summary: Number of Procedures allowed for a discount plans Periapical X-Ray category.

columns.name: AnnualMax
columns.summary: Annual discount maximum for frequency limitations. -1 indicates blank or no annual max limitation.

name: discountplansub
summary: Table used to determine discount plan subscribers, as well as the effective date range of a discount plan.

columns.name: DiscountSubNum
columns.summary: PK

columns.name: DiscountPlanNum
columns.summary: FK to discountplan.DiscountPlanNum, represents which plan the patient is subscribed to.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum which represents the subscriber

columns.name: DateEffective
columns.summary: When the discount plan should start to impact procedure fees.

columns.name: DateTerm
columns.summary: When the discount plan should no longer impact procedure fees.

columns.name: SubNote
columns.summary: Note for this sub.

name: disease
summary: Each row is one disease that one patient has.  Now called a problem in the UI.  Must have a DiseaseDefNum.

columns.name: DiseaseNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

columns.name: DiseaseDefNum
columns.summary: FK to diseasedef.DiseaseDefNum.  The disease description is in that table.

columns.name: PatNote
columns.summary: Any note about this disease that is specific to this patient. When importing from eForms, this is where the disease name goes for "Other" when there's no match.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: The last date and time this row was altered.  Not user editable.

columns.name: ProbStatus
columns.summary: Enum:ProblemStatus Active=0, Resolved=1, Inactive=2.

columns.name: DateStart
columns.summary: Date that the disease was diagnosed.  Can be minval if unknown.

columns.name: DateStop
columns.summary: Date that the disease was set resolved or inactive.  Will be minval if still active.  ProbStatus should be used to determine if it is active or not.

columns.name: SnomedProblemType
columns.summary: FK to snomed.SnomedCode.  Used in EHR CCD export/import only.  Must be one of the following SNOMED codes: Problem/Concern (55607006 or blank), Finding (404684003), Complaint (409586006), Dignosis (282291009), Condition (64572001), FunctionalLimitation (248536006), Symptom (418799008).

columns.name: FunctionStatus
columns.summary: Enum:FunctionalStatus  Used to export EHR CCD functional status and/or cognitive status information only.

name: diseasedef
summary: A list of diseases that can be assigned to patients.  Cannot be deleted if in use by any patients.

columns.name: DiseaseDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: 0-based.  The order that the diseases will show in various lists.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: If hidden, the disease will still show on any patient that it was previously attached to, but it will not be available for future patients.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: The last date and time this row was altered.  Not user editable.

columns.name: ICD9Code
columns.summary: FK to icd9.Icd9Code.  Example: 250.00 for diabetes.  User not allowed to enter any string anymore, must pick one from the Icd9Code table.  Some may exist in the databases without linking to a valid Icd9Code table entry if the ConvertDatabase could not find the user typed string in the list of valid Icd9Codes.

columns.name: SnomedCode
columns.summary: FK to snomed.SnomedCode.  Example: 230572002 for diabetic neuropathy.  User not allowed to enter any string anymore, must pick from the Snomed table.  Some may exist in the databases without linking to a valid Snomed table entry if the ConvertDatabase could find the user typed string in the list of valid SnomedCodes.

columns.name: Icd10Code
columns.summary: FK to icd10.Icd10Code.  Example: E10.1 for 'Type 1 diabetes mellitus with ketoacidosis'. User not allowed to enter any string anymore, must pick one from the Icd10Code table.

name: displayfield
summary: Allows customization of which fields display in various lists and grids.  For now, the only grid is ProgressNotes.  Will also eventually let users set column widths and translate titles.  For now, the selections are the same for all computers.

columns.name: DisplayFieldNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: InternalName
columns.summary: This is the internal name that OD uses to identify the field within this category. This will be the default description if the user doesn't specify an alternate in Description. For Ortho chart, this column will be "Signature", "Provider", or blank. For SuperFamilyGridCols, if this is a patfield column, then this will be blank.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Order to display in the grid or list. Every entry must have a unique itemorder.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Optional alternate description to display for field. Can be in another language. For Ortho, this is the 'key', since InternalName is blank sometimes. For SuperFamilyGridCols, if this is a patfield column, then this will be the name of the patfield.FieldName.

columns.name: ColumnWidth
columns.summary: For grid columns, this lets user override the column width.  Especially useful for foreign languages.

columns.name: Category
columns.summary: Enum:DisplayFieldCategory If category is 0, then this is attached to a ChartView.

columns.name: ChartViewNum
columns.summary: FK to chartview.ChartViewNum. 0 if attached to a category.

columns.name: PickList
columns.summary: Newline delimited string which contains the selectable options in combo box dropdowns.  Specifically for the Ortho chart.

columns.name: DescriptionOverride
columns.summary: Only used in Ortho and SuperFamilyGridCols (PatField). Ortho chart display fields utilize the InternalName field for Signature and Provider indicators, this field is here to override description. Some users want to use different fields but use the same description for multiple tabs. Example: The display field of WeightWeekly shows as "Weight" and in another tab the field for WeightMonthly can also show as "Weight".

name: displayreport
summary: One row per standard report.

columns.name: DisplayReportNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Category
columns.summary: Enum:DisplayReportCategory 0 - ProdInc; 1 - Daily, 2 - Monthly, 3 - Lists, 4 - PublicHealth, 5 - ArizonaPrimaryCare.

columns.name: IsVisibleInSubMenu
columns.summary: When true and IsHidden is false, will show this report in a pop out sub menu.

name: dispsupply
summary: A dental supply or office supply item that has been dispensed.

columns.name: DispSupplyNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SupplyNum
columns.summary: FK to supply.SupplyNum

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum

columns.name: DispQuantity
columns.summary: Quantity given out.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Notes on the dispensed supply.

name: document
summary: Represents a single document in the imaging module.

columns.name: DocNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Description of the document.

columns.name: DateCreated
columns.summary: Date and time. Can be edited by user, but not forward dated without that permission.

columns.name: DocCategory
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Categories for documents. 0 for ChartLetters.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  The document will be located in the patient folder of this patient.

columns.name: FileName
columns.summary: The name of the file. Does not include any directory info.

columns.name: ImgType
columns.summary: Enum:ImageType Document, Radiograph, Photo, File, Attachment.

columns.name: IsFlipped
columns.summary: True if flipped horizontally. A vertical flip would be stored as a horizontal flip plus a 180 rotation.

columns.name: DegreesRotated
columns.summary: Any positive or negative, including decimals.

columns.name: ToothNumbers
columns.summary: An optional list of tooth numbers. In Db, rigorously formatted as American numbers, and separated by commas.  For display, uses hyphens for sequences.  Very likely supports international tooth numbers, but not tested for that.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: MediumText, so max length=16M for API upload base64.

columns.name: SigIsTopaz
columns.summary: True if the signature is in Topaz format rather than OD format.

columns.name: Signature
columns.summary: The encrypted and bound signature in base64 format.  The signature is bound to the byte sequence of the original image. Signature for ChartLetter is also bound to bytes of Word doc, but it might be a slightly different algorithm than non-ChartLetters.

columns.name: CropX
columns.summary: Crop rectangle X. May be negative. First, image is rotated as needed around center. Then, clipped to this crop rectangle.  X-Y is center of the crop rectangle relative to center of the image, and where positive is to the upper right of the center of the image.

columns.name: CropY
columns.summary: Crop rectangle Y. May be negative. First, image is rotated as needed around center. Then, clipped to this crop rectangle. X-Y is center of the crop rectangle relative to center of the image, and where positive is to the upper right of the center of the image.

columns.name: CropW
columns.summary: Crop rectangle Width in original image pixel scale.  May be zero if no cropping.  May be greater than original image width.

columns.name: CropH
columns.summary: Crop rectangle Height in original image pixel scale.  May be zero if no cropping.  May be greater than original image height.

columns.name: WindowingMin
columns.summary: The lower value of the "windowing" (contrast/brightness) for radiographs.  Default is 0.  Max is 255.

columns.name: WindowingMax
columns.summary: The upper value of the "windowing" (contrast/brightness) for radiographs.  Default is 0(no windowing).  Max is 255. For 12 bit images with a max of 4096, the same max of 255 is used here, but it's just scaled proportionally (x16).

columns.name: MountItemNum
columns.summary: FK to mountitem.MountItemNum. If set, then this image will only show on a mount, not in the main tree. If set to 0, then no mount item is associated with this document.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: Date/time last altered.

columns.name: RawBase64
columns.summary: The raw file data encoded as base64.  Only used if there is no AtoZ folder.

columns.name: Thumbnail
columns.summary: Thumbnail encoded as base64.  Only present if not using AtoZ folder. 100x100 pixels, jpg, takes around 5.5k.

columns.name: ExternalGUID
columns.summary: The primary key associated to a document hosted on an external source.

columns.name: ExternalSource
columns.summary: Enum:ExternalSourceType None, Dropbox, XVWeb. The source for the corresponding ExternalGUID.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Optional. Used for radiographs and ChartLetters.

columns.name: IsCropOld
columns.summary: Set to true as part of conversion to 21.4. Set back to false once the crop is converted to the new scheme. It would take too long to do this conversion in the normal script because it involves loading each image to obtain width and height. So this is a lazy conversion.

columns.name: OcrResponseData
columns.summary: Stores a JSON serialized OcrInsScanResponse object. The type of this object is defined by the OcrCaptureType.

columns.name: ImageCaptureType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumOcrCaptureType 0=Miscellaneous, 1=PrimaryInsFront, 2=PrimaryInsBack, 3=SecondaryInsFront, 4=SecondaryInsBack. Only used when patient scans their insurance card from eClipboard.

columns.name: PrintHeading
columns.summary: Set true by default for radiographs and tooth charts. When set to true, it will print additional heading text including patient name, DOB, and today's date.

columns.name: ChartLetterStatus
columns.summary: If not 0, this document is a Chart Letter. It will only show in the Chart Module and not in the Imaging Module. The document will be a Word document based on a template. The intent is for it to be used for very complex chart notes. It could then be sent to the referring dentist, for example. DocCategory will be 0 for these which naturally hides them in Imaging module. Like a procnote, a chart letter cannot actually be edited or deleted. All edits are preserved for audit trail and a copy is made for each edit.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. Only used when DocChartLetterStatus > 0. Tracks which user made the change.

columns.name: ChartLetterHash
columns.summary: Only used for ChartLetter. Every time a Word document is saved, we create a new document row with this hash tied to the byte sequence of that Word document. This proves that it was unaltered. The hash is 16 bytes, but we want a human-readable version. So we convert each byte to a two char hex string. So this field will always be 32 characters without any spaces or punc.

name: documentmisc
summary: For storing docs/images in database.  This table is for the various miscellaneous documents that are not in the normal patient subfolders.

columns.name: DocMiscNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: DateCreated
columns.summary: Date created.

columns.name: FileName
columns.summary: The name the file would have if it was not in the database. Does not include any directory info.DocumentMisc rows that store the contents of the UpdateFiles folder will set this column to an "item order".Due to severe limitations with sending large amounts of data all in one query we are going to store the UpdateFiles over several rows.The FileName column will store the order of which the UpdateFiles need to go back into when we try to reconstruct it.

columns.name: DocMiscType
columns.summary: Enum:DocumentMiscType Corresponds to the same subfolder within AtoZ folder. eg. UpdateFiles

columns.name: RawBase64
columns.summary: The raw file data encoded as base64.

name: drugmanufacturer
summary: Manufacturer of a vaccine.

columns.name: DrugManufacturerNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ManufacturerCode
columns.summary: An abbreviation of the manufacturer name.

name: drugunit
summary: And other kinds of units.  We will only prefill this list with units needed for the tests.  Users would have to manually add any other units.

columns.name: DrugUnitNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: UnitIdentifier
columns.summary: Example ml, capitalization not critical. Usually entered as lowercase except for L.

columns.name: UnitText
columns.summary: Example milliliter.

name: dunning
summary: A message that will show on certain patient statements when printing bills.  Criteria must be met in order for the dunning message to show.

columns.name: DunningNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: DunMessage
columns.summary: The actual dunning message that will go on the patient bill.

columns.name: BillingType
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.

columns.name: AgeAccount
columns.summary: Program forces only 0,30,60,or 90.

columns.name: InsIsPending
columns.summary: Enum:YN Set Y to only show if insurance is pending.

columns.name: MessageBold
columns.summary: A message that will be copied to the NoteBold field of the Statement.

columns.name: EmailSubject
columns.summary: An override for the default email subject.

columns.name: EmailBody
columns.summary: An override for the default email body. Limit in db: 16M char.

columns.name: DaysInAdvance
columns.summary: The number of days before an account reaches AgeAccount to include this dunning message on statements. Example: If DaysInAdvance=3 and AgeAccount=90, an account that is 87 days old when bills are generated will include this message.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

columns.name: IsSuperFamily
columns.summary: Boolean. Is true when the message is specifically created for super families.

name: ebill
summary: Keeps track of account details of e-statements per clinic.

columns.name: EbillNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

name: ClinicNum
summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum

name: ClientAcctNumber
summary: The account number for the e-statement client.

name: ElectUserName
summary: The user name for this particular account.

name: ElectPassword
summary: The password for this particular account.

name: PracticeAddress
summary: Enum:EbillAddress

name: RemitAddress
summary: Enum:EbillAddress

name: eclipboardimagecapture
summary: Linker table between patients and the images they have submitted to the office via eClipboard. Lets office know when a patient last submitted a certain image. Is used in conjuction with EClipboardImageCaptureDef table to allow offices to set frequencies for how often patients should submit certain images, similar to sheets.

columns.name: EClipboardImageCaptureNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: DefNum
columns.summary: FK to def.DefNum. Should match a DefNum that that is in the in 'EClipboard Images' defcat. Will be zero when IsSelfPortrait.

columns.name: IsSelfPortrait
columns.summary: Using DefNum to identify the self portrait is unreliable as the image category that is used to store self portraits may change. Instead, set this field to true for any image capture that is a self portrait. Only for self-portraits tied to the pref 'EClipboardAllowSelfPortraitOnCheckIn', not 'eClipboard Images' defcat.

columns.name: DateTimeUpserted
columns.summary: Records the date and time the patient took the image. If patient has submitted this eclipboard image before, then we simply update the DateUpserted field and DocNum field. We do not insert an entirely new record.

columns.name: DocNum
columns.summary: FK to document.DocNum. If a document is deleted, need to also delete any record from this table with the same DocNum.

columns.name: OcrCaptureType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumOcrCaptureType 0=Miscellaneous, 1=PrimaryInsFront, 2=PrimaryInsBack, 3=SecondaryInsFront, 4=SecondaryInsBack

name: eclipboardimagecapturedef
summary: Used to set rules for how often a patient should submit an image when checking in for their appointment via eClipboard. Example: insurance card or patient portrait. This is the grid on the right in eClipboard Images window.

columns.name: EClipboardImageCaptureDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: DefNum
columns.summary: FK to def.DefNum. Should match a DefNum that is in the in 'EClipboard Images' defcat.  Will be zero when IsSelfPortrait.

columns.name: IsSelfPortrait
columns.summary: True if the rule pertains to the patient self portrait. False if the rule is for an 'Eclipboard images' defcat definition.

columns.name: FrequencyDays
columns.summary: Deprecated.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Clinic the rule pertains to.

columns.name: OcrCaptureType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumOcrCaptureType 0=Miscellaneous, 1=PrimaryInsFront, 2=PrimaryInsBack, 3=SecondaryInsFront, 4=SecondaryInsBack

columns.name: Frequency
columns.summary: Enum:EnumEClipFreq 0=Once, 1=EachTime, 2=TimeSpan. The frequency that an image capture will be submitted by patients. ResubmitInterval can only be set if Frequency is TimeSpan.

columns.name: ResubmitInterval
columns.summary: If Frequency is EnumEClipFreq.TimeSpan, this will indicate the acceptable amount of time (measured in Years and Months) that can pass since the last time the patient has submitted this image capture.

name: eclipboardsheetdef
summary: Holds settings for eClipboard. Each row is attached to one SheetDef or EFormDef. This table might typically only have 3 to 4 rows in it. There could be more for different clinics. This information helps the software decide whether or not to display a sheet or eForm for a specific patient based on certain criteria. Examples include MinAge, MaxAge, Frequency, and ResubmitInterval. Forms will also end up on the eClipboard if their sheet.ShowInTerminal is non-zero or eForm.Status=ReadyForPatientFill.

columns.name: EClipboardSheetDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SheetDefNum
columns.summary: FK to SheetDef.SheetDefNum. Can be zero if this row is for an eForm.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  0 if no clinic or if default clinic.

columns.name: ResubmitInterval
columns.summary: If Frequency is EnumEClipFreq.TimeSpan, this will indicate the acceptable amount of time (measured in Years, Months, and Days) that can pass since the last time the patient has filled this form out. Once this has elapsed, if the EClipboardCreateMissingFormsOnCheckIn pref is turned on, this form will automatically be added to the patient forms to fill out when the patient is checked in.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: The order in which the patient will be asked to fill out this form.

columns.name: PrefillStatus
columns.summary: Determines how forms will be shown in eClipboard, blank or prefill. eForms are prefilled regardless. This flag just indicates whether to also attempt to fill non-db fields by using info from previous eForms.

columns.name: MinAge
columns.summary: Indicates the minimum age of the patient to be given the form to fill out. If their age is below the minimum limit, they will not be given the form to fill out. A value of -1 means ignore any age requirements.

columns.name: MaxAge
columns.summary: Indicates the maximum age of the patient to be given the form to fill out. If their age is over or equal to this maximum limit, they will not be given the form to fill out. A value of -1 means ignore any age requirements.

columns.name: IgnoreSheetDefNums
columns.summary: Comma delimited list of sheetdef nums to ignore. This can only be set if the preFillStatus is set to Once. These sheetDefs are ignored until this sheet is filled out. For example, an office may have a sheet for new patients that is only filled out once. IgnoreSheetDefNums can be set to include the normal patient forms which will be ignored at first. Once the new patient has filled out this sheet, these other sheetDefs will no longer be ignored when the patient checks in again. Nothing like this for eForms yet.

columns.name: PrefillStatusOverride
columns.summary: For both Sheets and eForms. 0 by default. When saving a linked Def, the UI gives the user an option to update this field with the new RevID. It explains that this will cause all patients to have to fill out this form again, even though it's marked as Frequency Once. If this value is higher than the RevID of the last form the patient filled out, then the Def must have been updated in this manner and the patient will need to fill out the form again. Otherwise, it will be excluded.

columns.name: EFormDefNum
columns.summary: FK to EFormDef.EFormDefNum. Can be zero if this row is for a sheet.

columns.name: Frequency
columns.summary: Enum:EnumEClipFreq 0=Once, 1=EachTime, 2=TimeSpan. The frequency that a form will be submitted by patients. ResubmitInterval can only be set if Frequency is TimeSpan.

columns.name: SheetDefNumsConsidered
columns.summary: Comma-delimited list of sheetDefNums that will also be considered with this eForm when doing frequency calculations. This allows easy transition from sheets to eForms. The reason we allow multiple is because sheets were likely to have one form for new patients and a different form for existing patients. The code must be resilient enough to handle bad SheetNums here.

name: eduresource
summary: EHR education resource.  Only one of the 3 FK fields will be used at a time (DiseaseDefNum, MedicationNum, or LabResultID).  The other two will be blank.   Displays a clickable URL if the patient meets certain criteria.

columns.name: EduResourceNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: DiseaseDefNum
columns.summary: FK to diseasedef.DiseaseDefNum.  This now also handles ICD9s and Snomeds via the entry in DiseaseDef.

columns.name: MedicationNum
columns.summary: FK to medication.MedicationNum.

columns.name: LabResultID
columns.summary: FK to labresult.TestID.

columns.name: LabResultName
columns.summary: Used for display in the grid.

columns.name: LabResultCompare
columns.summary: String, example <43. Must start with < or > followed by int.  Only used if FK LabResultID is used.

columns.name: SmokingSnoMed
columns.summary: FK to ehrmeasureevent.CodeValueResult when ehrmeasureevent.EventType=EhrMeasureEventType.TobaccoUseAssessed (8).

name: eform
summary: EForms is a way for patients to fill out forms. This is similar to sheets, but optimized for dynamic layout instead of fixed layout. The office sets up templates, EFormDefs, which get copied to EForms. Each EForm is linked to one patient.

columns.name: EFormNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: FormType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumEFormType 0=PatientForm, 1=MedicalHistory, 2=Consent. This doesn't actually do anything, and all fields are available for all types, but that might eventually change if more types are added.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FKey to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: DateTimeShown
columns.summary: The date and time that show in the UI.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: The title of the EForm. Copied from EFormDef.Description.

columns.name: DateTEdited
columns.summary: The date and time when the EForm was lasted edited. Not editable by the user in the UI.

columns.name: MaxWidth
columns.summary: Required. Can be any value between 50 and 1000. On wide screens, this limits the width of the form. This is needed on pretty much anything other than a phone. Makes it look consistent across devices and prevents useless white space. Default 450.

columns.name: EFormDefNum
columns.summary: FKey to eformdef.EFormDefNum. Don't use this as a FK to an EFormDef normally because the original def is not guaranteed to be intact. Since it was just a template, it can easily have changed since the eForm was copied from the template. Think of it as a lightweight minimal reference just used for a few edge cases. This is only used alongside the eClipboardSheetDef table to determine if the patient has filled out that form yet. It's also used with the RevID to prefill fields that don't use a DbLink by pulling from a previous form. I think this also requires using the ReportableName for those fields.

columns.name: Status
columns.summary: Enum:EnumEFormStatus 0-None, 1-ShowInEClipboard, 2-Filled, 3-Imported. In the None status, the office might be filling in the tooth number on a consent form. ShowInEClipboard status makes it show in eClipboard. Sheets use ShowInTerminal for this purpose. Once the patient has filled it, the status is changed to Filled. Sheets uses IsWebForm for this purpose. If a Filled eForm gets imported, then the status is changed to Imported.

columns.name: RevID
columns.summary: Revision ID. Copied from EFormDef. See notes over there.

columns.name: ShowLabelsBold
columns.summary: If true, then this form will show labels at 95% and slightly bold. This looks good, but some users might not want it for certain forms, so it's an option. This applies to text, date, radiobuttons, and sigBox. It does not apply to types label, checkbox, or medicationList.

columns.name: SpaceBelowEachField
columns.summary: The amount of space below each field. Overrides the global default and can be overridden by field.SpaceBelow. -1 indicates to use default. That way, 0 means 0 space.

columns.name: SpaceToRightEachField
columns.summary: The amount of space to the right of each field. Overrides the global default and can be overridden by field.SpaceToRight. -1 indicates to use default. That way, 0 means 0 space.

columns.name: SaveImageCategory
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. This gets set when an EForm is created from an EFormDef. 0 for none or else it's set to an image category. User can change it. It only saves if user saves manually.

name: eformdef
summary: EForms are a way for patients to fill out forms. This is similar to sheets, but optimized for dynamic layout instead of fixed layout. The office sets up templates, EFormDefs, which get copied to EForms. Since this is a template EForm, it does not link to a patient. It can be freely changed without affecting any EForms. We also supply internal EFormDefs, which are hard coded as XML rather than being in any office database.

columns.name: EFormDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: FormType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumEFormType 0=PatientForm, 1=MedicalHistory, 2=Consent. This doesn't actually do anything, and all fields are available for all types, but that might eventually change if more types are added.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: The title of the EFormDef. Set by the user.

columns.name: DateTCreated
columns.summary: The date and time when the EFormDef was created. Not editable by the user in the UI.

columns.name: IsInternalHidden
columns.summary: Deprecated.

columns.name: MaxWidth
columns.summary: Required. Can be any value between 50 and 1000. On wide screens, this limits the width of the form. This is needed on pretty much anything other than a phone. Makes it look consistent across devices and prevents useless white space. Default 450.
