name: ehrmeasure
summary: For EHR module, automate measure calculation.

columns.name: EhrMeasureNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: MeasureType
columns.summary: Enum:EhrMeasureType

columns.name: Numerator
columns.summary: 0-100, -1 indicates not entered yet.

columns.name: Denominator
columns.summary: 0-100, -1 indicates not entered yet.

name: ehrmeasureevent
summary: Stores events for EHR that are needed for reporting purposes.

columns.name: EhrMeasureEventNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: DateTEvent
columns.summary: Date and time of measure event.

columns.name: EventType
columns.summary: Enum:EhrMeasureEventType .

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

columns.name: MoreInfo
columns.summary: Used to provide extra information about a measure event.  Not typically used.

columns.name: CodeValueEvent
columns.summary: The code for this event.  Example: TobaccoUseAssessed can be one of three LOINC codes: 11366-2 History of tobacco use Narrative, 68535-4 Have you used tobacco in the last 30 days, and 68536-2 Have you used smokeless tobacco product in the last 30 days.

columns.name: CodeSystemEvent
columns.summary: The code system name for the event code.  Examples: LOINC, SNOMEDCT.

columns.name: CodeValueResult
columns.summary: The code for this event result.  Example: A TobaccoUseAssessed event type could result in a finding of SNOMED code 8517006 - Ex-smoker (finding).  There are 54 allowed tobacco user/non-user codes, and the user is allowed to select from any SNOMED code if they wish, for a TobaccoUseAssessed event.

columns.name: CodeSystemResult
columns.summary: The code system for this event result.  Example: SNOMEDCT,

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: A foreign key to a table associated with the EventType.  0 indicates not in use.  Used to properly count denominators for specific measure types.

columns.name: TobaccoCessationDesire
columns.summary: How eager a tobacco user is to quit using tobacco.  Scale of 1-10.

columns.name: DateStartTobacco
columns.summary: The date the patient started using tobacco.

name: ehrnotperformed
summary: For EHR module, these are all the items 'not performed' on patients.  Each row will link to the ehrcode table to retrieve relevant data.  To join this table to the ehrcode table you must join on CodeValue and CodeSystem.  Some items will have associated reasons attached to specify why it was not performed.  Those reasons will also be defined in the ehrcode table, so it may be necessary to join with that table again for the data relevant to the reason.

columns.name: EhrNotPerformedNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: CodeValue
columns.summary: This will be a FK to a specific code system table identified by the CodeSystem column.  The code for this item from one of the code systems supported.  Examples: 90656 or 442333005.

columns.name: CodeSystem
columns.summary: FK to codesystem.CodeSystemName. The code system name for this code.  Possible values are: CPT, CVX, LOINC, SNOMEDCT.

columns.name: CodeValueReason
columns.summary: FK to ehrcode.CodeValue.  This code may not exist in the ehrcode table, it may have been chosen from a bigger list of available codes.  In that case, this will be a FK to a specific code system table identified by the CodeSystem column.  The code for the reason the item was not performed from one of the code systems supported.  Examples: 182856006 or 419808006.

columns.name: CodeSystemReason
columns.summary: FK to codesystem.CodeSystemName. The code system name for this code.  Possible value is: SNOMEDCT.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Relevant notes for this not performed item.  Just in case users want it, does not get reported in EHR quality measure reporting.

columns.name: DateEntry
columns.summary: The date and time this item was created.  Can be edited to the date and time the item actually occurred.

name: ehrpatient
summary: Patient information needed for EHR.  1:1 relation to patient table.  They are stored here because we want to try to keep the size of the patient table a bit smaller. Some non-EHR columns have also been added, which isn't a big deal.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  Also the primary key for this table. Always one to one relationship with patient table.  A new patient might not have an entry here until needed.

columns.name: MotherMaidenFname
columns.summary: Mother's maiden first name.  Exported in HL7 PID-6 for immunization messages.

columns.name: MotherMaidenLname
columns.summary: Mother's maiden last name.  Exported in HL7 PID-6 for immunization messages.

columns.name: VacShareOk
columns.summary: Enum:YN  Indicates whether or not the patient wants to share their vaccination information with other EHRs.  Used in immunization export.

columns.name: MedicaidState
columns.summary: The abbreviation for the state for the patient's MedicaidID. Displayed in patient information window, used to validate the length of the MedicaidID.

columns.name: SexualOrientation
columns.summary: The patient's sexual orientation. Stored as a SNOMED code or HL7 null flavor.

columns.name: GenderIdentity
columns.summary: The patient's gender identity. Stored as a SNOMED code or HL7 null flavor.

columns.name: SexualOrientationNote
columns.summary: Will be blank unless SexualOrientation is OTH, additional orientation.

columns.name: GenderIdentityNote
columns.summary: Will be blank unless GenderIdentity is OTH, additional gender identity.

columns.name: DischargeDate
columns.summary: Used in hospitals. Used to track patients discharge date.

name: ehrprovkey
summary: Used to store and track Ehr Provider Keys.  There can be multiple EhrProvKeys per provider.

columns.name: EhrProvKeyNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  Only used by HQ for generating keys for customers.  Will always be 0 for non-HQ users.

columns.name: LName
columns.summary: The provider LName.

columns.name: FName
columns.summary: The provider FName.

columns.name: ProvKey
columns.summary: The key assigned to the provider

columns.name: FullTimeEquiv
columns.summary: Usually 1.  Can be less, like .5 or .25 to indicate possible discount is justified.

columns.name: Notes
columns.summary: Any notes that the tech wishes to include regarding this situation.

columns.name: YearValue
columns.summary: Required when generating a new provider key.  It is used to determine annual EHR eligibility.  Format will always be YY.

name: ehrquarterlykey
summary: Also used by OD customer support to store and track Ehr Quarterly Keys for customers.

columns.name: EhrQuarterlyKeyNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: YearValue
columns.summary: Example 11

columns.name: QuarterValue
columns.summary: Example 2

columns.name: PracticeName
columns.summary: The customer must have this exact practice name entered in practice setup.

columns.name: KeyValue
columns.summary: The calculated key value, tied to year, quarter, and practice name.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  Always zero for customer databases.  When used by OD customer support, this is the customer num.

columns.name: Notes
columns.summary: Any notes that the tech wishes to include regarding this situation.

name: ehrsummaryccd
summary: Can also be a CCR.  Received CCDs/CCRs are stored both here and in emailattach.  Sent CCDs are not saved here, but are only stored in emailattach.  To display a saved Ccd, it is combined with an internal stylesheet.

columns.name: EhrSummaryCcdNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: DateSummary
columns.summary: Date that this Ccd was received.

columns.name: ContentSummary
columns.summary: The xml content of the received text file.

columns.name: EmailAttachNum
columns.summary: FK to emailattach.EmailAttachNum.  The Direct email attachment where the CCD xml message came from.  Needed to sync PatNum with the email PatNum if the PatNum is changed on the email.

name: ehrtrigger
summary: CDS Triggers when referenced in UI. Used for CDS automation.  May later be expanded to replace "automation."

columns.name: EhrTriggerNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Short description to describe the trigger.

columns.name: DemographicsList
columns.summary: Age, Gender.  Can be multiple age entries but only one gender entry as coma delimited values.  Example: " age,>18  age,<=55gender,male"

columns.name: LabLoincList
columns.summary: List of loinc codes padded with spaces.

columns.name: VitalLoincList
columns.summary: Examples:  Height,>=72  Weight<,100  BMI=  (BP currently not implemented.)

columns.name: Instructions
columns.summary: The reccomended course of action for this intervention.

columns.name: Bibliography
columns.summary: Bibliographic information, not a URL.

columns.name: Cardinality
columns.summary: Enum:MatchCardinality Requires One, OneOfEachCategory, TwoOrMore, or All for trigger to match.

name: electid
summary: Corresponds to the electid table in the database. Helps with entering elecronic/payor id's as well as keeping track of the specific carrier requirements. Only used by the X12 format.

columns.name: ElectIDNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PayorID
columns.summary: aka Electronic ID.  A simple string. This is not necessarily unique between different CarrierNames.  Also, different clearinghouses use different systems of PayorIDs.

columns.name: CarrierName
columns.summary: Used when doing a search.

columns.name: IsMedicaid
columns.summary: True if medicaid. Then, the billing and treating providers will have their Medicaid ID's attached.

columns.name: ProviderTypes
columns.summary: Integers separated by commas. Each long represents a ProviderSupplementalID type that is required by this insurance. Usually only used for BCBS or other carriers that require supplemental provider id's.  Even if we don't put the supplemental types in here, the user can still add them.  This just helps by doing an additional check for known required types.

columns.name: Comments
columns.summary: Any comments. Usually includes enrollment requirements and descriptions of how to use the provider id's supplied by the carrier because they might call them by different names.

columns.name: CommBridge
columns.summary: Enum:EclaimsCommBridge Where this Electronic ID came from. Will be 0 if created by the user. Currently, only ClaimConnect and EDS are supported.

columns.name: Attributes
columns.summary: Comma delimited list of which PayerAttributes of a CommBridge are supported by this Electronic ID. Example: "0,2,8". Enum values for either EnumClaimConnectPayerAttributes or EnumEDSPayerAttributes.

name: emailaddress
summary: Stores all the connection info for one email address.  Linked to clinic by clinic.EmailAddressNum.  Sends email based on patient's clinic.

columns.name: EmailAddressNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SMTPserver
columns.summary: For example smtp.gmail.com

columns.name: EmailPassword
columns.summary: Password associated with this email address.  Encrypted when stored in the database and decrypted before using.

columns.name: ServerPort
columns.summary: Usually 587, sometimes 25 or 465.

columns.name: SenderAddress
columns.summary: The email address of the sender as it should appear to the recipient.

columns.name: Pop3ServerIncoming
columns.summary: For example pop.gmail.com

columns.name: ServerPortIncoming
columns.summary: Usually 110, sometimes 995.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Associates a user with this email address.  A user may only have one email address associated with them. Can be 0 if no user is associated with this email address.

columns.name: AccessToken
columns.summary: Needed for OAuth.

columns.name: RefreshToken
columns.summary: Needed for OAuth.

columns.name: DownloadInbox
columns.summary: When true, this will allow the user to download emails to their inbox.

columns.name: QueryString
columns.summary: Allows gmail users to specify search parameters

columns.name: AuthenticationType
columns.summary: Enum:OAuthType None=0,Google=1,Microsoft=2.  Indicates which OAuth type to use for the email address.

name: emailattach
summary: Keeps track of one file attached to an email.  Multiple files can be attached to an email using this method.

columns.name: EmailAttachNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: EmailMessageNum
columns.summary: FK to emailmessage.EmailMessageNum.  0 if EmailTemplateNum is set, otherwise must have a value.

columns.name: DisplayedFileName
columns.summary: The name of the file that shows on the email.  For example: tooth2.jpg.

columns.name: ActualFileName
columns.summary: The actual file is stored in the A-Z folder in EmailAttachments.  This field stores the sub directories and name of the file.  The files are named automatically based on Date/time along with a random number.  This ensures that they will be sequential as well as unique.

columns.name: EmailTemplateNum
columns.summary: FK to emailtemplate.EmailTemplateNum.  0 if EmailMessageNum is set, otherwise must have a value.

name: emailautograph
summary: A manually created autograph that can be inserted at the bottom of an outgoing email.

columns.name: EmailAutographNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Description of the autograph.  This is what the user sees when picking an autograph.

columns.name: EmailAddress
columns.summary: Email address(es) that this autograph is associated with.  An autograph can be associated with multiple addresses.

columns.name: AutographText
columns.summary: The actual text of the autograph.

columns.name: EmailHostingTemplateNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: TemplateName
columns.summary: Name of the template.

columns.name: Subject
columns.summary: Default subject line.

columns.name: BodyPlainText
columns.summary: Body of the email

columns.name: BodyHTML
columns.summary: Body of the email. When email is regular html this will only contain the body text. Will contain full html when email type is RawHtml

columns.name: TemplateId
columns.summary: The email hosting template's identifier

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum

columns.name: EmailTemplateType
columns.summary: Enum:EmailType The type of email template this is (Regular HTML or Full HTML)

columns.name: TemplateType
columns.summary: Enum:PromotionType the type of mass email this template is for

name: emailmessage
summary: Stores both sent and received emails, as well as saved emails which are still in composition.

columns.name: EmailMessageNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient whom is sending this message. May be sent by a guarantor on behalf of a dependent.

columns.name: ToAddress
columns.summary: Either a single email address or a comma-delimited list of addresses. For web mail messages, this will not be an email address.  Instead, it will be the name of the corresponding patient or provider.

columns.name: FromAddress
columns.summary: Valid email address.  For web mail messages, this will not be an email address.  Instead, it will be the name of the corresponding patient or provider.

columns.name: Subject
columns.summary: Subject line.

columns.name: BodyText
columns.summary: Body of the email

columns.name: MsgDateTime
columns.summary: Date and time the message was sent. Automated at the UI level.

columns.name: SentOrReceived
columns.summary: Enum:EmailSentOrReceived Neither, Received, Read, WebMailReceived, WebMailRecdRead, WebMailSent, WebMailSentRead, SentDirect, ReceivedEncrypted, ReceivedDirect, ReadDirect, AckDirectProcessed, AckDirectNotSent

columns.name: RecipientAddress
columns.summary: Copied from the EmailAddress.EmailUsername field when a message is received into the inbox.Similar to the ToAddress, except the ToAddress could contain multiple recipient addresses or group email address instead. The recipient address helps match the an email to a particular EmailAddress.

columns.name: RawEmailIn
columns.summary: For incomming email only.  The raw email contents for encrypted email or email which we had trouble parsing.For unencrypted (clear text) email, this will be similar to the raw email except the attachments will be dissolved to prevent db bloating.Can be used for debugging if there are any issues parsing the content.This will bloat the database a little bit, but we need it for now to ensure our inbox is working in real world scenarios.Might be blank for a few emails downloaded immediately after the email inbox feature was created.

columns.name: ProvNumWebMail
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  The provider to whom this message was sent or from whom this message was sent.  Only used when EmailSentOrReceived is WebMailReceived, WebMailRecdRead, WebMailSent, or WebMailSentRead.  Will be 0 if not a web mail message.

columns.name: PatNumSubj
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Represents the patient to whom this email message is addressed, or from whom it is being sent on behalf of. If guarantor is sending on behalf of self then this field will match PatNum field.

columns.name: CcAddress
columns.summary: Single address or comma-delimited list of addresses.  User may enter multiple email addresses for visible carbon copies.

columns.name: BccAddress
columns.summary: Single email address or comma-delimited list of addresses.  User may enter multiple email addresses for blind carbon copies.

columns.name: HideIn
columns.summary: Enum:HideInFlags None=0,EmailInbox=1,ApptEdit=2,ContrChartProgNotes=4,ContrAccountGridProg.  Indicates which places in the program that should not show this email message, bitwise. 0 means don't hide anywhere.

columns.name: AptNum
columns.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum. Used to a attach an email to an appointment for eReminders and eConfirmations.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Optional.  0 if unknown (ex recieved emails).

columns.name: HtmlType
columns.summary: Enum:EmailType

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

columns.name: MsgType
columns.summary: Enum:EmailMessageSource Stored in db as string. This is used to identify where in the program this message originated from. This is used for sent email messages.

columns.name: FailReason
columns.summary: Reason the message failed to send. Blank if sent successful.

name: emailmessageuid
summary: Used to track which email messages have been downloaded into the inbox for a particular recipient address.Not linked to the email message itself because no link is needed.If we decide to add a foreign key to a EmailMessage later, we should consider what do to when an email message is deleted (set the foreign key to 0 perhaps).

columns.name: EmailMessageUidNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: MsgId
columns.summary: The unique id for the associated EmailMessage.

columns.name: RecipientAddress
columns.summary: Copied from the EmailAddress.EmailUsername field when a message is received into the inbox. Similar to the ToAddress of the EmailMessage, except the ToAddress could contain multiple recipient addressesor group email address instead. The recipient address helps match the EmailMessageUid to a particular EmailAddress.

name: emailsecure
summary: Tracks every secure email sent and received from or to a patient.

columns.name: EmailSecureNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: EmailMessageNum
columns.summary: FK to emailmessage.EmailMessageNum.  0 indicates email has not been successfully downloaded from API yet.

columns.name: EmailChainFK
columns.summary: FK to emailchain, as hosted by API.  Table does not exist at dental office.

columns.name: EmailFK
columns.summary: FK to email, as hosted by API.  Table does not exist at dental office.

columns.name: DateTEntry
columns.summary: DateTime the entry was inserted

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: DateTime the entry was edited.

name: emailsecureattach
summary: Tracks every attachment linked to a secure email.

columns.name: EmailSecureAttachNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

columns.name: EmailAttachNum
columns.summary: FK to emailattach.EmailAttachNum.  0 indicates attachment has not been successfully downloaded from API yet.

columns.name: EmailSecureNum
columns.summary: FK to emailsecure.EmailSecureNum.

columns.name: AttachmentGuid
columns.summary: Attachment identifier, as hosted by API.  Table does not exist at dental office.

columns.name: DisplayedFileName
columns.summary: The displayed name of the file/object.

columns.name: Extension
columns.summary: The extension of the object (i.e. png).

columns.name: DateTEntry
columns.summary: FK to email, as hosted by API.  Table does not exist at dental office.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: DateTime the entry was edited.

name: emailtemplate
summary: A template email which can be used as the basis for a new email.

columns.name: EmailTemplateNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Subject
columns.summary: Default subject line.

columns.name: BodyText
columns.summary: Body of the email

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Different than Subject.  The description of the email template.  This is what the user sees in the list.

columns.name: TemplateType
columns.summary: Enum:EmailType

name: employee
summary: An employee at the dental office.

columns.name: EmployeeNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: LName
columns.summary: Employee's last name.

columns.name: FName
columns.summary: First name.

columns.name: MiddleI
columns.summary: Middle initial or name.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: If hidden, the employee will not show on the list.

columns.name: ClockStatus
columns.summary: This is just text used to quickly display the clockstatus.  eg Working,Break,Lunch,Home, etc.

columns.name: PhoneExt
columns.summary: The phone extension for the employee.  e.g. 101,102,etc.  This field is only visible for user editing if the pref DockPhonePanelShow is true (1).

columns.name: PayrollID
columns.summary: Used to store the payroll identification number used to generate payroll reports. ADP uses six digit number between 000051 and 999999.

columns.name: ReportsTo
columns.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum

name: employer
summary: Most insurance plans are organized by employer.  This table keeps track of the list of employers.  The address fields were added at one point, but I don't know why they don't show in the program in order to edit.  Nobody has noticed their absence even though it's been a few years, so for now we are just using the EmpName and not the address.

columns.name: EmployerNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: EmpName
columns.summary: Name of the employer.

columns.name: Address2
columns.summary: Second line of address.

columns.name: State
columns.summary: 2 char in the US.

columns.name: Phone
columns.summary: Includes any punctuation.

name: encounter
summary: Mostly used for EHR.  This rigorously records encounters using rich automation, so that reporting can be easy and meaningful.  Encounters can also be tracked separately using billable procedures.  In contrast, encounters in this table are not billable.  There can be multiple encounters at one appointment because there can be different types.

columns.name: EncounterNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: CodeValue
columns.summary: FK to ehrcode.CodeValue.  This code may not exist in the ehrcode table, it may have been chosen from a bigger list of available codes.  In that case, this will be a FK to a specific code system table identified by the CodeSystem column.  The code for this item from one of the code systems supported.  Examples: 185349003 or 406547006.

columns.name: CodeSystem
columns.summary: FK to codesystem.CodeSystemName. This will determine which specific code system table the CodeValue is a FK to.  We only allow the following CodeSystems in this table: CDT, CPT, HCPCS, and SNOMEDCT.

columns.name: DateEncounter
columns.summary: Date the encounter occurred

name: entrylog
summary: Stores entries made for AppointmentCreate. Acts as an additional securitylog entry.

columns.name: EntryLogNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum

columns.name: FKeyType
columns.summary: Enum:EntryLogFKeyType

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: A foreign key to a table associated with the EntryLogFKeyType.

columns.name: LogSource
columns.summary: Enum:LogSources

columns.name: EntryDateTime
columns.summary: The date and time of the entry.  Its value is set when inserting and can never change.  Even if a user changes the date on their computer, this remains accurate because it uses server time.

name: eobattach
summary: One file attached to an eob (claimpayment).  Multiple files can be attached to an eob using this method.  Order shown will be based on date/time scanned.

columns.name: EobAttachNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ClaimPaymentNum
columns.summary: FK to claimpayment.ClaimPaymentNum. Will be zero if this eobattach is for a preauthorization.

columns.name: DateTCreated
columns.summary: Date/time created.

columns.name: FileName
columns.summary: The file is stored in the A-Z folder in 'EOBs' folder.  This field stores the name of the file.  The files are named automatically based on Date/time along with EobAttachNum for uniqueness.

columns.name: RawBase64
columns.summary: The raw file data encoded as base64.  Only used if there is no AtoZ folder.

columns.name: ClaimNumPreAuth
columns.summary: FK to claim.ClaimNum of a preauthorization. Will be zero if this eobattach is for a claimpayment.

name: equipment
summary: Used for property tax tracking.

columns.name: EquipmentNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Short description, need not be very unique.

columns.name: SerialNumber
columns.summary: Must be unique among all pieces of equipment.  Auto-generated 3 char alpha numeric gives 1.5M unique serial numbers.  Zero never part of autogenerated serial number.

columns.name: ModelYear
columns.summary: Limit 2 char.

columns.name: DatePurchased
columns.summary: Date when this corporation obtained the equipment.  Always has a valid value.

columns.name: DateSold
columns.summary: Normally 01-01-0001 if equipment still in possession.  Once sold, a date will be present.

columns.name: Location
columns.summary: Freeform text.

columns.name: DateEntry
columns.summary: Security uses this date to lock older entries from accidental deletion.  Date, no time.

columns.name: ProvNumCheckedOut
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Only filled in if equipment has been checked out, otherwise 0.

columns.name: DateCheckedOut
columns.summary: Only used when equipment has been checked out.

columns.name: DateExpectedBack
columns.summary: Only used when equipment has been checked out.  Defaults to same day as check out.

columns.name: DispenseNote
columns.summary: Any notes regarding the equipment checked out.

columns.name: Status
columns.summary: Status of the equipment.

name: erouting
summary: A set of actions to take in sequence for each interaction with a specific patient.  Individual actions are in eRoutingAction. Templates are in eRoutingDef.  Only used in eClipboard for now.

columns.name: ERoutingNum
columns.summary: Primary Key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Copied from eRoutingDef.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient this eRouting is for.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. The clinic this patient eRouting is in. Set to 0 if in headquarters or clinics are disabled.

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: The DateTime this eRouting was created. eRoutings are created when they are started. Not able to edited by the user.

columns.name: IsComplete
columns.summary: eRouting is considered complete if this is true. Used on backend to get incomplete eRouting without checking eRoutingActions

name: eroutingaction
summary: A single action attached to a eRouting. Only used in eClipboard for now.

columns.name: ERoutingActionNum
columns.summary: Primary Key

columns.name: ERoutingNum
columns.summary: FK to eRouting.ERoutingNum

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Copied from eRoutingActionDef.ItemOrder.

columns.name: ERoutingActionType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumERoutingActionType

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. This is the user that completed the action. If not complete, this will be 0.

columns.name: IsComplete
columns.summary: True if marked complete, otherwise set to false.

columns.name: DateTimeComplete
columns.summary: The date and time this action was set complete by the user.

columns.name: ForeignKeyType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumERoutingFKType Indicates the type of object that ForeignKey references. None=0, Sheet=1

columns.name: ForeignKey
columns.summary: FK to attached object. Type is indicated by ForeignKeyType. Sheet for Consent forms.

columns.name: LabelOverride
columns.summary: Override for the title of the eRouting Action. This will be shown in the eClipboard UI instead of EnumERoutingActionType description if it is present.

name: eroutingactiondef
summary: A single action attached to an ERoutingDef. Changing these does not alter any patient records. Only used in ODTouch for now.

columns.name: ERoutingActionDefNum
columns.summary: PK

columns.name: ERoutingDefNum
columns.summary: FK to eRouting.eRoutingDefNum. Defines what eRouting this action is tied to

columns.name: ERoutingActionType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumeRoutingActionType

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Determines the order the items show in the eRoutingactiondef and what order they are to be completed in.

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: The date this action definition was created. Not able to edited by the user.

columns.name: DateTLastModified
columns.summary: The date time this action was last changed. Not able to be edited by the user.

columns.name: ForeignKeyType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumERoutingDefFKType Indicates the type of object that ForeignKey references. None=0, SheetDef=1

columns.name: ForeignKey
columns.summary: FK to attached object. Type is indicated by ForeignKeyType. SheetDef for Consent forms.

columns.name: LabelOverride
columns.summary: Override for the title of the eRouting Action. This will be shown in the eClipboard UI instead of EnumERoutingActionType description if it is present.

name: eroutingdef
summary: A set of actions to take in sequence for each interaction with a patient.  Individual actions are in eRoutingActionDef.  Changing these does not alter any patient records. Only used in eClipboard for now.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Represents the clinic that the eRouting is tied to, if any. Can be 0.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: The name of the eRouting.

columns.name: UserNumCreated
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. The user that created this eRouting. Cannot be edited by user.

columns.name: UserNumModified
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. The user that last edited this eRouting. Cannot be edited by user.

columns.name: SecDateTEntered
columns.summary: Date Time this eRouting was created. Cannot be edited by user.

columns.name: DateLastModified
columns.summary: Date time this eRouting was last edited. Cannot be edited by user.

name: eroutingdeflink
summary: There can be multiple eRoutingDefLinks for each eRoutingDef. For example, one eRoutingDef could have 4 appointment types as well as a billing type, for a total of 5 eRoutingDefLinks.  If an appointment has a matching AppointmentType and BillingType, then that eRouting is used.

columns.name: ERoutingDefLinkNum
columns.summary: PK

columns.name: ERoutingDefNum
columns.summary: FK to eRoutingdef.eRoutingDefNum.

columns.name: Fkey
columns.summary: FK to other tables. Dictated by the FKey Type.

columns.name: ERoutingType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumeRoutingType

columns.name: ErxLogNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: MsgText
columns.summary: Holds up to 16MB.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. The provider that the prescription request was sent by or on behalf of.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to Userod.UserNum. The user that created the erx.

name: eservicelog
summary: Stores an ongoing record of EServices activity. User not allowed to edit.

columns.name: EServiceLogNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: LogDateTime
columns.summary: The date and time of the entry. It's value is set when inserting and can never change. Even if a user changes the date on their computer, this remains accurate because it uses server time.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Can be 0 if not applicable.

columns.name: EServiceType
columns.summary: Enum:eServiceType Indicates which eService feature this log entry is associated with, such as Web Sched, Patient Portal, or eClipboard.

columns.name: EServiceAction
columns.summary: Enum:eServiceAction Describes the specific action or event that occurred within the eService, such as scheduling an appointment, submitting a form, or logging in.

columns.name: KeyType
columns.summary: Enum:FKeyType

columns.name: LogGuid
columns.summary: Guid for logging actions with no associated PatNum.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: Clinic Number.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: FKey for given type.

columns.name: DateTimeUploaded
columns.summary: The time this log was uploaded.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Additional information for the log. This is intentionally limited to 255 characters to prevent bloat.Add any new uses of this field to the list below. Provide the eServiceAction types and what the Note field represents for those types.PPPaymentCreatedByXWeb: The amount of the payment.PPPaymentCreatedByPayconnect: The amount of the payment.PPOpenedHostedPaymentForm: The name of the merchant service that the hosted payment form belongs to.

name: eserviceshortguid
summary: For example, links a statement to a specific MsgToPay. ShortGuids are usually generated at ODHQ.

columns.name: EServiceShortGuidNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: EServiceCode
columns.summary: Enum:eServiceCode EService that this short GUID applies to.

columns.name: ShortGuid
columns.summary: A unique alphanumeric string that identifies something.

columns.name: ShortURL
columns.summary: URL generated by HQ.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: Usually identifies the object that is linked to ShortGUID.

columns.name: FKeyType
columns.summary: Describes the type of object referenced by the FKey.

columns.name: DateTimeExpiration
columns.summary: Timestamp at which this short GUID will expire..

columns.name: DateTEntry
columns.summary: The exact server time when this EServiceShortGuid was entered into db.  Handled automatically.

name: eservicesignal
summary: Communication item from workstation to OD HQ. Stores the statuses of the eConnector and other eServices.

columns.name: EServiceSignalNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ServiceCode
columns.summary: Enum eServiceCode. Service which this signal applies to.

columns.name: ReasonCategory
columns.summary: The enum is at HQ as OpenDentalWebCore.BroadcasterThreadDefs. Can be zero if no grouping is necessary per a given service.

columns.name: ReasonCode
columns.summary: The enum is at HQ as OpenDentalWebCore.BroadcasterErrorCodes. This code is used to determine what actions to take and how to process this message. It is a function of ReasonCategory. It will most likely be defined by an enum that lives on HQ-only closed source.

columns.name: Severity
columns.summary: Enum:eServiceSignalSeverity

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Human readable description of what this signal means, or a message for the user.

columns.name: SigDateTime
columns.summary: Time signal was sent.

columns.name: Tag
columns.summary: Used to store serialized data that can be used for processing this signal.

columns.name: IsProcessed
columns.summary: After a message has been processed or acknowledged this is set true. Not currently used for heartbeat or service status signals.

name: etrans
summary: One electronic transaction.  Typically, one claim or response.  Or one benefit request or response.  Is constantly being expanded to include more types of transactions with clearinghouses.  Also stores printing of paper claims.  Sometimes stores a copy of what was sent.

columns.name: EtransNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: DateTimeTrans
columns.summary: The date and time of the transaction.

columns.name: ClearingHouseNum
columns.summary: FK to clearinghouse.ClearinghouseNum .  Can be 0 if no clearinghouse was involved.

columns.name: Etype
columns.summary: Enum:EtransType

columns.name: ClaimNum
columns.summary: FK to claim.ClaimNum if a claim. Otherwise 0.  Warning.  Original claim might have been deleted.  But if Canadian claim was successfully sent, then deletion will be blocked.

columns.name: OfficeSequenceNumber
columns.summary: For Canada. Unique for every transaction sent. Uncapped, but is modded by 1,000,000 when sent in a transaction as required by the standard.

columns.name: CarrierTransCounter
columns.summary: For Canada. Separate counter for each carrier. Uncapped, but is modded by 100,000 when sent in a transaction as required by the standard.

columns.name: CarrierTransCounter2
columns.summary: For Canada. Separate counter for each carrier. Uncapped, but is modded by 100,000 when sent in a transaction as required by the standard. If this claim includes secondary, then this is the counter for the secondary carrier.

columns.name: CarrierNum
columns.summary: FK to carrier.CarrierNum.

columns.name: CarrierNum2
columns.summary: FK to carrier.CarrierNum Only used if secondary insurance info is provided on a claim.  Necessary for Canada.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum This is useful in case the original claim has been deleted.  Now, we can still tell who the patient was.

columns.name: BatchNumber
columns.summary: Maxes out at 999, then loops back to 1.  This is not a good key, but is a restriction of (canadian?).  So dates must also be used to isolate the correct BatchNumber key.  Specific to one clearinghouse.  Only used with e-claims.  Claim will have BatchNumber, and 997 will have matching BatchNumber. (In X12 lingo, it's a functional group number)

columns.name: AckCode
columns.summary: A=Accepted, R=Rejected, blank if not able to parse, Recd=Received (835s only).  More options will be added later.  The incoming 997 or 999 sets this flag automatically.  To find the 997 or 999, look for a matching BatchNumber with a similar date, since both the claims and the 997 or 999 will both have the same batch number.  The 997 or 999 does not have this flag set on itself.

columns.name: TransSetNum
columns.summary: For sent e-claims, within each batch (functional group), each carrier gets it's own transaction set.  Since 997s and 999s acknowledge transaction sets rather than batches, we need to keep track of which transaction set each claim is part of as well as which batch it's part of.  This field can't be set as part of 997 or 999, because one 997 or 999 refers to multiple trans sets.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Typical uses include indicating that the report was printed, the claim was resent, reason for rejection, etc.  For a 270, this contains the automatically generated short summary of the response.  The response could include the reason for failure, or it could be a short summary of the 271.

columns.name: EtransMessageTextNum
columns.summary: FK to etransmessagetext.EtransMessageTextNum.  Can be 0 if there is no message text.  Multiple Etrans objects can refer to the same message text, very common in a batch.

columns.name: AckEtransNum
columns.summary: FK to etrans.EtransNum.  Only has a non-zero value if there exists an ack etrans, like a 997, 999, 277ack, 271, 835, or ackError.There can be only one ack for any given etrans, but one ack can apply to multiple etran's that were sent as one batch.999 FK can be replaced by 277ack FK, and then by 835 FK.  This column does triple duty.The AckEtransNum can be used to chain together related etrans entries.  For example,if this is a 270 request, then AckEtransNum points to the 271 response.If this is a 271, then AckEtransNum points to the HTML (if any) for the response.

columns.name: PlanNum
columns.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum.  Used if EtransType.BenefitInquiry270 and BenefitResponse271 and Eligibility_CA.

columns.name: InsSubNum
columns.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum.  Used if EtransType.BenefitInquiry270 and BenefitResponse271 and Eligibility_CA.

columns.name: TranSetId835
columns.summary: X12 ST02 Transaction Set Identifier for an 835.  Specifies the unique transaction id within the 835 that this etrans record corresponds to.  This column will always be set for 835s imported in version 14.3 or greater.  For 835s imported in version 14.2, this column will alway be blank.  If blank, and there is more than one transaction id within the 835, then FormEtrans835PickEob will show and allow the user to select the desired EOB from a list.  The X12 guide states that there is only one transaction (EOB) allowed per 835, but ClaimConnect returns multiple transactions (EOBs) within a single 835 and other clearinghouses probably do as well.  When an 835 is imported, it is examined to determine the number of transactions within it.  One etrans entry is created for each EOB within the 835.  We may have a similar issue with multiple transactions within 277s as well, but we have not seen any evidence yet.  Our current 277 implementation expects a single transaction, just as the X12 standard specifies.

columns.name: CarrierNameRaw
columns.summary: Only used if the CarrierNum is 0.  If CarrierNum is not 0, the name associated to CarrierNum will overrideCarrierNameRaw in the FormClaimsSend history grid.  Added for 835s so that customer databases are not cluttered with dummy carriers andso there is no extra processing time when FormClaimsSend is loading.  Size is 60 bytes to match 835 carrier name length.

columns.name: PatientNameRaw
columns.summary: Only used if the PatNum is 0.  If PatNum is not 0, the name associated to PatNum will override PatientNameRaw in the FormClaimsSend history grid.  Added for 835s so that there is no extra processing time when FormClaimsSend is loading, and so text representing the patient count can be used instead of an actual patient name.  Size is 133 bytes to match X12 specs for last name (60), first name (35), middle name (25), suffix (10), and spaces in between (3).

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum

name: etrans835
summary: Corresponds to an etrans record containing a raw 835 X12 message attached in etransmessagetext table.  This is denoted by etrans.Etype=ERA_835

columns.name: Etrans835Num
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: EtransNum
columns.summary: FK to etrans.EtransNum .

columns.name: PayerName
columns.summary: Up to 60 characters.  Corresponds to X835.PayerName, a read-only field.

columns.name: TransRefNum
columns.summary: Up to 50 characters.  Corresponds to X835.TransRefNum, a read-only field.

columns.name: InsPaid
columns.summary: Corresponds to X835.InsPaid, a read-only field.

columns.name: ControlId
columns.summary: Up to 9 characters.  Corresponds to X835.ControlId, a read-only field.

columns.name: PaymentMethodCode
columns.summary: Up to 3 characters.  Corresponds to X835._paymentMethodCode, a read-only field.

columns.name: PatientName
columns.summary: Up to 100 characters (not based on actual patient name field sizes).Corresponds to Hx835_Claim.PatientName.ToString() if one patient, or says "(#)" if multiple patients to show count.

columns.name: Status
columns.summary: Enum:X835Status .  Calculated status.  Only changes when ERA changes.

columns.name: AutoProcessed
columns.summary: Enum:X835AutoProcessed .  The initial disposition of ERA's that have passed through our auto/semi-auto processing system.

columns.name: IsApproved
columns.summary: True if a user has acknowledged the auto processed ERA.

name: etrans835attach
summary: Links a specific claim within an ERA 835 to an actual claim in the claims table.

columns.name: Etrans835AttachNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: EtransNum
columns.summary: FK to etrans.EtransNum.

columns.name: ClaimNum
columns.summary: FK to claim.ClaimNum.  Can be 0, which indicates that the ERA claim does not have a match in OD.

columns.name: ClpSegmentIndex
columns.summary: Segment index for the CLP/Claim segment within the X12 document containing the 835. This index is unique, even if there are multiple 835 transactions within the X12 document.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: DateTime that the row was inserted.

name: etransmessagetext
summary: Each row is big.  The entire X12 message text is stored here, since it can be the same for multiple etrans objects, and since the messages can be so big.

columns.name: EtransMessageTextNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: MessageText
columns.summary: The entire message text, including carriage returns.

name: evaluation
summary: An evaluation is for one student and is copied from an EvaluationDef.

columns.name: EvaluationNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: InstructNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: StudentNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: SchoolCourseNum
columns.summary: FK to schoolcourse.SchoolCourseNum.  For example to PEDO 732.

columns.name: EvalTitle
columns.summary: Copied from evaluation def.  Not editable.

columns.name: DateEval
columns.summary: Date of the evaluation.

columns.name: GradingScaleNum
columns.summary: FK to gradingscale.GradingScaleNum.  The overall grading scale for this evaluation.  Copied from EvaluationDef.  Criteria will not all necessarily have the same scale.

columns.name: OverallGradeShowing
columns.summary: OverallGradeNumber is calculated as described below.  Once the nearest number on the scale is found, the corresponding gradescaleitem.GradeShowing is used here.

columns.name: OverallGradeNumber
columns.summary: Always recalculated as each individual criterion is changed, so no risk of getting out of synch.  Only considers criteria on the evaluation that use the same grading scale as the evaluation itself.  It's an average of all those criteria.  When averaging, the result will almost never exactly equal one of the numbers in the scale, so the nearest one must be found and used here.  For example, if the average is 3.6 on a 4 point scale, this will show 4.  Percentages will be rounded to the nearest whole number.  This is the value that will be returned in reports and also used in calculations of the student's grade for the term.

columns.name: Notes
columns.summary: Any note that the instructor wishes to place at the bottom of this evaluation.

name: evaluationcriterion
summary: One row on an evaluation.

columns.name: EvaluationCriterionNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: EvaluationNum
columns.summary: FK to evaluation.EvaluationNum

columns.name: CriterionDescript
columns.summary: Description that is displayed for the criterion.

columns.name: IsCategoryName
columns.summary: This row will show in bold and will not have a grade attached to it.

columns.name: GradingScaleNum
columns.summary: FK to gradingscale.GradingScaleNum.  The grading scale used for this criterion.  Having this here allows the instructor to edit saved grades and also allows the evaluation overall grade to consider whether to include this criterion in the calculation.

columns.name: GradeShowing
columns.summary: Copied from gradingscaleitem.GradeShowing.  Required.  For example A, B, C, D, F, or 1-10, pass, fail, 89, etc.  Except for percentages, must come from pick list.

columns.name: GradeNumber
columns.summary: Copied from gradingscaleitem.GradeNumber.  Required.  For example A=4, A-=3.8, pass=1, percentages stored as 89, etc.  Except for percentages, must come from pick list.

columns.name: Notes
columns.summary: A note about why this student received this particular grade on this criterion.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Copied from item order of def.  Defines the order that all the criteria show on the evaluation.  User not allowed to change here, only in the def.

columns.name: MaxPointsPoss
columns.summary: For ScaleType=Points, sets the maximum value of points for this criterion.

name: evaluationcriteriondef
summary: Rows on an evaluation def.  The individual items that will be graded. Criterion Defs

columns.name: EvaluationCriterionDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: EvaluationDefNum
columns.summary: FK to evaluationdef.EvaluationDefNum.

columns.name: CriterionDescript
columns.summary: Description that is displayed for the criterion.

columns.name: IsCategoryName
columns.summary: This row will show in bold and will not have a grade attached to it.

columns.name: GradingScaleNum
columns.summary: FK to gradingscale.GradingScaleNum.  The grading scale used for this criterion.  As a user builds an evaluationDef, each criterion should default to the GradingScaleNum of the EvaluationDef, and then the user can change if needed.  The individual criteria do not have to be the same scale as the evaluation.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Defines the order that all the criteria show on the evaluation.  Copied to ItemOrder of actual criterion.

columns.name: MaxPointsPoss
columns.summary: For ScaleType=Points, sets the maximum value of points for this criterion.

name: evaluationdef
summary: An evaluation def is the entire form that the instructor sets up ahead of time.  Actual evaluations for students are copied from these 'templates', so an evaluation def can be altered or deleted without damaging any student record.  Evaluation defs are usually not specific to instructors, but if different instructors want different evaluation forms, they can use the description column to differentiate.  For example, the description can include the instructor's name or even the year.  But most commonly, the same evaluation will be used from year to year.  There should be a duplicate function to make a copy an entire evaluation def and then allow user to alter the SchoolCourseNum.

columns.name: EvaluationDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SchoolCourseNum
columns.summary: FK to schoolcourse.SchoolCourseNum.  For example to PEDO 732.

columns.name: EvalTitle
columns.summary: Description of this evaluation form.

columns.name: GradingScaleNum
columns.summary: FK to gradingscale.GradingScaleNum.  The default grading scale for this evaluation.  Each criterion will typically use the same scale, but that is not required.

name: famaging
summary: This table stores intermediate family aged balances just prior to updating the patient table.  Once the aging calculations are finishedand the patient table is updated, this table is truncated.  At the start of the aging calculations this table is checked and if there are existingrows, we will notify the user and force them to decide whether an aging calculation has already begun or an error happened that prevented thecalculations from finishing and the rows are left over and can be deleted.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  Also thekey for this table.  Always the PatNum for the Guarantor of a family.  A guarantor may notexist in this table if the family does not have a balance.  i.e. If a PatNum is not in this table, the aged balance columns on the patient tableare set to 0, so either the patient is not the guarantor or the family has a zero balance.

columns.name: Bal_0_30
columns.summary: Aged balance from 0 to 30 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family.  Only stored with guarantor.

columns.name: Bal_31_60
columns.summary: Aged balance from 31 to 60 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family.  Only stored with guarantor.

columns.name: Bal_61_90
columns.summary: Aged balance from 61 to 90 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family.  Only stored with guarantor.

columns.name: BalOver90
columns.summary: Aged balance over 90 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family.  Only stored with guarantor.

columns.name: InsEst
columns.summary: Insurance Estimate for entire family.  Only stored with guarantor.

columns.name: BalTotal
columns.summary: Total balance for entire family before insurance estimate.  Not the same as the sum of the 4 aging balances because this can be negative.  Only stored with guarantor.

columns.name: PayPlanDue
columns.summary: Amount "due now" for all payment plans such that someone in this family is the payment plan guarantor.This is the total of all payment plan charges past due (taking into account the PayPlansBillInAdvanceDays setting) subtract the amountalready paid for the payment plans.  Only stored with family guarantor.

name: familyhealth
summary: For EHR, this lets us record medical problems for family me]}mbers.  These family members will usually not be in our database, and they are just recorded by relationship.

columns.name: FamilyHealthNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: Relationship
columns.summary: Enum:FamilyRelationship

columns.name: DiseaseDefNum
columns.summary: FK to diseasedef.DiseaseDefNum, which will have a SnoMed associated with it.

columns.name: PersonName
columns.summary: Name of the family member.

name: fee
summary: There is one entry in this table for each fee for a single procedurecode.  So if there are 5 different fees stored for one procedurecode, then there will be five entries here.

columns.name: FeeNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Amount
columns.summary: The amount usually charged.  If an amount is unknown, then the entire Fee entry is deleted from the database.The absence of a fee is shown in the user interface as a blank entry.For clinic and/or provider fees, amount can be set to -1 which indicates that their fee should be blank and not use the default fee.

columns.name: OldCode
columns.summary: Do not use.

columns.name: FeeSched
columns.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum.

columns.name: UseDefaultFee
columns.summary: Not used.

columns.name: UseDefaultCov
columns.summary: Not used.

columns.name: CodeNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  Must be 0 if feesched.IsGlobal=true.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  Must be 0 if feesched.IsGlobal=true.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Gets set automatically to the user logged in when the row is inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

columns.name: DateEffective
columns.summary: The date when the Fee is valid. Most users will have their fees with empty dates (0001-01-01) meaning their fees are always valid. This lets user enter a fee schedule ahead of an effective date. When we show fees to the user in areas where there is no date filter, we use today as the dateEffective. We don't show future fees in those areas.

name: feesched
summary: Fee schedule names used to be in the definition table, but now they have their own table.  We are about to have many many more fee schedules as we start automating allowed fees.

columns.name: FeeSchedNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: The name of the fee schedule.

columns.name: FeeSchedType
columns.summary: Enum:FeeScheduleType

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Unlike with the old definition table, this ItemOrder is not as critical in the caching of data.  The item order is only for fee schedules of the same type.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: True if the fee schedule is hidden.  Can't delete fee schedules or change their type once created.

columns.name: IsGlobal
columns.summary: True if the fee schedule is used globally and linked to the HQ. Localization of the fees is not allowed. ClinicNum and ProvNum must both be zero for all fees.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

name: feeschedgroup
summary: Can be used when using clinics, and a single fee schedule has fees that are region specific and need to be different for different clinics. A FeeSchedGroup stores a list of clinics that one fee schedule applies to, overriding the normal fee sched. This is designed so that you can have a few "groups" per fee sched instead of dozens or hundreds of clinics. Fees are still created on a per-clinic basis, and we attempt to manage them when we do things like change fees or edit groups.

columns.name: FeeSchedGroupNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: FeeSchedNum
columns.summary: FK to FeeSched.FeeSchedNum.

columns.name: ClinicNums
columns.summary: Comma delimited list of Clinic.ClinicNums.

name: feeschednote
summary: A note that is attached to a fee schedule, and can additionally be associated with a clinic too.

columns.name: FeeSchedNoteNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: FeeSchedNum
columns.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum.

columns.name: ClinicNums
columns.summary: A comma delimited list of clinic nums that the fee schedule note is for. Can include 0. For most offices this will be empty string because they do not use clinics.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: A note for a particular fee schedule. No character lim.

columns.name: DateEntry
columns.summary: The date of this note. User is allowed to change this date.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change. The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates. Not user editable with the UI.

name: fhircontactpoint

columns.name: ChannelEndpoint
columns.summary: Where the channel points to.

columns.name: ChannelPayLoad
columns.summary: Mimetype to send, or blank for no payload.

columns.name: ChannelHeader
columns.summary: Usage depends on the channel type.

columns.name: DateEnd
columns.summary: When to automatically delete the subscription.

columns.name: APIKeyHash
columns.summary: A hash of the API key that was used in the request to create this subscription.

name: fielddeflink
summary: A better name would be FieldHide. This specifies places where PatFields or ApptFields should be hidden. PatFieldDefs already have an IsHidden field, so this is redundant there. But it's powerful for letting PatFields show in some places but not other places.

columns.name: FieldDefLinkNum

columns.name: FieldLocation

name: formpat

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: FormDateTime
columns.summary: The date and time that this questionnaire was filled out.

name: gradingscale
summary: Used in Evaluations.  Describes a scale to be used in grading.  Freeform scales are not allowed.  Percentage scales are handled a little differently than the other scales.

columns.name: GradingScaleNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: For example, A-F or Pass/Fail.

columns.name: ScaleType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumScaleType Used to determine method of assigning grades.  PickList will be the only type that has GradingScaleItems.

name: gradingscaleitem
summary: Only used when GradingScale.ScaleType=PickList, not Percentage or Points.  The specific grades allowed on a scale.  Contains both the GradeShowing and the equivalent number.  There are no FKs to these items.  The values are all copied from here into student records as they are used.

columns.name: GradingScaleItemNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: GradingScaleNum
columns.summary: FK to gradingscale.GradingScaleNum

columns.name: GradeShowing
columns.summary: For example A, B, C, D, F.  Optional.  If not specified, it shows the number.

columns.name: GradeNumber
columns.summary: For example A=4, A-=3.8, pass=1, etc.  Required.  Enforced to be equal to or less than GradingScale.MaxPointsPoss.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Optional additional info about what this particular grade means.  Just used as guidance and does not get copied to the individual student record.

name: grouppermission
summary: Every user group has certain permissions.  This defines a permission for a group.  The absense of permission would cause that row to be deleted from this table.

columns.name: GroupPermNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: NewerDate
columns.summary: Only granted permission if newer than this date.  Can be Minimum (01-01-0001) to always grant permission.

columns.name: NewerDays
columns.summary: Can be 0 to always grant permission.  Otherwise, only granted permission if item is newer than the given number of days.  1 would mean only if entered today.

columns.name: UserGroupNum
columns.summary: FK to usergroup.UserGroupNum.  The user group for which this permission is granted.  If not authorized, then this groupPermission will have been deleted.

columns.name: PermType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumPermType Some permissions will treat a zero FKey differently. Some denote it as having access to everything for that PermType. I.e. Reports.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: Generic foreign key to any other table.  Typically used in combination with PermType to give permission to specific things.

name: guardian
summary: Links patient to patient in a many to many database relationship.  The two PatNums need not be in the same family, but will usually be.The two PatNums could be in different families if the relationship was entered, then one of the patients in the relationship is moved to another family.This table can also be used for other relationship types besides guardians.  The table name is guardian because we only supported guardian relationships in the past,and we did not want to risk breaking queries by changing the table or column names. User can specify any relationship as a guardian or not a guardian.For example, a retired person might specify their brother or child as their guardian, or the user may want to record the brother of a patient as a non-guardian.

columns.name: GuardianNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNumChild
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  If Relationship is "Mother", then this PatNum is the child of the mother.

columns.name: PatNumGuardian
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  If Relationship is "Mother", then this is the PatNum of the mother.

columns.name: Relationship
columns.summary: Enum:GuardianRelationship .

columns.name: IsGuardian
columns.summary: True if this specifies a guardian relationship, or false if any other relationship.When this flag is true, the relationship will show in the "Guardians" appointment view field and in the family module "Guardians" display field for the patient.  This also grantsaccess in the patient portal to the specific patient designated via PatNumChild.

name: hcpcs

columns.name: HcpcsCode
columns.summary: Examples: AQ, J1040

columns.name: DescriptionShort

columns.summary: Copied from Appointment.

columns.summary: Copied from Appointment.

columns.name: DateTimeAskedToArrive
columns.summary: Copied from Appointment.

columns.name: ProcsColored
columns.summary: Copied from Appointment.

columns.name: ColorOverride
columns.summary: Copied from Appointment.

columns.name: AppointmentTypeNum
columns.summary: Copied from Appointment.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: Copied from Appointment.

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: Copied from Appointment.

columns.name: Priority
columns.summary: Copied from Appointment.

columns.name: ProvBarText
columns.summary: Copied from Appointment.

columns.name: PatternSecondary
columns.summary: Copied from Appointment.

columns.name: SecurityHash

columns.name: HL7DefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ModeTx
columns.summary: Enum:ModeTxHL7 File, TcpIp.

columns.name: IncomingFolder
columns.summary: Used for File mode and for SFTP mode.  For file mode, this is the folder for inbound HL7 messages.For SFTP mode, this is the relative path from the SFTP root directory to the directory where the result messages can be found.The root or home directory '.' can be included in the path but is not necessary.  Examples: /./results or /results or results.

columns.name: OutgoingFolder
columns.summary: Only used for File mode

columns.name: IncomingPort
columns.summary: Only used for tcpip mode. Example: 1461

columns.name: OutgoingIpPort
columns.summary: Only used for tcpip mode. Example: 192.168.0.23:1462

columns.name: FieldSeparator
columns.summary: Only relevant for outgoing. Incoming field separators are defined in MSH. Default |.

columns.name: ComponentSeparator
columns.summary: Only relevant for outgoing. Incoming field separators are defined in MSH. Default ^.

columns.name: SubcomponentSeparator
columns.summary: Only relevant for outgoing. Incoming field separators are defined in MSH. Default &.

columns.name: RepetitionSeparator
columns.summary: Only relevant for outgoing. Incoming field separators are defined in MSH. Default ~.

columns.name: EscapeCharacter
columns.summary: Only relevant for outgoing. Incoming field separators are defined in MSH. Default.

columns.name: IsInternal
columns.summary: If this is set, then there will be no child tables. Internal types are fully defined within the C# code rather than in the database.

columns.name: InternalType
columns.summary: Enum:HL7InternalType Stored in db as string, but used in OD as enum HL7InternalType. Example: eCWTight.  This will always have a value because we always start with a copy of some internal type.

columns.name: InternalTypeVersion
columns.summary: Example: 12.2.14. This will be empty if IsInternal. This records the version at which they made their copy. We might have made significant improvements since their copy.

columns.name: HL7Server
columns.summary: The machine name of the computer where the OpenDentHL7 service for this def is running.

columns.name: HL7ServiceName
columns.summary: The name of the HL7 service for this def.  Must begin with OpenDent...

columns.name: ShowDemographics
columns.summary: Enum:HL7ShowDemographics Hide,Show,Change,ChangeAndAdd

columns.name: ShowAppts
columns.summary: Show Appointments module.

columns.name: ShowAccount
columns.summary: Show Account module

columns.name: IsQuadAsToothNum
columns.summary: Send the quadrant in the tooth number component instead of the surface component of the FT1.26 field of the outgoing DFT messages.  Only for eCW.

columns.name: LabResultImageCat
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.  Image category used by MedLab HL7 interfaces when storing PDFs received via inbound HL7 messages.

columns.name: SftpUsername
columns.summary: The username for logging into the Sftp server.

columns.name: SftpPassword
columns.summary: The password used with the SftpUsername to log into the Sftp server.  This won't be displayed to the user but will be stored as encrypted text in the db.

columns.name: SftpInSocket
columns.summary: The socket used to connect to the Sftp server for retrieving inbound HL7 messages.  Currently only used by MedLabv2_3 interfaces. This will be the address:port of the Sftp server to connect to for retrieving lab results.  Example: server.address.com:20020.

columns.name: HasLongDCodes
columns.summary: For eCW HL7 interfaces only.  False by default.  When false, D codes sent in outbound DFT messages will be limited to 5 characters. Any additional characters will be stripped off when generating the HL7 message.  When true, D codes will not be truncated.

columns.name: IsProcApptEnforced
columns.summary: If true a message box will warn users if they try to send procedures from the chart module that are not attached to an appointment.

name: hl7deffield
summary: Multiple fields per segment.

columns.name: HL7DefFieldNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: HL7DefSegmentNum
columns.summary: FK to hl7deffield.HL7DefSegmentNum

columns.name: OrdinalPos
columns.summary: Position within the segment.

columns.name: TableId
columns.summary: HL7 table Id, if applicable. Example: 0234. Example: 1234/2345.  DataType will be ID.

columns.name: DataType
columns.summary: The DataTypeHL7 enum will be unlinked from the db by storing as string in db. As it's loaded into OD, it will become an enum.

columns.name: FieldName
columns.summary: User will get to pick from a list of fields that we will maintain. Example: guar.nameLFM, prov.provIdName, or pat.addressCityStateZip.  See below for the full list.  This will be blank if this is a fixed text field.

columns.name: FixedText
columns.summary: User will need to insert fixed text for some fields.  Either FixedText or FieldName will have a value, not both.

name: hl7defmessage
summary: There is no field for MessageStructureHL7 (ADT_A01), because that will be inferred. Defined in HL7 specs, section 2.16.3.

columns.name: HL7DefMessageNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: HL7DefNum
columns.summary: FK to hl7def.HL7DefNum

columns.name: MessageType
columns.summary: Enum:MessageTypeHL7 Stored in db as string, but used in OD as enum MessageTypeHL7. Example: ADT

columns.name: EventType
columns.summary: Enum:EventTypeHL7 Stored in db as string, but used in OD as enum EventTypeHL7. Example: A04, which is only used with ADT/ACK.

columns.name: InOrOut
columns.summary: Enum:InOutHL7 Incoming, Outgoing

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: The only purpose of this column is to let you change the order in the HL7 Def windows.  It's just for convenience.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: text

columns.name: MessageStructure
columns.summary: Enum:MessageStructureHL7 Stored in db as string, but used in OD as enum MessageStructure. Example: ADT_A01, which is the structure used for event types A01, A04, A08, and A13.

name: hl7defsegment
summary: multiple segments per message

columns.name: HL7DefSegmentNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: HL7DefMessageNum
columns.summary: FK to hl7defmessage.HL7DefMessageNum

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Since we don't enforce or automate, it can be 1-based or 0-based.  For outgoing, this affects the message structure.  For incoming, this is just for convenience and organization in the HL7 Def windows.

columns.name: CanRepeat
columns.summary: For example, a DFT can have multiple FT1 segments.  This turns out to be a completely useless field, since we already know which ones can repeat.

columns.name: IsOptional
columns.summary: If this is false, and an incoming message is missing this segment, then it gets logged as an error/failure.  If this is true, then it will gracefully skip a missing incoming segment.  Not used for outgoing.

columns.name: SegmentName
columns.summary: Stored in db as string, but used in OD as enum SegmentNameHL7. Example: PID.

name: hl7msg
summary: HL7 messages sent and received.

columns.name: HL7MsgNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: HL7Status
columns.summary: Enum:HL7MessageStatus Out/In are relative to Open Dental.  This is in contrast to the names of the old ecw folders, which were relative to the other program.  OutPending, OutSent, InReceived, InProcessed.

columns.name: MsgText
columns.summary: The actual HL7 message in its entirity.

columns.name: AptNum
columns.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum.  Many of the messages contain "Visit ID" which is equivalent to our AptNum.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: Used to determine which messages are old so that they can be cleaned up.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

name: hl7procattach
summary: Keeps track of whether procedures have been sent in an HL7 message.

columns.name: HL7ProcAttachNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: HL7MsgNum
columns.summary: FK to hl7msg.HL7MsgNum.

columns.name: ProcNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum.

name: icd10
summary: Other tables generally use the ICD10Code string as their foreign key.  It is implied that these are all ICD10CMs, although that may not be the case in the future.

columns.name: Icd10Num
columns.summary: Primary key. Also identical to "Order Number" column in ICD10 documentation.

columns.name: Icd10Code
columns.summary: ICD-10-CM or ICD-10-PCS code. Dots are included. Not allowed to edit this column once saved in the database.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Short Description provided by ICD10 documentation.

columns.name: IsCode
columns.summary: 0 if the code is a header  not valid for submission on a UB04. 1 if the code is valid for submission on a UB04.

name: icd9
summary: Other tables generally use the ICD9Code string as their foreign key.  Currently synched to mobile server in a very inefficient manner.  It is implied that these are all ICD9CMs, although that may not be the case in the future.

columns.name: ICD9Num
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ICD9Code
columns.summary: Not allowed to edit this column once saved in the database.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Description.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: The last date and time this row was altered.  Not user editable.

name: imagedraw
summary: Image text, lines. drawings, and scales. Attached to either a document or a mount. Drawings are in pixel coordinates of original image prior to any cropping or rotating. For a mount, coordinates are relative to the entire mount. Drawings do not get changed when cropping or rotating are changed. The result is that drawings always stay on the image in exactly the original location, and they move with the image.

columns.name: ImageDrawNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: DocNum
columns.summary: FK to document.DocNum

columns.name: MountNum
columns.summary: FK to mount.MountNum

columns.name: ColorDraw
columns.summary: For text, this is the foreground color. For lines, this is the color, and ColorBack is not used. For polygons, this is the fill color. No transparency component.

columns.name: ColorBack
columns.summary: Background color for text. Can be Transparent (0,255,255,255)=16777215.

columns.name: DrawingSegment
columns.summary: Point data for a drawing segment.  The format would look similar to this: 45.2,68.1;48,70;49,72;0,0;55,88;etc.  It's simply a sequence of points, separated by semicolons.  Only positive floats are used, rounded to one decimal place.  0,0 is the upper left of the image or mount.  Cropping is ignored.  If the pen is picked up, it becomes a new segment, so a new row in the database.  Or, if this is DrawType.ScaleValue, then this field stores scale, decimal places, and units, separated by spaces.  Example: "123.4 0 mm". The first two are required; units is optional.

columns.name: DrawText
columns.summary: The location of the text in pixels is incorporated into this string.  Example: 25,123;This shows.  Carriage returns etc are not supported.  ColorDraw and FontSize are also used.  Unlike tooth initial, this does not support floats.

columns.name: FontSize
columns.summary: This could vary significantly based on the size of the image.  It's always relative to orginal image or mount pixels. Always 0 for Pearl.

columns.name: DrawType
columns.summary: Enum:ImageDrawType

columns.name: ImageAnnotVendor
columns.summary: Enum:EnumImageAnnotVendor 0: Open Dental drawings and text, 1:Pearl AI annotations.

columns.name: Details
columns.summary: Extra space for any text. Currently only used for Pearl annotation categories, relationship properties, and relationship values, which are all stored as a single chunk of user readable text drawn straight to screen when hovering.

columns.name: PearlLayer
columns.summary: Enum:Pearl.EnumCategoryOD This is how we hide and show layers for Pearl objects in the Imaging module.

columns.name: BetterDiagLayer
columns.summary: Enum:EnumCategoryBetterDiag This is how we hide and show layers for BetterDiagnostics objects in the Imaging module.

name: imagingdevice
summary: Xray sensor, camera, etc. Depending on the hardware, this can either be one physical device or a set of similar devices.

columns.name: ImagingDeviceNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Any description of the device.

columns.name: ComputerName
columns.summary: Name of the computer where this device is available.  Optional.  If blank, then this device will be available to all computers.

columns.name: DeviceType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumImgDeviceType TwainRadiograph, XDR(not functional), or TwainMulti.

columns.name: TwainName
columns.summary: The name of the twain device as in Windows.

name: insbluebook
summary: Records insurance plan and insurance payment data of a procedure that has been paid on primary or secondary insurance claim made to out of network plans. This data is used to estimate allowed fees and make more accurate insurance estimates.

columns.name: InsBlueBookNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ProcCodeNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum. The code of the procedure.

columns.name: CarrierNum
columns.summary: FK to insplan.CarrierNum. The carrier that the insurance plan belongs to.

columns.name: PlanNum
columns.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum. The insurance plan for which the claim was made.

columns.name: GroupNum
columns.summary: The insplan.GroupNum. May be blank.

columns.name: InsPayAmt
