columns.summary: The sum of InsPayAmt per claim for received and supplemental claimprocs of the procedure that are associated to the insurance plan.

columns.name: AllowedOverride
columns.summary: The AllowedOverride of the received claimproc on the claim.

columns.name: DateTEntry
columns.summary: The date and time of entry. Not editable by user.

columns.name: ProcNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum.

columns.name: ProcDate
columns.summary: The date of service, derived from claimproc.ProcDate of the received claimproc on the claim.

columns.name: ClaimType
columns.summary: The claim.ClaimType. Currently only gathering data for primary and secondary claims, so this will be "P"(Primary) or "S"(Secondary).

columns.name: ClaimNum
columns.summary: FK to claim.ClaimNum.

name: insbluebooklog
summary: Logs all changes made to claimproc estimates that are made by the Blue Book feature.

columns.name: InsBlueBookLogNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ClaimProcNum
columns.summary: FK to claimproc.ClaimProcNum. The claimproc for which the estimate was changed.

columns.name: AllowedFee
columns.summary: The new claimproc.InsEstTotal that was calculated by the Blue Book feature.

columns.name: DateTEntry
columns.summary: The date and time of entry. Not editable by user.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Explanation of how the Blue Book feature obtained the new insurance estimate.

name: insbluebookrule
summary: The insbluebookrule table represents an ordered hierarchy of rules that the program will attempt to apply when determining insurance estimates for out of network plans. If the highest priority rule does not produce an estimate, the program attempts to apply the second rule, and so on, until an estimate is obtained.

columns.name: InsBlueBookRuleNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: 0 based. This rule's priority in the hierarchy of all insbluebookrules. 0 is highest priority.

columns.name: RuleType
columns.summary: Enum:InsBlueBookRuleType Types 0 to 3 are for rules that determine estimates by looking at the payment history of an insurance plan, insurance plan group, carrier, or carrier group. Type 4 utilizes fee schedules that are attached to out of network plans that are manually maintained by the user. Type 5 bases estimates off of the UCR fee.

columns.name: LimitValue
columns.summary: The number of years, months, weeks, or days of insurance payment history that will be considered when generating a Blue Book estimate. Will be 0 if the RuleType is 4-ManualBlueBookSchedule or 5-UcrFee as limits do not apply to these rule types.

columns.name: LimitType
columns.summary: Enum:InsBlueBookRuleLimitType Determines the unit of time that InsBlueBookRule.LimitValue represents. Will be 0-None if the RuleType is 4-ManualBlueBookSchedule or 5-UcrFee as limits do not apply to these rule types.

columns.name: InsEditLogNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: Key to the foreign table.

columns.name: LogType
columns.summary: Enum:InsEditLogType 0 - InsPlan, 1 - Carrier, 2 - Benefit, 3 - Employer.

columns.name: FieldName
columns.summary: The name of the column that was altered.

columns.name: OldValue
columns.summary: The old value of this field.

columns.name: NewValue
columns.summary: The new value of this field.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. The user that made this change.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: Time that the row was inserted into the DB.

columns.name: ParentKey
columns.summary: Stores the key to the parent table (insplan.PlanNum) when LogType = 2 (Benefit).

columns.name: Description
columns.summary:
The string describing this entry. Displays different information depending on the LogType:
0 - InsPlan: GroupNum and GroupName
1 - Carrier: CarrierNum and CarrierName
2 - Benefit: CovCat Description
3 - Employer: Employer Name

columns.name: InsEditPatLogNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: Foreign key to the field flagged with the PriKey attributed for the corresponding table type which is specified by LogType. Note, some logs do not use table type objects that are directly related to the LogType. E.g. Adjustment LogType uses a claimproc entity. 0 - PatPlan: patplan.PatPlanNum. 1 - Subscriber: inssub.InsSubNum. 2 - Adjustment: claimproc.ClaimProcNum.

columns.name: LogType
columns.summary: Enum:InsEditPatLogType 0 - PatPlan, 1 - Subscriber, 2 - Adjustment.

columns.name: FieldName
columns.summary: The name of the column that was altered.

columns.name: OldValue
columns.summary: The old value of this field.

columns.name: NewValue
columns.summary: The new value of this field.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. The user that made this change.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: Time that the row was inserted into the DB.

columns.name: ParentKey
columns.summary: Used to store another foreign key link to another entity based off of the current LogType. 0 - PatPlan: Not used. 1 - Subscriber: Not used. 2 - Adjustment: claimproc.InsSubNum

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: The string describing this entry. Displays different information depending on the LogType: 1 - Subscriber: Subscriber's Name, 2 - Adjustment: Insurance Benefit

name: insfilingcode
summary: An optional field on insplan and claims.  This lets user customize so that they can track insurance types. Only used for e-claims. Typically two characters. Examples: CI for Commercial Insurance, VA for Veterans, WC for Worker's Comp, MB for Medicare part B, etc.

columns.name: InsFilingCodeNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Descript
columns.summary: Description of the insurance filing code.

columns.name: EclaimCode
columns.summary: Code for electronic claim.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Display order for this filing code within the UI.  0-indexed.

columns.name: GroupType
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.  Reporting Group.

columns.name: ExcludeOtherCoverageOnPriClaims
columns.summary: If set to true, and the patient's secondary insurance plan uses this insfilingcode, the secondary insurance plan will not be populated on primary e-claims or paper claims.

name: insfilingcodesubtype
summary: Stores the list of insurance filing code subtypes.

columns.name: InsFilingCodeSubtypeNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: InsFilingCodeNum
columns.summary: FK to insfilingcode.insfilingcodenum

columns.name: Descript
columns.summary: The description of the insurance filing code subtype.

name: inspending
summary: This table is an easy way to import insurance into Open Dental. It avoids all the complexity of InsPlans, Carriers, InsSubs, and PatPlans. The API and eClipboard eForms both take advantage of this table. The office then has control over when and how they convert this InsPending to an actual insurance plan. Details are entered separately for each family member so it can look like there's some duplication in a family. But the UI to convert to a real ins plan handles that smoothly. Ins Pending shows to the left of normal insurance in the Family module. InsPending does not mix with InsSub or PatPlan. There can be multiple InsPendings per patient if needed.

columns.name: InsPendingNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum  The patient who has this insurance. Analogous to patplan.PatNum. Always required.

columns.name: PatNumSubscriber
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum  The patient who is the subscriber. Always required.

columns.name: Ordinal
columns.summary: Number like 1, 2, 3, etc.  Represents primary ins, secondary ins, tertiary ins, etc. But this is really just an indicator of which ordinal the patient "wants" the insurance to go into. It always shows to the left of the true plans in the Family module. These aren't actually intermingled with ins plans. A number here does not indicate that the InsPending is actually in the desired position. Since it's not very important, it can also be 0.

columns.name: Relationship
columns.summary: Enum:Relat Required to be Self if this is the subscriber (PatNum==PatNumSubscriber).

columns.name: GroupNum
columns.summary: Optional.

columns.name: GroupName
columns.summary: Optional.

columns.name: Employer
columns.summary: Optional.

columns.name: SubscriberID
columns.summary: Number assigned by insurance company. No dashes. Not allowed to be blank.

columns.name: Phone
columns.summary: Includes any punctuation.

name: insplan
summary: Subscribers can share insplans by using the InsSub table.  The patplan table determines coverage for individual patients.  InsPlans can also exist without any subscriber.

columns.name: PlanNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: GroupName
columns.summary: Optional

columns.name: GroupNum
columns.summary: Optional.  In Canada, this is called the Plan Number.

columns.name: PlanNote
columns.summary: Note for this plan.  Same for all subscribers.

columns.name: FeeSched
columns.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum.

columns.name: PlanType
columns.summary: ""=percentage(the default),"p"=ppo_percentage,"f"=flatCopay,"c"=capitation.

columns.name: ClaimFormNum
columns.summary: FK to claimform.ClaimFormNum. eg. "1" for ADA2002.  For ADA2006, it varies by office.

columns.name: UseAltCode
columns.summary: 0=no,1=yes.  could later be extended if more alternates required

columns.name: ClaimsUseUCR
columns.summary: Fee billed on claim should be the UCR fee for the patient's provider.

columns.name: CopayFeeSched
columns.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum. Not usually used. This fee schedule holds only co-pays(patient portions).  Only used for Capitation or for fixed copay plans.

columns.name: EmployerNum
columns.summary: FK to employer.EmployerNum.

columns.name: CarrierNum
columns.summary: FK to carrier.CarrierNum.

columns.name: AllowedFeeSched
columns.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum.  Not usually used.  This fee schedule holds amounts allowed by carriers.  Always represents a feesched of type OutOfNetwork.

columns.name: DivisionNo
columns.summary: Only used in Canada. It's a suffix to the plan number (group number).

columns.name: IsMedical
columns.summary: True if this is medical insurance rather than dental insurance.  When creating a claim, this, along with pref.

columns.name: FilingCode
columns.summary: FK to insfilingcode.InsFilingCodeNum.  Used for e-claims.  Also used for some complex reports in public health.  The e-claim usage might become obsolete when PlanID implemented by HIPAA.  Can be 0 to indicate none.  Then 'CI' will go out on claims.

columns.name: DentaideCardSequence
columns.summary: Canadian e-claim field. D11 and E07.  Zero indicates empty.  Mandatory value for Dentaide.  Not used for all others.  2 digit.  DEPRECATED - See CDAnet Message Formats+Standards 4.2_2021.

columns.name: ShowBaseUnits
columns.summary: If checked, the units Qty will show the base units assigned to a procedure on the claim form.

columns.name: CodeSubstNone
columns.summary: Set to true to not allow procedure code downgrade substitution on this insurance plan.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: Set to true to hide it from the pick list and from the main list.

columns.name: MonthRenew
columns.summary: The month, 1 through 12 when the insurance plan renews.  It will renew on the first of the month.  To indicate calendar year, set renew month to 0.

columns.name: FilingCodeSubtype
columns.summary: FK to insfilingcodesubtype.InsFilingCodeSubtypeNum

columns.name: CanadianPlanFlag
columns.summary: Canadian C12.  Single char, usually blank.  If non-blank, then it's one of three kinds of Provincial Medical Plans.  A=Newfoundland MCP Plan.  V=Veteran's Affairs Plan.  N=NIHB.  N and V are not yet in use, so they will result in blank being sent instead.  See Elig5.

columns.name: CanadianDiagnosticCode
columns.summary: Canadian C39. Required when CanadianPlanFlag is 'A'.

columns.name: CanadianInstitutionCode
columns.summary: Canadian C40. Required when CanadianPlanFlag is 'A'.

columns.name: RxBIN
columns.summary: BIN location number.  Only used with EHR.

columns.name: CobRule
columns.summary: Enum:EnumCobRule 0=Basic, 1=Standard, 2=CarveOut.

columns.name: SopCode
columns.summary: FK to sop.SopCode. Examples: 121, 3115, etc.  Acts as default for all patients using this insurance.  When code is changed for an insplan, it should change automatically for patients having that primary insurance.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

columns.name: HideFromVerifyList
columns.summary: Is false if this plan needs to be verified.

columns.name: OrthoType
columns.summary: Enum:OrthoClaimType 0=InitialClaimOnly, 1=InitialPlusVisit, 2=InitialPlusPeriodic. If this is an ortho claim, dictates what type of Ortho claim it is.

columns.name: OrthoAutoProcFreq
columns.summary: Enum:OrthoAutoProcFrequency The frequency that the automatic procedures and claims are created for insplans with an InitialPlusPeriodic OrthoType

columns.name: OrthoAutoProcCodeNumOverride
columns.summary: If 0, this insplan uses the OrthoAutoProc preference.  Otherwise, this overrides that value.

columns.name: OrthoAutoFeeBilled
columns.summary: The amount that the ortho auto procedure will bill to insurance by default. Overridden by patplan.OrthoAutoFeeBilledOverride.

columns.name: OrthoAutoClaimDaysWait
columns.summary: Usually 0 or 30. Number of days that should pass after the initial banding that an automatic Ortho claim/procedure are generated.

columns.name: BillingType
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.

columns.name: HasPpoSubstWriteoffs
columns.summary: True by default.  When a plan allows downgrading procedures and this field is false, the writeoff will be $0 and the difference between the proc fee and the insurance estimate will be the patient portion.

columns.name: ExclusionFeeRule
columns.summary: Enum:ExclusionRule The exclusion rule for this insurance plan.  PracticeDefault by default.  It determines how insurance plans should behave with Exclusions.

columns.name: ManualFeeSchedNum
columns.summary: FK to feesched that has a FeeSchedType of 4-ManualBlueBook. Optional, can be 0.

columns.name: IsBlueBookEnabled
columns.summary: determines if the plan is going to have BlueBook Enabled or not

columns.name: InsPlansZeroWriteOffsOnAnnualMaxOverride
columns.summary: Overrides the InsPlansZeroWriteOffsOnAnnualMax preference. 0=use default, 1=true, 2=false.

columns.name: InsPlansZeroWriteOffsOnFreqOrAgingOverride
columns.summary: Overrides the InsPlansZeroWriteOffsOnFreqOrAging preference. 0=use default, 1=true, 2=false.

columns.name: PerVisitPatAmount
columns.summary: The per visit patient copay amount. 0 by default. When an appt is scheduled or set complete, a new proc gets created with code specified in pref.PerVisitPatAmountProcCode.

columns.name: PerVisitInsAmount
columns.summary: The per visit amount to bill insurance. 0 by default. When an appt is scheduled or set complete, a new proc gets created with code specified in pref.PerVisitInsAmountProcCode.

name: insplanpreference
summary: Used to create overrides at the insurance plan level.

columns.name: InsPlanPrefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PlanNum
columns.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: FK to to a table associated with FKeyType

columns.name: FKeyType
columns.summary: Enum:InsPlanPrefFKeyType ProcCodeNoBillIns

columns.name: ValueString
columns.summary: Used to hold the override. NoBillIns stores 0, 1.

name: inssub
summary: Multiple subscribers can have the same insurance plan.  But the patplan table is still what determines coverage for individual patients.

columns.name: InsSubNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PlanNum
columns.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum.

columns.name: Subscriber
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: DateEffective
columns.summary: Date plan became effective. Is 0001-01-01 if not set.

columns.name: DateTerm
columns.summary: Date plan was terminated. Is 0001-01-01 if not set.

columns.name: ReleaseInfo
columns.summary: Release of information signature is on file.

columns.name: AssignBen
columns.summary: Assignment of benefits signature is on file.  For Canada, this handles Payee Code, F01.  Option to pay other third party is not included.

columns.name: SubscriberID
columns.summary: Number assigned by insurance company. No dashes. Not allowed to be blank.

columns.name: BenefitNotes
columns.summary: User doesn't usually put these in.  Only used when automatically requesting benefits, such as with Trojan.  All the benefits get stored here in text form for later reference.  Not at plan level because might be specific to subscriber.  If blank, we try to display a benefitNote for another subscriber to the plan.

columns.name: SubscNote
columns.summary: Use to store any other info that affects coverage.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

columns.name: SecurityHash
columns.summary: Holds the salted hash of the following inssub fields: PlanNum, Subscriber, SubscriberID, and DateTerm.

name: installmentplan
summary: Simpler than a payment plan.  Does not affect running account balances.  Allows override of finance charges.  Affects the "pay now" on statements.  Only one installmentplan is allowed for a family, attached to guarantor only.  This is loosely enforced.

columns.name: InstallmentPlanNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: DateAgreement
columns.summary: Date payment plan agreement was made.

columns.name: DateFirstPayment
columns.summary: Date of first payment.

columns.name: MonthlyPayment
columns.summary: Amount of monthly payment.

columns.name: APR
columns.summary: Annual Percentage Rate. e.g. 12.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Note

name: insverify
summary: A row for the most recent time an insplan benefit or patplan enrollment was verified. Also see insverifyhist, which keeps a historical record. When a new plan is created, a row gets created here with no date. There is never more than one row per plan because old ones get moved over to InsVerifyHist.

columns.name: InsVerifyNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: DateLastVerified
columns.summary: The date of the last successful verification. This date will be DateTime.MinVal upon insert and will not change until the user has verified insurance benefits or pat plan eligibility in FormInsVerificationList, or until the user has entered and saved a date in Eligibility Last Verified or Benefits Last Verified textboxes in FormInsPlan.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. Typically 0. There is an optional feature that lets an office "assign" users to a verification so that they can split the load of verifying between different users.

columns.name: VerifyType
columns.summary: Enum:VerifyTypes either InsuranceBenefits or PatientEnrollment

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: Foreign key either insplan.PlanNum or patplan.PatPlanNum.

columns.name: DefNum
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Links to the category InsVerifyStatus

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Note for this insurance verification.

columns.name: DateLastAssigned
columns.summary: Optional feature that's part of "assigning" users to verification. Default is DateTime.MinVal. The DateTime of when a userod.UserNum was last assigned/unassigned a patient's insverify in FormInsVerificationList, the last time the status was changed on the insverify, when a patient's patplan has been dropped, or whenever an error occurs when trying to batch verify patient benefits.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: DateTime the row was added.

columns.name: HoursAvailableForVerification
columns.summary: Number of hours that were available from the time the insurance needed verified to the date of the appointment. Includes minutes if applicable.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed.

columns.name: SecurityHash
columns.summary: Holds the salted hash of the following insverify fields: UserNum, DefNum, DateLastAssigned.

name: insverifyhist
summary: A historical copy of an insurance verification record.

columns.name: InsVerifyHistNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: InsVerifyNum
columns.summary: Copied from InsVerify.

columns.name: DateLastVerified
columns.summary: Copied from InsVerify.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: Copied from InsVerify.

columns.name: VerifyType
columns.summary: Copied from InsVerify.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: Copied from InsVerify.

columns.name: DefNum
columns.summary: Copied from InsVerify.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Copied from InsVerify.

columns.name: DateLastAssigned
columns.summary: Copied from InsVerify.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: Copied from InsVerify.

columns.name: HoursAvailableForVerification
columns.summary: Copied from InsVerify.

columns.name: VerifyUserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  User that was logged on when row was inserted.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Not copied from Task. Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed.

columns.name: SecurityHash
columns.summary: Copied from InsVerify. When an InsVerifyHist is created, the 3 hashed fields remain unchanged, so this hash remains valid.

name: intervention
summary: An intervention ordered or performed.  Examples: smoking cessation and weightloss counseling.  Links to a definition in the ehrcode table using the CodeValue and CodeSystem.

columns.name: InterventionNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: CodeValue
columns.summary: FK to ehrcode.CodeValue.  This code may not exist in the ehrcode table, it may have been chosen from a bigger list of available codes.  In that case, this will be a FK to a specific code system table identified by the CodeSystem column.  The code for this item from one of the code systems supported.  Examples: V65.3 or 418995006.

columns.name: CodeSystem
columns.summary: FK to codesystem.CodeSystemName. The code system name for this code.  Possible values are: CPT, HCPCS, ICD9CM, ICD10CM, and SNOMEDCT.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: User-entered details about the intervention for this patient.

columns.name: DateEntry
columns.summary: The date of the intervention.

columns.name: CodeSet
columns.summary: Enum:InterventionCodeSet AboveNormalWeight, BelowNormalWeight, TobaccoCessation, Nutrition, PhysicalActivity, Dialysis.

columns.name: IsPatDeclined
columns.summary: Indicates whether the intervention was offered/recommended to the patient and the patient declined the treatment/referral.

name: journalentry
summary: Used in accounting to represent a single credit or debit entry.  There will always be at least 2 journal enties attached to every transaction.  All transactions balance to 0.

columns.name: JournalEntryNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: TransactionNum
columns.summary: FK to transaction.TransactionNum

columns.name: AccountNum
columns.summary: FK to account.AccountNum

columns.name: DateDisplayed
columns.summary: Always the same for all journal entries within one transaction.

columns.name: DebitAmt
columns.summary: Negative numbers never allowed.

columns.name: CreditAmt
columns.summary: Negative numbers never allowed.

columns.name: Splits
columns.summary: A human-readable description of the splits.  Used only for display purposes.

columns.name: CheckNumber
columns.summary: Any user-defined string.  Usually a check number, but can also be D for deposit, Adj, etc.

columns.name: ReconcileNum
columns.summary: FK to reconcile.ReconcileNum. 0 if not attached to a reconcile. Not allowed to alter amounts if attached.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. The user who created this journal entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: The date and time that this journal entry was created.

columns.name: SecUserNumEdit
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. The user who last edited this journal entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: The last time this journal entry was edited.

name: labcase
summary: A lab case.

columns.name: LabCaseNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: LaboratoryNum
columns.summary: FK to laboratory.LaboratoryNum. The lab that the case gets sent to.  Required.

columns.name: AptNum
columns.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum. This is how a lab case is attached to a scheduled appointment. Multiple labcases can be attached to any appointment. Labcase can exist without being attached to any appointments at all, making this zero.

columns.name: PlannedAptNum
columns.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum.  This is how a lab case is attached to a planned appointment in addition to the scheduled appointment.

columns.name: DateTimeDue
columns.summary: The due date that is put on the labslip.  NOT when you really need the labcase back, which is usually a day or two later and is the date of the appointment this case is attached to.

columns.name: DateTimeCreated
columns.summary: When this lab case was created. User can edit.

columns.name: DateTimeSent
columns.summary: Time that it actually went out to the lab.

columns.name: DateTimeRecd
columns.summary: Date/time received back from the lab.  If this is filled, then the case is considered received.

columns.name: DateTimeChecked
columns.summary: Date/time that quality was checked.  It is now completely ready for the patient.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: Instructions
columns.summary: The text instructions for this labcase.

columns.name: LabFee
columns.summary: This is used for tracking and informational purposes only. The fee is not used in any calculation.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: Automatically updated whenever a row is added or changed.  Not user editable.

columns.name: InvoiceNum
columns.summary: Optional invoice number

name: laboratory
summary: A dental laboratory. Will be attached to lab cases.

columns.name: LaboratoryNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Description of lab.

columns.name: Phone
columns.summary: Freeform text includes punctuation.

columns.name: Notes
columns.summary: Any notes.  No practical limit to amount of text.

columns.name: Slip
columns.summary: FK to sheetdef.SheetDefNum.  Lab slips can be set for individual laboratories.  If zero, then the default internal lab slip will be used instead of a custom lab slip.

name: labpanel
summary: One lab panel comes back from the lab with multiple lab results.  Multiple panels can come back in one HL7 message.  This table loosely corresponds to the OBR segment.

columns.name: LabPanelNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

columns.name: RawMessage
columns.summary: The entire raw HL7 message.  Can contain other labpanels in addition to this one.

columns.name: LabNameAddress
columns.summary: Both name and address in a single field.  OBR-20.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: To be used for synch with web server.

columns.name: SpecimenCondition
columns.summary: OBR-13.  Usually blank.  Example: hemolyzed.

columns.name: SpecimenSource
columns.summary: OBR-15.  Usually blank.  Example: LNA&Arterial Catheter&HL70070.

columns.name: ServiceId
columns.summary: OBR-4-0, Service performed, id portion, LOINC.  For example, 24331-1.

columns.name: ServiceName
columns.summary: OBR-4-1, Service performed description.  Example, Lipid Panel.

columns.name: MedicalOrderNum
columns.summary: FK to medicalorder.MedicalOrderNum.  Used to attach in imported lab panel to a lab order.  Multiple panels may be attached to an order.

name: labresult
summary: Medical labs, not dental labs.  Multiple labresults are attached to a labpanel.  Loosely corresponds to the OBX segment in HL7.

columns.name: LabResultNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: LabPanelNum
columns.summary: FK to labpanel.LabPanelNum.

columns.name: DateTimeTest
columns.summary: OBX-14.

columns.name: TestName
columns.summary: OBX-3-1, text portion.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: To be used for synch with web server.

columns.name: TestID
columns.summary: OBX-3-0, id portion, LOINC.  For example, 10676-5.

columns.name: ObsValue
columns.summary: OBX-5. Value always stored as a string because the type might vary in the future.

columns.name: ObsUnits
columns.summary: OBX-6  For example, mL.  Was FK to drugunit.DrugUnitNum, but that would make reliable import problematic, so now it's just text.

columns.name: ObsRange
columns.summary: OBX-7  For example, <200 or >=40.

columns.name: AbnormalFlag
columns.summary: Enum:LabAbnormalFlag 0-None, 1-Below, 2-Normal, 3-Above.

name: labturnaround
summary: The amount of time it takes for a lab case to be processed at the lab.  Used to compute due dates.

columns.name: LabTurnaroundNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: LaboratoryNum
columns.summary: FK to laboratory.LaboratoryNum. The lab that this item is attached to.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: The description of the service that the lab is performing.

columns.name: DaysPublished
columns.summary: The number of days that the lab publishes as the turnaround time for the service.

columns.name: DaysActual
columns.summary: The actual number of days.  Might be longer than DaysPublished due to travel time.  This is what the actual calculations will be done on.

name: language
summary: This is a list of phrases that need to be translated.  The primary key is a combination of the ClassType and the English phrase.  This table is currently filled dynmically at run time, but the plan is to fill it using a tool that parses the code.

columns.name: LanguageNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: EnglishComments
columns.summary: No longer used.

columns.name: ClassType
columns.summary: A string representing the class where the translation is used.

columns.name: English
columns.summary: The English version of the phrase, case sensitive.

columns.name: IsObsolete
columns.summary: As this gets more sophisticated, we will use this field to mark some phrases obsolete instead of just deleting them outright.  That way, translators will still have access to them.  For now, this is not used at all.

name: languageforeign
summary: Will usually only contain translations for a single foreign language, although more are allowed.  The primary key is a combination of the ClassType and the English phrase and the culture.

columns.name: LanguageForeignNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ClassType
columns.summary: A string representing the class where the translation is used.

columns.name: English
columns.summary: The English version of the phrase.  Case sensitive.

columns.name: Culture
columns.summary: The specific culture name.  Almost always in 5 digit format like this: en-US.

columns.name: Translation
columns.summary: The foreign translation.  Remember we use Unicode-8, so this translation can be in any language, including Russian, Hebrew, and Chinese.

columns.name: Comments
columns.summary: Comments for other translators for the foreign language.

name: languagepat
summary: Practice-defined translations for text shown to patients. Unlike Language and LanguageForeign, which translate Open Dental's interface to a practice's preferred language, LanguagePat allows practices to customize translations of messages and information displayed to patients in their preferred language. Used right now for about 30 prefs for things like email messages. Also used for EForms. So either PrefName will be empty or EFormFieldDefNum will be 0. Sheets are translated differently, by making a copy of each SheetFieldDef used for each language.

columns.name: LanguagePatNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PrefName
columns.summary: FK to pref.PrefName. There are about 30 of these in use. This allows us to translate the value stored for templates like email, postcard, text, etc. Will be empty string if this is an eForm translation.>

columns.name: Language
columns.summary: Three-letter language name or custom language name.  The custom language name is the full string name and is not necessarily supported by Microsoft.This will typically be matched to the patient's preferred language to select the appropriate translation.Three-letter language name examples: eng (English), spa (Spanish), fra (French).Custom language name examples: Tahitian, American Sign Language, Morse Code.The LanguagesUsedByPatients preference stores the three-letter names that the practice chooses to support.

columns.name: Translation
columns.summary: The translated text. Max 65,000 characters. Might store complex email templates.

columns.name: EFormFieldDefNum
columns.summary: FK to eformfielddef.EFormFieldDefNum. This is how eForms get translated. Once a def is converted to an eForm, this is not needed. The eForm fields have all the translated text. Will be 0 if this is a pref translation.

name: letter
summary: These are templates that are used to send simple letters to patients.

columns.name: LetterNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Description of the Letter.

columns.name: BodyText
columns.summary: Text of the letter

name: lettermerge
summary: Describes the templates for letter merges to Word.

columns.name: LetterMergeNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Description of this letter.

columns.name: TemplateName
columns.summary: The filename of the Word template. eg MyTemplate.doc.

columns.name: DataFileName
columns.summary: The name of the data file. eg MyTemplate.txt.

columns.name: Category
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.

columns.name: ImageFolder
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. This determines the default Image Category that will be selected when printing or previewing the letter. Can be 0 which means 'None' will be selected.

name: lettermergefield
summary: When doing a lettermerge, a data file is created with certain fields.  This is a list of those fields for each lettermerge.

columns.name: FieldNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: LetterMergeNum
columns.summary: FK to lettermerge.LetterMergeNum.

columns.name: FieldName
columns.summary: One of the preset available field names.

name: limitedbetafeature
summary: Limited Beta features are specific parts of the OpenDental suite of services that are locked behind a registration process while the feature undergoes improvement or further testing. This registration process is done through HQ working with a customer to determine if they will be a good candidate to use and test this feature before it's full release. If they are a good candidate, a row is inserted into their database that will allow them access to the feature. LimitedBetaFeatures get inserted during the nightly synch with our eServiceSignups. This is done in our call to WebServiceMainHQProxy.GetEServiceSetupFull. The nightly synch is the only place these rows get altered.

columns.name: LimitedBetaFeatureTypeNum
columns.summary: Stores the integer value of the LimitedBetaFeatureEnum. This is done to prevent out of bounds exceptions due to versioning.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: ClinicNum that is signed up for the feature. Clinic independant features only have one row with a clinicNum of -1.

columns.name: IsSignedUp
columns.summary: An office is considered signed up if they have a valid version to be using this feature on, the feature is on limited beta, and they've signed up with HQ.

name: loginattempt
summary: Keeps track of failed login attempts.

columns.name: LoginAttemptNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: UserName
columns.summary: The username that was attempted. May not be a username that exists.

columns.name: LoginType
columns.summary: Enum:UserWebFKeyType The part of the program where an attempt was made. If we want to use this for other parts of the program that are do not use the userweb table, we can change this enum to a different one.

columns.name: DateTFail
columns.summary: When the failed attempt was attempted.

name: loinc
summary: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) used to identify both lab panels and lab results. Widths specified are from LOINC documentation and may not represent length of fields in the Open Dental Database.

columns.name: LoincNum
columns.summary: Primary key. Internal use only.

columns.name: LoincCode
columns.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# Also called LOINC_NUM in the official LOINCDB. Width-10. LOINC244 column 1.

columns.name: Component
columns.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# First Major axis:component or analyte. Width-255. LOINC244 column 2.

columns.name: PropertyObserved
columns.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# Second major axis:property observed (e.g., mass vs. substance). Width-30. LOINC244 column 3.

columns.name: TimeAspct
columns.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# Third major axis:timing of the measurement (e.g., point in time vs 24 hours). Width-15. LOINC244 column 4.

columns.name: SystemMeasured
columns.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# Fourth major axis:type of specimen or system (e.g., serum vs urine). Width-100 LOINC244. column 5.

columns.name: ScaleType
columns.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# Fifth major axis:scale of measurement (e.g., qualitative vs. quantitative). Width-30. LOINC244 column 6.

columns.name: MethodType
columns.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# Sixth major axis:method of measurement. Width-50. LOINC244 column 7.

columns.name: StatusOfCode
columns.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# Width-10. LOINC244 column 13.ACTIVE = Concept is active. Use at will.TRIAL = Concept is experimental in nature. Use with caution as the concept and associated attributes may change. DISCOURAGED = Concept is not recommended for current use. New mappings to this concept are discouraged; although existing may mappings may continue to be valid in context. Wherever  possible, the superseding concept is indicated in the MAP_TO field in the MAP_TO table (see Table 28b) and should be used instead. DEPRECATED = Concept is deprecated. Concept should not be used, but it is retained in LOINC for historical purposes. Wherever possible, the superseding concept is indicated in the MAP_TO field (see Table 28b) and should be used both for new mappings and updating existing implementations..

columns.name: NameShort
columns.summary: #EULA REQUIRED# Introduced in version 2.07, this field is a concatenation of the fully specified LOINC name. The field width may change in a future release. Width 40. LOINC244 column 29.

columns.name: ClassType
columns.summary: 1=Laboratory class; 2=Clinical class; 3=Claims attachments; 4=Surveys. LOINC244 column 16.

columns.name: UnitsRequired
columns.summary: Y/N field that indicates that units are required when this LOINC is included as an OBX segment in a HIPAA attachment. LOINC244 column 26.

columns.name: OrderObs
columns.summary: Defines term as order only, observation only, or both. A fourth category, Subset, is used for terms that are subsets of a panel but do not represent a package that is known to be orderable we have defined them only to make it easier to maintain panels or other sets within the LOINC construct. LOINC244 column 30.

columns.name: HL7FieldSubfieldID
columns.summary: A value in this field means that the content should be delivered in the named field/subfield of the HL7 message. When NULL, the data for this data element should be sent in an OBX segment with this LOINC code stored in OBX-3 and with the value in the OBX-5. Width 50. LOINC244 column 32.

columns.name: ExternalCopyrightNotice
columns.summary: External copyright holders copyright notice for this LOINC code. LOINC244 column 33.

columns.name: NameLongCommon
columns.summary: This field contains the LOINC term in a more readable format than the fully specified name. The long common names have been created via a table driven algorithmic process. Most abbreviations and acronyms that are used in the LOINC database have been fully spelled out in English. Width 255. LOINC244 column 35.

columns.name: UnitsUCUM
columns.summary: The Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM) is a code system intended to include all units of measures being contemporarily used in international science, engineering, and business. (www.unitsofmeasure.org ) This field contains example units of measures for this term expressed as UCUM units. Width 255. LOINC244 column 1.

columns.name: RankCommonTests
columns.summary: Ranking of approximately 2000 common tests performed by laboratories in USA. LOINC244 column 45.

columns.name: RankCommonOrders
columns.summary: Ranking of approximately 300 common orders performed by laboratories in USA. LOINC244 column 46.

name: medicalorder
summary: Ehr. Lab and radiology orders.  Medication orders are simply fields in medicationPat.

columns.name: MedicalOrderNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: MedOrderType
columns.summary: Enum:MedicalOrderType Laboratory=0,Radiology=1.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

columns.name: DateTimeOrder
columns.summary: Date and time of order.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: User will be required to type entire order out from scratch.

columns.name: IsDiscontinued
columns.summary: EHR requires Active/Discontinued status. 0=Active, 1=Discontinued.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

name: medication
summary: A list of medications, not attached to any particular patient.  Not allowed to delete if in use by a patient.  Not allowed to edit name once created due to possibility of damage to patient record.

columns.name: MedicationNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: MedName
columns.summary: Name of the medication.  User can change this.  If an RxCui is present, the RxNorm string can be pulled from the in-memory table for UI display in addition to the MedName.

columns.name: GenericNum
columns.summary: FK to medication.MedicationNum.  Cannot be zero.If this is a generic drug, then the GenericNum will be the same as the MedicationNum.Otherwise, if this is a brand drug, then the GenericNum will be a non-zero value corresponding to another medicaiton.

columns.name: Notes
columns.summary: Examples: interactions, drug class, contraindications, etc.  Not typically for dosage.  Mg, times per days, etc. typically entered into MedicationPat.PatNote.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: The last date and time this row was altered.  Not user editable.

columns.name: RxCui
columns.summary: RxNorm Code identifier.  We should have used a string type.  Used by EHR in CQM.  But the queries should use medicationpat.RxCui, NOT this RxCui, because all medicationpats (meds and orders) coming back from NewCrop will not have a FK to this medication table.  When this RxCui is modified by the user, then medicationpat.RxCui is automatically updated where medicationpat.MedicationNum matches this medication.

name: medicationpat
summary: Links medications to patients.  For ehr, some of these can be considered 'medication orders', but only if they contain a PatNote (instructions), a ProvNum, and a DateStart.

columns.name: MedicationPatNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: MedicationNum
columns.summary: FK to medication.MedicationNum.  If 0, implies that the medication order came from eRx.  This was done to allow MU2 measures to be set by either creating a medication from the medical window, or by creating an manual prescription.

columns.name: PatNote
columns.summary: Medication notes specific to this patient. Example: 10 mg tablets, two tabs 3 times per day

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: The last date and time this row was altered.  Not user editable.

columns.name: DateStart
columns.summary: Date that the medication was started.  Can be minval if unknown.

columns.name: DateStop
columns.summary: Date that the medication was stopped.  Can be minval if unknown.  If minval, then the medication is not "discontinued".  If prior to today, then the medication is "discontinued".  If today or a future date, then not discontinued yet.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Can be 0. Gets set to the patient's primary provider when adding a new med.  If adding the med from EHR, gets set to the ProvNum of the logged-in user.

columns.name: MedDescript
columns.summary: Used for eRx and eForm import. In these cases, MedicationNum=0.

columns.name: RxCui
columns.summary: For NewCrop medical orders, corresponds to the RxCui of the prescription (NewCrop only returns a value sometimes).  Otherwise, this field is synched with the medication.RxCui field based on medication.MedicationNum.  We should have used a string type.  The only purpose of this field is so that when CCDs are created, we have structured data to put in the XML, not just plain text.  Allergies exported in CCD do not look at this table, but only at the medication table.  Medications require MedicationPat.RxCui or Medication.RxCui to be exported on CCD.

columns.name: ErxGuid
columns.summary: Uniquely identifies the prescription corresponding to the medical order.Allows us to update existing eRx medical orders when refreshing prescriptions in the Chart (similar to how prescriptions are updated).Also used in 2-way medication synching with eRx.

columns.name: IsCpoe
columns.summary: If eRx is used to prescribe a medication, a medication order is imported automatically into Open Dental.  If a provider is logged in, then this is CPOE (Computerized Provider Order Entry), and this will be true.   Or, if a provider is logged in and Rx entered through OD, it's also CPOE.  If a staff person is logged in, and enters an Rx through NewCrop or OD, then this is non-CPOE, so false.

name: medlab
summary: The EHRLab table is structured to tightly with the HL7 standard and should have names that more reflect how the user will consume the data and for that reason for actual implementation we are using these medlab tables. Medical lab observation order.  This table is currently only used for LabCorp, but may be utilized by other third party lab services in the future.  These are the fields required for the LabCorp result report, used to link the order to the result(s), specimen(s), place(s) of service, or for linking parent and child results. This table contains data from the PID, ORC, OBR, and applicable NTE segments

columns.name: MedLabNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SendingApp
columns.summary: MSH-2 - Sending Application.  Used to identify the LabCorp Lab System sending the results.Possible values for LabCorp (as of their v10.7 specs): '1100' - LabCorp Lab System, 'DIANON' - DIANON Systems,'ADL' - Acupath Diagnostic Laboratories, 'EGL' - Esoterix Genetic Laboratories.For backward compatibility only: 'CMBP', 'LITHOLINK', 'USLABS'

columns.name: SendingFacility
columns.summary: MSH-3 - Sending Facility.  Identifies the LabCorp laboratory responsible for the client. It could be a LabCorp assigned 'Responsible Lab Code' representing the responsible laboratory or it could be a CLIA number.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  PID.2 - External Patient ID. LabCorp report field "Client Alt. Pat ID".

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  Can be 0. Attempt to match ordering prov external IDs to internal provnum.

columns.name: PatIDLab
columns.summary: PID.3 - Lab Assigned Patient Id.  LabCorp report field "Specimen Number".  LabCorp assigned, alpha numeric specimen number.

columns.name: PatIDAlt
columns.summary: PID.4 - Alternate Patient ID.  LabCorp report field "Patient ID".  Alternate patient ID.

columns.name: PatAge
columns.summary: PID.7.2/7.3/7.4 - Patient Age Years/Months/Days.  LabCorp report field "Age (Y/M/D)".  YYY/MM/DD format.  Three chars for years,2 each for months and days.  Some tests require age for calculation of result.  This will be the age at the time of the test, so we will usethe values in the message instead of re-calculating..

columns.name: PatAccountNum
columns.summary: PID.18.1 - Account Number.  LabCorp report field "Account Number".  LabCorp Client ID, 8 digit account number.

columns.name: PatFasting
columns.summary: PID.18.7 - Fasting.  LabCorp report field "Fasting".  Y, N, or blank. A blank component will be stored as 0 - Unknown, the result report fasting field will be blank.

columns.name: SpecimenID
columns.summary: ORC.2.1 and OBR.2.1 - Unique Foreign Accession or Specimen ID.  LabCorp report field "Client Accession (ACC)". ID sent on the specimen container.

columns.name: SpecimenIDFiller
columns.summary: ORC.3.1 and OBR.3.1 - Internal (to LabCorp for example)/Filler Accession or Specimen ID. LabCorp assigned specimen number, reused on a yearly basis.

columns.name: ObsTestID
columns.summary: OBR.4.1 - Observation Battery Identifier.  Reflex result will have this value in OBR.29 to link the reflex to the parent.

columns.name: ObsTestDescript
columns.summary: OBR.4.2 - Observation Battery Text.  LabCorp report field "Tests Ordered".

columns.name: ObsTestLoinc
columns.summary: OBR.4.4 - Alternate Battery Identifier (LOINC).  This is the LOINC code for the test performed.When displaying the results, LabCorp requires OBR.4.2, the text name of the test to be displayed, not the LOINC code.But we will store it so we can link to the LOINC code table for reporting purposes.

columns.name: ObsTestLoincText
columns.summary: OBR.4.5 - Alternate Observation Battery Text (LOINC Description).  The LOINC code description for the test performed. We will display OBR.4.2 per LabCorp requirements, but we will store this description for reporting purposes.

columns.name: DateTimeCollected
columns.summary: OBR.7 - Observation/Specimen Collection Date/Time.  LabCorp report field "Date & Time Collected". yyyyMMddHHmm format in the message, no seconds.  May be blank.

columns.name: TotalVolume
columns.summary: OBR.9 - Collection/Urine Volume (Quantity/Field Value).  LabCorp report field "Total Volume". The LabCorp document says this field is "Numeric Characters", but the HL7 documentation data type as CQ, which is a number with units in the form of Quantity^Units.  The Units component has subcomponents: ID&Text&Name of Coding System&Alt ID&Alt Text&Name of Alt Coding System&Coding System Version ID&Alt Coding System Version ID&Original Text. We will make this a string column and store the Quantity with the Units ID subcomponent if present. The default unit of measurement is ML, so if the field is a number only we will add ML.

columns.name: ActionCode
columns.summary: Enum:ResultAction OBR.11 - Action Code.  Blank for normal result, "G" for reflex result.

columns.name: ClinicalInfo
columns.summary: OBR.13.1 - Relevant Clinical Information.  LabCorp report field "Additional Information".  The report field will be filled with this value from the first OBR record in the message.  The message limits this field to 64 characters, the rest is truncated.

columns.name: DateTimeEntered
columns.summary: OBR.14 - Date/Time of Specimen Receipt in Lab.  LabCorp report field "Date Entered".  yyyyMMddHHmm format in the message, no seconds. Date and time the order was entered in the Lab System.

columns.name: OrderingProvNPI
columns.summary: ORC.12.1 and OBR.16.1 - Ordering Provider ID Number.  LabCorp report field "NPI".  ORC.12.* and OBR.16.* are repeatable, the eighth component identifies the source of the ID in the first component.  Component 8 possible values: "U"-UPIN,"P"-Provider Number (Medicaid or Commercial Ins Provider ID), "N"-NPI (Required for third party billing), "L"-Local (Physician ID).

columns.name: OrderingProvLocalID
columns.summary: ORC.12.1 and OBR.16.1 - Ordering Provider ID Number.  LabCorp report field "Physician ID".  ORC.12.* and OBR.16.* are repeatable, the eighth component identifies the source of the ID in the first component.  Component 8 possible values: "U"-UPIN, "P"-Provider Number (Medicaid or Commercial Ins Provider ID), "N"-NPI (Required for third party billing), "L"-Local (Physician ID).

columns.name: OrderingProvLName
columns.summary: ORC.12.2 and OBR.16.2 - Ordering Provider Last Name.  LabCorp report field "Physician Name".  Last, First.

columns.name: OrderingProvFName
columns.summary: ORC.12.3 and OBR.16.3 - Ordering Provider First Initial.  LabCorp report field "Physician Name".  Last, First.

columns.name: SpecimenIDAlt
columns.summary: OBR.18 - Alternate Unique Foreign Accession / Specimen ID.  LabCorp report field "Control Number".

columns.name: DateTimeReported
columns.summary: OBR.22 - Date/Time Observations Reported.  LabCorp report field "Date & Time Reported".  yyyyMMddHHmm format in the message, no secs. Date and time the results were released from the Lab System.

columns.name: ResultStatus
columns.summary: Enum:ResultStatus OBR.25 - Order Result Status.  LabCorp possible values: "F" - Final, "P" - Preliminary, "X" - Cancelled, "C" - Corrected.

columns.name: ParentObsID
columns.summary: OBR.26.1 - Link to Parent Result or Organism Link to Susceptibility. A reflex test will have the parent's OBX.3.1 value here for linking.

columns.name: ParentObsTestID
columns.summary: OBR.29 - Link to Parent Order.  A reflex test will have the value from OBR.4.1 of the original order in this field for linking.

columns.name: NotePat
columns.summary: NTE.3 - Comment Text, PID Level.  The NTE segment is repeatable and the Comment Text component is limited to 78 characters.  Multiple NTE segments can be used for longer comments.  All NTE segments at the PID level will be concatenated and stored in this one field.

columns.name: NoteLab
columns.summary: NTE.3 - Comment Text, OBR level.  The NTE segment is repeatable and the Comment Text component is limited to 78 characters.  Multiple NTE segments can be used for longer comments.  All NTE segments at the OBR level will be concatenated and stored in this one field.

columns.name: FileName
columns.summary: Not unique. More than one MedLab object can point to the same FileName, so deleting the MedLab object does not necessarily mean thefile can also be deleted.  This is the filename of the original archived message that was processed to create this medlab object as well asassociated medlabresult, medlabspecimen, and medlabfacility obects.  The files will be stored in the OpenDentImages folder in a sub-foldercalled MedLabHL7.  If a message is processed correctly it will be moved into the sub-folder MedLabHL7/Processed.  Any message that remains inthe MedLabHL7 folder and aren't moved into the Processed folder failed at some point during processing.  If the option to store images directlyin the database is chosen, this will be an empty field and there will not be the option to display the original HL7 message.This is a relative file path from the ImageStore.GetPreferredAtoZpath(),Example: "MedLabHL7/FileName.txt" OR "MedLabHL7/Processed/FileName.txt"Use: string pathToFile=ODFileUtils.CombinePaths(ImageStore.GetPreferredAtoZpath(),FileName)

columns.name: OriginalPIDSegment
columns.summary: The PID Segment from the HL7 message used to generate this MedLab object.

name: medlabfacattach
summary: Links a MedLab or a MedLabResult to a place of service.  Either the MedLabNum OR the MedLabResultNum column will be populated, neverboth, so this will link the facility to EITHER a MedLab OR a MedLabResult object.Every MedLab and MedLabResult will have 1 to many laboratories attached.

columns.name: MedLabFacAttachNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: MedLabNum
columns.summary: FK to medlab.MedLabNum.

columns.name: MedLabResultNum
columns.summary: FK to medlabresult.MedLabResultNum.

columns.name: MedLabFacilityNum
columns.summary: FK to medlabfacility.MedLabFacilityNum.

name: medlabfacility
summary: Medical lab facility that performed the test procedure(s).  Contains data from the ZPS segment.  Each MedLab object can have one tomany places of service, each in a repetition of the ZPS segment.  Each repetition will be its own row in this table.

columns.name: MedLabFacilityNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: FacilityName
columns.summary: ZPS.3 - Facility Name.  Medical lab location name that performed the testing.

columns.name: Address
columns.summary: ZPS.4.1 - Facility Address.

columns.name: City
columns.summary: ZPS.4.3 - Facility City.

columns.name: State
columns.summary: ZPS.4.4 - Facility State or Province.  Upper case state abbreviation.

columns.name: Zip
columns.summary: ZPS.4.5 - Facility Zip or Postal Code.

columns.name: Phone
columns.summary: ZPS.5 - Facility Phone Number.

columns.name: DirectorTitle
columns.summary: ZPS.7.1 - Facility Director Title.

columns.name: DirectorLName
columns.summary: ZPS.7.2 - Facility Director Last Name.

columns.name: DirectorFName
columns.summary: ZPS.7.3 - Facility Director First Name.

name: medlabresult
summary: Medical lab result.  The EHRLabResult table is structured too tightly with the HL7 standard and should have names that more reflect howthe user will consume the data and for that reason for actual implementation we are using these medlab tables.This table is currently only used for LabCorp, but may be utilized by other third party labservices in the future.  These fields are required for the LabCorp result report, used to link the result to an order,or for linking a parent and child result.  Contains data from the OBX, ZEF, and applicable NTE segments.

columns.name: MedLabResultNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: MedLabNum
columns.summary: FK to medlab.medLabNum.  Each MedLab object can have one or more results pointing to it.

columns.name: ObsID
columns.summary: OBX.3.1 - Observation Identifier.  Reflex results will have the ObsID of the parent in OBR.26 for linking.

columns.name: ObsText
columns.summary: OBX.3.2 - Observation Text.  LabCorp report field "TESTS".  LabCorp test name.

columns.name: ObsLoinc
columns.summary: OBX.3.4 - Alternate Identifier (LOINC).  This is the LOINC code for the observation.When displaying the results, LabCorp requires OBX.3.2, the text name of the test to be displayed, not the LOINC code.But we will store it so we can link to the LOINC code table for reporting purposes.

columns.name: ObsLoincText
columns.summary: OBX.3.5 - Alternate Observation Text (LOINC Description).  The LOINC code description for the observation. We will display OBX.3.2 per LabCorp requirements, but we will store this description for reporting purposes.

columns.name: ObsIDSub
columns.summary: OBX.4 - Observation Sub ID.  Used to aid in the identification of results with the same Observation ID (OBX.3) within a given OBR. This value is used to tie the results to the same organism.  The value in OBX.5.3 tells whether this OBX is the organism, observation, or antibiotic and then the value in OBX.4 links them together as to whether this is for organism #1, organism #2, etc.

columns.name: ObsValue
columns.summary:
OBX.5.1 - Observation Value.  LabCorp report field "RESULT". 
Can be null if coded entries, prelims, canceled, or >21 chars and being returned as an attached NTE. 
"TNP" will be reported for Test Not Performed.  For value >21 chars in length: OBX.2 will be 'TX' for text, 
OBX.5 will be NULL (empty field), and the value will be in attached NTEs. 
Examples: Value less than 21 chars: 
OBX|1|ST|001180^Potassium, Serum^L||K+ is >6.5 mEq/L.||3.5-5.5|A||N|F|19830527||200605040929|01| 
Value >21 chars: 
OBX|6|TX|001180^Potassium, Serum^L||||3.5-5.5|||N|C|19830527||200511071406|01| 
NTE|1|L|Red cells observed in serum. Glucose may be falsely decreased. 
NTE|2|L|Potassium may be falsely increased.

columns.name: ObsSubType
columns.summary: Enum:DataSubtype OBX.5.3 - Data Subtype.  Used to identify the coding system. Required if Discrete Microbiology testing is ordered to identifyMicrobiology Result Type.  Example of use: If OBX.5.3 is ORM, then the observation sub ID in OBX.4 is used to associate the result witha specific organism.  OBX.4 might contain 1, 2, or 3 meaning the result is for organism #1, organism #2, or organism #3.

columns.name: ObsUnits
columns.summary: OBX.6.1 - Identifier.  LabCorp report field "UNITS".  Units of measure, if too large it will be in the NTE segment.

columns.name: ReferenceRange
columns.summary: OBX.7 - Reference Ranges.  LabCorp report field "REFERENCE INTERVAL".  Only if applicable.

columns.name: AbnormalFlag
columns.summary: Enum:AbnormalFlag OBX.8 - Abnormal Flags.  LabCorp report field "FLAG".  Blank or null is normal.  When this is displayed on the LabCorp report it must be the human readable display name, so for example _gt (>) is displayed as "Panic High" and _lt (<) is "Panic Low".

columns.name: ResultStatus
columns.summary: Enum:ResultStatus OBX.11 - Observation Result Status.

columns.name: DateTimeObs
columns.summary: OBX.14 - Date/Time of Observation.  yyyyMMddHHmm format in the message, no seconds. Date and time tech entered result into the Lab System.

columns.name: FacilityID
columns.summary: OBX.15 - Producer ID (Producers Reference).  LabCorp report field "LAB".  ID of LabCorp Facility responsible for performing the testing.  The Lab Name is supplied in the ZPS segment.

columns.name: DocNum
columns.summary: FK to document.DocNum.  ZEF.2 - Embedded File.  Each result may have one or more ZEF segments for embedded files.The base-64 text version of the PDF is sent in ZEF.2.  If the file size exceeds 50k, then multiple segments will be sent with 50k blocksof the text.  When processing, we will concatenate all ZEF.2 fields, create the PDF document, store the file in the patient's image folder,and create an entry in the document table.  Then update this field with the pointer to the document table entry.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: NTE.3 at the OBX level.  The NTE segment is repeatable and the Comment Text component is limited to 78 characters.  Multiple NTE segments can be used for longer comments.  All NTE segments at the OBX level will be concatenated and stored in this one field.

name: medlabspecimen
summary: The EHRLabSpecimen table is structured to tightly with the HL7 standard and should have names that more reflect how the user willconsume the data and for that reason for actual implementation we are using these medlab tables.Medical lab specimen.  Contains data from the SPM segment.  Each MedLab object can have 0 to many specimen segments.Each segment will be its own row in this table.

columns.name: MedLabSpecimenNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: MedLabNum
columns.summary: FK to medlab.MedLabNum.  Each MedLab object can have 0 to many specimens pointing to it.

columns.name: SpecimenID
columns.summary: SPM.2 - Specimen ID.  Unique identifier for the specimen as referenced by the Placer application, the Filler application, or both. The value sent in this field should be the identification value sent on the specimen container.

columns.name: SpecimenDescript
columns.summary: SPM.14 - Specimen Description.  Additional information about the specimen.

columns.name: DateTimeCollected
columns.summary: SPM.17 - Specimen Collection Date/Time.  yyyyMMddHHmm format in the message, no seconds.  The date and time when the specimen wasacquired from the source.  This is a DR - Date/Time Range data type, so it may have more than one component if a specimen was collected overa period of time.  The first component is the start date/time so we will make sure to only store SPM.17.1 in this field.

name: mobileappdevice
summary: Stores information on mobile app devices. These are devices that utilize the Xamarin mobile application.

columns.name: MobileAppDeviceNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

columns.name: DeviceName
columns.summary: The name of the device.

columns.name: UniqueID
columns.summary: The unique identifier of the device. Platform specific.

columns.name: IsEclipboardEnabled
columns.summary: Indicates whether the device is allowed to operate the checkin app. For BYOD sessions will always be true because BYOD is authenticated by a unique URL link in a text message.

columns.name: EclipboardLastAttempt
columns.summary: The date and time of the last attempted login for Eclipboard.

columns.name: EclipboardLastLogin
columns.summary: The date and time of the last successful login for Eclipboard.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Indicates which patient is currently using the device. 0 indicates the device is not in use. -1 indicates that the device is in use but we do not yet know which patient is using the device.

columns.name: LastCheckInActivity
columns.summary: The date and time when we last updated the PatNum field for this device (indication the current use-state of the device).

columns.name: IsBYODDevice
columns.summary: Indicates whether a device is a BYOD device, defaults to false.

columns.name: DevicePage
columns.summary: Current page of the device.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. Indicates which user is currently logged into the device. 0 indicates this device is not logged into.

columns.name: IsODTouchEnabled
columns.summary: Indicates whether this device is being used for ODTouch or not.

columns.name: ODTouchLastLogin
columns.summary: The date and time of the last successful login for ODTouch.

columns.name: ODTouchLastAttempt
columns.summary: The date and time of the last attempted login for ODTouch.

name: mobilebrandingprofile
summary: Deprecated. Use Branding instead. Branding Profile for eClipboard customization. One (or none) to One relationship with clinics. Allows customers to customize the look of their eClipboard with a Clinic name and Logo.

columns.name: MobileBrandingProfileNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

columns.name: OfficeDescription
columns.summary: The Clinic Name that will be shown on eClipboard CheckIn

columns.name: LogoFilePath
columns.summary: eConnector will fetch this file. Same path for every computer, so maybe use a network shared file. Shows as 90x90 pixels.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: The time that this object was last modified or inserted. Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Used to determine if eClipboard needs to fetch an updated mobile branding profile.

name: mobiledatabyte
summary: Table used to send various types of objects as bytes to ODXam applications. Example is a PDF for TxPlan or PaymentPlan. Row gets added here, sent to mobile device, and then consumed. Old rows are ignored.

columns.name: MobileDataByteNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: RawBase64Data
columns.summary: The bytes in Base64.

columns.name: RawBase64Code
columns.summary: The unlock code in Base64. Blank if no unlock code required to retrieve.

columns.name: RawBase64Tag
columns.summary: Misc data in Base64

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: Can start out as 0.

columns.name: ActionType
columns.summary: Enum:eActionType Stores the intended action associated to this rows data.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: The DateTime this row was entered.

columns.name: DateTimeExpires
columns.summary: The DateTime that this row should be removed.

name: mobilenotification
summary: Mobile App devices periodically poll this table and retrieve any records that are relevant to the device itself, the user using the device, or the clinic the device belongs to. The mobile apps will then perform an action based on the mobile notification type.

columns.name: MobileNotificationNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: NotificationType
columns.summary: Enum:MobileNotificationType The type of notification. Example: TP. This will determine what actions the mobile app will perform upon retrieving this notification.

columns.name: DeviceId
columns.summary: The device id for the mobile notification. Example is random string of 10-12 characters. Only the device with this DeviceId will retrieve this record.

columns.name: PrimaryKeys
columns.summary: A comma-delimited list of primary keys associated with the mobile notification. See MobileNotificationType for what is included with each type. Can include MobileDataByteNums, TreatPlanNum, SheetNums, and others.

columns.name: Tags
columns.summary: A comma-delimited list of tags for this mobile notification. Can be anything. Different for each MobileNotificationType. See MobileNotificationType for what is included with each type.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: DateTime notification was entered into Db. Should not be edited.

columns.name: DateTimeExpires
columns.summary: DateTime notification expires and becomes invalid.

columns.name: AppTarget
columns.summary: Enum:EnumAppTarget Stores the mobile app that this notification is targeting. Prohibits a device running one app from consuming mobile notifications intended for a different app.

name: mount
summary: A mount shows in the images module just like other images in the tree.  But it is just a container for images within it rather than an actual image itself.  A mount layout cannot be edited once created for a patient (simply because we didn't add that functionality), but the individual images on it can be edited.

columns.name: MountNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

columns.name: DocCategory
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Categories for documents.

columns.name: DateCreated
columns.summary: The date/time at which the mount itself was created. Usually, all the images on the mount are the same date, but not always.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Used to provide a document description in the image module tree-view.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: To allow the user to enter specific information regarding the exam and tooth numbers, as well as points of interest in the xray images.

columns.name: Width
columns.summary: The width of the mount, in pixels.

columns.name: Height
columns.summary: The height of the mount, in pixels.

columns.name: ColorBack
columns.summary: Color of the mount background.  Typically white for photos and black for radiographs. Transparency not allowed.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum. Optional. Used for radiographs.

columns.name: ColorFore
columns.summary: Color of drawings and text.  Typically black for photos and white for radiographs.

columns.name: ColorTextBack
columns.summary: Color of drawing text background.  Typically white for photos and black for radiographs. Transparent is allowed.

columns.name: FlipOnAcquire
columns.summary: If true, each image will be flipped as it's acquired. Because ScanX images are backwards.

columns.name: AdjModeAfterSeries
columns.summary: If true, then it will switch to Adj mode instead of the usual Pan mode.

name: mountdef
summary: Template for each new mount.  But there is no linking of the mount back to this mountDef.  These can be freely deleted, renamed, moved, etc. without affecting any patient info.

columns.name: MountDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: The order that the mount defs will show in various lists.

columns.name: Width
columns.summary: The width of the mount, in pixels.

columns.name: Height
columns.summary: Height of the mount, in pixels.

columns.name: ColorBack
columns.summary: Color of the mount background.  Typically white for photos and black for radiographs.

columns.name: ColorFore
columns.summary: Color of drawings and text.  Typically black for photos and white for radiographs.

columns.name: ColorTextBack
columns.summary: Color of drawing text background.  Typically white for photos and black for radiographs. Transparent is allowed.

columns.name: ScaleValue
columns.summary: Scale, decimal places, and units, separated by spaces.  Example: "123.4 0 mm". The first two are required; units is optional.  When a mount is created, and if this isn't blank, then this is converted into an ImageDraw of type ScaleValue.

columns.name: DefaultCat
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. If set, a new mount will go into this category, regardless of which category is currently selected.

columns.name: FlipOnAcquire
columns.summary: If true, each image will be flipped as it's acquired. Because ScanX images are backwards.

columns.name: AdjModeAfterSeries
columns.summary: If true, then it will switch to Adj mode instead of the usual Pan mode.

name: mountitem
summary: These are always attached to a mount. Like a mount, they cannot be edited.  Documents are attached to each MountItem using Document.MountItemNum field.  Image will always be cropped to make it look smaller or bigger if it doesn't exactly match the mount item rectangle ratio.

columns.name: MountItemNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: MountNum
columns.summary: FK to mount.MountNum.

columns.name: Xpos
columns.summary: The x position, in pixels, of the item on the mount.

columns.name: Ypos
columns.summary: The y position, in pixels, of the item on the mount.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: The ordinal position of the item on the mount. 1-indexed because users see it.  Any item with an ItemOrder of 0 is text, which cannot accept an image or be clicked on. Any item with an ItemOrder of -1 is unmounted and will show in the umounted area instead of on the mount.

columns.name: Width
columns.summary: The width, in pixels, of the mount item rectangle.

columns.name: Height
columns.summary: The height, in pixels, of the mount item rectangle.

columns.name: ToothNumbers
columns.summary: An optional list of tooth numbers. In Db, rigorously formatted as American numbers, and separated by commas.  For display, uses hyphens for sequences.  Very likely supports international tooth numbers, but not tested for that.  These tooth numbers are initially copied here from the MountItemDef. They are then copied to the document (image) that gets put in this mount item.  So mountitem.ToothNumbers is not actually used to indicate the final tooth numbers.  use document.ToothNumbers instead.

columns.name: TextShowing
columns.summary: Instead of an image, a mount item can show text. In this case, ItemOrder=0. Text color and background will be the mount default.

columns.name: FontSize
columns.summary: This could vary significantly based on the size of the mount.  It's always relative to mount pixels.

name: mountitemdef
summary: These are always attached to mountdefs.  Can be deleted without any problems.

columns.name: MountItemDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: MountDefNum
columns.summary: FK to mountdef.MountDefNum.

columns.name: Xpos
columns.summary: The x position, in pixels, of the item on the mount.

columns.name: Ypos
columns.summary: The y position, in pixels, of the item on the mount.

columns.name: Width
columns.summary: Width, in pixels, of the item rectangle on the mount.  Any cropping, rotating, etc, will all be defined in the original image itself.

columns.name: Height
columns.summary: Height, in pixels, of the item rectangle on the mount.  Any cropping, rotating, etc, will all be defined in the original image itself.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: The ordinal position of the item on the mount. 1-indexed because users see it. 0 if TestShowing has a value.

columns.name: ToothNumbers
columns.summary: An optional list of tooth numbers. In Db, rigorously formatted as American numbers, and separated by commas.  For display, uses hyphens for sequences.  Very likely supports international tooth numbers, but not tested for that.

columns.name: TextShowing
columns.summary: Instead of an image, a mount item can show text. In this case, ItemOrder=0. Text color and background will be the mount default.

columns.name: FontSize
columns.summary: This could vary significantly based on the size of the mount.  It's always relative to mount pixels.

name: msgtopaysent
summary: AutoComm object for MsgToPay messages that have been queued or sent by the eConnector. The HQ version of this object is MsgToPayActive where a record is kept for ShortGuid/redirect purposes. Inherits IAutoCommApptGuid since they will all be attached to appointments.

columns.name: MsgToPaySentNum
columns.summary: PK.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum for the corresponding patient.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.ClinicNum for the corresponding patient.

columns.name: SendStatus
columns.summary: Indicates status of message.

columns.name: Source
columns.summary: Source of this object. Can be Manual (implemented) or EConnectorAutoComm (not yet implemented).

columns.name: MessageFk
columns.summary: FK to primary key of appropriate table.

columns.name: Subject
columns.summary: Subject of the message.

columns.name: Message
columns.summary: Content of the message.

columns.name: EmailType
columns.summary: Only used for manually sent emails.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: Generated by OD. Timestamp when row is created.

columns.name: DateTimeSent
columns.summary: DateTime the message was sent.

columns.name: ResponseDescript
columns.summary: Generated by OD in some cases and HQ in others. Any human readable error message generated by either HQ or EConnector. Used for debugging.

columns.name: ApptReminderRuleNum
columns.summary: FK to apptreminderrule.ApptReminderRuleNum. Allows us to look up the rules to determine how to send this apptcomm out.

columns.name: ShortGUID
columns.summary: Generated by HQ. Identifies this AutoCommGuid in future transactions between HQ and OD.

columns.name: ApptNum
columns.summary: FK to Appointment.AptNum

columns.name: StatementNum
columns.summary: FK to Statement.StatementNum

columns.name: OIDExternalNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: IDType
columns.summary: Enum:IdentifierType Internal data type to be associated with.

columns.name: IDInternal
columns.summary: This should be a Primary Key to a Table Type defined by the IDType field. Example: If IDType==Patient, then this field should be a PatNum that is a FK to Patient.Patnum

columns.name: IDExternal
columns.summary: The OID extension, when combined with rootExternal it uniquely identifies an object.

columns.name: rootExternal
columns.summary: The OID root, when combined with IDExternal it uniquely identifies an object.
