columns.name: OIDInternalNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: IDType
columns.summary: Enum:IdentifierType Internal data type to be associated with OIDRoot

columns.name: IDRoot
columns.summary: This is the root OID for this data type, when combined with extension, uniquely identifies a single object.

name: operatory
summary: Each row is a single operatory or column in the appts module.

columns.name: OperatoryNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: OpName
columns.summary: The full name to show in the column.

columns.name: Abbrev
columns.summary: 5 char or less. Not used much.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: The order that this op column will show.  Changing views only hides some ops; it does not change their order.  Zero based.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: Used instead of deleting to hide an op that is no longer used.

columns.name: ProvDentist
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  The dentist assigned to this op.  If more than one dentist might be assigned to an op, then create a second op and use one for each dentist. If 0, then no dentist is assigned.

columns.name: ProvHygienist
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  The hygienist assigned to this op.  If 0, then no hygienist is assigned.

columns.name: IsHygiene
columns.summary: Set true if this is a hygiene operatory.  The hygienist will then be considered the main provider for this op.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  0 if no clinic.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: Not user editable. The last time this row was edited.

columns.name: SetProspective
columns.summary: If true patients put into this operatory will have status set to prospective.

columns.name: IsWebSched
columns.summary: Operatories with IsWebSched set to true will be the ONLY operatories considered when searching for available time slots.

columns.name: IsNewPatAppt
columns.summary: Deprecated as of 18.1.  Entries within the deflink table indicate if this operatory is in fact available for WebSched New Pat Appt. Old summary: Operatories with IsNewPatAppt set to true will be the ONLY operatories considered when searching for available time slots. This is in regards to the New Patient Appointment portion of the Web Sched web application.

columns.name: OperatoryType
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. The type of the Operatory. This value is not normally used, but rather to just mark which type the Operatory is.

name: orthocase
summary: Holds financial and timing information for a single ortho case. For procs linked to Orthocases, estimates are calculated based off of orthocase info, not insurance info. The orthocase numbers are automatically placed into InsPayEst and InsEstTotalOverride in Procedures.ComputeEstimates(), taking control from insurance. Procedure fees are calculated based on orthocase info, not fee schedules. All overrides (fees and insurance) are performed when the procedure is set complete.

columns.name: OrthoCaseNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  The patient on this ortho case.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

columns.name: Fee
columns.summary: Total amount of procedure fees. Is editable by user.

columns.name: FeeInsPrimary
columns.summary: The amount that primary insurance will cover for the entire ortho case.

columns.name: FeePat
columns.summary: Calculated from Fee - FeeIns.

columns.name: BandingDate
columns.summary: Date of Banding.

columns.name: DebondDate
columns.summary: Date of Debond.

columns.name: DebondDateExpected
columns.summary: Date of expected Debond.

columns.name: IsTransfer
columns.summary: Used to denote that the banding date is used as the transfer date instead.

columns.name: OrthoType
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: DateTime ortho case was added. Not editable by user.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.usernum. The usernum that added the OrthoCase.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Timestamp of the last modification to the ortho case. Not editable by user.

columns.name: IsActive
columns.summary: Determines whether or not this is an active ortho case

columns.name: FeeInsSecondary
columns.summary: The amount that secondary insurance will cover for the entire ortho case. Will be set to zero if patient doesn't have secondary insurance

name: orthochart
summary: For the orthochart feature, each row in this table is one cell in that grid.  An empty cell often corresponds to a missing db table row.

columns.name: OrthoChartNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: DateService
columns.summary: Deprecated, use orthochartrow table instead.  Date of service.

columns.name: FieldName
columns.summary: Keyed to displayfield.Description.

columns.name: FieldValue
columns.summary: Stores the text that the user entered or picked.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: Deprecated, use orthochartrow table instead. FK to userod.UserNum.  The user that created or last edited an ortho chart field.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: Deprecated, use orthochartrow table instead. FK to provider.ProvNum.  Can be 0.

columns.name: OrthoChartRowNum
columns.summary: FK to orthochartrow.OrthoChartRowNum.

name: orthochartlog
summary: This stores log entries for debugging the orthochart.  Logging gets turned on and off with the pref. This table will go away once the bug is found.

columns.name: OrthoChartLogNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: DateTimeLog
columns.summary: DateTime that this log entry was made

columns.name: DateTimeService
columns.summary: DateTime of the chart row.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  The user that created or last edited an ortho chart field.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: OrthoChartRowNum
columns.summary: FK to orthochartrow.OrthoChartRowNum.

columns.name: LogData
columns.summary: This can be long and complex -- whatever you want. MediumText, so max length=16M.

name: orthochartrow
summary: Represent a row in the ortho chart UI grid.

columns.name: OrthoChartRowNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: DateTimeService
columns.summary: DateTime of service.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  The user that created or last edited an ortho chart field.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: Signature
columns.summary: Examples: "0:ritwq/wV8vlrgUYahhK+RH5UeBFA6W4jCkZdo0cDWd63aZb1S/W3Z4eW5LmchqfgniG23" and "1:52222559445999975122111500485555". The 1st character is whether or not the signature is Topaz. The 2nd character is a separator. The rest of the string is the hashed signature data. Raw signature data is the concatenation of the FieldName and FieldValue of all cells (orthocharts), ordered by FieldName.

name: orthocharttab
summary: Links one orthocharttab to one displayfield.  Allows for displayfields to be part of multiple orthocharttabs.

columns.name: OrthoChartTabNum
columns.summary: FK to orthocharttab.OrthoChartTabNum.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Overrides the displayfield ItemOrder, so that each display field can have a different order in each ortho chart tab.

name: orthocharttablink
summary: Links one orthocharttab to one displayfield.  Allows for displayfields to be part of multiple orthocharttabs.

columns.name: OrthoChartTabLinkNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Overrides the displayfield ItemOrder, so that each display field can have a different order in each ortho chart tab.

columns.name: OrthoChartTabNum
columns.summary: FK to orthocharttab.OrthoChartTabNum.

columns.name: DisplayFieldNum
columns.summary: FK to displayfield.DisplayFieldNum.

columns.name: ColumnWidthOverride
columns.summary: Overrides the DisplayField.ColumnWidth for OrthChartTabLinks when not 0. Otherwise uses associated DisplayFieldFieldNums DisplayField.ColumnWidth value.

name: orthohardware
summary: Represents one bracket, wire, or elastic.

columns.name: OrthoHardwareNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: DateExam
columns.summary: Every hardware entry is tied to a single date. At each exam, a copy can be made of the hardware from the previous exam, and then it can be edited. It normally shows the most recent exam, and the hardware items showing in the ortho grid only include the most recent exam. Not sure yet how we will show hardware for previous exams/dates.

columns.name: OrthoHardwareType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumOrthoHardwareType Bracket, Wire, or Elastic.

columns.name: OrthoHardwareSpecNum
columns.summary: FK to orthohardwarespec.OrthoHardwareSpecNum. This is where the description and color come from.

columns.name: ToothRange
columns.summary: Tooth numbers stored here are always stored in Universal (1-32) notation. They are displayed to the user as Palmer notation. For brackets, always use single tooth numbers, like 8. For wires, must use a range like 2-15. For elastics, typically use 2 teeth separated with commas, but more are allowed.

name: orthohardwarespec
summary: Specification for ortho hardware. Linked to one type such as bracket, wire, or elastic. This is a pick list of description and color for the user. These remain linked to patient data, so changes here will affect historical chart entries.

columns.name: OrthoHardwareSpecNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: OrthoHardwareType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumOrthoHardwareType Bracket, Wire, or Elastic.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Example NITI 16x25

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: 0 indexed. User controls it with arrows.

name: orthoplanlink
summary: Used to attach payment plans and ortho schedules to an Ortho Case.

columns.name: OrthoPlanLinkNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: OrthoCaseNum
columns.summary: FK to orthocase.OrthoCaseNum.

columns.name: LinkType
columns.summary: Enum:OrthoPlanLinkType  Holds the type of object that is being linked.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: Holds the FKey of the object from the LinkType.

columns.name: IsActive
columns.summary: Denotes if plan link is active or not.

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: DateTime. Date plan link was added. Not editable by user.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UseNum. User that added the plan link.

name: orthoproclink
summary: Used to attach procedures to an OrthoCase. Multiple procs are typically attached to one OrthoCase.

columns.name: OrthoProcLinkNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: OrthoCaseNum
columns.summary: FK to orthocase.OrthoCaseNum.

columns.name: ProcNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: DateTime proclink was added. Not editable by user.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. User that added the proc link.

columns.name: ProcLinkType
columns.summary: Enum:OrthoProcType Indicates what type of procedure is being associated to Ortho Case in link.

name: orthorx
summary: A group of ortho hardware that allows for faster entry than one tooth at a time. Changes to this table do not affect any patient records.

columns.name: OrthoRxNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: OrthoHardwareSpecNum
columns.summary: FK to orthohardwarespec.OrthoHardwareSpecNum. Description comes from here.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: The description used for picking the prescription from a list.

columns.name: ToothRange
columns.summary: Tooth numbers stored here are always stored in Universal (1-32) notation. They are displayed to the user as Palmer notation. For brackets and elastics, always use tooth numbers separated by commas, like 2,3,4,5,6. For wires, must use a range like 2-15.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: 0 indexed. User controls it with arrows.

name: orthoschedule
summary: Optional. Holds the Production Schedule for an OrthoCase.

columns.name: OrthoScheduleNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: BandingDateOverride
columns.summary: Override for banding date.

columns.name: DebondDateOverride
columns.summary: Override for debond date.

columns.name: BandingAmount
columns.summary: Amount to charge for banding procedure.

columns.name: VisitAmount
columns.summary: Used every visit until the total off all visits+BandingAmount+DebondAmount=Fee of linked OrthoCase.

columns.name: DebondAmount
columns.summary: Amount to charge for debond procedure.

columns.name: IsActive
columns.summary: Is true if the ortho schedule is active.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: DateTime the ortho schedule was last modified. Not editable by user.

name: patfield
summary: These are custom fields added and managed by the user. Each row here is a field value for one patient.

columns.name: PatFieldNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

columns.name: FieldName
columns.summary: FK to patfielddef.FieldName.  The full name is shown here for ease of use when running queries.  But the user is only allowed to change fieldNames in the patFieldDef setup window.

columns.name: FieldValue
columns.summary: Any text that the user types in.  For picklists, this will contain the picked text.  For dates, this is stored as the user typed it, after validating that it could be parsed.  So queries that involve dates won't work very well.  If we want better handling of date fields, we should add a column to this table.  Checkbox will either have a value of 1, or else the row will be deleted from the db.  Currency is handled in a culture neutral way, just like other currency in the db.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

name: patfielddef
summary: These are the definitions for the custom patient fields added and managed by the user.

columns.name: PatFieldDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: FieldName
columns.summary: This is treated as the key. The name of the field that the user will be allowed to fill in the patient info window.

columns.name: FieldType
columns.summary: Enum:PatFieldType Text=0,PickList=1,Date=2,Checkbox=3,Currency=4

columns.name: PickList
columns.summary: Deprecated. Use patfieldpickitem.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: Hides this PatField for any patient where it's currently blank. If already in use by a patient, then it still shows.

name: patfieldpickitem
summary: Each row is an item in a PatFieldDef picklist. Not used unless the PatFieldDef is a Picklist type. These objects are created and managed by user.

columns.name: PatFieldPickItemNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatFieldDefNum
columns.summary: FK to patfielddef.PatFieldDefNum

columns.name: Name
columns.summary: Full text of PickList item.

columns.name: Abbreviation
columns.summary: Abbr to show when PickList item is displayed in cramped spaces like columns. Only implemented in Superfamily grid so far.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: False for normal PickList items. Even if true/hidden, this item will still show in all the various windows where patient fields show. A hidden item will not normally show when picking from list for a patient unless the patient has already been assigned this item.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: 0-based.

name: patient
summary: One row for each patient.  Includes deleted patients.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: LName
columns.summary: Last name.

columns.name: FName
columns.summary: First name.

columns.name: MiddleI
columns.summary: Middle initial or name.

columns.name: Preferred
columns.summary: Preferred name, aka nickname.

columns.name: PatStatus
columns.summary: Enum:PatientStatus

columns.name: Gender
columns.summary: Enum:PatientGender

columns.name: Position
columns.summary: Enum:PatientPosition Marital status would probably be a better name for this column.

columns.name: Birthdate
columns.summary: Age is not stored in the database.  Age is always calculated as needed from birthdate.

columns.name: SSN
columns.summary: In the US, this is 9 digits, no dashes. For all other countries, any punctuation or format is allowed.

columns.name: Address2
columns.summary: Optional second address line.

columns.name: State
columns.summary: 2 Char in USA.  Used to store province for Canadian users.

columns.name: Zip
columns.summary: Postal code.  For Canadian claims, it must be ANANAN.  No validation gets done except there.

columns.name: HmPhone
columns.summary: Home phone. Includes any punctuation

columns.name: Guarantor
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  Head of household.

columns.name: CreditType
columns.summary: Single char. Shows at upper right corner of appointments.  Suggested use is A,B,or C to designate creditworthiness,  but it can actually be used for any purpose.

columns.name: Salutation
columns.summary: Dear __.  This field does not include the "Dear" or a trailing comma.  If this field is blank, then the typical salutation is FName.  Or, if a Preferred name is present, that is used instead of FName.

columns.name: EstBalance
columns.summary: Current patient balance.(not family). Never subtracts insurance estimates.

columns.name: PriProv
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  The patient's primary provider.  Required.  The database maintenance tool ensures that every patient  always has this number set, so the program no longer has to handle 0.

columns.name: SecProv
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  Secondary provider (hygienist). Optional.

columns.name: FeeSched
columns.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum.  Fee schedule for this patient.  Usually not used.  If missing, the practice default fee schedule is used. If patient has insurance, then the fee schedule for the insplan is used.

columns.name: BillingType
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.  Must have a value, or the patient will not show on some reports.

columns.name: ImageFolder
columns.summary: Name of folder where images will be stored. Not editable for now.

columns.name: AddrNote
columns.summary: Address or phone note.  Unlimited length in order to handle data from other programs during a conversion.

columns.name: FamFinUrgNote
columns.summary: Family financial urgent note.  Only stored with guarantor, and shared for family.

columns.name: MedUrgNote
columns.summary: Individual patient note for Urgent medical.

columns.name: ApptModNote
columns.summary: Individual patient note for Appointment module note.

columns.name: StudentStatus
columns.summary: Single char.  Nonstudent='N' or blank, Parttime='P', Fulltime='F'.

columns.name: SchoolName
columns.summary: College name.  If Canadian, then this is field C10 and must be filled if C9 (patient.CanadianEligibilityCode) is 1 and patient  is 18 or older.

columns.name: ChartNumber
columns.summary: Usually blank. Alternative and supplement to PatNum. Can take alphanumeric. Usually set during conversion or when bridging to imaging software. Historically, it typically showed as a sticker on the outside of a paper chart.  Max length 100 to support larger ids for bridging to imaging softwares.

columns.name: MedicaidID
columns.summary: Optional. The Medicaid ID for this patient.

columns.name: Bal_0_30
columns.summary: Aged balance from 0 to 30 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family.  Only stored with guarantor.

columns.name: Bal_31_60
columns.summary: Aged balance from 31 to 60 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family.  Only stored with guarantor.

columns.name: Bal_61_90
columns.summary: Aged balance from 61 to 90 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family.  Only stored with guarantor.

columns.name: BalOver90
columns.summary: Aged balance over 90 days old. Aging numbers are for entire family.  Only stored with guarantor.

columns.name: InsEst
columns.summary: Insurance Estimate for entire family. Only stored with guarantor.

columns.name: BalTotal
columns.summary: Total balance for entire family before insurance estimate.  Not the same as the sum of the 4 aging balances because this can be negative.  Only stored with guarantor.

columns.name: EmployerNum
columns.summary: FK to employer.EmployerNum.

columns.name: EmploymentNote
columns.summary: Not used since version 2.8.

columns.name: County
columns.summary: FK to county.CountyName, although it will not crash if key absent.

columns.name: GradeLevel
columns.summary: Enum:PatientGrade Gradelevel.

columns.name: Urgency
columns.summary: Enum:TreatmentUrgency Used in public health screenings.

columns.name: DateFirstVisit
columns.summary: The date that the patient first visited the office.  Automated.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Can be zero if not attached to a clinic or no clinics set up.

columns.name: HasIns
columns.summary: For now, an 'I' indicates that the patient has insurance.  This is only used when displaying appointments. It will later be expanded.  User can't edit.

columns.name: TrophyFolder
columns.summary: The Trophy bridge is inadequate, this attempts to make it usable for offices that have invested in Trophy hardware.

columns.name: PlannedIsDone
columns.summary: This simply indicates whether the 'done' box is checked in the chart module.  Used to be handled as a -1 in the NextAptNum field, but now that field is unsigned.

columns.name: Premed
columns.summary: Set to true if patient needs to be premedicated for appointments, includes PAC, halcion, etc.

columns.name: Ward
columns.summary: Only used in hospitals.

columns.name: PreferConfirmMethod
columns.summary: Enum:ContactMethod Used for eCR, which includes eReminders eConfirmations.

columns.name: PreferContactMethod
columns.summary: Enum:ContactMethod

columns.name: PreferRecallMethod
columns.summary: Enum:ContactMethod

columns.name: SchedDayOfWeek
columns.summary: We do not use this, but some users do, so here it is. 0=none. Otherwise, 1-7 for day.

columns.name: Language
columns.summary: The primary language of the patient.  Typically eng (English), fra (French), spa (Spanish), or similar.  If it's a custom language, then it might look like Tahitian. If none, then empty string.

columns.name: AdmitDate
columns.summary: Used in hospitals.  It can be before the first visit date.  It typically gets set automatically by the hospital system.

columns.name: Title
columns.summary: Includes any punctuation.  For example, Mr., Mrs., Miss, Dr., etc.  There is no selection mechanism yet for user; they must simply type it in.

columns.name: PayPlanDue
columns.summary: Amount "due now" for all payment plans such that someone in this family is the payment plan guarantor. This is the total of all payment plan charges past due (taking into account the PayPlansBillInAdvanceDays setting) subtract the amount already paid for the payment plans.  Only stored with family guarantor.

columns.name: SiteNum
columns.summary: FK to site.SiteNum. Can be zero. Replaces the old GradeSchool field with a proper foreign key.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable.

columns.name: ResponsParty
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Can be zero.  Person responsible for medical decisions rather than finances.  Guarantor is still responsible  for finances.  This is useful for nursing home residents.  Part of public health.

columns.name: CanadianEligibilityCode
columns.summary: C09.  Eligibility Exception Code.  A number between 1-4.  0 is not acceptable for e-claims. 1=FT student, 2=disabled, 3=disabled student, 4=code not applicable.  Warning.  4 is a 0 if using CDAnet version 02. This column should have been created as an int.

columns.name: AskToArriveEarly
columns.summary: Number of minutes patient is asked to come early to appointments.

columns.name: PreferContactConfidential
columns.summary: Enum:ContactMethod  Used for EHR.

columns.name: SuperFamily
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  If this is the same as PatNum, then this is a SuperHead.  If zero, then not part of a superfamily. Synched for entire family.  If family is part of a superfamily, then the guarantor for this family will show in the superfamily list in the Family module for anyone else who is in the superfamily.  Only a guarantor can be a superfamily head.

columns.name: TxtMsgOk
columns.summary: Enum:YN

columns.name: SmokingSnoMed
columns.summary: EHR smoking status as a SNOMED code.  Will always be the most recent smoking status for the patient.

columns.name: Country
columns.summary: Country name.  Only used by HQ to add country names to statements.

columns.name: DateTimeDeceased
columns.summary: Needed for EHR syndromic surveillance messaging.  Used in HL7 PID-29.  Also for feature request #3040.  Date and time because we need precision to the minute in syndromic surveillence messging.

columns.name: BillingCycleDay
columns.summary: A number between 1 and 31 that is the day of month that repeat charges should be applied to this account. Previously this was determined by the start date of the repeate charges.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateEntry
columns.summary: Date automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  Date when patient was inserted.

columns.name: HasSuperBilling
columns.summary: 0 by default.  If true, this guarantor should be included in superbilling statements.

columns.name: PatNumCloneFrom
columns.summary: Deprecated, use patientlink table instead. Indicates if this patient should act as a clone of another patient. Previously, ortho cloned patients were signified by capitalizing the name fields of the newly cloned patient. This field will allow for an explicit flag to be set to indicate cloned status.

columns.name: DiscountPlanNum
columns.summary: Deprecated, use discountplansub table instead. FK to discountplan.DiscountPlanNum. Will be 0 if there is no DiscountPlan.

columns.name: HasSignedTil
columns.summary: Signed Truth in Lending, relates to client permission to be charged interest on a payment plan.

columns.name: ShortCodeOptIn
columns.summary: Indicates if the patient has opted in, out, or not yet to using Short Codes for Appointment Texts.

columns.name: SecurityHash
columns.summary: Holds the salted hash of the PatNum. This prevents 3rd parties from inserting patients without our Db Integrity system noticing.

name: patientlink
summary: Keeps track of patients who have been merged or cloned.

columns.name: PatientLinkNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNumFrom
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient that is linked from. For a Merge type, this is that patient that was merged from. For a Clone type, this is the original or master patient.

columns.name: PatNumTo
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum, unless LinkType=PaySimple. The patient that is linked to.For a Merge type, this is that patient that was merged into.For a Clone type, this represents the clone that was made from the PatNumFrom patient.

columns.name: LinkType
columns.summary: Enum:PatientLinkType The type of link.

columns.name: DateTimeLink
columns.summary: The time the link was created.

name: patientnote
summary: Essentially more columns in the patient table.  They are stored here because these fields can contain a lot of information, and we want to try to keep the size of the patient table a bit smaller.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  Also the primary key for this table. Always one to one relationship with patient table.  A new patient might not have an entry here until needed.

columns.name: FamFinancial
columns.summary: Only one note per family stored with guarantor.

columns.name: ApptPhone
columns.summary: No longer used.

columns.name: Medical
columns.summary: Medical Summary

columns.name: Service
columns.summary: Service notes. Shows in Medical information window and in the Pt Info section of the Chart module.

columns.name: MedicalComp
columns.summary: Complete current Medical History

columns.name: Treatment
columns.summary: Shows in the Chart module normally just below the graphical tooth chart. Also known as Odontogram Notes.

columns.name: ICEName
columns.summary: In Case of Emergency Name.

columns.name: ICEPhone
columns.summary: In Case of Emergency Phone.

columns.name: OrthoMonthsTreatOverride
columns.summary: -1 by default. Overrides the default number of months for an ortho treatment for this patient. Gets automatically set to the current value found in the pref OrthoDefaultMonthsTreat when the first placement procedure has been completed and this value is -1. This column is an integer instead of a byte because it needs to store -1 so that users can override with the value of 0. When set to -1 the default practice value for the pref OrthoDefaultMonthsTreat is used.

columns.name: DateOrthoPlacementOverride
columns.summary: Overrides the date of the first ortho procedure for this patient to use for ortho case patients. If MinDate, then the date is derived by looking at the first ortho procedure for this patient.

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed.

columns.name: Consent
columns.summary: Enum:PatConsentFlags None=0,ShareMedicationHistoryErx=1, Indicates if the patient consents for DoseSpot to access their medication history, bitwise.

columns.name: UserNumOrthoLocked
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. A real-time flag of which user is currently editing the Orth Chart.  Prevents concurrency issues. 0 indicates unlocked. -5 indicates that an instance of OD changed users locally in order to sign an Ortho Chart row. -1 indicates another user with the same username took control.

columns.name: Pronoun
columns.summary: Enum: PronounPreferred Patient Pronoun override. None indicates no override.

columns.name: PatientPortalInviteNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum for the corresponding patient.

columns.name: ApptNum
columns.summary: Foreign key to the appointment represented by this AutoCommAppt.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum for the corresponding appointment.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: Generated by OD. Timestamp when row is created.

columns.name: TSPrior
columns.summary: This was the TSPrior used to send this reminder.

columns.name: SendStatus
columns.summary: Indicates status of message.

columns.name: MessageFk
columns.summary: FK to primary key of appropriate table.

columns.name: ResponseDescript
columns.summary: Generated by OD in some cases and HQ in others. Any human readable error message generated by either HQ or EConnector. Used for debugging.

columns.name: DateTimeSent
columns.summary: DateTime the message was sent.

columns.name: ApptReminderRuleNum
columns.summary: FK to apptreminderrule.ApptReminderRuleNum. Allows us to look up the rules to determine how to send this apptcomm out.

columns.name: ApptDateTime
columns.summary: The Date and time of the original appointment. We need this in case the appointment was moved and needs another reminder sent out.

name: patientrace
summary: Each patient may have multiple races.  Used to represent a race or an ethnicity for a patient.

columns.name: PatientRaceNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: Race
columns.summary: Enum:PatRace Deprecated. CdcrecCode should be used exclusively.

columns.name: CdcrecCode
columns.summary: FK to cdcrec.CdcrecCode. Example 2054-5. The value 'Declined to Specify' is stored as ASKU-ETHNICITY for ethnicity and ASKU-RACE as race.

name: patplan
summary: Each row represents the linking of one insplan to one patient for current coverage.  Dropping a plan will delete the entry in this table.  Deleting a patplan will delete the actual insplan (if no dependencies).

columns.name: PatPlanNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to  patient.PatNum.  The patient who currently has the insurance.  Not the same as the subscriber.

columns.name: Ordinal
columns.summary: Number like 1, 2, 3, etc.  Represents primary ins, secondary ins, tertiary ins, etc. 0 is not used

columns.name: IsPending
columns.summary: For informational purposes only. You have to enter the plan in order to check this box. Not related at all to the InsPending table.

columns.name: Relationship
columns.summary: Enum:Relat Remember that this may need to be changed in the Claim also, if already created.

columns.name: PatID
columns.summary: An optional patient ID which will override the insplan.SubscriberID on eclaims.  For Canada, this holds the Dependent Code, C17 and E17, and in that use it doesn't override subscriber id, but instead supplements it.

columns.name: InsSubNum
columns.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum.  Gives info about the subscriber.

columns.name: OrthoAutoFeeBilledOverride
columns.summary: Only for Ortho practices. The fee that will be charged out by the auto procedureto insurance each period. Overrides insplan.OrthoAutoFeeBilled. -1 to use insplan default. Instantiated to -1 in the program so that it defaults to the insplan default.

columns.name: OrthoAutoNextClaimDate
columns.summary: Only for Ortho practices. The date before which the next automatic ortho procedure/claim cannot be automatically generated. If blank, this patient's ortho treatment has been stopped.

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

name: patrestriction
summary: Currently only used to block scheduling of specific patients.

columns.name: PatRestrictionNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: PatRestrictType
columns.summary: Enum:PatRestrict

name: payconnectresponseweb
summary: This table will never delete records, only upsert.  PayConnectResponseWeb rows are records of all payments made from the Patient Portal via either PayConnect's Web Portal, or PayConnect's Merchant Services WebService if using a credit card token as a result of PayConnect's Web Portal.

columns.name: PayConnectResponseWebNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: PayNum
columns.summary: FK to payment.PayNum.

columns.name: AccountToken
columns.summary: The account token used to poll the processing status.

columns.name: PaymentToken
columns.summary: The payment token used for future payments.

columns.name: ProcessingStatus
columns.summary: Enum:PayConnectWebStatus Used to determine if the payment is pending, needs action, or is completed and attached to a payment.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual datetime of entry.

columns.name: DateTimePending
columns.summary: DateTime that the payment went to the pending status.

columns.name: DateTimeCompleted
columns.summary: DateTime that the payment went to the completed status and is attached to a payment.

columns.name: DateTimeExpired
columns.summary: DateTime that the payment opportunity time expired.

columns.name: DateTimeLastError
columns.summary: DateTime of the last time that the payment had an error.

columns.name: LastResponseStr
columns.summary: Raw JSON response (or error) from PayConnect.

columns.name: CCSource
columns.summary: Enum:CreditCardSource .

columns.name: Amount
columns.summary: The amount of the payment that is attempting to be made.

columns.name: PayNote
columns.summary: The note entered when making a payment.

columns.name: IsTokenSaved
columns.summary: Whether or not the credit card token can be saved for future uses.

columns.name: PayToken
columns.summary: The payment token used to poll the processing status.

columns.name: ExpDateToken
columns.summary: Provides the Expiration Date of the account being accessed. Format is yyMM from XWeb gateway. Will be converted to ExpirationDate.

columns.name: RefNumber
columns.summary: The RefNumber associated to this transaction.  Will only be set for Completed PayConnectWebStatuses.

columns.name: TransType
columns.summary: The Transaction Type associated to this transaction.  Will only be set for Completed PayConnectWebStatuses.

columns.name: EmailResponse
columns.summary: Email address used for a requested receipt provided by the user when making a payment via the patient portal.

columns.name: LogGuid
columns.summary: The GUID used in EserviceLogs related to this response. May be blank.

name: payment
summary: A patient payment.  Always has at least one split.

columns.name: PayNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PayType
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.  This will be 0 if this is an income transfer to another provider. Examples: Cash, Check, CC, Refund.

columns.name: PayDate
columns.summary: The date that the payment displays on the patient account.

columns.name: PayAmt
columns.summary: Amount of the payment.  Must equal the sum of the splits.

columns.name: CheckNum
columns.summary: Check number is optional.

columns.name: BankBranch
columns.summary: Bank-branch code for checks. Example 19-7076.

columns.name: PayNote
columns.summary: Any admin note.  Not for patient to see.  Length 4000.

columns.name: IsSplit
columns.summary: No longer used.  Set to true to indicate that a payment has more than one paysplit.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  The patient where the payment entry will show.  But only the splits affect account balances.  This has a value even if the 'payment' is actually an income transfer to another provider.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  Can be 0 to indicate no clinic (unassigned). Copied from patient.ClinicNum when creating payment, but user can override.  Not used in provider income transfers.  Cannot be used in financial reporting when grouping by clinic, because payments may be split between clinics.

columns.name: DateEntry
columns.summary: The date that this payment was entered.  Not user editable.

columns.name: DepositNum
columns.summary: FK to deposit.DepositNum.  0 if not attached to any deposits.  Cash does not usually get attached to a deposit; only checks.

columns.name: Receipt
columns.summary: Text of printed receipt if the payment was done electronically. Allows reprinting if needed.

columns.name: IsRecurringCC
columns.summary: True if this was an automatically added recurring CC charge rather then one entered by the user.  This was set to true for all historical entries before version 11.1, but will be accurate after that.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

columns.name: PaymentSource
columns.summary: Enum:CreditCardSource Indicates the origin of the payment if the payment came from a credit card or from an external API. Will be 'None' if this payment did not use a credit card or API

columns.name: ProcessStatus
columns.summary: Enum:ProcessStat Flags whether a payment came from online and needs to be processed.

columns.name: RecurringChargeDate
columns.summary: The date of the recurring charge that this payment applies to.

columns.name: ExternalId
columns.summary: External Id

columns.name: PaymentStatus
columns.summary: Enum:PaymentStatus

columns.name: IsCcCompleted
columns.summary: A credit card transaction has been completed. This disables the CC buttons at the top of payment edit window to prevent duplicates.

columns.name: MerchantFee
columns.summary: Stores any additional fees charged to the customer during a transaction. For display purposes only.

name: payortype
summary: Used to identify the source of payment for a given patient at a given point in time.  As insurance is added and removed, rows should be either automatically inserted into this table, or the user should be prompted to specify what the new payor type is.  The DateStart of one payor type is interpreted as the end date of the previous payor type.  Example: Patient with no insurance may have payortype.SopCode=81 ("SelfPay").  Patient then adds Medicaid insurance and gets a second new PayorType entry with SopCode=2 (Medicaid).

columns.name: PayorTypeNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: DateStart
columns.summary: Date of the beginning of new payor type.  End date is the DateStart of the next payor type entry.

columns.name: SopCode
columns.summary: FK to sop.SopCode. Examples: 121, 3115, etc.

name: payperiod
summary: Used to view employee timecards.  Timecard entries are not linked to a pay period.  Instead, payperiods are set up, and the user can only view specific pay periods.  So it feels like they are linked, but it's date based.

columns.name: PayPeriodNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: DateStart
columns.summary: The first day of the payperiod

columns.name: DateStop
columns.summary: The last day of the payperiod.  Inclusive, ignoring time of day.

columns.name: DatePaycheck
columns.summary: The date that paychecks will be dated.  A few days after the dateStop.  Optional.

name: payplan
summary: Each row represents one signed agreement to make payments.

columns.name: PayPlanNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  The patient who had the treatment done.

columns.name: Guarantor
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  The person responsible for the payments.  Does not need to be in the same family as the patient. Not necessarily the same as the guarantor on the PayPlanCharge.

columns.name: PayPlanDate
columns.summary: Date that the payment plan will display in the account.

columns.name: APR
columns.summary: Annual percentage rate.  eg 18.  This does not take into consideration any late payments, but only the percentage used to calculate the amortization schedule.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Generally used to archive the terms when the amortization schedule is created.

columns.name: PlanNum
columns.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum.  Will be 0 if standard payment plan.  But if this is being used to track expected insurance payments, then this will be the foreign key to insplan.PlanNum, and Guarantor will be 0.

columns.name: CompletedAmt
columns.summary: The amount of the treatment that has already been completed.  This should match the sum of the principal amounts for most situations.  But if the procedures have not yet been completed, and the payment plan is to make any sense, then this number must be changed.

columns.name: InsSubNum
columns.summary: FK to inssub.InsSubNum.  Will be 0 if standard payment plan.  But if this is being used to track expected insurance payments, then this will be the foreign key to inssub.InsSubNum, and Guarantor will be 0.

columns.name: PaySchedule
columns.summary: Enum:PaymentSchedule How often payments are scheduled to be made. This was used to make charges for amortization schedules of patient payment plans before dynamic payment plans were created. It is conceptually the same as ChargeFrequency and provides the same options. This is still set in various places, but only ChargeFrequency is used in algorithms for creating charges. This is now only used for insurance and old patient payment plans.

columns.name: NumberOfPayments
columns.summary: The number of payments that will be made to complete the payment plan.

columns.name: PayAmt
columns.summary: Payment amount due per payment plan charge.

columns.name: DownPayment
columns.summary: The amount paid toward the payment plan when it was first opened.

columns.name: IsClosed
columns.summary: True if this payment plan is closed.  Closed should not be edited.

columns.name: Signature
columns.summary: The encrypted and bound signature in base64 format.  The signature is bound to the concatenation of the Total Amount,APR,Number of Payments,Payment Amount

columns.name: SigIsTopaz
columns.summary: True if the signature is in Topaz format rather than OD format.

columns.name: PlanCategory
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum

columns.name: IsDynamic
columns.summary: True if this payment plan is a dynamic payment plan, false if it is static.

columns.name: ChargeFrequency
columns.summary: Enum:PayPlanFrequency How often charges are created for the payment plan. This column was added when dynamic payment plans were created. Why this was added is uncertain because it is conceptually the same as PaySchedule and provides the same options. PaySchedule is still set in various places, but only ChargeFrequency is used in algorithms for creating charges. This is only used for dynamic payment plans.

columns.name: DatePayPlanStart
columns.summary: The date of the first payment plan charge. Does not include downpayment.

columns.name: IsLocked
columns.summary: True if the payment plan is locked. This is "Locked", not just disabling the terms. Locked payment plans cannot add production or modify terms. The checkbox 'Locked' can't be unchecked unless the user has the PayPlanUnlock permission. If the preference PayPlanRequireLockForAPR is enabled, 'Locked' must be checked before saving a plan with APR.

columns.name: DateInterestStart
columns.summary: The date on which the pay plan can begin posting interest charges.

columns.name: DynamicPayPlanTPOption
columns.summary: Enum:DynamicPayPlanTPOptions Indicates the selected mode for how treatment planned procedures are handled by a dynamic payment plan.

columns.name: MobileAppDeviceNum
columns.summary: A FK to the mobile app device that the PayPlan is currently on.

columns.name: SecurityHash
columns.summary: Holds the salted hash of the following paysplit fields: Guarantor, PayAmt, IsClosed, IsLocked.

columns.name: SheetDefNum
columns.summary: FK to sheetdef.SheetDefNum. This is use when printing. Can only be payment plan type sheet. If 0, uses hard coded logic.

name: payplancharge
summary: One of the dated charges attached to a payment plan.  This has nothing to do with payments, but rather just causes the amount due to increase on the date of the charge.  The amount of the charge is the sum of the principal and the interest.

columns.name: PayPlanChargeNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PayPlanNum
columns.summary: FK to payplan.PayPlanNum.

columns.name: Guarantor
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  The guarantor account that each charge will affect.  Does not have to match the guarantor of the payment plan. This column doesn't even have to point to a guarantor at all. E.g. Credits and Closeout debits will be linked to the patient, not guarantor.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  The patient account that the principal gets removed from.

columns.name: ChargeDate
columns.summary: The date that the charge will show on the patient account.  Any charge with a future date will not show on the account yet and will not affect the balance.

columns.name: Principal
columns.summary: For Debits, this is the principal charge amount.  For Credits (version 2 only), then this is the credit amount.

columns.name: Interest
columns.summary: For Debits, this is the interest portion of this payment.  Always 0 for Credits.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Any note about this particular payment plan charge

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  Since there is no ProvNum field at the payplan level, the provider must be the same for all payplancharges. It's initially assigned as the patient priProv.  Payments applied should be to this provnum, although the current user interface does not help with this.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  Since there is no ClincNum field at the payplan level, the clinic must be the same for all payplancharges.  It's initially assigned using the patient clinic.  Payments applied should be to this clinic, although the current user interface does not help with this.

columns.name: ChargeType
columns.summary: Enum:PayPlanChargeType The charge type of the payment plan. 0 - ChargeDue, 1 - Production.  Only relevant for those on Payment Plan Version 2, not Dynamic Payment Plans.

columns.name: ProcNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum. The procedure that this payplancharge is attached to.  Only applies to credits. Since DPPs dont' use credits, this column is not used for DPPs. Always 0 for ChargeDue.  Can be 0 for production not attached to a procedure.

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: DateTime payplancharge was added to the payplan. Not editable by user.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: DateTime payplancharge was edited. Not editable by user.

columns.name: StatementNum
columns.summary: FK to statement.StatementNum.  Only used when the statement in an invoice.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: Only present for dynamic payment plans. Contains FKey of the link type. ProcNum, AdjNum, or OrthoCaseNum. Since one ChargeDue can be split to multiple procedures, multiple rows are created in that case. In UI, these would be grouped by due date unless user checked ungroup box.

columns.name: LinkType
columns.summary: Enum:PayPlanLinkType Only present for dynamic payment plans.

columns.name: IsOffset
columns.summary: Set to true if this charge is created to offset an overcharge. Dynamic payment plans can get into this rare scenario where a charge has been inserted into the database for too much value. There is a 'fix' that users can apply from within the dynamic payment plan overcharge report which will create offsetting negative charges. The Income Transfer logic needs to know that this is an overcharge in order to remove value from corresponding charge that is linked to the same production entry (proc, adj, etc).

columns.name: IsDownPayment
columns.summary: Set to true if this charge is a down payment. There can be multiple charges marked as down payment on one pay plan because of how charges get split because they get attached to production.

name: payplanlink
summary: Each row represents Production for a Procedure, Adjustment, or OrthoCase on a (Dynamic) Payment Plan. The sum of these is the total of the payment plan.

columns.name: PayPlanLinkNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: PayPlanNum
columns.summary: FK to payplan.PayPlanNum

columns.name: LinkType
columns.summary: Enum:PayPlanLinkType  The object type being linked to be credited.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: Stores the FKey of object being linked, known from link type.

columns.name: AmountOverride
columns.summary: Optional override if full amount of object is not desired.

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: DateTime. Date the link was created. If pref.PayPlanItemDateShowProc is false, then this is also the date that this entry shows in the main account module.

name: payplantemplate
summary: A template of payplan terms that can be copied to a payment plan.  Only used for dynamic payment plans, not patient payment plans.

columns.name: PayPlanTemplateNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: PayPlanTemplateName
columns.summary: The name of the Pay Plan Template.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Can be 0.

columns.name: APR
columns.summary: Annual percentage rate.  eg 18.

columns.name: InterestDelay
columns.summary: The number of payments before interest is applied.

columns.name: PayAmt
columns.summary: The total payment amount due for each period.

columns.name: NumberOfPayments
columns.summary: The total number of periods for the payment plan. If the Pay Plan is dynamic and NumberOfPayments is not 0 then this is only used to calculate the PayAmt. After the PayAmt is calculated, NumberOfPayments is set to 0.

columns.name: ChargeFrequency
columns.summary: Enum:PayPlanFrequency How often charges are created for the payment plan. Monthly, weekly, etc.  Only for Dynamic Payment Plans.

columns.name: DownPayment
columns.summary: The amount paid toward the payment plan when it was first opened.

columns.name: DynamicPayPlanTPOption
columns.summary: Enum:DynamicPayPlanTPOptions Indicates the selected mode for how treatment planned procedures are handled by a dynamic payment plan.  None, AwaitComplete, or TreatAsComplete.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: A detailed note of the terms shows for future reference. Any changes made to the terms will be added to the note. Other notes can be added as needed.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: Templates can not be deleted, but can be hidden if not needed any more.

columns.name: SheetDefNum
columns.summary: FK to sheetdef.SheetDefNum. This is use when printing. Can only be payment plan type sheet. If 0, uses hard coded logic.

name: paysplit
summary: Always attached to a payment.  Always affects exactly one patient account and one provider.

columns.name: SplitNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SplitAmt
columns.summary: Amount of split.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Can be the PatNum of the guarantor if this is a split for a payment plan and the guarantor is in another family.

columns.name: ProcDate
columns.summary: DEPRECATED.  No longer used.  In older versions (before 7.0), this was the date that showed on the account.  Frequently the same as the date of the payment, but not necessarily.  Not when the payment was made.

columns.name: PayNum
columns.summary: FK to payment.PayNum.  Every paysplit must be linked to a payment.

columns.name: IsDiscount
columns.summary: No longer used.

columns.name: DiscountType
columns.summary: No longer used

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: PayPlanNum
columns.summary: FK to payplan.PayPlanNum.  0 if not attached to a payplan.

columns.name: DatePay
columns.summary: Date always in perfect synch with Payment date.

columns.name: ProcNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum.  0 if not attached to a procedure.

columns.name: DateEntry
columns.summary: Date this paysplit was created.  User not allowed to edit.

columns.name: UnearnedType
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Usually 0 unless this is an Unearned / Prepayment split. If there is no procedure attached to the paysplit, defaults to the type set in Pref PrepaymentUnearnedType. In the paysplit UI, 0=None. When this is set, it defaults to the first one in the list of defs which is typically Prepayment.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  Can be 0.  Need not match the ClinicNum of the Payment, because a payment can be split between clinics.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program  updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

columns.name: FSplitNum
columns.summary: No longer used.

columns.name: AdjNum
columns.summary: FK to adjustment.AdjNum.  Can be 0.  Indicates that this paysplit is meant to counteract an Adjustment.

columns.name: PayPlanChargeNum
columns.summary: FK to payplancharge.PayPlanChargeNum. Can be 0. Indicates that this paysplit is meant to counteract a PayPlanCharge.

columns.name: PayPlanDebitType
columns.summary: Enum:PayPlanDebitTypes Explicitly specifies what this paysplit should be applied towards in regards to principal or interest.

columns.name: SecurityHash
columns.summary: Holds the salted hash of the following paysplit fields: PatNum, SplitAmt, DateEntry.

name: payterminal
summary: Stores information about credit card terminals used for taking payments. Only used for PayConnect.

columns.name: PayTerminalNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Name
columns.summary: User defined name for the payterminal. E.g. Front Desk.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

columns.name: TerminalID
columns.summary: Serial number of physical device, typically provided by the card processor.

name: pearlrequest
summary: Stores the necessary information for polling Pearls API to check if AI annotations have been generated for an image sent from the Imaging module. It's also used to prevent duplicate image submissions to the API, which would return an error response. To poll Pearl for an image, all that's required is a request_id and an organization_id. Organization_id is stored in the Pearl program link.

columns.name: PearlRequestNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: RequestId
columns.summary: Request ID given to Pearl to uniquely identify this request. Generated as a GUID before uploading an image to Pearl.

columns.name: DocNum
columns.summary: FK to document. Links this request to the image that was sent. This is sufficient for mounts because mount images are sent individually to Pearl.

columns.name: RequestStatus
columns.summary: Enum:EnumPearlStatus Keeps track of the request's status. Can be Polling, Received, or Error.

columns.name: DateTSent
columns.summary: The time the image was originally sent to Pearl.

columns.name: DateTChecked
columns.summary: The most recent time an API call was made to Pearl to check the status of this request.

name: perioexam
summary: One perio exam for one patient on one date.  Has lots of periomeasures attached to it.

columns.name: PerioExamNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: DateTMeasureEdit
columns.summary: Date and time PerioExam was created or modified, including the associated PerioMeasure rows.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Note box for exam based notes.

name: periomeasure
summary: One row can hold up to six measurements for one tooth, all of the same type.  Always attached to a perioexam.

columns.name: PerioMeasureNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PerioExamNum
columns.summary: FK to perioexam.PerioExamNum.

columns.name: SequenceType
columns.summary: Enum:PerioSequenceType  eg probing, mobility, recession, etc.

columns.name: IntTooth
columns.summary: Valid values are 1-32. Every measurement must be associated with a tooth.

columns.name: ToothValue
columns.summary: This is used when the measurement does not apply to a surface(mobility and skiptooth).  Valid values for all surfaces are 0 through 19, or -1 to represent no measurement taken.

columns.name: MBvalue
columns.summary: -1 represents no measurement and are very common. Values of 100+ represent positive values for Gingival Margins. Example: +5. Non-probing numbers show through from previous exams as slightly greyed out. The value from the most recent exam will show through. It will ignore any -1's on recent exams when deciding what should show through.

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

name: pharmacy
summary: An individual pharmacy store.

columns.name: PharmacyNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PharmID
columns.summary: NCPDPID assigned by NCPDP.  Not used yet.

columns.name: StoreName
columns.summary: For now, it can just be a common description.  Later, it might have to be an official designation.

columns.name: Phone
columns.summary: Includes all punctuation.

columns.name: Fax
columns.summary: Includes all punctuation.

columns.name: Address2
columns.summary: Optional.

columns.name: State
columns.summary: Two char, uppercase.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: A freeform note for any info that is needed about the pharmacy, such as hours.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: The last date and time this row was altered.  Not user editable.

name: pharmclinic
summary: Links a pharmacy store to a clinic.

columns.name: PharmClinicNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PharmacyNum
columns.summary: FK to pharmacy.PharmacyNum.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

name: phonenumber
summary: Used to store phone numbers for patients.

columns.name: PhoneNumberNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: PhoneNumberVal
columns.summary: The actual phone number for the patient.  Includes any punctuation.  No leading 1 or plus, so almost always 10 digits.

columns.name: PhoneNumberDigits
columns.summary: The phone number for the patient with all non-digit chars and any leading 1's or 0's removed.

columns.name: PhoneType
columns.summary: Enum:PhoneType .  Used to determine which column in the patient table, if any, this row should be synced with.  Rows with 0 - Other are not synced with patient table columns.  The other values sync with their corresponding column in the patient table 1 - HmPhone, 2 - WkPhone, and 3 - WirelessPhone.

name: popup
summary: If an existing popup message gets changed, then an archive first gets created that's a copy of the original.  This is so that we can track historical changes.  When a new one gets created, all the archived popups will get automatically repointed to the new one.  If you "delete" a popup, it actually archives that popup.  All the other archives of that popup still point to the newly archived popup, but now there is no popup in that group with the IsArchived flag not set.

columns.name: PopupNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: The text of the popup.

columns.name: IsDisabled
columns.summary: Deprecated. Use DateTimeDisabled instead.

columns.name: PopupLevel
columns.summary: Enum:EnumPopupLevel 0=Patient, 1=Family, 2=Superfamily. If Family, then this Popup will apply to the entire family.  If Superfamily, then this popup will apply to the entire superfamily.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: The server time that this note was entered.  Cannot be changed by user.  Does not get changed automatically when level or isDisabled gets changed.  If note itself changes, then a new popup is created along with a new DateTimeEntry. Current popup's edit date gets set to the previous entry's DateTimeEntry

columns.name: IsArchived
columns.summary: Indicates that this is not the most current popup and that it is an archive.  True for any archived or "deleted" popups.

columns.name: PopupNumArchive
columns.summary: This will be zero for current popups that show when a patient is selected.  Archived popups will have a value which is the FK to its parent Popup.  The parent popup could be the most recent popup or another archived popup.  Will be zero for current and "deleted" popups.

columns.name: DateTimeDisabled
columns.summary: The DateTime at which this popup will be disabled. If this is DateTime.MinValue, then it will never be disabled.

name: preference
summary: Stores small bits of data for a wide variety of purposes.  Any data that's too small to warrant its own table will usually end up here.

columns.name: PrefName
columns.summary: The text 'key' in the key/value pairing.

columns.name: ValueString
columns.summary: The stored value.

columns.name: PrefNum
columns.summary: Primary key. Not actually used. All queries are designed to use PrefName.

columns.name: Comments
columns.summary: Documentation on usage and values of each pref.  Mostly deprecated now in favor of using XML comments in the code.

name: printer
summary: One printer selection for one situation for one computer.

columns.name: PrinterNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ComputerNum
columns.summary: FK to computer.ComputerNum.  This will be changed some day to refer to the computername, because it would make more sense as a key than a cryptic number.

columns.name: PrintSit
columns.summary: Enum:PrintSituation One of about 10 different situations where printing takes place.  If no printer object exists for a situation, then a default is used and a prompt is displayed.

columns.name: PrinterName
columns.summary: The name of the printer as set from the specified computer.

columns.name: DisplayPrompt
columns.summary: If true, then user will be prompted for printer.  Otherwise, print directly with little user interaction.

columns.name: FileExtension
columns.summary: String that holds the file extension type for this printer. No leading period. Example pdf or xps. Only used when IsVirtualPrinter is true.

columns.name: IsVirtualPrinter
columns.summary: Bool that indicates if this printer is a virtual  printer (pdf, xps, etc).

name: procapptcolor
summary: An individual procedure code color range.

columns.name: ProcApptColorNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: CodeRange
columns.summary: Procedure code range defined by user.  Includes commas and dashes, but no spaces.  The codes need not be valid since they are ranges.

columns.name: ColorText
columns.summary: Color that shows in appointments

columns.name: ShowPreviousDate
columns.summary: Adds most recent completed date to ProcsColored

name: procbutton
summary: The 'buttons' to show in the Chart module.  They must have items attached in order to do anything.

columns.name: ProcButtonNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: The text to show on the button.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Order that they will show in the Chart module.

columns.name: Category
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.

columns.name: ButtonImage
columns.summary: If no image, then the clob will be an empty string.  In this case, the bitmap will be null when loaded from the database.

columns.name: IsMultiVisit
columns.summary: Only useful for procedure buttons which cause more than one procedure to be charted.  Example: Crown (D code) and Delivery (N code). Causes the procedures generated by this procedure button to be grouped using links in the procmultivisit table.

name: procbuttonitem
summary: Attached to procbuttons.  These tell the program what to do when a user clicks on a button.  There are two types: proccodes or autocodes.

columns.name: ProcButtonItemNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ProcButtonNum
columns.summary: FK to procbutton.ProcButtonNum.

columns.name: OldCode
columns.summary: Do not use.

columns.name: AutoCodeNum
columns.summary: FK to autocode.AutoCodeNum.  0 if this is a procedure code.

columns.name: CodeNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum.  0 if this is an autocode.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Unusual ItemOrder column. Set implicitly based on the order procedures were added to the procedure button. This should prevent "random"  ordered procedures on buttons with multiple procedures.

name: procbuttonquick
summary: Used to customize quick buttons in the chart module.

columns.name: ProcButtonQuickNum
columns.summary: Primary Key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Description used for display.

columns.name: CodeValue
columns.summary: FK to procedurecode.ProcCode.

columns.name: Surf
columns.summary: Surfaces.

columns.name: YPos
columns.summary: Zero based YPos, row number within panel.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Items within each row are sorted using item order. Smallest item order will be drawn on the left.

columns.name: IsLabel
columns.summary: If true, this "button" will be displayed as a label.

name: proccodenote
summary: Stores the default note and time increments for one procedure code for one provider.  That way, an unlimited number of providers can each have different notes and times.  These notes and times override the defaults which are part of the procedurecode table.  So, for single provider offices, there will be no change to the current interface.

columns.name: ProcCodeNoteNum
columns.summary: Primary Key.

columns.name: CodeNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: The note.

columns.name: ProcTime
columns.summary: X's and /'s describe Dr's time and assistant's time in the same increments as the user has set.

columns.name: ProcStatus
columns.summary: Enum:ProcStat Indicates which status the procedure has to be set to in order for this note to take affect. Should only ever be 1 (TP) or 2 (C).  See procedurelog.ProcStatus for more info.

name: procedurecode
summary: A list setup ahead of time with all the procedure codes used by the office.  Every procedurelog entry which is attached to a patient is also linked to this table.

columns.name: CodeNum
columns.summary: Primary Key.  This happened in version 4.8.7.

columns.name: ProcCode
columns.summary: D-Code. Was Primary key, but now CodeNum is primary key.  Can hold dental codes, medical codes, custom codes, etc.

columns.name: Descript
columns.summary: The main description.

columns.name: AbbrDesc
columns.summary: Abbreviated description.

columns.name: ProcTime
columns.summary: X's and /'s describe Dr's time and assistant's time in the same increments as the user has set.

columns.name: ProcCat
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.  The category that this code will be found under in the search window.  Has nothing to do with insurance categories.

columns.name: TreatArea
columns.summary: Enum:TreatmentArea

columns.name: NoBillIns
columns.summary: If true, do not usually bill this procedure to insurance.

columns.name: IsProsth
columns.summary: True if Crown,Bridge,Denture, or RPD. Forces user to enter Initial or Replacement and Date.

columns.name: DefaultNote
columns.summary: The default procedure note to copy when marking complete.

columns.name: IsHygiene
columns.summary: Identifies hygiene procedures so that the correct provider can be selected.

columns.name: GTypeNum
columns.summary: No longer used.

columns.name: AlternateCode1
columns.summary: For Medicaid.  There may be more later.

columns.name: MedicalCode
columns.summary: FK to procedurecode.ProcCode.  The actual medical code that is being referenced must be setup first.  Anytime a procedure it added, this medical code will also be added to that procedure.  The user can change it in procedurelog.

columns.name: IsTaxed
columns.summary: Used by some offices.  SalesTaxPercentage has been added to the preference table to store the amount of sales tax to apply as an adjustment attached to a procedurelog entry.

columns.name: PaintType
columns.summary: Enum:ToothPaintingType

columns.name: GraphicColor
columns.summary: If set to anything but 0, then this will override the graphic color for all procedures of this code, regardless of the status.

columns.name: LaymanTerm
columns.summary: When creating treatment plans, this description will be used instead of the technical description.

columns.name: IsCanadianLab
columns.summary: Only used in Canada.  Set to true if this procedure code is only used as an adjunct to track the lab fee.

columns.name: PreExisting
columns.summary: This is true if this procedure code existed before ADA code distribution changed at version 4.8, false otherwise.

columns.name: BaseUnits
columns.summary: Support for Base Units for a Code (like anesthesia).  Should normally be zero.

columns.name: SubstitutionCode
columns.summary: FK to procedurecode.ProcCode.  Used for posterior composites because insurance substitutes the amalgam code when figuring the coverage.

columns.name: SubstOnlyIf
columns.summary: Enum:SubstitutionCondition Used so that posterior composites only substitute if tooth is molar.  Ins usually pays for premolar composites.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: Last datetime that this row was inserted or updated.

columns.name: IsMultiVisit
columns.summary: Deprecated

columns.name: DrugNDC
columns.summary: 11 digits or blank, enforced.  For 837I

columns.name: RevenueCodeDefault
columns.summary: Gets copied to procedure.RevCode.  For 837I

columns.name: ProvNumDefault
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  0 for none. Otherwise, this provider will be used for this code instead of the normal provider.

columns.name: CanadaTimeUnits
columns.summary: For Canadian customers, tracks scaling insurance and periodontal scaling units for patients depending on coverage.

columns.name: IsRadiology
columns.summary: Set to true for radiology procedures.  An EHR core measure uses this flag to help determine the denominator for rad orders.

columns.name: DefaultClaimNote
columns.summary: Default note inserted to claim note when claim is created.

columns.name: DefaultTPNote
columns.summary: The default procedure note used when creating a new treatment planned procedure.

columns.name: BypassGlobalLock
columns.summary: Enum:BypassLockStatus Specifies whether a proceduce with this code can be created before the global lock date. The only values that should be used for this field are NeverBypass and BypassIfZero.

columns.name: TaxCode
columns.summary: Used only by OD HQ for Sales Tax.  This is the tax code we send to Avalara API so they can determine how much sales tax to charge for this procedure.  The only way to edit this value is through raw queries, which is very dangerous.

columns.name: PaintText
columns.summary: The text to draw on the tooth for paint type Text.

columns.name: AreaAlsoToothRange
columns.summary: This is an adjunct to TreatArea. If Quad or Arch, then this allows users to also specify a tooth or tooth range.  Required by some insurance.

columns.name: DiagnosticCodes
columns.summary: Text to store up to 4 ICD-10 codes. Codes are comma-separated with no whitespace. Used to set the default DiagnosticCode, DiagnosticCode2, DiagnosticCode3, and DiagnosticCode4 fields for new procedures linked to the procedure code. When this field is not empty or null, it will override the ICD9DefaultForNewProcs preference. Example: M26.31,K08.401,K02.51

name: procedurelog
summary: Database table is procedurelog.  A procedure for a patient.  Can be treatment planned or completed.  Once it's completed, it gets tracked more closely by the security portion of the program.  A procedure can NEVER be deleted.  Status can just be changed to "deleted". A "Group Note" is a special kind of procedure. Its status is always EC. It always uses DCode "~GRP~". Just like all other procs, it can have exactly one ProcNote. To attach other procs a Group Note, we use the ProcGroupItem table. It does not have to have any attachd procs, and their ProcStatuses do not matter (except maybe D). The ProvNum of a GroupNote can be independently of the ProvNums on the attached procs.

columns.name: ProcNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

columns.name: AptNum
columns.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum.  Only allowed to attach proc to one appt(not counting planned appt)

columns.name: OldCode
columns.summary: No longer used.

columns.name: ProcDate
columns.summary: Procedure date that will show in the account as the date performed.  If just treatment planned, the date can be the date it was tp'd, or the date can be min val if we don't care. This has no time component. Also see ProcTime column.

columns.name: ProcFee
columns.summary: Procedure fee.

columns.name: Surf
columns.summary: Surfaces, or use "UL" etc for quadrant, "2" etc for sextant, "U","L" for arches.  Sextants in the United States are: 1 (Upper Right), 2 (Upper Anterior), 3 (Upper Left), 4 (Lower Left), 5 (Lower Anterior), 6 (Lower Right).  In Canada, Sextants are 03 through 08 (add 2 to the US sextant and prepend a zero).

columns.name: ToothNum
columns.summary: May be blank, otherwise 1-32 or A-T, 1 or 2 char. For supernumerary, add 50 to use 51-82. For supernumerary primary, use AS-TS.  For Canadian users, using FDI nomenclature, we use 51 as a placeholder for supernumerary teeth, which is tooth number 99 according to CDHA standards (2/17/2014).  Logic for this is handled in the tooth logic class.

columns.name: ToothRange
columns.summary: May be blank, otherwise is series of toothnumbers separated by commas. No dashes. Tooth numbers include 1-32 or A-T.  Supernumeraries not supported here yet.

columns.name: Priority
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum, which contains the text of the priority.

columns.name: ProcStatus
columns.summary: Enum:ProcStat TP=1,Complete=2,Existing Cur Prov=3,Existing Other Prov=4,Referred=5,Deleted=6,Condition=7.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: Dx
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum, which contains text of the Diagnosis.

columns.name: PlannedAptNum
columns.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum.  Was called NextAptNum in older versions.  Allows this procedure to be attached to a Planned appointment as well as a standard appointment.

columns.name: PlaceService
columns.summary: Enum:PlaceOfService  Only used in Public Health. Zero(Office) until procedure set complete. Then it's set to the value of the DefaultProcedurePlaceService preference.

columns.name: Prosthesis
columns.summary: Single char. Blank=no, I=Initial, R=Replacement.

columns.name: DateOriginalProsth
columns.summary: For a prosthesis Replacement, this is the original date.

columns.name: ClaimNote
columns.summary: This note goes out on e-claims.  Not visible in Canada.

columns.name: DateEntryC
columns.summary: This is the date this procedure was entered or set complete.  If not status C, then the value is ignored.  This date is set automatically when Insert, but older data or converted data might not have this value set.  It gets updated when set complete.  User never allowed to edit.  This will be enhanced later.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  0 if no clinic.

columns.name: MedicalCode
columns.summary: FK to procedurecode.ProcCode. Optional.

columns.name: DiagnosticCode
