columns.summary: Simple text for ICD-9 code. Gets sent with medical claims.

columns.name: IsPrincDiag
columns.summary: Set true if this medical diagnostic code is the principal diagnosis for the visit.  If no principal diagnosis is marked for any procedures on a medical e-claim, then it won't be allowed to be sent.  If more than one is marked, then it will just use one at random.

columns.name: ProcNumLab
columns.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum. Only used in Canada. If not zero, then this proc is a lab fee and this indicates to which actual procedure the lab fee is attached.  For ordinary use, they are treated like two separate procedures.  It's only for insurance claims that we need to know which lab fee belongs to which procedure.  Two lab fees may be attached to one procedure.

columns.name: BillingTypeOne
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Lets some users track charges for certain types of reports.  For example, a Medicaid billing type could be assigned to a procedure, flagging it for inclusion in a report mandated by goverment.  Would be more useful if it was automated to flow down based on insurance plan type, but that can be added later.  Not visible if prefs.EasyHideMedicaid is true.

columns.name: BillingTypeTwo
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.  Same as BillingTypeOne, but used when there is a secondary billing type to account for.

columns.name: CodeNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum

columns.name: CodeMod1
columns.summary: Modifier for certain CPT codes.

columns.name: CodeMod2
columns.summary: Modifier for certain CPT codes.

columns.name: CodeMod3
columns.summary: Modifier for certain CPT codes.

columns.name: CodeMod4
columns.summary: Modifier for certain CPT codes.

columns.name: RevCode
columns.summary: NUBC Revenue Code for medical/inst billing. Used on UB04 and 837I.

columns.name: UnitQty
columns.summary: Default is 1.  Becomes Service Unit Count on institutional UB claimforms SV205.  Becomes Service Unit Count on medical 1500 claimforms SV104.  Becomes procedure count on dental claims SV306.  Gets multiplied by fee in all accounting calculations.

columns.name: BaseUnits
columns.summary: Base units used for some billing codes.  Default is 0.  No UI for this field.  It is only edited in the ProcedureCode window.  The database maint tool changes BaseUnits of all procedures to match that of the procCode.  Not sure yet what it's for.

columns.name: StartTime
columns.summary: Start time in military.  Doesn't seem to affect sorting in the ProgressNotes, although we could do that some day.

columns.name: StopTime
columns.summary: Stop time in military.  No longer used, but not deleting just in case someone has critical information stored here.

columns.name: DateTP
columns.summary: The date that the procedure was originally treatment planned.  Does not change when marked complete.

columns.name: SiteNum
columns.summary: FK to site.SiteNum.

columns.name: HideGraphics
columns.summary: Set to true to hide the chart graphics for this procedure.  For example, a crown was done, but then tooth extracted.

columns.name: CanadianTypeCodes
columns.summary: F16, up to 5 char. One or more of the following: A=Repair of a prior service, B=Temporary placement, C=TMJ, E=Implant, L=Appliance lost, S=Appliance stolen, X=none of the above.  Blank is equivalent to X for claim output, but one value will not be automatically converted to the other in this table.  That will allow us to track user entry for procedurecode.IsProsth.

columns.name: ProcTime
columns.summary: Used to be part of the ProcDate, but that was causing reporting issues.

columns.name: ProcTimeEnd
columns.summary: Marks the time a procedure was finished.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed.

columns.name: Prognosis
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum, which contains text of the Prognosis.

columns.name: DrugUnit
columns.summary: Enum:EnumProcDrugUnit For 837I and UB04

columns.name: DrugQty
columns.summary: Includes fractions. For 837I

columns.name: UnitQtyType
columns.summary: Enum:ProcUnitQtyType For dental, the type is always sent electronically as MultiProcs. For institutional SV204, Days will be sent electronically if chosen, otherwise ServiceUnits will be sent. For medical SV103, MinutesAnesth will be sent electronically if chosen, otherwise ServiceUnits will be sent.

columns.name: StatementNum
columns.summary: FK to statement.StatementNum.  Only used when the statement in an invoice.

columns.name: IsLocked
columns.summary: If this flag is set, then the proc is locked down tight.  No changes at all can be made except to append, sign, or invalidate. Invalidate really just sets the proc to status 'deleted'.  An invalidated proc retains its IsLocked status.  All locked procs will be status of C or D.  Locked group notes will be status of EC or D.

columns.name: BillingNote
columns.summary: A note that will show directly in the Account module.  Also used for repeating charges. Helps distinguish between charges for the same proccode in the same month.

columns.name: RepeatChargeNum
columns.summary: FK to repeatcharge.RepeatChargeNum.  Used in repeating charges to determine which procedures belong to each repeating charge. If the repeat charge that this RepeatChargeNum points to is deleted, this column will not be set to 0 so that a record will still exist that this procedure came from a repeat charge.

columns.name: SnomedBodySite
columns.summary: Some procedures require a SNOMED code which indicates that site on the body at which this procedure was performed.

columns.name: DiagnosticCode2
columns.summary: Simple text for ICD-9 code. Gets sent with medical claims.

columns.name: DiagnosticCode3
columns.summary: Simple text for ICD-9 code. Gets sent with medical claims.

columns.name: DiagnosticCode4
columns.summary: Simple text for ICD-9 code. Gets sent with medical claims.

columns.name: ProvOrderOverride
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  Ordering provider override.  Goes hand-in-hand with OrderingReferralNum.  Medical eclaims only. Defaults to zero.

columns.name: Discount
columns.summary: Stores the dollar amount of the discount, not full price.  E.g.  for a 10% discount, Fee = $160 Discount = $16.  This column is used by treatment planned procedures to create an adjustment when set complete.  It should not be used as an accurate monetary discount value for completed procedures.

columns.name: IsDateProsthEst
columns.summary: For prosthesis replacement procedures on 5010 eclaims only.  If true, indicates that the DateOriginalProsth is an estimated date.  Estimated dates are often used when the original prosthesis was performed by another doctor.

columns.name: IcdVersion
columns.summary: The ICD code version for all diagnosis codes on this procedure, including DiagnosisCode, DiagnosisCode2, DiagnosisCode3, and DiagnosisCode4.  Value of 9 for ICD-9, 10 for ICD-10, etc.  Default value is 9.  This value is copied from the DxIcdVersion preference when a procedure is created.  The user can also manually change the IcdVersion on individual procedures.

columns.name: IsCpoe
columns.summary: Procedures will be flagged as CPOE (Computerized Provider Order Entry) if this procedure was created by a provider. If a provider views, edits, or has any interaction with this procedure after its creation, it will be flagged as IsCPOE. Also, there will be a helpful window where providers can go to to "approve" non-CPOE procedures and mark them as CPOE to help meet EHR measures. If a staff person is logged in and enters this procedure then this is non-CPOE, so false.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date and time of entry.

columns.name: DateComplete
columns.summary: Normally do not use this field. The date the procedure was originally set complete. If status is set complete and then set to something other than complete, this field will be set to DateTime.MinValue if DateComplete is today.  If DateComplete is set to a day in the past and the status is changed from complete to something else, the field will not be cleared or updated.  Db only field used by one customer and this is how they requested it. PatNum #19191

columns.name: OrderingReferralNum
columns.summary: FK to referral.ReferralNum.  Goes hand-in-hand with ProvOrderOverride.  Medical eclaims only.  Defaults to zero. If set, and the ProvOrderOverride is not set, then this referral will go out at the ordering provider on medical e-claims.

columns.name: TaxAmt
columns.summary: Holds the Sales Tax estimate for this procedure.  Becomes a finalized amount when the procedure is marked complete.

columns.name: Urgency
columns.summary: Enum:ProcUrgency Used in 1500 Medical Claim Form box 24c. Normal=blank 24c,Emergency='Y' in 24c.

columns.name: DiscountPlanAmt
columns.summary: The difference between the UCR fee and discount plan fee. Frequently recalculated when procedure is TP.

name: procgroupitem
summary: Links Procedures(groupnotes) to Procedures in a 1-n relationship.

columns.name: ProcGroupItemNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ProcNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum.

columns.name: GroupNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum.This is the group note that the procedure is in.

name: procmultivisit
summary: Example: a crown prep and seat is spread over two appointments. A ProcMultiVisit row is created for each procedure. The procedure "In Process" status is a derived status in the UI based on the existence of a link between procedures in this table. In Process is removed once all procs in the group have been set complete. Having a procedure become part of a multi-visit group can affect how benefits are calculated and will set claim statuses so that they reflect that a multi-visit group is in progress.

columns.name: ProcMultiVisitNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: GroupProcMultiVisitNum
columns.summary: FK to procmultivisit.ProcMultiVisitNum.  Groups procmultivisit rows.  Set to the ProcMultiVisitNum of the first row in the group.

columns.name: ProcNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum.

columns.name: ProcStatus
columns.summary: Enum:ProcStat A copy of the value from procedurelog.ProcStatus, based on ProcNum.  Reduces queries and speeds up logic.

columns.name: IsInProcess
columns.summary: A pseudo-status, calculated for the entire group and based on ProcStatuses of all procedures in the group. This will be true for all rows in an In Process group.

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

name: procnote
summary: A procedure note for one procedure.  User does not have any direct control over this table at all.  It's handled automatically.  When user "edits" a procedure note, the program actually just adds another note.  No note can EVER be edited or deleted.

columns.name: ProcNoteNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

columns.name: ProcNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum

columns.name: EntryDateTime
columns.summary: The server time that this note was entered. Essentially a timestamp.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: The actual note.

columns.name: SigIsTopaz
columns.summary: There are two kinds of signatures.  Topaz signatures use hardware manufactured by that company, and the signature is created by their library.  OD signatures work exactly the same way, but are only for on-screen signing.

columns.name: Signature
columns.summary: The encrypted signature.  A signature starts as a collection of vectors.  The Topaz .sig file format is proprietary.  The OD signature format looks like this: 45,68;48,70;49,72;0,0;55,88;etc. Tenths are allowed, so it's common to see decimals.  It's simply a sequence of points, separated by semicolons.  0,0 represents pen up.  Then, a hash is created from the Note, concatenated directly with the userNum.  For example, "This is a note3" gets turned into a hash of 2849283940385391 (16 bytes).  The hash is used to encrypt the signature data string using symmetric encryption.  Therefore, the actual signature cannot be retrieved from the database by ordinary means.  Also, the signature info cannot even be retrieved by Open Dental at all unless it supplies the same hash as before, proving that the data has not changed since signed.  If OD supplies the correct hash, then it will be able to extract the sequence of vectors which it will then use to display the signature.  The OD sigs are not compressed, and the Topaz sigs are.  But there is very little difference in their sizes.  It would be very rare for a signature to be larger than 1000 bytes. There are also situations where the API or web service inserts a totally different here. The first two points are int.MinVal. Example: -2147483648,-2147483648;-2147483648,-2147483648;47,23;12,35;... The remaining points after the first two are the byte values of individual letters that make up a string that will be displayed inside the signature box.

name: proctp
summary: These are copies of procedures that are attached to saved treatment plans.  The ProcNumOrig points to the actual procedurelog row.

columns.name: ProcTPNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: TreatPlanNum
columns.summary: FK to treatplan.TreatPlanNum.  The treatment plan to which this proc is attached.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: ProcNumOrig
columns.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum. This procNum is only here to compare and test the existence of the referenced procedure.  If present, it will check to see whether the procedure is still status TP.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: The order of this proc within its tp.  This is set when the tp is first created and can't be changed.  Drastically simplifies loading the tp.

columns.name: Priority
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum which contains the text of the priority.

columns.name: ToothNumTP
columns.summary: A simple string displaying the tooth number.  If international tooth numbers are used, then this will be in international format already.  For Canadian users, using FDI nomenclature, we use 51 as a placeholder for supernumerary teeth, which is tooth number 99 according to CDHA standards (2/17/2014).  Logic for this is handled in the tooth logic class.

columns.name: Surf
columns.summary: Tooth surfaces or area.  This is already converted for international use.  If arch or quad, then it will have U,LR, etc.

columns.name: ProcCode
columns.summary: Not a foreign key.  Simply display text.  Can be changed by user at any time.

columns.name: Descript
columns.summary: Description is originally copied from procedurecode.Descript, but user can change it.

columns.name: FeeAmt
columns.summary: The fee charged to the patient. Never gets automatically updated.

columns.name: PriInsAmt
columns.summary: The amount primary insurance is expected to pay. Never gets automatically updated.

columns.name: SecInsAmt
columns.summary: The amount secondary insurance is expected to pay. Never gets automatically updated.

columns.name: PatAmt
columns.summary: The amount the patient is expected to pay. Never gets automatically updated.

columns.name: Discount
columns.summary: The amount of discount.  Used for PPOs and procedure level discounts.

columns.name: Prognosis
columns.summary: Text from prognosis definition.  Can be changed by user at any time.

columns.name: Dx
columns.summary: Text from diagnosis definition.  Can be changed by user at any time.

columns.name: ProcAbbr
columns.summary: The ProcedureCode abbreviation.  Can be changed by user at any time.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

columns.name: FeeAllowed
columns.summary: The amount primary insurance allows. Should be the exact amount in the FormClaimProc allowed amount field. May be either the PPO fee or the out of network allowed fee.

columns.name: TaxAmt
columns.summary: Holds the Sales Tax estimate for this procedure.  Used to review history when being reviewed by accounting. In the Treatment Plan, this represents an estimate and a record for pre-payments.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  Holds the ProvNum for this procedure's provider.

columns.name: DateTP
columns.summary: Holds the DateTP for this procedure.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  Holds the ClinicNum for this procedure's clinic.

columns.name: CatPercUCR
columns.summary: The UCR fee for the procedure. Cannot be changed by the user.

name: program
summary: Each row is a bridge to an outside program, frequently an imaging program.  Most of the bridges are hard coded, and simply need to be enabled.  But user can also add their own custom bridge.

columns.name: ProgramNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ProgName
columns.summary: Unique name for built-in program bridges. Not user-editable. enum ProgramName

columns.name: ProgDesc
columns.summary: Description that shows.

columns.name: Enabled
columns.summary: True if enabled.

columns.name: Path
columns.summary: The path of the executable to run or file to open. Text since 255 is the largest VARCHAR supported and some softwares have long paths that can easily exceed 255 characters.

columns.name: CommandLine
columns.summary: Some programs will accept command line arguments. Text since 255 is the largest VARCHAR supported and some softwares have long command line arguments that can easily exceed 255 characters.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Notes about this program link. Peculiarities, etc.

columns.name: PluginDllName
columns.summary: If this is a Plugin, then this is the filename of the dll, including the extension.  The dll must be located in the application directory.

columns.name: ButtonImage
columns.summary: If no image, then will be an empty string.  In this case, the bitmap will be null when loaded from the database. Must be a 22 x 22 image, and thus needs (width) x (height) x (depth) = 22 x 22 x 4 = 1936 bytes.

columns.name: FileTemplate
columns.summary: For custom program links only.  Stores the template of a file to be generated when launching the program link.

columns.name: FilePath
columns.summary: For custom program links only.  Stores the path of a file to be generated when launching the program link.

columns.name: IsDisabledByHq
columns.summary: Do not use directly.  Call Programs.IsEnabledByHq() instead.  Has HQ disabled this program for all customers via WebServiceHq.EnableAdditionalFeatures().  Using 'Disabled' because the web method will only send Programs HQ cares about.  Any user defined Programs should not be marked as 'Disabled' by default.

columns.name: CustErr
columns.summary: Typically blank. A value is added to this if we have disabled this program at HQ's side and will be updated during HqProgram.Download()

name: programproperty
summary: Some program links (bridges), have properties that need to be set.  The property names are always hard coded.  User can change the value.  The property is usually retrieved based on its name.

columns.name: ProgramPropertyNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ProgramNum
columns.summary: FK to program.ProgramNum

columns.name: PropertyDesc
columns.summary: The description or prompt for this property.  Blank for workstation overrides of program path.  Many bridges use this description as an "internal description". This way it can act like a FK in order to look up this particular property.  Users cannot edit.

columns.name: PropertyValue
columns.summary: The value. Could contain FK to other tables.

columns.name: ComputerName
columns.summary: The human-readable name of the computer on the network (not the IP address).  Only used when overriding program path.  Blank for typical Program Properties.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  This is only used by a few bridges.  Set to 0 for most bridges.

columns.name: IsMasked
columns.summary: Is true if the program property is sensitive information that would need to be masked in the UI. False by default.

columns.name: IsHighSecurity
columns.summary: Is true if the program property is a high security property. False by default.

name: promotion
summary: This table represents a grouping of promotionlogs. When sending a waive of emails, this table links those promotion logs/emails together.

columns.name: PromotionNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PromotionName
columns.summary: The name of the promotion.

columns.name: DateTimeCreated
columns.summary: The time this promotion was sent out.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum The clinic this promotion was sent for.

columns.name: TypePromotion
columns.summary: Enum:PromotionType - The type of promotion this is.

name: promotionlog
summary: When a reminder is sent for an appointment a record of that send is stored here. This is used to prevent re-sends of the same reminder.

columns.name: PromotionLogNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PromotionNum
columns.summary: FK to promotion.PromotionNum

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum for the corresponding patient.

columns.name: MessageFk
columns.summary: FK to primary key of appropriate table.

columns.name: EmailHostingFK
columns.summary: A foreign key from the email hosting API that allows us to receive status updates on this specific email.

columns.name: DateTimeSent
columns.summary: DateTime the message was sent.

columns.name: PromotionStatus
columns.summary: Enum:PromotionLogStatus

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum for the corresponding appointment.

columns.name: SendStatus
columns.summary: Indicates status of message.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: Generated by OD. Timestamp when row is created.

columns.name: ResponseDescript
columns.summary: Generated by OD in some cases and HQ in others. Any human readable error message generated by either HQ or EConnector. Used for debugging.

columns.name: ApptReminderRuleNum
columns.summary: FK to apptreminderrule.ApptReminderRuleNum. Allows us to look up the rules to determine how to send this apptcomm out.

name: provider
summary: A provider is usually a dentist or a hygienist.  But a provider might also be a denturist, a dental student, or a dental hygiene student.  A provider might also be a 'dummy', used only for billing purposes or for notes in the Appointments module.  There is no limit to the number of providers that can be added.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Abbr
columns.summary: Abbreviation.  There was a limit of 5 char before version 5.4.  The new limit is 255 char.  This will allow more elegant solutions to various problems.  Providers will no longer be referred to by FName and LName.  Abbr is used as a human readable primary key.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Order that provider will show in lists. 0-based.

columns.name: LName
columns.summary: Last name.

columns.name: FName
columns.summary: First name.

columns.name: MI
columns.summary: Middle inital or name.

columns.name: Suffix
columns.summary: eg. DMD or DDS.

columns.name: FeeSched
columns.summary: FK to feesched.FeeSchedNum.

columns.name: Specialty
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.

columns.name: SSN
columns.summary: or TIN.  No punctuation

columns.name: StateLicense
columns.summary: DEPRECATED. Can include punctuation

columns.name: DEANum
columns.summary: DEPRECATED.  DEANum can be found in the providerclinic table.

columns.name: IsSecondary
columns.summary: True if hygienist.

columns.name: ProvColor
columns.summary: Color that shows in appointments

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: If true, provider will not show on any lists. The provider will still be a selection option in standard reports. Use IsHiddenReport to hide from reports. Hidden providers cannot access eRx. This will not affect scheduled appointments.

columns.name: UsingTIN
columns.summary: True if the SSN field is actually a Tax ID Num

columns.name: BlueCrossID
columns.summary: No longer used since each state assigns a different ID.  Use the providerident instead which allows you to assign a different BCBS ID for each Payor ID.

columns.name: SigOnFile
columns.summary: Signature on file.

columns.name: OutlineColor
columns.summary: Color that shows in appointments as outline when highlighted.

columns.name: SchoolClassNum
columns.summary: FK to schoolclass.SchoolClassNum Used in dental schools.  Each student is a provider.  This keeps track of which class they are in.

columns.name: NationalProvID
columns.summary: US NPI, and Canadian CDA provider number.

columns.name: CanadianOfficeNum
columns.summary: Canadian field required for e-claims.  Assigned by CDA.  It's OK to have multiple providers with the same OfficeNum.  Max length should be 4.

columns.name: AnesthProvType
columns.summary: FK to ??. Field used to set the Anesthesia Provider type. Used to filter the provider dropdowns on FormAnestheticRecord

columns.name: TaxonomyCodeOverride
columns.summary: If none of the supplied taxonomies works.  This will show on claims.

columns.name: IsCDAnet
columns.summary: For Canada. Set to true if CDA Net provider.

columns.name: EcwID
columns.summary: The name of this field is bad and will soon be changed to MedicalSoftID.  This allows an ID field that can be used for HL7 synch with other software.  Before this field was added, we were using prov abbreviation, which did not work well.

columns.name: StateRxID
columns.summary: DEPRECATED. Provider medical State ID.

columns.name: IsNotPerson
columns.summary: Default is false because most providers are persons.  But some dummy providers used for practices or billing entities are not persons.  This is needed on 837s.

columns.name: StateWhereLicensed
columns.summary: DEPRECATED. The state abbreviation where the state license number in the StateLicense field is legally registered.

columns.name: EmailAddressNum
columns.summary: Not currently used.  FK to emailaddress.EmailAddressNum.  Optional, can be 0.

columns.name: IsInstructor
columns.summary: Default is false because most providers will not be instructors.  Used in Dental Schools

columns.name: EhrMuStage
columns.summary: Used to determine which stage of MU the provider is shown. 0=Global preference(Default), 1=Stage 1, 2=Stage 2, 3=Modified Stage 2.

columns.name: ProvNumBillingOverride
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum

columns.name: CustomID
columns.summary: Custom ID used for reports or bridges only.

columns.name: ProvStatus
columns.summary: Enum:ProviderStatus

columns.name: IsHiddenReport
columns.summary: Determines whether the provider will show in the combobox on standard reports. IsHidden will not hide from reports. Data for this provider is still included on reports when running for "All" providers.

columns.name: IsErxEnabled
columns.summary: Enum:ErxEnabledStatus Indicates whether or not the provider has individually agreed to accept eRx charges.  Defaults to Disabled for new providers.

columns.name: Birthdate
columns.summary: The birthdate of the provider.

columns.name: SchedNote
columns.summary: Indicates if the provider should only be scheduled in a certain way (e.g. Root canals only)

columns.name: WebSchedDescript
columns.summary: The description of the provider that is displayed to patients in Web Sched.

columns.name: WebSchedImageLocation
columns.summary: The image of the provider that is displayed to patients in Web Sched. File name only (path not included).  This should be a file name in the A to Z folder.

columns.name: HourlyProdGoalAmt
columns.summary: The hourly production goal amount of the provider.

columns.name: DateTerm
columns.summary: The date that the provider's term ends. This can be used to prevent appointments from being scheduled, appointments from being  marked complete, prescriptions from being prescribed, and claims from being sent.

columns.name: PreferredName
columns.summary: The preferred name of the provider, shows what will be displayed to patients in eClipboard.

name: providerclinic
summary: Allows specifying DEA number override and other overrides for the given combination of provider and clinic. This is different from the ProviderClinicLink table. That table records which providers are restricted to which clinics.

columns.name: ProviderClinicNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

columns.name: DEANum
columns.summary: The DEA number for this provider and clinic.  The DEA number used to be stored in provider.DEANum.

columns.name: StateLicense
columns.summary: License number corresponding to the StateWhereLicensed.  Can include punctuation

columns.name: StateRxID
columns.summary: Provider medical State ID.

columns.name: StateWhereLicensed
columns.summary: The state abbreviation where the state license number in the StateLicense field is legally registered.

columns.name: CareCreditMerchantId
columns.summary: The merchant number for this provider and clinic.

name: providercliniclink
summary: This table restricts a provider to a certain clinic. Muliple entries will allow them access to multiple clinics. If a provider does not have an entry in this table, it means that provider is linked to all clinics. This is different from the ProviderClinic table. That table holds override information for providers for certain clinics.

columns.name: ProviderClinicLinkNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. An entry of -1 means the provider is associated to no clinics.

name: providererx
summary: Tracks which providers have access to eRx based on NPI.  Synchronized with HQ.

columns.name: ProviderErxNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  Holder of registration key only for HQ record, in customer record this will be 0.

columns.name: NationalProviderID
columns.summary: NPI of a provider from the provider table.  May correspond to multiple records in the provider table.

columns.name: IsEnabled
columns.summary: Enum:ErxStatus Set to Enabled if the provider with the given NationalProviderID has access to eRx.  Pending statuses are treated as if Disabled.

columns.name: IsIdentifyProofed
columns.summary: True if HQ knows that the provider has completed the Identify Proofing (IDP) process and is allowed access to eRx. A provider can be enabled even when this is false if the provider is an existing provider before version 15.4 (a legacy provider).

columns.name: IsSentToHq
columns.summary: Set to true if the NationalProviderID has been sent to HQ.  Will be false in customer db until sent. If true, this tells us that the IsEnabled and IsIdentityProofed flags are set according to HQ records.

columns.name: IsEpcs
columns.summary: Set to true manually if the customer has completed their EPCS process.

columns.name: ErxType
columns.summary: Enum:ErxOption Identifies which eRx option is being used when asking HQ if they are enabled.

columns.name: UserId
columns.summary: User identifier used by the associated ErxType.  Only used by OD HQ.

columns.name: AccountId
columns.summary: Only used by OD HQ.

columns.name: RegistrationKeyNum
columns.summary: FK to registrationkey.RegistrationKeyNum.  HQ only, links to the registration key used to make this providererx row.

name: providerident
summary: Some insurance companies require special provider ID #s, and this table holds them.

columns.name: ProviderIdentNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  An ID only applies to one provider.

columns.name: PayorID
columns.summary: FK to carrier.ElectID  aka Electronic ID. An ID only applies to one insurance carrier.

columns.name: SuppIDType
columns.summary: Enum:ProviderSupplementalID

columns.name: IDNumber
columns.summary: The number assigned by the ins carrier.

name: queryfilter
summary: Each row is a query filter for the Query Monitor window. That window will exclude queries from showing and logging when they contain FilterText. This can significantly reduce the noise when looking through the queries.

columns.name: QueryFilterNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: GroupName
columns.summary: This is a simple string instead of a FK to another small table.

columns.name: FilterText
columns.summary: The text that we look for in the query monitor. Any query that contains this text will be filtered out.

name: question
summary: Each row is one Question for one patient.  If a patient has never filled out a questionnaire, then they will have no rows in this table.

columns.name: QuestionNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: The order that this question shows in the list.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: The original question.

columns.name: Answer
columns.summary: The answer to the question in text form.

columns.name: FormPatNum
columns.summary: FK to formpat.FormPatNum

name: questiondef
summary: Each row represents one question on the medical history questionnaire.  Later, other questionnaires will be allowed, but for now, all questions are on one questionnaire for the patient.  This table has no dependencies, since the question is copied when added to a patient record.  Any row can be freely deleted or altered without any problems.

columns.name: QuestionDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: The question as presented to the patient.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: The order that the Questions will show.

columns.name: QuestType
columns.summary: Enum:QuestionType

name: quickpastecat
summary: Quick paste categories are used by the quick paste notes feature.

columns.name: QuickPasteCatNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: The order of this category within the list. 0-based.

columns.name: DefaultForTypes
columns.summary: Enum:EnumQuickPasteType  Each Category can be set to be the default category for multiple types of notes. Stored as integers separated by commas.

name: quickpastenote
summary: Template for quick pasted note feature.

columns.name: QuickPasteNoteNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: QuickPasteCatNum
columns.summary: FK to quickpastecat.QuickPasteCatNum.  Keeps track of which category this note is in.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: The order of this note within it's category. 0-based.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: The actual note. Can be multiple lines and possibly very long.

columns.name: Abbreviation
columns.summary: The abbreviation which will automatically substitute when preceded by a ?.

name: reactivation
summary: Track patient contact via a commlog type ("Reactivation"). Any commlogs of this type that occur after the last completed procedure will be considered a contact attempt. Patients should show in this list if they have previously completed procedures (excluding broken/canceled), and the most recent was completed before the time span specified by the "Days Past" preference. Include Patients with the following PatStatus: Patient, Inactive, Prospective Patients should not show in this list if they have been marked "Do not contact". Patients should not show in this list if a future appointment is scheduled. Once contacted, Patient should not show in this list.  Patient will later reappear in this list if the "Reactivation contact interval" time period passes since the last contact and an appointment has not yet been scheduled. If the patient is contacted the maximum number of times specified by the "Count Contact Max" preference, mark the patient as "Do Not Contact". Example: Johnny Patient had his last procedure completed on 1/1/2018.  There is a "Reactivation" type commlog on his chart from 6/1/2018. He does not have any future scheduled appointments.  Johnny would be included in the list of "Reactivation" patients, with a single contact attempt having been made already.

columns.name: ReactivationNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: ReactivationStatus
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Uses the existing RecallUnschedStatus DefCat.

columns.name: ReactivationNote
columns.summary: An administrative note for staff use.

columns.name: DoNotContact
columns.summary: The patient can set this property if they don't want to be contacted so that it won't interfere with the max attempts to contact option.

name: recall
summary: A patient can only have one recall object per type. The recall table stores a few dates that must be kept synchronized with other information in the database.  This is difficult. Anytime one of the following items changes, things need to be synchronized: procedurecode.SetRecall, any procedurelog change for a patient (procs added, deleted, completed, status changed, date changed, etc), patient status changed. There are expected to be a few bugs in the synchronization logic, so anytime a patient's recall is opened, it will also update. During synchronization, the program will frequently alter DateDueCalc, DateDue, and DatePrevious based on trigger procs. The system will also add and delete recalls as necessary. But it will not delete a recall unless all values are default and there is no useful information. When a user tries to delete a recall, they will only be successful if the trigger conditions do not apply. Otherwise, they will have to disable the recall instead.

columns.name: RecallNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: DateDueCalc
columns.summary: Not editable.  The calculated date due. Generated by the program and subject to change anytime the conditions change. It can be blank (0001-01-01) if no appropriate triggers.

columns.name: DateDue
columns.summary: This is the date that is actually used when doing reports for recall.  It will usually be the same as DateDueCalc unless user has changed it. System will only update this field if it is the same as DateDueCalc.  Otherwise, it will be left alone.  Gets cleared along with DateDueCalc when resetting recall.  When setting disabled, this field will also be cleared.  This is the field to use if converting from another software.

columns.name: DatePrevious
columns.summary: Not editable. Previous date that procedures were done to trigger this recall. It is calculated and enforced automatically. If you want to affect this date, add a procedure to the chart with a status of C, EC, or EO.

columns.name: RecallInterval
columns.summary: The interval between recalls.  The Interval struct combines years, months, weeks, and days into a single integer value.

columns.name: RecallStatus
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum, or 0 for none.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: An administrative note for staff use.

columns.name: IsDisabled
columns.summary: If true, this recall type will be disabled (there's only one type right now). This is usually used rather than deleting the recall type from the patient because trigger conditions must be enforced for all patients.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: Last datetime that this row was inserted or updated.

columns.name: RecallTypeNum
columns.summary: FK to recalltype.RecallTypeNum.

columns.name: DisableUntilBalance
columns.summary: Default is 0.  If a positive number is entered, then the family balance must be less in order for this recall to show in the recall list.

columns.name: DisableUntilDate
columns.summary: If a date is entered, then this recall will be disabled until that date.

columns.name: DateScheduled
columns.summary: This will only have a value if a recall is scheduled.

columns.name: Priority
columns.summary: Enum:RecallPriority Indicates if the appointment has any special priority.

columns.name: TimePatternOverride
columns.summary: Default is an empty string. Used to override a RecallTypes time pattern.

name: recalltrigger
summary: Links one procedurecode to one recalltype.  The presence of this trigger is used when determining DatePrevious in the recall table.

columns.name: RecallTriggerNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: RecallTypeNum
columns.summary: FK to recalltype.RecallTypeNum

columns.name: CodeNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum

name: recalltype
summary: All recalls are based on these recall types.  Recall triggers are in their own table.

columns.name: RecallTypeNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: DefaultInterval
columns.summary: The interval between recalls.  The Interval struct combines years, months, weeks, and days into a single integer value.

columns.name: TimePattern
columns.summary: Stores the length of the appointment in /'s and X's.  Used when scheduling the appointment. Each / or X represents one unit in regards to the global 'Time Increments' appointment view setting. This means that recall appointment lengths change along with the 'Time Increments' preference.  /X/ could rep 15 mins, 30 mins, etc.

columns.name: Procedures
columns.summary: What procedures to put on the recall appointment.  Comma delimited set of ProcCodes.  (We may change this to CodeNums).

columns.name: AppendToSpecial
columns.summary: Set to true if this recall type should be automatically appended to the appointment when scheduling a special recall type. This boolean only gets considered if this recall type is a "manual" or "custom" recall type. If this recall type is flagged as a special recall type then variable is ignored.

name: reconcile
summary: Used in the Accounting section.  Each row represents one reconcile.  Transactions will be attached to it.

columns.name: ReconcileNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: AccountNum
columns.summary: FK to account.AccountNum

columns.name: StartingBal
columns.summary: User enters starting balance here.

columns.name: EndingBal
columns.summary: User enters ending balance here.

columns.name: DateReconcile
columns.summary: The date that the reconcile was performed.

columns.name: IsLocked
columns.summary: If StartingBal + sum of entries selected = EndingBal, then user can lock.  Unlock requires special permission, which nobody will have by default.

name: recurringcharge
summary: This table holds a record of recurring charges that have been attempted.

columns.name: RecurringChargeNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The patient this recurring charge is for.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.ClinicNum. The clinic this recurring charge is for.

columns.name: DateTimeCharge
columns.summary: The date time of the charge.

columns.name: ChargeStatus
columns.summary: Enum:RecurringChargeStatus

columns.name: FamBal
columns.summary: The family balance at the time this charge was created.

columns.name: PayPlanDue
columns.summary: The pay plan due at the time this charge was created.

columns.name: TotalDue
columns.summary: The sum of the FamBal and PayPlanDue at the time this charge was created.

columns.name: RepeatAmt
columns.summary: The recurring charge amount from the credit card at the time this charge was created.

columns.name: ChargeAmt
columns.summary: The amount that was charged (or will be charged if the status is NotYetCharged).

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. The user that processed this charge. Will be 0 if this was done automatically.

columns.name: PayNum
columns.summary: FK to payment.PayNum. The payment created from this charge.

columns.name: CreditCardNum
columns.summary: FK to creditcard.CreditCardNum. The credit card that caused this charge.

columns.name: ErrorMsg
columns.summary: Any error message from processing this charge.

name: refattach
summary: Attaches a referral to a patient.

columns.name: RefAttachNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ReferralNum
columns.summary: FK to referral.ReferralNum.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Order to display in patient info. One-based.  Will be automated more in future.

columns.name: RefDate
columns.summary: Date of referral.

columns.name: RefType
columns.summary: Enum:ReferralType 0=RefTo,1=RefFrom,2=RefCustom.

columns.name: RefToStatus
columns.summary: Enum:ReferralToStatus 0=None,1=Declined,2=Scheduled,3=Consulted,4=InTreatment,5=Complete.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Why the patient was referred out, or less commonly, the circumstances of the referral source. Also used when importing from forms. A referral is created with LName=Other. It gets attached to the patient with a note here.

columns.name: IsTransitionOfCare
columns.summary: Used to track ehr events.  All outgoing referrals default to true.  The incoming ones get a popup asking if it's a transition of care.

columns.name: ProcNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  Used when referring out a patient to track the referring provider for EHR meaningful use.  Will be -1 when RefType is not set to RefTo.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: The datetime this referral attachment was last edited.

name: referral
summary: All info about a referral is stored with that referral even if a patient.  That way, it's available for easy queries.

columns.name: ReferralNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: LName
columns.summary: Last name. Or, if this is a referral like "website" or "word of mouth", then that text goes here in the LName field.

columns.name: FName
columns.summary: First name.

columns.name: MName
columns.summary: Middle name or initial.

columns.name: SSN
columns.summary: SSN or TIN, no punctuation.  For Canada, this holds the referring provider CDA num for claims.

columns.name: UsingTIN
columns.summary: Specificies if SSN is real SSN.

columns.name: Specialty
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.

columns.name: ST
columns.summary: State

columns.name: Telephone
columns.summary: Primary phone, restrictive, must only be 10 digits and only numbers.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Holds important info about the referral.

columns.name: Phone2
columns.summary: Additional phone no restrictions

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: Can't delete a referral, but can hide if not needed any more.

columns.name: NotPerson
columns.summary: Set to true for referralls such as Yellow Pages.

columns.name: Title
columns.summary: i.e. DMD or DDS

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum for referrals that are patients.

columns.name: NationalProvID
columns.summary: NPI for the referral

columns.name: Slip
columns.summary: FK to sheetdef.SheetDefNum.  Referral slips can be set for individual referral sources.  If zero, then the default internal referral slip will be used instead of a custom referral slip.

columns.name: IsDoctor
columns.summary: True if another dentist or physician.  Cannot be a patient.

columns.name: IsTrustedDirect
columns.summary: True if checkbox E-mail Trust for Direct is checked.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: The datetime this referral was last edited.

columns.name: IsPreferred
columns.summary: True if the referral is a preferred referral. The only purpose is to allow filtering in the list of referrals so that the list can be much shorter.

columns.name: BusinessName
columns.summary: Represents the name of the business that the referral works for.

columns.name: DisplayNote
columns.summary: This is a global field used for Scheduling Notes that will show in the family module patient info grid.

name: referralcliniclink
summary: Table to link referrals and clinics together.

columns.name: ReferralClinicLinkNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ReferralNum
columns.summary: FK to referral.ReferralNum.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

name: registrationkey
summary: Keeps track of which product keys have been assigned to which customers. This datatype is only used if the program is being run from a distributor installation. A single customer is allowed to have more than one key, to accommodate for various circumstances, including having multiple physical business locations.

columns.name: RegistrationKeyNum
columns.summary: Primary Key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. The customer to which this registration key applies.

columns.name: RegKey
columns.summary: The registration key as stored in the customer database.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Db note about the registration key. Specifically, the note must include information about the location to which this key pertains, since once at least one key must be assigned to each location to be legal.

columns.name: DateStarted
columns.summary: This will help later with tracking for licensing.

columns.name: DateDisabled
columns.summary: This is used to completely disable a key.  Might possibly even cripple the user's program.  Usually only used if reassigning another key due to abuse or error.  If no date specified, then this key is still valid.

columns.name: DateEnded
columns.summary: This is used when the customer cancels monthly support.  This still allows the customer to get downloads for bug fixes, but only up through a certain version.  Our web server program will use this date to deduce which version they are allowed to have.  Any version that was released as a beta before this date is allowed to be downloaded.

columns.name: IsForeign
columns.summary: This is assigned automatically based on whether the registration key is a US version vs. a foreign version.  The foreign version is not able to unlock the procedure codes.  There are muliple layers of safeguards in place.

columns.name: UsesServerVersion
columns.summary: Deprecated.

columns.name: IsFreeVersion
columns.summary: We have given this customer a free version.  Typically in India.

columns.name: IsOnlyForTesting
columns.summary: This customer is not using the software with live patient data, but only for testing and development purposes.

columns.name: VotesAllotted
columns.summary: Typically 100, although it can be more for multilocation offices.

columns.name: IsResellerCustomer
columns.summary: This is a customer of a reseller, so this customer will not have full access to all our services.

columns.name: HasEarlyAccess
columns.summary: This is a customer that is allowed early access to certain features.  E.g. downloading the Alpha version of the software.

columns.name: DateTBackupScheduled
columns.summary: Deprecated. Moved to the supplementalbackups database. Next date and time of supplemental backup for the customer who owns this registration key.

columns.name: BackupPassCode
columns.summary: Deprecated. Moved to the supplementalbackups database. Pass code for next supplemental backup expected from this customer.

name: reminderrule
summary: Ehr

columns.name: ReminderRuleNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ReminderCriterion
columns.summary: Enum:EhrCriterion Problem,Medication,Allergy,Age,Gender,LabResult.

columns.name: CriterionFK
columns.summary: Foreign key to disease.DiseaseDefNum, medicationpat.MedicationNum, or allergy.AllergyDefNum. Will be 0 if Age, Gender, or LabResult are the trigger.

columns.name: CriterionValue
columns.summary: Only used if Age, Gender, or LabResult are the trigger. Examples: "<25"(must include < or >), "Male"/"Female", "INR" (the simple description of the lab test)

columns.name: Message
columns.summary: Text that will show as the reminder.

name: repeatcharge
summary: Each row represents one charge that will be added. Usually monthly, but quarterly and annually are allowed.

columns.name: RepeatChargeNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: ProcCode
columns.summary: FK to procedurecode.ProcCode.  The code that will be added to the account as a completed procedure.

columns.name: ChargeAmt
columns.summary: The amount that will be charged.  The amount from the procedurecode will not be used.  This way, a repeating charge cannot be accidentally altered.

columns.name: DateStart
columns.summary: The date of the first charge if UseBillingCycleDays is not enabled.  Charges will always be added on the same day of the frequency start date. If UseBillingCycleDays is enabled, repeat charges will be applied on billing cycle day instead. If more than one frequency cycle goes by without applying repeating charges, then multiple procedures will be added.

columns.name: DateStop
columns.summary: The last date on which a charge is allowed. Can be blank (0001-01-01) to represent a perpetual repeating charge.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Any note for internal use.

columns.name: CopyNoteToProc
columns.summary: Indicates that the note should be copied to the corresponding procedure billing note.

columns.name: CreatesClaim
columns.summary: Set to true to have a claim automatically created for the patient with the procedure that is attached to this repeating charge.

columns.name: IsEnabled
columns.summary: Set to false to disable the repeating charge.  This allows patients to have repeating charges in their history that are not active.  Used mainly for repeating charges with notes that should not be deleted.

columns.name: UsePrepay
columns.summary: Set to true to use prepayments for repeating charges.

columns.name: Npi
columns.summary: Stores the NPI of the provider on this repeating charge for Erx.  This used to be stored in the Note field but got moved over to its own column in 17.2.

columns.name: ErxAccountId
columns.summary: Stores the Erx Account ID on this repeating charge for Erx.  This used to be stored in the Note field but got moved over to its own column in 17.2.

columns.name: ProviderName
columns.summary: Stores the name of the provider on this repeating charge for Erx.  Value is received directly from NewCrop.

columns.name: ChargeAmtAlt
columns.summary: HQ Only. An alternate amount to be charged for this RepeatCharge in some cases. Should always default to -1 as -1 will be used as a flag to indicate it has not been set. A value of 0 means ChargeAmtAlt has been intentionally set to 0.

columns.name: UnearnedTypes
columns.summary: If UsePrepay is true, when the procedure is created from this repeat charge, it will allocate payments from these unearned types. Stored as a comma separated list of DefNums of Category PaySplitUnearnedType. If empty, then all unearned types will be considered.

columns.name: Frequency
columns.summary: Enum:EnumRepeatChargeFrequency 0-Monthly, 1-Quarterly, 2-Annually.

name: replicationserver
summary: Replication server information. Used for server specific replication settings, manually entered by the user.  Each row is one server.

columns.name: ReplicationServerNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Descript
columns.summary: The description or name of the server.  Optional.

columns.name: ServerId
columns.summary: Db admin sets this server_id server variable on each replication server.  Allows us to know what server each workstation is connected to.  In display, it's ordered by this value.  Users are always forced to enter a value here.

columns.name: RangeStart
columns.summary: Deprecated. Only used for Random Primary Keys. The start of the key range for this server.  0 if no value entered yet.

columns.name: RangeEnd
columns.summary: Deprecated. Only used for Random Primary Keys. The end of the key range for this server.  0 if no value entered yet.

columns.name: AtoZpath
columns.summary: The AtoZpath for this server. Optional.

columns.name: UpdateBlocked
columns.summary: If true, then this server cannot initiate an update.  Typical for satellite servers.

columns.name: SlaveMonitor
columns.summary: Deprecated. Monitoring the status of replication is now monitored by a separate service. See online manual for information on installing the new service. The description or name of the comptuer that will monitor replication for this server.

name: reqneeded
summary: For Dental Schools.  Requirements needed in order to complete a course.

columns.name: ReqNeededNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SchoolCourseNum
columns.summary: FK to schoolcourse.SchoolCourseNum.  Never 0.

columns.name: SchoolClassNum
columns.summary: FK to schoolclass.SchoolClassNum.  Never 0.

name: reqstudent
summary: For Dental Schools.  The purpose of this table changed significantly in version 4.5.  This now only stores completed requirements.  There can be multiple completed requirements of each ReqNeededNum.  No need to synchronize any longer.

columns.name: ReqStudentNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ReqNeededNum
columns.summary: FK to reqneeded.ReqNeededNum.

columns.name: SchoolCourseNum
columns.summary: FK to schoolcourse.SchoolCourseNum.  Never 0.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  The student.  Never 0.

columns.name: AptNum
columns.summary: FK to appointment.AptNum.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

columns.name: InstructorNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum

columns.name: DateCompleted
columns.summary: The date that the requirement was completed.

name: requiredfield
summary: Each row represents a field that is required to be filled out.

columns.name: RequiredFieldNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: FieldType
columns.summary: Enum:RequiredFieldType . The area of the program that uses this field.

columns.name: FieldName
columns.summary: Enum:RequiredFieldName

name: requiredfieldcondition
summary: When one of these conditions is true, the corresponding requiredfield will be triggered.

columns.name: RequiredFieldConditionNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: RequiredFieldNum
columns.summary: FK to requiredfield.RequiredFieldNum.

columns.name: ConditionType
columns.summary: Enum:RequiredFieldName

columns.name: Operator
columns.summary: Enum:ConditionOperator . The operator that is being applied to the ConditionType.

columns.name: ConditionValue
columns.summary: The value that the condition is being compared against. Could be 18, Fulltime, Male, etc.

columns.name: ConditionRelationship
columns.summary: Enum:LogicalOperator 0-None,1-And,2-Or. This field is only used when comparing continuous values such as age or date.

name: rxalert
summary: Many-to-many relationship connecting Rx with DiseaseDef, AllergyDef, or Medication.  Only one of those links may be specified in a single row; the other two will be 0.

columns.name: RxAlertNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: RxDefNum
columns.summary: FK to rxdef.RxDefNum.  This alert is to be shown when user attempts to write an Rx for this RxDef.

columns.name: DiseaseDefNum
columns.summary: FK to diseasedef.DiseaseDefNum.  Only if DrugProblem interaction.  This is compared against disease.DiseaseDefNum using PatNum.  Drug-Problem (they call it Drug-Diagnosis) checking is also performed in NewCrop.

columns.name: AllergyDefNum
columns.summary: FK to allergydef.AllergyDefNum.  Only if DrugAllergy interaction.  Compared against allergy.AllergyDefNum using PatNum.  Drug-Allergy checking is also perfomed in NewCrop.

columns.name: MedicationNum
columns.summary: FK to medication.MedicationNum.  Only if DrugDrug interaction.  This will be compared against medicationpat.MedicationNum using PatNum.  Drug-Drug checking is also performed in NewCrop.

columns.name: NotificationMsg
columns.summary: This is typically blank, so a default message will be displayed by OD.  But if this contains a message, then this message will be used instead.

columns.name: IsHighSignificance
columns.summary: False by default.  Set to true to flag the drug-drug or drug-allergy intervention as high significance.

name: rxdef
summary: Rx definitions.  Can safely delete or alter, because they get copied to the rxPat table, not referenced.

columns.name: RxDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Drug
columns.summary: The name of the drug.

columns.name: Sig
columns.summary: Directions intended for the pharmacist.

columns.name: Disp
columns.summary: Amount to dispense.

columns.name: Refills
columns.summary: Number of refills.

columns.name: Notes
columns.summary: Notes about this drug. Will not be copied to the rxpat.

columns.name: IsControlled
columns.summary: Is a controlled substance.  This will affect the way it prints.

columns.name: RxCui
columns.summary: RxNorm Code identifier.  Copied down into medicationpat.RxCui (medical order) when a prescription is written.

columns.name: IsProcRequired
columns.summary: If true will require procedure be attached to this prescription when printed.  Usually true if IsControlled is true.

columns.name: PatientInstruction
columns.summary: Directions intended for the patient.

name: rxnorm
summary: RxNorm created from a zip file.

columns.name: RxNormNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: RxCui
columns.summary: RxNorm Concept universal ID.  Throughout the program, this is actually used as the Primary Key of this table rather than the RxNormNum.

columns.name: MmslCode
columns.summary: Multum code.  Only used for crosscoding during import/export with electronic Rx program.  User cannot see multum codes.  Most of the rows in this table do not have an MmslCode and user searches ignore rows with an MmslCode.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Only used for RxNorms, not Multums.

name: rxpat
summary: One Rx for one patient. Copied from rxdef rather than linked to it.

columns.name: RxNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: RxDate
columns.summary: Date of Rx.

columns.name: Drug
columns.summary: Drug name. Example: PenVK 500 mg capsules. Example: Percocet 5/500 tablets.

columns.name: Sig
columns.summary: Directions intended for the pharmacist. Example: Take 2 tablets twice a day.

columns.name: Disp
columns.summary: Amount to dispense. Example: 12 (twelve)

columns.name: Refills
columns.summary: Number of refills. Example: 3.  Example: 1 per month.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: Notes
columns.summary: Notes specific to this Rx.  Will not show on the printout.  For staff use only.

columns.name: PharmacyNum
columns.summary: FK to pharmacy.PharmacyNum.

columns.name: IsControlled
columns.summary: Is a controlled substance.  This will affect the way it prints.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: The last date and time this row was altered.  Not user editable.

columns.name: SendStatus
columns.summary: Enum:RxSendStatus

columns.name: RxCui
columns.summary: Deprecated.  RxNorm Code identifier.  Was used in FormRxSend for EHR 2011, but FormRxSend has been deleted.  No longer in use anywhere.  Still exists in db for now.

columns.name: DosageCode
columns.summary: NCI Pharmaceutical Dosage Form code.  Only used with ehr.  For example, C48542 is the code for Tablet dosing unit.  User enters code manually, and it's only used for Rx Send, which will be deprecated with 2014 cert.  Guaranteed that nobody actually uses or cares about this field.

columns.name: ErxGuid
columns.summary: eRx returns this unique identifier to use for electronic Rx.  Also set for Open Dental created medications using a different format.

columns.name: IsErxOld
columns.summary: True for historic prescriptions which existed prior to version 15.4.  The purpose of this column is to keep historic reports accurate.

columns.name: ErxPharmacyInfo
columns.summary: The pharmacyinfo field contains the pharmacy name as well as other information about the pharmacy, but the information is inconsistent.  The purpose of this field is to give the user means to visually verify they have the correct pharmacy selected.

columns.name: IsProcRequired
columns.summary: If true will require procedure be attached to this prescription when printed.  Usually true if IsControlled is true.

columns.name: ProcNum
columns.summary: The procedure attached to this prescription when IsProcRequired is true.

columns.name: DaysOfSupply
columns.summary: The number of days this prescription is intended to last.  Only used when IsProcRequired is true.

columns.name: PatientInstruction
columns.summary: Directions intended for the patient.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. Used to log who is accessing pdmp bridge

columns.name: RxType
columns.summary: Enum:RxTypes to check what bridge is being used to access pdmp. Indexed in database

name: schedule
summary: One block of time.  Either for practice, provider, employee, or blockout.

columns.name: ScheduleNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SchedDate
columns.summary: Date for this timeblock.

columns.name: StartTime
columns.summary: Start time for this timeblock.

columns.name: StopTime
columns.summary: Stop time for this timeblock.

columns.name: SchedType
columns.summary: Enum:ScheduleType 0=Practice,1=Provider,2=Blockout,3=Employee.  Practice is used as a way to indicate holidays and as a way to put a note in for the entire practice for one day.  But whenever type is Practice, times will be ignored.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum if a provider type.

columns.name: BlockoutType
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum if blockout.  eg. HighProduction, RCT Only, Emerg.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: This contains various types of text entered by the user.

columns.name: Status
columns.summary: Enum:SchedStatus enumeration 0=Open,1=Closed,2=Holiday.  All blocks have a status of Open, but user doesn't see the status. The "closed" status was previously used to override the defaults when the last timeblock was deleted.  But it's nearly phased out now. Still used by blockouts.  Holidays are a special type of practice schedule item which do not have providers attached. Used to differentiate between Practice SchedType Holidays and Notes.

columns.name: EmployeeNum
columns.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: Last datetime that this row was inserted or updated.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum if SchedType.Practice (holidays and practice notes) and applies to one clinic (operatories for one clinic). If SchedType.Practice and this applies to all clinics, or if any other SchedType, ClinicNum will be 0.  There won't be any scheduleop rows linking this schedule to operatories when the type is SchedType.Practice.  Instead, the linkage is implied based on the operatory.ClinicNum and applies to all operatories for the clinic.

columns.name: ScheduledProcessNum
columns.summary: Primary Key

columns.name: ScheduledAction
columns.summary: Enum:ScheduledActionEnum

columns.name: TimeToRun
columns.summary: What time of the day it's supposed to run.

columns.name: FrequencyToRun
columns.summary: Enum:FrequencyToRunEnum

columns.name: LastRanDateTime
columns.summary: Date and time when process last ran.

name: scheduleop
summary: Links one schedule block to one operatory.  A schedule block can be linked to one or more operatories.  A schedule can also not have any scheduleops.  For example the provider schedule.

columns.name: ScheduleOpNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ScheduleNum
columns.summary: FK to schedule.ScheduleNum.

columns.name: OperatoryNum
columns.summary: FK to operatory.OperatoryNum.

name: schoolclass
summary: Used in dental schools.  eg. Dental 2009 or Hygiene 2007.

columns.name: SchoolClassNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: GradYear
columns.summary: The year this class will graduate

columns.name: Descript
columns.summary: Description of this class. eg Dental or Hygiene

name: schoolcourse
summary: Used in dental schools.  eg OP 732 Operative Dentistry Clinic II.

columns.name: SchoolCourseNum

columns.name: CourseID
columns.summary: Alphanumeric.  eg PEDO 732.

columns.name: Descript
columns.summary: eg: Pediatric Dentistry Clinic II

name: screen
summary: Used in public health.  This screening table is meant to be general purpose.  It is compliant with the popular Basic Screening Survey.  It is also designed with minimal foreign keys and can be easily adapted to a tablet PC.  This table can be used with only the screengroup table, but is more efficient if provider, school, and county tables are also available.

columns.name: ScreenNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: Gender
columns.summary: Enum:PatientGender

columns.name: RaceOld
columns.summary: Enum:PatientRaceOld and ethnicity.

columns.name: GradeLevel
columns.summary: Enum:PatientGrade

columns.name: Age
columns.summary: Age of patient at the time the screening was done. Faster than recording birthdates.

columns.name: Urgency
columns.summary: Enum:TreatmentUrgency

columns.name: HasCaries
columns.summary: Enum:YN Set to true if patient has cavities.

columns.name: NeedsSealants
columns.summary: Enum:YN Set to true if patient needs sealants.

columns.name: CariesExperience
columns.summary: Enum:YN

columns.name: EarlyChildCaries
columns.summary: Enum:YN

columns.name: ExistingSealants
columns.summary: Enum:YN

columns.name: MissingAllTeeth
columns.summary: Enum:YN

columns.name: Birthdate
columns.summary: Optional

columns.name: ScreenGroupNum
columns.summary: FK to screengroup.ScreenGroupNum.

columns.name: ScreenGroupOrder
columns.summary: The order of this item within its group.

columns.name: ScreenPatNum
columns.summary: FK to screenpat.ScreenPatNum.

columns.name: SheetNum
columns.summary: FK to sheet.SheetNum

name: screengroup
summary: Used in public health.  The database table only has 3 columns.  There are 5 additional columns in C# that are not in the databae.  These extra columns are used in the UI to organize input, and are transferred to the screen table as needed.

columns.name: ScreenGroupNum
columns.summary: Primary key

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Up to the user.

columns.name: SGDate
columns.summary: The date of the screening.

columns.name: ProvName
columns.summary: Required.  Could be the name of the screener and not a provider necessarily.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  ProvNAME is always entered, but ProvNum supplements it by letting user select from list. When entering a provNum, the name will be filled in automatically. Can be 0 if the provider is not in the list, but provName is required.

columns.name: PlaceService
columns.summary: Enum:PlaceOfService Describes where the screening will take place.

columns.name: County
columns.summary: FK to county.CountyName, although it will not crash if key absent.

columns.name: GradeSchool
columns.summary: FK to site.Description, although it will not crash if key absent.

columns.name: SheetDefNum
columns.summary: FK to sheetdef.SheetDefNum

name: screenpat
summary: This allows users to set up a list of students prior to actually going to the school.  It also serves to attach the exam sheet to the screening.

columns.name: ScreenPatNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

columns.name: ScreenGroupNum
columns.summary: FK to screengroup.ScreenGroupNum. Every screening is attached to a group (classroom)

columns.name: SheetNum
columns.summary: Was never used.  Was supposed to be FK to sheetdef.Sheet_DEF_Num, so not even named correctly.

columns.name: PatScreenPerm
columns.summary: Enum:PatScreenPerm

name: securitylog
summary: Stores an ongoing record of database activity for security purposes.  User not allowed to edit.

columns.name: SecurityLogNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PermType
columns.summary: Enum:EnumPermType

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum

columns.name: LogDateTime
columns.summary: The date and time of the entry.  It's value is set when inserting and can never change.  Even if a user changes the date on their computer, this remains accurate because it uses server time.

columns.name: LogText
columns.summary: The description of exactly what was done. Varies by permission type.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  Can be 0 if not applicable.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: A foreign key to a table associated with the PermType. 0 indicates not in use.This is typically used for objects that have specific audit trails so that users can see all audit entries related to a particular object.Every permission using FKey should be included and implmented in the CrudAuditPerms enum so that securitylog FKeys are note orphaned.Additonaly, the tabletype will to have the [CrudTable(CrudAuditPerms=CrudAuditPerm._____] added with the new CrudAuditPerm you created.For the patient portal, it is used to indicate logs created on behalf of other patients.It's uses include:  AptNum with PermType AppointmentCreate, AppointmentEdit, or AppointmentMove tracks all appointment logs for a particularappointment.CodeNum with PermType ProcFeeEdit currently only tracks fee changes.PatNum with PermType PatientPortal represents an entry that a patient made on behalf of another patient. The PatNum column will represent the patient who is taking the action.PlanNum with PermType InsPlanChangeCarrierName tracks carrier name changes.

columns.name: LogSource
columns.summary: Enum:LogSources None, WebSched, InsPlanImport834, FHIR, PatientPortal.

columns.name: DefNum
columns.summary: Not used.

columns.name: DefNumError
columns.summary: Not used.

columns.name: DateTPrevious
columns.summary: Used to store the previous DateTStamp or SecDateTEdit of the object FKey refers to.

name: securityloghash
summary: Stores hashes of audit logs for detecting alteration.  User not allowed to edit.

columns.name: SecurityLogHashNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SecurityLogNum
columns.summary: FK to securityLog.SecurityLogNum.

columns.name: LogHash
columns.summary: The SHA-256 hash of PermType, UserNum, LogDateTime, LogText, and PatNum, all concatenated together.  This hash has length of 32 bytes encoded as base64.  Used to detect if the entry has been altered outside of Open Dental.

name: sessiontoken
summary: Stores the session token for when a user has logged into something.

columns.name: SessionTokenNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SessionTokenHash
columns.summary: The hash of the token. Hashed using SHA3_512 without a salt.

columns.name: Expiration
columns.summary: The datetime when this token will expire.

columns.name: TokenType
columns.summary: Enum:SessionTokenType The type of token this is.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: The FKey this token is for. For Patient Portal tokens, this is patient.PatNum. For Mobile Web tokens, this is userod.UserNum.

name: sheet
summary: One sheet for one patient. A better name might be Form, but that name is not unique enough and has already been used by MS. Sheets allow customized layout for things like postcards and lab slips. They also support data that the user fills out for things like medical histories.

columns.name: SheetNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SheetType
columns.summary: Enum:SheetTypeEnum

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  A saved sheet is always attached to a patient (except deposit slip).  There are a few sheets that are so minor that they don't get saved, such as a Carrier label.

columns.name: DateTimeSheet
columns.summary: The date and time of the sheet as it will be displayed in the commlog.

columns.name: FontSize
columns.summary: The default fontSize for the sheet.  The actual font must still be saved with each sheetField.

columns.name: FontName
columns.summary: The default fontName for the sheet.  The actual font must still be saved with each sheetField.

columns.name: Width
columns.summary: Width of each page in the sheet in pixels, 100 pixels per inch.

columns.name: Height
columns.summary: Height of each page in the sheet in pixels, 100 pixels per inch.

columns.name: InternalNote
columns.summary: An internal note for the use of the office staff regarding the sheet.  Not to be printed on the sheet in any way.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Copied from the SheetDef description.

columns.name: ShowInTerminal
columns.summary: Examples: 1, 2, etc. The order that this sheet will show in the Kiosk queue, or zero if not set. Also determines if it will show in eClipboard in addition to any eClipboardSheetDef. For eClipboard, this is just treated like a boolean and that actual order is ignored.

columns.name: IsWebForm
columns.summary: True if this sheet was downloaded from the webforms service. EForms uses Status field instead.

columns.name: IsMultiPage
columns.summary: Forces old single page behavior, ignoring page breaks.

columns.name: IsDeleted
columns.summary: Indicates whether or not this sheet has been marked deleted.

columns.name: SheetDefNum
columns.summary: FK to sheetdef.SheetDefNum. The SheetDef that was used to create this sheet. Will be 0 if an internal sheet or if the sheet was created before 17.2. Can be 0 for sheets that were created from web forms that were associated to web form sheet defs missing this value at HQ. The original purpose of this column was to use it in connection with RefID of the Sheet and SheetDef to automate the updating of forms such as office policies when they change significantly. It is now also used when making a copy of a sheet. Also used alongside EClipboardSheetDef to determine whether patient has already filled out a form.

columns.name: DocNum
columns.summary: FK to document.DocNum.  Referral letters are stored as PDF in the A to Z folder.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum. Used by webforms to limit the sheets displayed based on the currently selected clinic.

columns.name: DateTSheetEdited
columns.summary: The date and time the sheet was inserted or last time someone opened the sheet and clicked OK on FormSheetFillEdit. Gets updated even if no changes were made to the sheet or sheetfields, because we don't want to do the lengthy work of comparing all fields. Used when editing a sheet to warn user if the sheet has been edited by someone else.

columns.name: HasMobileLayout
