columns.summary: If true then this Sheet has been designed for mobile and will be displayed as a mobile-friendly WebForm.

columns.name: RevID
columns.summary: Revision ID. Used to determine in conjunction with PrefillMode for eClipboard to determine whether to show a patient a new form or have them update their last filled out form. Must match up with SheetDef RevID to show a previously filled out form.

columns.name: WebFormSheetID
columns.summary: Only set when this sheet was created from a Web Form. FK to webforms_sheet.SheetID within the Web Forms server. Used to determine if this particular Web Form has been retrieved before in order to avoid creating duplicate sheet entries for a single Web Form.

name: sheetdef
summary: A definition (template) for a sheet.  Can be pulled from the database, or it can be internally defined.

columns.name: SheetDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: The description of this sheetdef.

columns.name: SheetType
columns.summary: Enum:SheetTypeEnum

columns.name: FontSize
columns.summary: The default fontSize for the sheet.  The actual font must still be saved with each sheetField.

columns.name: FontName
columns.summary: The default fontName for the sheet.  The actual font must still be saved with each sheetField.

columns.name: Width
columns.summary: Width of each page in the sheet in pixels, 100 pixels per inch.

columns.name: Height
columns.summary: Height of each page in the sheet in pixels, 100 pixels per inch.

columns.name: IsLandscape
columns.summary: Set to true to print landscape.

columns.name: PageCount
columns.summary: Amount of editable space. Actual size when filling sheet may be different.

columns.name: IsMultiPage
columns.summary: If false, forces old single page behavior which ignores page breaks.

columns.name: BypassGlobalLock
columns.summary: Enum:BypassLockStatus Specifies whether a sheet can be created before the global lock date.

columns.name: HasMobileLayout
columns.summary: If true then this Sheet has been designed for mobile and will be displayed as a mobile-friendly WebForm.

columns.name: DateTCreated
columns.summary: The Date and time that SheetDef was created. Defaults to 0001-01-01 00:00:00 for existing sheets. When duplicating a custom sheet,  if the original custom sheet's DateTCreated is 0001-01-01 00:00:00, the duplicate's DateTCreated will also be 0001-01-01 00:00:00. This is  because this column is used for altering text fields' positions in PDFs.

columns.name: RevID
columns.summary: Revision ID. Gets updated any time a sheet field is added or deleted from a sheetdef (this includes any time a new language is added) or a static text field is changed. Used to determine in conjunction with PrefillMode for eClipboard to determine whether to show a patient a new form or have them update their last filled out form. Must match up with Sheet RevID to show a filled out form.

columns.name: AutoCheckSaveImage
columns.summary: Indicates whether sheets created with this sheet def get copied to the imaging module when changes are made and saved. It's badly named since we don't use a checkbox anymore.

columns.name: AutoCheckSaveImageDocCategory
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Used to override the category that is selected when auto saving the sheet to the imaging module.  This allows users to choose the category that a sheet is saved to on a per sheet basis.

name: sheetfield
summary: One field on a sheet. Any language translations have already happened. See SheetFieldDef. How Exam Sheet replacement fields work: Fields can be placed in a static text field on a PatientLetter, ReferralSlip, or ReferralLetter. 1. For fields with FieldName (not misc), format is [ExamSheet:ExamSheetName;FieldName]. 2. For misc radiobuttons, format is [ExamSheet:ExamSheetName;RadioButtonGroupName]. 3. For other fields, format is [ExamSheet:ExamSheetName;ReportableName].

columns.name: SheetFieldNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SheetNum
columns.summary: FK to sheet.SheetNum.

columns.name: FieldType
columns.summary: Enum:SheetFieldType  OutputText, InputField, StaticText,Parameter(only used for SheetField, not SheetFieldDef),Image,Drawing,Line,Rectangle,CheckBox,SigBox,PatImage,Grid, etc.

columns.name: FieldValue
columns.summary: For OutputText, this value is set before printing.  This is the data obtained from the database and ready to print.  For StaticText, this is copied from the sheetFieldDef, but in-line fields like [this] will have been filled.  For an archived sheet retrieved from the database (all SheetField rows), this value will have been saved and will not be filled again automatically.For InputField, this is the filled value. If an an AutoNote attached, then this field will start out like AutoNoteNum:### until they click to fill out the autonote.Parameter fieldtype: this will store the value of the parameter. FKs are numbers. Two of the parameters allow multiple ProcNums, which are stored here as comma list.Drawing fieldtype: this will be the point data for the lines.  The format would look similar to this: 45,68;48,70;49,72;0,0;55,88;etc.  It's simply a sequence of points, separated by semicolons.CheckBox: it will either be an X or empty.SigBox: the first char will be 0 or 1 to indicate SigIsTopaz, and all subsequent chars will be the Signature itself.PatImage: FK to document.DocNum, or blank, or "MountNum:####" to indicate mount instead of document.ComboBox: The chosen option, semicolon, then a pipe delimited list of options such as: March;January|February|March|AprilScreenChart: Contains a semicolon delimited list of a  single number followed by groups of comma separated surfaces. The first digit represents what type of ScreenChart it is.  0 = Permanent, 1 = Primary It may look like 0;S,P,N;S,S,S;... etc.Grid: Not used. All grid content is generated on the fly rather than preserved in the database. In the future, we should serialize grid into  here. But we probably have to overhaul the language translation for grids first.

columns.name: FontSize
columns.summary: The fontSize for this field regardless of the default for the sheet.  The actual font must be saved with each sheetField.

columns.name: FontName
columns.summary: The fontName for this field regardless of the default for the sheet.  The actual font must be saved with each sheetField.

columns.name: XPos
columns.summary: In pixels.

columns.name: YPos
columns.summary: In pixels.

columns.name: Width
columns.summary: The field will be constrained horizontally to this size.  Not allowed to be zero.

columns.name: Height
columns.summary: The field will be constrained vertically to this size.  Not allowed to be stored as 0.  It's not allowed to be zero so that it will be visible on the designer. Set to 0 in memory by SheetUtil.CalculateHeights if image is innacessible for printing.

columns.name: GrowthBehavior
columns.summary: Enum:GrowthBehaviorEnum

columns.name: RadioButtonValue
columns.summary: This is only used for checkboxes that you want to behave like radiobuttons.  Set the FieldName the same for each Checkbox in the group.  The FieldValue will likely be X for one of them and empty string for the others.  Each of them will have a different RadioButtonValue.  Whichever box has X, the RadioButtonValue for that box will be used when importing.  This field is not used for "misc" radiobutton groups.

columns.name: RadioButtonGroup
columns.summary: Only used for radiobuttons with FieldName set to "misc". Name which identifies the group within which the radio button belongs.

columns.name: IsRequired
columns.summary: Set to true if this field is required to have a value before the sheet is closed.

columns.name: TabOrder
columns.summary: Tab stop order for all fields. Only checkboxes and input fields can have values other than 0.

columns.name: ReportableName
columns.summary: Allows reporting on misc fields using queries. See summary of this table for explanation of how they can be used in Exam Sheet replacement fields.

columns.name: TextAlign
columns.summary: Text Alignment for text fields.

columns.name: ItemColor
columns.summary: Text color, line color, rectangle color. -16777216 is Black. 0 means Empty, which we attempt to treat as black if it happens.

columns.name: DateTimeSig
columns.summary: DateTime that a sheet was signed.

columns.name: IsLocked
columns.summary: Only used in Output and Static fields. Gets locked in the setup and cannot be edited at all once it is in the SheetFillEdit window. Example might be for text of a consent form.

columns.name: TabOrderMobile
columns.summary: Tab stop order for all fields of a mobile sheet. One-based.  Only mobile fields can have values other than 0.  If all SheetFieldDefs for a given SheetField are 0 then assume that this sheet has no mobile-specific view.

columns.name: UiLabelMobile
columns.summary: Each input field for a mobile will need a corresponding UI label. This is what the user sees as the label describing what this input is for. EG "First Name:, Last Name:, Address, etc." For check boxes, this field should be blank otherwise a group box will be displayed to the user with this text. For radio buttons, this field should be set to the text of the group caption.

columns.name: UiLabelMobileRadioButton
columns.summary: Human-readable label that will be displayed for radio button or checkbox item.  Cannot use UiLabelMobile for this purpose as it is already dedicated to the radio group header that groups radio button items together. This is also used in Exam Sheet replacement fields as the value to show for checkboxes and radiobuttons.

columns.name: SheetFieldDefNum
columns.summary: FK to sheetfielddef.SheetFieldDefNum. Only used in the Patient Forms window when the Prefill button is clicked.

columns.name: CanElectronicallySign
columns.summary: When true, allows a user to sign a signature box electronically.  ESign/DigitallySign means clicking instead of using a stylus to write out the sig. If IsSigProvRestricted, then the E button for digitally signing won't be visible unless a provider is signed in. There is a completely separate Pref.SignatureAllowDigital which only applies to signing procedures etc., not sheets.

columns.name: IsSigProvRestricted
columns.summary: When true, only allows the signature box to be signed by a provider. There is a completely separate Pref.NotesProviderSignatureOnly for doing the same thing in procedures etc., not sheets.

columns.name: UserSigned
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. Only for sig boxes. Stores the OD user that signed. Only stores it if the user.ProvNum > 0. Only needed when user clicks to change user before signing. Will have a value of 0 for sheets with sigboxes which have "Allow Electronic Signatures" or "Restrict Signature to Providers" left unchecked (ex. MedicalHistory sheet sigbox). In the richtextbox for drawing SigBoxes in FormSheetFillEdit.cs: "By: " will not show with the username if UserSigned value is 0. This is only used in sheets because other places like FormProcEdit can store in procnote.UserNum. Sheets is also the only places where the change user button shows within the sig box.

name: sheetfielddef
summary: One field on a sheetDef. Language translations are handled by the LanguagePat table. See SheetField. How Exam Sheet replacement fields work: Fields can be placed in a static text field on a PatientLetter, ReferralSlip, or ReferralLetter. 1. For fields with FieldName (not misc), format is [ExamSheet:ExamSheetName;FieldName]. 2. For misc radiobuttons, format is [ExamSheet:ExamSheetName;RadioButtonGroupName]. 3. For other fields, format is [ExamSheet:ExamSheetName;ReportableName].

columns.name: SheetFieldDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SheetDefNum
columns.summary: FK to sheetdef.SheetDefNum.

columns.name: FieldType
columns.summary: Enum:SheetFieldType  OutputText, InputField, StaticText,Parameter(only used for SheetField, not SheetFieldDef),Image,Drawing,Line,Rectangle,CheckBox,SigBox,PatImage,Grid, etc.

columns.name: FieldName
columns.summary: FieldName is used differently for different FieldTypes. For OutputText, each sheet typically has a main datatable type. For example statements correspond to the statment table. See SheetFieldsAvailable.GetList() for available values.If output field exactly matches a column from the main table this will be the <ColumnName>. For example, "FName" on patient Forms.If the output field exactly matches a column a different table this will be the <tablename>.<ColumnName>. For example, appt.Note on Routing Slips.If the output field is not a database column it must start with lowercase letter. For example, "statementReceiptInvoice" on Statements.For InputField, these are hardcoded to correspond to DB fields, for example "FName" corresponsds to patient.FNam See SheetFieldsAvailable.GetList() for available values.For Image, this file name with extention, for example "image1.jpg". Some image names are handled specially, for example  Info.gif". Images are stored in <imagefolder>\SheetImages\image1.jpg.For CheckBox, this groups checkboxes together so that only one per group can be checked.For PatImage, this is name of the DocCategory.For Special, identifies the type of special field. Currently only ToothChart and ToothChartLegend.For Grid, this is the specific type of grid. See SheetUti GetDataTableForGridType() for values. For example "StatementPayPlan". Column names use hard coded display fields that can be found in SheetUtil.GetGridColumnAvailable().For all fieldtypes, FieldName is blank or irrelevant.

columns.name: FieldValue
columns.summary: For StaticText, this text can include bracketed fields, like [nameLF]. For OutputText and InputField, this will be blank.  If an InputField has an AutoNote attached, then this field will be AutoNoteNum:'value'. Example AutoNoteNum:268.For CheckBoxes, either or blank.  Even if the checkbox is set to behave like a radio button.  For Pat Images, this is blank.  The filename of a PatImage will later be stored in SheetField.FieldValue ComboBoxes, the chosen option, semicolon, then a pipe delimited list of options such as: March;January|February|March|AprilFor ScreenCharts, a semicolon delimited list of comma surfaces.  It may look like S,P,N;S,S,S;... etc.For Grid, not used. All grid content is generated on the fly rather than preserved in the database. In the future, we should serialize content into here. But we probably have to overhaul the language translation for grids first.

columns.name: FontSize
columns.summary: The fontSize for this field regardless of the default for the sheet.  The actual font must be saved with each sheetField.

columns.name: FontName
columns.summary: The fontName for this field regardless of the default for the sheet.  The actual font must be saved with each sheetField.

columns.name: XPos
columns.summary: In pixels.

columns.name: YPos
columns.summary: In pixels.

columns.name: Width
columns.summary: The field will be constrained horizontally to this size.  Not allowed to be zero. When SheetType is associated to a dynamic layout def and GrowthBehavior is set to a dynamic value this value represents the corresponding controls minimum width.

columns.name: Height
columns.summary: The field will be constrained vertically to this size.  Not allowed to be 0.  It's not allowed to be zero so that it will be visible on the designer. When SheetType is associated to a dynamic layout def and GrowthBehavior is set to a dynamic value this value represents the corresponding controls minimum height.

columns.name: GrowthBehavior
columns.summary: Enum:GrowthBehaviorEnum

columns.name: RadioButtonValue
columns.summary: This is only used for checkboxes that you want to behave like radiobuttons.  Set the FieldName the same for each Checkbox in the group.  The FieldValue will likely be X for one of them and empty string for the others.  Each of them will have a different RadioButtonValue.  Whichever box has X, the RadioButtonValue for that box will be used when importing.  This field is not used for "misc" radiobutton groups.

columns.name: RadioButtonGroup
columns.summary: Only used for radiobuttons with FieldName set to "misc". Name which identifies the group within which the radio button belongs.

columns.name: IsRequired
columns.summary: Set to true if this field is required to have a value before the sheet is closed.

columns.name: TabOrder
columns.summary: The Bitmap should be converted to Base64 using POut.Bitmap() before placing in this field.  Not stored in the database.  Only used when uploading SheetDefs to the web server.

columns.name: ReportableName
columns.summary: Allows reporting on misc fields using queries. See summary of this table for explanation of how they can be used in Exam Sheet replacement fields.

columns.name: TextAlign
columns.summary: Text Alignment for text fields.

columns.name: IsPaymentOption
columns.summary: Used to determine if the field should be hidden when printing statements.

columns.name: ItemColor
columns.summary: Text color, line color, rectangle color.

columns.name: IsLocked
columns.summary: Only used in Output and Static fields. Gets locked in the setup and cannot be edited at all once it is in the SheetFillEdit window. Example might be for text of a consent form.

columns.name: TabOrderMobile
columns.summary: Tab stop order for all fields of a mobile sheet. One-based.  Only mobile fields can have values other than 0. If all SheetFieldDefs for a given SheetField are 0 then assume that this sheet has no mobile-specific view.

columns.name: UiLabelMobile
columns.summary: Each input field for a mobile will need a corresponding UI label. This is what the user sees as the label describing what this input is for. EG "First Name:, Last Name:, Address, etc." For check boxes, this field should be blank otherwise a group box will be displayed to the user with this text. For radio buttons, this field should be set to the text of the group caption.

columns.name: UiLabelMobileRadioButton
columns.summary: Human-readable label that will be displayed for radio button or checkbox item.  Cannot use UiLabelMobile for this purpose as it is already dedicated to the radio group header that groups radio button items together. This is also used in Exam Sheet replacement fields as the value to show for checkboxes and radiobuttons.

columns.name: LayoutMode
columns.summary: Enum:SheetFieldLayoutMode Just used in Chart module for ecw or medical. Otherwise, use SheetFieldLayoutMode.Default. TP mode in Chart module is no longer included here.

columns.name: Language
columns.summary: Blank by default. When set, patient.Language will attempt to match to SheetFieldDefs with a matching Language value.

columns.name: CanElectronicallySign
columns.summary: When true, allows a user to sign a signature box electronically which means clicking instead of using a stylus to write out the sig. If IsSigProvRestricted, then the E button for digitally signing won't be visible unless a provider is signed in. There is a completely separate Pref.SignatureAllowDigital which only applies to signing procedures etc., not sheets.

columns.name: IsSigProvRestricted
columns.summary: When true, only allows the signature box to be signed by a provider. There is a completely separate Pref.NotesProviderSignatureOnly for doing the same thing in procedures etc., not sheets.

name: sigbutdef
summary: This defines the light buttons on the left of the main screen.

columns.name: SigButDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ButtonText
columns.summary: The text on the button

columns.name: ButtonIndex
columns.summary: 0-based index defines the order of the buttons.

columns.name: SynchIcon
columns.summary: 0=none, or 1-9. The cell in the 3x3 tic-tac-toe main program icon that is to be synched with this button.  It will light up or clear whenever this button lights or clears.

columns.name: ComputerName
columns.summary: Blank for the default buttons.  Or contains the computer name for the buttons that override the defaults.

columns.name: SigElementDefNumUser
columns.summary: FK to sigelementdef.SigElementDefNum

columns.name: SigElementDefNumExtra
columns.summary: FK to sigelementdef.SigElementDefNum

columns.name: SigElementDefNumMsg
columns.summary: FK to sigelementdef.SigElementDefNum

name: sigelementdef
summary: This defines the items that will be available for clicking when composing a manual message. Also, these are referred to in the button definitions as a sequence of elements.

columns.name: SigElementDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: LightRow
columns.summary: If this element should cause a button to light up, this would be the row.  0 means none.

columns.name: LightColor
columns.summary: If a light row is set, this is the color it will turn when triggered.  Ack sets it back to white.  Note that color and row can be in two separate elements of the same signal.

columns.name: SigElementType
columns.summary: Enum:SignalElementType  0=User,1=Extra,2=Message.

columns.name: SigText
columns.summary: The text that shows for the element, like the user name or the two word message.  No long text is stored here.

columns.name: Sound
columns.summary: The sound to play for this element.  Wav file stored in the database in string format until "played".  If empty string, then no sound.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: The order of this element within the list of the same type.

name: sigmessage
summary: These are messages sent and received in the Manage module. Affects the main icon with the 9 boxes. Also causes a recorded sound to play so that everyone knows who the message is for.

columns.name: SigMessageNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ButtonText
columns.summary: The text on the button

columns.name: ButtonIndex
columns.summary: 0-based index defines the order of the buttons.

columns.name: SynchIcon
columns.summary: 0=none, or 1-9. The cell in the 3x3 tic-tac-toe main program icon that is to be synched with this button. It will light up or clear whenever this button lights or clears.

columns.name: FromUser
columns.summary: Text version of 'user' this message was sent from, which can actually be any description of a group or individual.

columns.name: ToUser
columns.summary: Text version of 'user' this message was sent to, which can actually be any description of a group or individual.

columns.name: MessageDateTime
columns.summary: Automatically set to the date and time upon insert.  Uses server time.

columns.name: AckDateTime
columns.summary: This date time will get set as soon as this message has been acknowledged.  How lights get turned off.

columns.name: SigText
columns.summary: The text that shows for the element, like the user name or the two word message.  No long text is stored here.

columns.name: SigElementDefNumUser
columns.summary: FK to sigelementdef.SigElementDefNum

columns.name: SigElementDefNumExtra
columns.summary: FK to sigelementdef.SigElementDefNum

columns.name: SigElementDefNumMsg
columns.summary: FK to sigelementdef.SigElementDefNum

name: signalod
summary: Open Dental uses a memory cache for many common small tables that don't change very often. If one computer makes a change to a cache table, then they insert a row in this table to indicate to all other computers that they need to update their cache for the given table. Certain entries in this table can also trigger the Appointments module to refresh if that date is currently showing for any computer. To add a row here, use DataValid.SetInvalid. See the discussion in Cache.cs. It seems like the rows that use KeyType and FKey seem to be treated very differently from the rows that use InvalidType for the cache.

columns.name: SignalNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: DateViewing
columns.summary: If IType=Date, then this is the affected date in the Appointments module.

columns.name: SigDateTime
columns.summary: The exact server time when this signal was entered into db. This does not need to be set by sender since it's handled automatically.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: Usually identifies the object that was edited to cause the signal to be created.  Can be used for special scenarios based on the FKeyType.  E.g. for SmsMsgUnreadCount, this represents a count, not an FK.

columns.name: FKeyType
columns.summary: Enum:KeyType Describes the type of object referenced by the FKey.

columns.name: IType
columns.summary: Enum:InvalidType Indicates what cache or entity has been changed.

columns.name: RemoteRole
columns.summary: Enum:MiddleTierRole The MiddleTierRole of the instance that created this signal.

columns.name: MsgValue
columns.summary: Message value of the signal.

name: site
summary: Generally used by mobile clinics to track the temporary locations where treatment is performed, such as schools, nursing homes, and community centers.  Replaces the old school table.

columns.name: SiteNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Notes could include phone, contacts, etc.

columns.name: Address2
columns.summary: Optional second address line.

columns.name: State
columns.summary: 2 Char in USA.  Used to store province for Canadian users.

columns.name: Zip
columns.summary: Postal code.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  Default provider for the site.

columns.name: PlaceService
columns.summary: Enum:PlaceOfService Describes where the site is located.

name: smsblockphone
summary: If a number is entered in this table, then any incoming text message will not be entered into the database.

columns.name: SmsBlockPhoneNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: BlockWirelessNumber
columns.summary: The phone number to be blocked.

name: smsfrommobile
summary: A Mobile Originating SMS bound for the office. Will usually be a re-constructed message.

columns.name: SmsFromMobileNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Not sent from HQ.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

columns.name: CommlogNum
columns.summary: FK to commlog.CommlogNum. Not sent from HQ.

columns.name: MsgText
columns.summary: Contents of the message.

columns.name: DateTimeReceived
columns.summary: Date and time message was inserted into the DB. Not sent from HQ.

columns.name: SmsPhoneNumber
columns.summary: This is the Phone Number of the office that the mobile device sent a message to.

columns.name: MobilePhoneNumber
columns.summary: This is the PhoneNumber that this message was sent from.

columns.name: MsgPart
columns.summary: Message part sequence number. For single part messages this should always be 1.  For messages that exist as multiple parts, due to staggered delivery of the parts, this will be a number between 1 and MsgTotal.

columns.name: MsgTotal
columns.summary: Total count of message parts for this single message identified by MsgRefID.  For single part messages this should always be 1.

columns.name: MsgRefID
columns.summary: Each part of a multipart message will have the same MsgRefID.

columns.name: SmsStatus
columns.summary: Enum:SmsFromStatus .

columns.name: Flags
columns.summary: Words surrounded by spaces, flags should be all lower case. This allows simple querrying. Example: " junk  recall " allows you to write "WHERE Flags like "% junk %" without having to worry about commas. Also, adding and removing tags is easier. Example: Flags=Flags.Replace(" junk ","");

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: Messages are not deleted, they can only be hidden.

columns.name: GuidMessage
columns.summary: FK to confirmationrequest.GuidMessageFromMobile. Generated at HQ when the confirmation pending is terminated with confirmation text message.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

name: smsphone
summary: A phone number used to send and receive SMS. When clinics is enabled all SmsPhones with clinic num 0 should be updated to have clinic num of the lowest numbered clinic. When clinics are disabled, all SmsPhones with the lowest numbered clinic num should be re-associated to clinic number 0.

columns.name: SmsPhoneNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

columns.name: PhoneNumber
columns.summary: String representation of the phone number in international format. Ex: 15035551234 This field should not contain any formatting characters.

columns.name: DateTimeActive
columns.summary: Date and time this phone number became active.

columns.name: DateTimeInactive
columns.summary: Date and time this phone number became inactive. Once inactive, the phone is dead and cannot be reactivated. A new number will have to be purchased.

columns.name: InactiveCode
columns.summary: Used to indicate why this phone number was made inactive.

columns.name: CountryCode
columns.summary: Country linked to this phone's clinic at the instant that this phone is created. Based on ISO31661.

name: smstomobile
summary: Messages are only inserted into this table after they are accepted by ODHQ.

columns.name: SmsToMobileNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

columns.name: GuidMessage
columns.summary: GUID. Uniquely identifies this message and is used for tracking message status.

columns.name: GuidBatch
columns.summary: GUID. When sending batch messages, all messages will have the same batch GUID that should be the GUID of the first message within the batch.

columns.name: SmsPhoneNumber
columns.summary: This is the sending phone number in international format. Each office may have several different numbers that they use.

columns.name: MobilePhoneNumber
columns.summary: The phone number that this message was sent to. Must be kept in addition to the PatNum.

columns.name: IsTimeSensitive
columns.summary: Set to true if this message should "jump the queue" and be sent asap.

columns.name: MsgType
columns.summary: Enum:SmsMessageSource  This is used to identify where in the program this message originated from.

columns.name: MsgText
columns.summary: The contents of the message.

columns.name: SmsStatus
columns.summary: Enum:SmsDeliveryStatus  Set by the Listener, tracks status of SMS.

columns.name: MsgParts
columns.summary: The count of parts that this message will be broken into when sent. A single long message will be broken into several smaller 153 utf8 or 70 unicode character messages.

columns.name: MsgChargeUSD
columns.summary: The amount charged to the customer. Total cost for this message always stored in US Dollars.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  0 when not using clinics.

columns.name: CustErrorText
columns.summary: Only used when SmsDeliveryStatus==Failed.

columns.name: DateTimeSent
columns.summary: Time message was accepted at ODHQ.

columns.name: DateTimeTerminated
columns.summary: Date time that the message was either successfully delivered or failed.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: Messages are hidden, not deleted.

columns.name: MsgDiscountUSD
columns.summary: Any discount applied to this message. If a particular messages has a MsgDiscountUSD > 0  then the MsgChargeUSD will reflect the charge to the customer after the discount has already been applied. Multi-part messages will still be charged the wholesale rate for all parts after the first part. To calculate the typical charge that this customer would pay without the discount use MsgChargeUSD + MsgDiscountUSD. To calculate the percentage discounted off standard charges use (MsgDiscountUSD / (MsgChargeUSD + MsgDiscountUSD)).

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

name: snomed
summary: We do not import synonyms, only "Fully Specified Name records". Snomed for holding a large list of codes. Codes in use are copied into the DiseaseDef table.  SNOMED CT maintained, owned and copyright International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO).

columns.name: SnomedNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SnomedCode
columns.summary: Used as FK by other tables.  Also called the Concept ID.  Not allowed to edit this column once saved in the database.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Also called "Term", "Name", or "Fully Specified Name".  Not editable and doesn't change.

name: stateabbr
summary: State abbreviations are always copied to patient records rather than linked. Items in this list can be freely altered or deleted without harming patient data.

columns.name: StateAbbrNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Full state name

columns.name: Abbr
columns.summary: Short state abbreviation (usually 2 digit)

columns.name: MedicaidIDLength
columns.summary: The length that the Medicaid ID should be for this state. If 0, then the Medicaid length is not enforced for this state

name: statement
summary: Represents one statement for one family.  Usually already sent, but could still be waiting to send.

columns.name: StatementNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Typically the guarantor.  Can also be the patient for walkout statements.

columns.name: DateSent
columns.summary: This will always be a valid and reasonable date regardless of whether it's actually been sent yet.

columns.name: DateRangeFrom
columns.summary: Typically 45 days before dateSent

columns.name: DateRangeTo
columns.summary: Any date >= year 2200 is considered max val.  We generally try to automate this value to be the same date as the statement rather than the max val.  This is so that when payment plans are displayed, we can add approximately 10 days to effectively show the charge that will soon be due.  Adding the 10 days is not done until display time.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Can include line breaks.  This ordinary note will be in the standard font.

columns.name: NoteBold
columns.summary: More important notes may go here.  Font will be bold.  Color and size of text will be customizable in setup.

columns.name: Mode_
columns.summary: Enum:StatementMode Mail, InPerson, Email, Electronic.

columns.name: HidePayment
columns.summary: Set true to hide the credit card section, and the please pay box.

columns.name: SinglePatient
columns.summary: One patient on statement instead of entire family.

columns.name: Intermingled
columns.summary: If entire family, then this determines whether they are all intermingled into one big grid, or whether they are all listed in separate grids.

columns.name: IsSent
columns.summary: True

columns.name: DocNum
columns.summary: FK to document.DocNum when a pdf has been archived.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: Date/time last altered.

columns.name: IsReceipt
columns.summary: The only effect of this flag is to change the text at the top of a statement from "statement" to "receipt".  It might later do more.

columns.name: IsInvoice
columns.summary: This flag is for marking a statement as Invoice.  In this case, it must have procedures and/or adjustments attached.

columns.name: IsInvoiceCopy
columns.summary: Only used if IsInvoice=true.  The first printout will not be a copy.  Subsequent printouts will show "copy" on them.

columns.name: EmailSubject
columns.summary: Empty string by default.  Only used to override BillingEmailSubject pref when emailing statements.  Only set when statements are created from the Billing Options window.  No UI for editing.

columns.name: EmailBody
columns.summary: Empty string by default.  Only used to override BillingEmailBodyText pref when emailing statements.  Only set when statements are created from the Billing Options window.  No UI for editing.  Limit in db: 16M char.

columns.name: SuperFamily
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Typically zero unless a super family statement is desired. Will be non-zero if the patient is associated with a super family and a super family statement is desired.

columns.name: IsBalValid
columns.summary: True for statements generated in version 16.1 or greater. Older statements did not store InsEst or BalTotal.

columns.name: InsEst
columns.summary: Insurance Estimate for entire family, taken from guarantor at time of statement being sent/saved. For invoices, this field contains the total adjustment amount instead.

columns.name: BalTotal
columns.summary: Total balance for entire family before insurance estimate. Not the same as the sum of the 4 aging balances because this can be negative.

columns.name: StatementType
columns.summary: Enum:StmtType Statement, Receipt, Invoice, LimitedStatement.

columns.name: ShortGUID
columns.summary: A short alphanumeric string used to uniquely identify this statement.

columns.name: StatementShortURL
columns.summary: A short URL that can be visited to view this statement. Useful to include in text messages.

columns.name: StatementURL
columns.summary: A URL that can be visited to view this statement.

columns.name: SmsSendStatus
columns.summary: Enum:AutoCommStatus Stores what should be done or was done in regards to SMS messaging for this statement.

columns.name: LimitedCustomFamily
columns.summary: Enum:EnumLimitedCustomFamily Indicates the scope of a custom limited statement. Special behavior in getSuperFamAccount for Family and SuperFamily.

columns.name: ShowTransSinceBalZero
columns.summary: Used for setting the "Show transactions since zero/negative balance" checkbox when opening/editing a statement. True for statements that were saved with "Show transactions since zero/negative balance" checked. For new statements, the value is set according to the BillingShowTransSinceBalZero pref (except for statements created from Billing, where the checkbox in the Billing Options window overrides this).

name: statementprod
summary: Links production items to a statement. Also tracks whether or not a late charge adjustment has been created for the production item.

columns.name: StatementProdNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: StatementNum
columns.summary: FK to statement.StatementNum. The statement that the production item is on.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: Foreign key to linked production item.

columns.name: ProdType
columns.summary: Enum:ProductionType Type of production item.

columns.name: LateChargeAdjNum
columns.summary: FK to adjustment.AdjNum. The late charge adjustment made for this production item. 0 if no late charge has been made.

columns.name: DocNum
columns.summary: FK to document.DocNum. The pdf document last associated to the statement. Will be 0 for statements that are sent electronically when pdfs are not saved for electronic statements.

name: stmtlink
summary: Attaches individual rows of Procs, Adjustments, Payments, etc to a Statement object so that we can recreate the statement again later.

columns.name: StmtLinkNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: StatementNum
columns.summary: FK to statement.StatementNum.

columns.name: StmtLinkType
columns.summary: Enum:StmtLinkTypes Represents what object FKey corresponds to.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: FK to type of PK of another object depending on StmtLinkType value. E.g. procedurelog.ProcNum, paysplit.PaySplitNum, adjustment.AdjNum, etc.

name: substitutionlink
summary: Entries in this table will represent procedurecodes that the insurance plan wants to SKIP when considering substitution codes.

columns.name: SubstitutionLinkNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PlanNum
columns.summary: FK to insplan.PlanNum.

columns.name: CodeNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum.

columns.name: SubstitutionCode
columns.summary: FK to procedurecode.ProcCode.

columns.name: SubstOnlyIf
columns.summary: Enum:SubstitutionCondition

name: supplier
summary: A company that provides supplies for the office, typically dental supplies.

columns.name: SupplierNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: CustomerId
columns.summary: The customer ID that this office uses for transactions with the supplier

columns.name: Website
columns.summary: Full address to website.  We might make it clickable.

columns.name: UserName
columns.summary: The username used to log in to the supplier website.

columns.name: Password
columns.summary: The password to log in to the supplier website.  Not encrypted or hidden in any way.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Any note regarding supplier.  Could hold address, CC info, etc.

name: supply
summary: A dental supply or office supply item.

columns.name: SupplyNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SupplierNum
columns.summary: FK to supplier.SupplierNum

columns.name: CatalogNumber
columns.summary: The catalog item number that the supplier uses to identify the supply.

columns.name: Descript
columns.summary: The description can be similar to the catalog, but not required.  Typically includes qty per box/case, etc.

columns.name: Category
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.  User can define their own categories for supplies.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: The zero-based order of this supply within it's category.  Hidden supplies can be included in this order.

columns.name: LevelDesired
columns.summary: Aka Stock Level.  The level that a fresh order should bring item back up to.  Can include fractions.  If this is 0, then it will be displayed as having this field blank rather than showing 0.  This simply gives a cleaner look.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: If hidden, then this supply item won't normally show in the main list.

columns.name: Price
columns.summary: The price per unit that the supplier charges for this supply.  If this is 0.00, then no price will be displayed.

columns.name: BarCodeOrID
columns.summary: Scanned code from a reader.

columns.name: DispDefaultQuant
columns.summary: Only used for dental schools.  This is the typical quantity dispensed at the window.

columns.name: DispUnitsCount
columns.summary: Only used in dental schools.  For example, 20 capsules composite per container.

columns.name: DispUnitDesc
columns.summary: Only used in dental schools.  Description of the units when dispensing for use.  For example: Capsule, cartridge, carpule, glove, or needle.

columns.name: LevelOnHand
columns.summary: Deprecated.

columns.name: OrderQty
columns.summary: The amount to order when the next SupplyOrder is created.  Creating a SupplyOrder then zeroes this out, so it's just a temporary value.

name: supplyneeded
summary: A supply freeform typed in by a user.

columns.name: SupplyNeededNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

name: supplyorder
summary: One supply order to one supplier.  Contains SupplyOrderItems.

columns.name: SupplyOrderNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SupplierNum
columns.summary: FK to supplier.SupplierNum.

columns.name: DatePlaced
columns.summary: A date greater than 2200 (eg 2500), is considered a max date.  A max date is used for an order that was started but has not yet been placed.  This puts it at the end of the list where it belongs, but it will display as blank.  Only one unplaced order is allowed per supplier.

columns.name: AmountTotal
columns.summary: The sum of all the amounts of each item on the order.  If any of the item prices are zero, then it won't auto calculate this total.  This will allow the user to manually put in the total without having it get deleted.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. User that placed the order, is editable.

columns.name: ShippingCharge
columns.summary: The order's shipping charge.

columns.name: DateReceived
columns.summary: The date the order was received. If the SupplyOrder existed before updating to version 19.4, then this value will be set to the date the office updated to 19.4.

name: supplyorderitem
summary: One item on one supply order.  This table links supplies to orders as well as storing a small amount of additional info.

columns.name: SupplyOrderItemNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SupplyOrderNum
columns.summary: FK to supplyorder.supplyOrderNum.

columns.name: SupplyNum
columns.summary: FK to supply.SupplyNum.

columns.name: Qty
columns.summary: How many were ordered.

columns.name: Price
columns.summary: Price per unit on this order.

columns.name: DateReceived
columns.summary: Optional. The order itself already has this field. But if a partial order comes in, and if the user wants to track item dates separately, then they can do it here.

name: task
summary: A task is a single todo item.  Also see taskhist, which keeps a historical record.

columns.name: TaskNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: TaskListNum
columns.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum.  If 0, then it will show in the trunk of a section.  This is temporarily -1 to indicate that a task is not assigned to a tasklist yet, but -1 never gets saved to the db.

columns.name: DateTask
columns.summary: Only used if this task is assigned to a dated category.  Children are NOT dated.  Only dated if they should show in the trunk for a date category.  They can also have a parent if they are in the main list as well.

columns.name: KeyNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum or appointment.AptNum. Only used when ObjectType is not 0.

columns.name: Descript
columns.summary: The description of this task.  Might be very long.

columns.name: TaskStatus
columns.summary: Enum:TaskStatusEnum New,Viewed,Done.  We may want to put an index on this column someday.

columns.name: IsRepeating
columns.summary: True if it is to show in the repeating section.  There should be no date.  All children and parents should also be set to IsRepeating=true.

columns.name: DateType
columns.summary: Enum:TaskDateType  None, Day, Week, Month.  If IsRepeating, then setting to None effectively disables the repeating feature.

columns.name: FromNum
columns.summary: FK to task.TaskNum  If this is derived from a repeating task, then this will hold the TaskNum of that task.  It helps automate the adding and deleting of tasks.  It might be deleted automatically if not are marked complete.

columns.name: ObjectType
columns.summary: Enum:TaskObjectType  0=none,1=Patient,2=Appointment.  More will be added later. If a type is selected, then the KeyNum will contain the primary key of the corresponding Patient or Appointment.  Does not really have anything to do with the ObjectType of the parent tasklist, although they tend to match.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: The date and time that this task was added.  User editable. For reminder tasks, this field is used to indicate the date and time the reminder will take effect.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  The person who created the task.

columns.name: DateTimeFinished
columns.summary: The date and time that this task was marked "done".

columns.name: PriorityDefNum
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.  The priority for this task which is used when filling task lists.  The placement of the task in the list is dependent on the item order of the definitions.

columns.name: ReminderGroupId
columns.summary: Optional.  Set to null or empty if not a reminder task. For repeating reminders, the ReminderGroupId will be the same for each task spawned from any task in the group.

columns.name: ReminderType
columns.summary: Bit field.

columns.name: DateTimeOriginal
columns.summary: The original datetime that the row was inserted.  Used to sort the list by the order entered. Using taskhist.DateTimeOriginal will get the datetime that the task row was inserted, not the taskhist.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed.

columns.name: DescriptOverride
columns.summary: Limited to 256 char. If present, shows only this text in task list grids instead of prepending date, aggregating notes, etc. Shows as Short Descript in the UI for space reasons.

columns.name: IsReadOnly
columns.summary: Determines if this task can be edited by most users. Currently only used at HQ.

columns.name: Category
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. Only used when pref.TaskCategoryShow is set to true.

name: taskancestor
summary: Represents one ancestor of one task.  Each task will have at least one ancestor unless it is directly on a main trunk. An ancestor is defined as a tasklist that is higher in the heirarchy for the task, regardless of how many levels up it is. This allows us to mark task lists as having "new" tasks, and it allows us to quickly check for new tasks for a user on startup.

columns.name: TaskAncestorNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: TaskNum
columns.summary: FK to task.TaskNum

columns.name: TaskListNum
columns.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum

name: taskattachment
summary: An attachment to a task. Attachment can be a document or a string.

columns.name: TaskAttachmentNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: TaskNum
columns.summary: FK to task.TaskNum.

columns.name: DocNum
columns.summary: FK to document.DocNum. If no document is attached, then this field will be 0.

columns.name: TextValue
columns.summary: Used to store text that doesn't need to be visible from the main task edit window at all times.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: A brief description of this attachment. If document is linked, used for document description as well.

name: taskhist
summary: A historical copy of a task.  These are generated as a result of a task being edited, so there can be multiple entries here per task.  When creating for insertion it needs a passed-in Task object.

columns.name: TaskHistNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: UserNumHist
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum  Identifies the user that changed this task from this state, not the person who originally wrote it.

columns.name: DateTStamp
columns.summary: The date and time that this task was edited and added to the Hist table. This value will not be updated by MySQL whenever the row changes.

columns.name: IsNoteChange
columns.summary: True if the note was changed when this historical copy was created.

columns.name: TaskNum
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: TaskListNum
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: DateTask
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: KeyNum
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: Descript
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: TaskStatus
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: IsRepeating
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: DateType
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: FromNum
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: ObjectType
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: DateTimeFinished
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: PriorityDefNum
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: ReminderGroupId
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: ReminderType
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: ReminderFrequency
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: DateTimeOriginal
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Not copied from Task. Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed.

columns.name: DescriptOverride
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: IsReadOnly
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

columns.name: Category
columns.summary: Copied from Task.

name: tasklist
summary: A tasklist is like a folder system, where it can have child tasklists as well as tasks.

columns.name: TaskListNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Descript
columns.summary: The description of this tasklist.  Might be very long, but not usually.

columns.name: Parent
columns.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum  The parent task list to which this task list is assigned.  If zero, then this task list is on the main trunk of one of the sections.

columns.name: DateTL
columns.summary: Optional. Set to 0001-01-01 for no date.  If a date is assigned, then this list will also be available from the date section.

columns.name: IsRepeating
columns.summary: True if it is to show in the repeating section.  There should be no date.  All children should also be set to IsRepeating=true.

columns.name: DateType
columns.summary: Enum:TaskDateType  None, Day, Week, Month.  If IsRepeating, then setting to None effectively disables the repeating feature.

columns.name: FromNum
columns.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum  If this is derived from a repeating list, then this will hold the TaskListNum of that list.  It helps automate the adding and deleting of lists.  It might be deleted automatically if no tasks are marked complete.

columns.name: ObjectType
columns.summary: Enum:TaskObjectType  0=none, 1=Patient, 2=Appointment.  More will be added later. If a type is selected, then this list will be visible in the appropriate places for attaching the correct type of object.  The type is not copied to a task when created.  Tasks in this list do not have to be of the same type.  You can only attach an object to a task, not a tasklist.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: The date and time that this list was added.  Used to sort the list by the order entered.

columns.name: GlobalTaskFilterType
columns.summary: Enum:GlobalTaskFilterType 0=Disabled, 1=Default, 2=None, 3=Clinic, 4=Region.  If a type is selected, then tasks in this tasklist will be filtered by default such that only tasks that match the tasklist's GlobalFilterType will show in the view. Disabled is not valid for tasklists and will be treated as Default if applied to a tasklist; it only valid on the TasksGlobalFilterType preference.

columns.name: TaskListStatus
columns.summary: Enum:TaskListStatusEnum 0=Active, 1=Archived. Archived task lists are hidden from the Task Window's User, Main, and Reminder tabs by default.

name: tasknote
summary: A tasknote is a note that may be added to a task. Many notes may be attached to a task. A user may only edit their own tasknotes within a task.

columns.name: TaskNoteNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: TaskNum
columns.summary: FK to task.TaskNum. The task this tasknote is attached to.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. The user who created this tasknote.

columns.name: DateTimeNote
columns.summary: Date and time the note was created or last modified (editable).

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Note. Text that the user wishes to show on the task.

name: tasksubscription
summary: A subscription of one user to either a tasklist or to a task.

columns.name: TaskSubscriptionNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum

columns.name: TaskListNum
columns.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum  When this is not 0 then TaskNum will be 0.

columns.name: TaskNum
columns.summary: FK to task.TaskNum.  When this is not 0 then TaskListNum will be 0.

name: taskunread
summary: When a task is created or a comment made, a series of these taskunread objects are created, one for each user who is subscribed to the tasklist.  Duplicates are intelligently avoided.  Rows are deleted once user reads the task.

columns.name: TaskUnreadNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: TaskNum
columns.summary: FK to task.TaskNum.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

name: terminalactive
summary: Each row is 1 computer, or if in RDP session, 1 connection from 1 computer, currently acting as a terminal for patient input.

columns.name: TerminalActiveNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ComputerName
columns.summary: The name of the computer where the terminal is active. On RDP, this is client name.

columns.name: TerminalStatus
columns.summary: Enum:TerminalStatusEnum  No longer used.  Instead, the PatNum field is used.  Used to indicates at what point the patient was in the sequence. 0=standby, 1=PatientInfo, 2=Medical, 3=UpdateOnly.  If status is 1, then nobody else on the network could open the patient edit window for that patient.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.  The patient currently showing in the terminal.  If 0, then terminal is in standby mode.

columns.name: SessionId
columns.summary: The ID of the session from which this terminal instance was started.  The session ID is unique per computer login, so if this is a  terminal server every remote connection will have a unique session ID.  A kiosk is identified by ComputerName+SessionId+ProcessId.

columns.name: ProcessId
columns.summary: The ID of the process that initiated this kiosk instance.  This is unique per active computer process, so if a row exists with a ProcessId that matches the instance we're about to start, we know it is safe to delete it, it must be left over and needs cleaned up.

columns.name: SessionName
columns.summary: The name of the computer used to make the remote connection to the app server when enabling kiosk mode. Could also be a name manually entered by the user if there's already a connection to the app server from the same computer session. This serves as a human-readable name for the ComputerName+SessionId+ProcessId to uniquely identify a kiosk. We will display the ComputerName and SessionName to the user in the kiosk manager, but we will use the ComputerName+SessionId+ProcessId when the kiosk checks for available forms to display.

name: timeadjust
summary: Used on employee timecards to make adjustments.  Used to make the end-of-the week OT entries.  Can be used instead of a clock event by admin so that a clock event doesn't have to be created.

columns.name: TimeAdjustNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: EmployeeNum
columns.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum

columns.name: TimeEntry
columns.summary: The date and time that this entry will show on timecard.

columns.name: RegHours
columns.summary: The number of regular hours to adjust timecard by.  Can be + or -.

columns.name: OTimeHours
columns.summary: Overtime hours. Usually +.  Automatically combined with a - adj to RegHours.  Another option is clockevent.OTimeHours.

columns.name: IsAuto
columns.summary: Set to true if this adjustment was automatically made by the system.  When the calc weekly OT tool is run, these types of adjustments are fair game for deletion.  Other adjustments are preserved.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  The clinic the TimeAdjust was entered at.

columns.name: PtoDefNum
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum.  Defaults to 0.  Is set to 0 for general adjustments.  When not 0, points to a definition in the TimeCardAdjTypes category.

columns.name: PtoHours
columns.summary: PTO Hours.  The number of PTO hours applied to a specific day.  Ignored if PtoDefNum is 0.

columns.name: IsUnpaidProtectedLeave
columns.summary: Defaults to false. True when this TimeAdjust is for unpaid protected leave. Hours from unpaid protected leave adjustments contribute to hours worked, but not to payable hours.

columns.name: SecuUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. The user that created this TimeAdjust.

name: timecardrule
summary: A rule for automation of timecard overtime.  Can apply to one employee or all.

columns.name: TimeCardRuleNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: EmployeeNum
columns.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum. If zero, then this rule applies to all employees.

columns.name: OverHoursPerDay
columns.summary: Typical example is 8:00.  In California, any work after the first 8 hours is overtime.

columns.name: AfterTimeOfDay
columns.summary: Typical example is 16:00 to indicate that all time worked after 4pm for specific employees is at Rate2 rate.

columns.name: BeforeTimeOfDay
columns.summary: Typical example is 6:00 to indicate that all time worked before 6am for specific employees is at Rate2 rate.

columns.name: IsOvertimeExempt
columns.summary: Indicates if the employee should have overtime calculated for their hours worked in a pay period.

columns.name: MinClockInTime
columns.summary: When set this is the earliest an employee can clock in. Otherwise minimum dateTime represents not set.

columns.name: HasWeekendRate3
columns.summary: Indicates if the employee is eligible to earn Rate3 rate for weekend hours.

name: toolbutitem
summary: Each row represents one toolbar button to be placed on a toolbar and linked to a program.

columns.name: ToolButItemNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ProgramNum
columns.summary: FK to program.ProgramNum.

columns.name: ToolBar
columns.summary: Enum:EnumToolBar The toolbar to show the button on.

columns.name: ButtonText
columns.summary: The text to show on the toolbar button.

name: toothgridcell
summary: Holds one recorded cell value for a tooth grid, which is a special kind of sheet field type that shows a grid with 32 rows and configurable columns.  The entire grid is a single large sheet field.

columns.name: ToothGridCellNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SheetFieldNum
columns.summary: FK to sheetfield.SheetFieldNum.  Required.

columns.name: ToothGridColNum
columns.summary: FK to toothgridcol.ToothGridColNum.  This tells which column it belongs in.  Can't use the column name here because multiple columns could have the same name.

columns.name: ValueEntered
columns.summary: Cannot be empty.  For a tooth-level cell, the only allowed value is X.  If the cell is unchecked, then it won't even have a row in this table.  For a surface level column, only valid surfaces can be entered:MOIDBFLV  Enforced.  FreeText columns can have any text up to 255 char.

columns.name: ToothNum
columns.summary: Corresponds exactly to procedurelog.ToothNum.  May be blank, otherwise 1-32, 51-82, A-T, or AS-TS, 1 or 2 char.  Gets internationalized as being displayed.

name: toothgridcol
summary: Defines the columns present in a single completed tooth grid, which is a special kind of sheet field that shows a grid with 32 rows and configurable columns.  The entire grid is a single large sheet field.  This table defines how the grid is layed out on an actual sheet, pulled initially from a ToothGridDef.  The data itself is recorded in ToothGridCell.

columns.name: ToothGridColNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: SheetFieldNum
columns.summary: FK to sheet.SheetFieldNum.  Required.

columns.name: NameItem
columns.summary: Pulled from the ToothGridDef.  This can be a NameInternal , or it can be a NameShowing if it's a user-defined column.

columns.name: CellType
columns.summary: Enum:ToothGridCellType  0=HardCoded, 1=Tooth, 2=Surface, 3=FreeText.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Order of the column to display.  Every entry must have a unique itemorder.

columns.name: CodeNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum.  This allows data entered to flow into main program as actual completed or tp procedures.

columns.name: ProcStatus
columns.summary: Enum:ProcStat  If these flow into main program, then this is the status that the new procs will have.

name: toothgriddef
summary: Defines the columns present in a tooth grid, which is a special kind of sheet field def that shows a grid with 32 rows and configurable columns.  Can be edited without damaging any completed sheets.

columns.name: ToothGridDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: NameInternal
columns.summary: This is the internal name that OD uses to identify the column.  Blank if this is a user-defined column.  We will keep a hard-coded list of available NameInternals in the code to pick from.

columns.name: NameShowing
columns.summary: The user may override the internal name for display purposes.  If this is a user-defined column, this is the only name, since there is no NameInternal.

columns.name: CellType
columns.summary: Enum:ToothGridCellType  0=HardCoded, 1=Tooth, 2=Surface, 3=FreeText.

columns.name: ItemOrder
columns.summary: Order of the column to display.  Every entry must have a unique itemorder.

columns.name: CodeNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurecode.CodeNum.  This allows data entered to flow into main program as actual completed or tp procedures.

columns.name: ProcStatus
columns.summary: Enum:ProcStat  If these flow into main program, then this is the status that the new procs will have.

columns.name: SheetFieldDefNum
columns.summary: FK to sheetfielddef.SheetFieldDefNum

name: toothinitial
summary: Used to track missing teeth, primary teeth, movements, and drawings.

columns.name: ToothInitialNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum

columns.name: ToothNum
columns.summary: 1-32 or A-Z. Supernumeraries not supported here yet.

columns.name: InitialType
columns.summary: Enum:ToothInitialType

columns.name: Movement
columns.summary: Shift in mm, or rotation / tipping in degrees.

columns.name: DrawingSegment
columns.summary: Point data for a drawing segment.  The format would look similar to this: 45,68;48,70;49,72;0,0;55,88;etc.  It's simply a sequence of points, separated by semicolons.  Only positive numbers are used.  0,0 is the upper left of the tooth chart, and the lower right is at 410,307.  This scale of 410,307 is always used, regardless of how the tooth chart control is scaled for viewing.  Floats with tenths can be included.  If the pen is picked up, it becomes a new segment, so a new row in the database.

columns.name: SecDateTEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

columns.name: DrawText
columns.summary: For text not associated with any tooth. The location of the text within 410,307 is incorporated into this string.  Example: 25.3,123.8;This shows.  Carriage returns etc are not supported.  ColorDraw is used.

name: transaction
summary: Used in the accounting section of the program.  Each row is one transaction in the ledger, and must always have at least two JournalEntries (splits).  All JournalEntries must always add up to zero.

columns.name: TransactionNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: DateTimeEntry
columns.summary: Not user editable.  Server time.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. The user that entered this transaction.

columns.name: DepositNum
columns.summary: FK to deposit.DepositNum.  Will eventually be replaced by a source document table, and deposits will just be one of many types.

columns.name: PayNum
columns.summary: FK to payment.PayNum.  Like DepositNum, it will eventually be replaced by a source document table, and payments will just be one of many types.

columns.name: SecUserNumEdit
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. The user who last edited this transaction.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: The last time this transaction was edited.

columns.name: TransactionInvoiceNum
columns.summary: FK to transactioninvoice.TransactionInvoiceNum.  A document that can be attached to the transaction.

name: transactioninvoice
summary: Used in the accounting section of the program.  Each row contains a document that is attached to a transaction.

columns.name: TransactionInvoiceNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: FileName
columns.summary: File name including the extension.

columns.name: InvoiceData
columns.summary: The raw file data converted to base64. Will be blank when using FilePath.

columns.name: FilePath
columns.summary: Full file path. Will be blank when using InvoiceData.

name: treatplan
summary: Stores all treatment plans, including Active, Inactive, and Saved treatment plans. Active and Inactive treatment plans use treatplanattaches to reference attached procedures. As procedures are set complete, they get removed from active and inactive treatment plans. Saved treatment plans use proctps, which are copies of the procedure, and will not change after being saved.

columns.name: TreatPlanNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: DateTP
columns.summary: The date of the treatment plan

columns.name: Heading
columns.summary: The heading that shows at the top of the treatment plan.  Usually 'Proposed Treatment Plan'

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: A note specific to this treatment plan that shows at the bottom.

columns.name: Signature
columns.summary: The encrypted and bound signature in base64 format.  The signature is bound to the concatenation of the tp Note, DateTP, and to each proctp Descript and PatAmt.

columns.name: SigIsTopaz
columns.summary: True if the signature is in Topaz format rather than OD format.

columns.name: ResponsParty
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum. Can be 0.  The patient responsible for approving the treatment.  Public health field not visible to everyone else.

columns.name: DocNum
columns.summary: FK to document.DocNum. Can be 0.  If signed, this is the pdf document of the TP at time of signing. See PrefName.TreatPlanSaveSignedToPdf

columns.name: TPStatus
columns.summary: Enum:TreatPlanStatus Determines the type of treatment plan this is. 0 - Saved, 1 - Active, 2 - Inactive.

columns.name: SecUserNumEntry
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  Set to the user logged in when the row was inserted at SecDateEntry date and time.

columns.name: SecDateEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp automatically generated and user not allowed to change.  The actual date of entry.

columns.name: SecDateTEdit
columns.summary: Automatically updated by MySQL every time a row is added or changed. Could be changed due to user editing, custom queries or program  updates.  Not user editable with the UI.

columns.name: UserNumPresenter
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum. The user that will present the treatment plan. Defaults to the user that entered the treatment plan, but can be changed with the TreatPlanPresenterEdit permission.

columns.name: TPType
columns.summary: Enum:TreatPlanType Determines the type of insurance this treatment plan was saved with.  Used for displaying proper information when loading.

columns.name: SignaturePractice
columns.summary: The encrypted and bound signature in base64 format.  The signature is bound to the concatenation of the tp Note, DateTP, and to each proctp Descript and PatAmt.

columns.name: DateTSigned
columns.summary: The date of the treatment plan is signed.

columns.name: DateTPracticeSigned
columns.summary: The date of the treatment plan is signed by the office.

columns.name: SignatureText
columns.summary: The typed name of the person who signed the treatplan.

columns.name: SignaturePracticeText
columns.summary: The typed name of the person who signed the practice signature.

columns.name: MobileAppDeviceNum
columns.summary: FK to MobileAppDevice.

name: treatplanattach
summary: Links active and inactive treatment plans to procedurelog rows. When the treatment plan or chart modules are selected, any treatplanattach rows that are linked to completed or deleted procedures will be deleted.

columns.name: TreatPlanAttachNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: TreatPlanNum
columns.summary: FK to treatplan.TreatPlanNum.

columns.name: ProcNum
columns.summary: FK to procedurelog.ProcNum.

columns.name: Priority
columns.summary: FK to definition.DefNum, which contains the text of the priority. Identical to Procedure.Priority but used to allow different priorities for the same procedure depending on which TP it is a part of.

name: treatplanparam
summary: Stores check box information for each treatment plan, so that when a signed treatment plan PDF needs to be saved from eClipboard, it can correctly save and generate the PDF.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to Patient.

columns.name: TreatPlanNum
columns.summary: FK to TreatPlan.

columns.name: ShowDiscount
columns.summary: Value is set by the Discount check box in the Tx Module.

columns.name: ShowMaxDed
columns.summary: Value is set by the Use Ins Max and Deduct check box in the Tx Module.

columns.name: ShowSubTotals
columns.summary: Value is set by the Subtotals check box in the Tx Module.

columns.name: ShowTotals
columns.summary: Value is set by the Totals check box in the Tx Module.

columns.name: ShowCompleted
columns.summary: Value is set by the Graphical Completed Tx check box in the Tx Module.

columns.name: ShowFees
columns.summary: Value is set by the Fees check box in the Tx Module.

columns.name: ShowIns
columns.summary: Value is set by the Insurances Estimates check box in the Tx Module.

name: tsitranslog
summary: Transworld Systems Inc (TSI) transaction log.  Logs communication between the Open Dental program and TSI.  Entries contain information about accounts placed with TSI, payments or adjustments to accounts placed, or transactions to Suspend, Reinstate or Cancel accounts.

columns.name: TsiTransLogNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum for the guarantor of the account sent to TSI for collection services.  TSI refers to this as the Debtor Reference  or Responsible Party Account Number.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  The user who sent the account for placement with TSI or who suspended, reinstated or cancelled collection  services for an account placed with TSI or who created the payment/adjustment for an account placed with TSI.

columns.name: TransType
columns.summary: Enum:TsiTransType - Identifies the transaction message sent to TSI.  Can be a message for placing/cancelling/suspending/reinstating  collection services for an account or to notify TSI of a payment/writeoff/adjustment entered into OD.

columns.name: TransDateTime
columns.summary: Timestamp at which this row was created. Auto generated on insert.  Identifies exactly when the action happened in OD to cause the  message to be sent to TSI.

columns.name: ServiceType
columns.summary: Enum:TsiServiceType - for placements, this is the type of collection activity that will start on the account being placed.

columns.name: ServiceCode
columns.summary: Enum:TsiServiceCode - for placements, intensity of first letter sent to guarantor.  Will usually be 0 - Diplomatic.

columns.name: TransAmt
columns.summary: Used for payments/writeoffs/adjustments, amount applied to the debt.

columns.name: AccountBalance
columns.summary: Total balance due on the account by the patient, i.e. BalTotal-InsPayEst-WoEst.  If this is a placement, this is the debt amount TSI is going to attempt to collect.  If this is a payment/writeoff/adjustment, this is the new balance after the transaction amount is applied to the debt.

columns.name: FKeyType
columns.summary: Enum:TsiFKeyType - Used in conjunction with FKey to point to the item that this log row represents.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: Foreign key to the table defined by the corresponding FKeyType.  Currently supports paysplit.SplitNum, claimproc.ClaimProcNum, adjustment.AdjNum, procedurelog.ProcNum, payplan.PayPlanNum, payplancharge.PayPlanChargeNum.

columns.name: RawMsgText
columns.summary: Raw pipe-delimited message sent to TSI.

columns.name: ClientId
columns.summary: If ServiceType for the placement is TsiDemandType.AcceleratorPr, this will be the Accelerator/Profit Recovery client ID. If TsiServiceType.Collection it will be the Collection client ID. Will always match the first field, Client Number, in the RawMsgText.

columns.name: TransJson
columns.summary: Json serialized string representation of the TsiTrans list used to calculate the account balance for this guarantor at the time o placement with Transworld.  Used to update Transworld if any of the transactions are modified after placement.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  This will be 0 if clinics are not enabled.  This will be 0 for logs prior to version 18.4.

columns.name: AggTransLogNum
columns.summary: FK to tsitranslog.TransLogNum.  Will be 0 if not part of an aggregate group.  Will be 0 for logs prior to version 18.4.

name: ucum
summary: Unified Code for Units of Measure.  UCUM is not a stricly defined list of codes but is instead a language definition that allows for all units and derived units to be named.  Examples: g (grams), g/L (grams per liter), g/L/s (grams per liter per second), g/L/s/s (grams per liter per second per second), etc... are all allowed units meaning there is an infinite number of units that can be defined using UCUM conventions.  The codes stored in this table are merely a common subset that was readily available and premade.

columns.name: UcumNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: UcumCode
columns.summary: Indexed.  Also called concept code. Example: mol/mL

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Also called Concept Name.  Human readable form of the UCUM code. Example: Moles Per MilliLiter [Substance Concentration Units]

columns.name: IsInUse
columns.summary: True if this unit of measure is or has ever been in use.  Useful for assisting users to select common units.

name: updatehistory
summary: Makes an entry every time Open Dental has successfully updated to a newer version. New entries will always be for the newest version being used so that users can see a "history" of how long they used previous versions. This will also help EHR customers when attesting or when they get audited.

columns.name: UpdateHistoryNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: DateTimeUpdated
columns.summary: DateTime that OD was updated to the Version.

columns.name: ProgramVersion
columns.summary: The version that OD was updated to.

columns.name: Signature
columns.summary: Obfuscated string containing when and who accepted the license agreement.

name: userclinic
summary: This creates a many-to-many relationship between users and clinics. An entry in this table means that the user has access to the clinic. Not used unless userod.ClinicIsRestricted is turned on for a user.  Userod.Clinic is also used separately, regardless of whether this table is used. Provider access is derived from this by using the userod.ProvNum.

columns.name: UserClinicNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum

name: usergroup
summary: A group of users.  Security permissions are determined by the usergroup of a user.

columns.name: UserGroupNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: UserGroupNumCEMT
columns.summary: FK to usergroup.UserGroupNum.  The user group num within the Central Manager database.  Only editable via CEMT.  Can change when CEMT syncs.

name: usergroupattach
summary: Allows multiple groups to be attached to a user.  Security permissions are determined by the usergroups of a user.

columns.name: UserGroupAttachNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

columns.name: UserGroupNum
columns.summary: FK to usergroup.UserGroupNum.

name: userod
summary: (User OD since "user" is a reserved word) Users are a completely separate entity from Providers and Employees even though they can be linked. A usernumber can never be changed, ensuring a permanent way to record database entries and leave an audit trail.  A user can be a provider, employee, or neither.
