columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Password
columns.summary: The password details in a "HashType$Salt$Hash" format, separating the different fields by '$'. This is NOT the actual password but the encoded password hash. If the contents of this variable are not in the aforementioned format, it is assumed to be a legacy password hash (MD5).

columns.name: UserGroupNum
columns.summary: Deprecated. Use UserGroupAttaches to link Userods to UserGroups.

columns.name: EmployeeNum
columns.summary: FK to employee.EmployeeNum. Used for timecards to block access by other users.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  Default clinic for this user.  It causes new patients to default to this clinic when entered by this user.  If 0, then user has no default clinic or default clinic is HQ if clinics are enabled. Also see userod.ClinicIsRestricted and userclinic table.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  It is possible to have multiple userods attached to a single provider.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: Set true to hide user from login list.

columns.name: TaskListInBox
columns.summary: FK to tasklist.TaskListNum.  0 if no inbox setup yet.  It is assumed that the TaskList is in the main trunk, but this is not strictly enforced.  User can't delete an attached TaskList, but they could move it.

columns.name: AnesthProvType
columns.summary: Defaults to 3 (regular user) unless specified. Helps populates the Anesthetist, Surgeon, Assistant and Circulator dropdowns properly on FormAnestheticRecord /

columns.name: DefaultHidePopups
columns.summary: If set to true, the BlockSubsc button will start out pressed for this user.

columns.name: PasswordIsStrong
columns.summary: Gets set to true if strong passwords are turned on, and this user changes their password to a strong password.  We don't store actual passwords, so this flag is the only way to tell.

columns.name: ClinicIsRestricted
columns.summary: When true, prevents user from having access to clinics that are not in the corresponding userclinic table. Many places throughout the program will optionally remove the 'All' option from this user when true. Also see userod.ClinicNum and userclinic table. This field handles the double negative issue because the default must be no restriction.

columns.name: InboxHidePopups
columns.summary: If set to true, the BlockInbox button will start out pressed for this user.

columns.name: UserNumCEMT
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  The user num within the Central Manager database.  Only editable via CEMT.  Can change when CEMT syncs.

columns.name: DateTFail
columns.summary: The date and time of the most recent log in failure for this user.  Set to MinValue after user logs in successfully.

columns.name: FailedAttempts
columns.summary: The number of times this user has failed to log into their account.  Set to 0 after user logs in successfully.

columns.name: DomainUser
columns.summary: The username for the ActiveDirectory user to link the account to. Consists of the Pref DomainObjectGuid followed by the domain user name. Example:634dd357-3902-48e2-b6d3-9b84dada6bd2\KyleG.

columns.name: IsPasswordResetRequired
columns.summary: Boolean.  If true, the user's password needs to be reset on next login.

columns.name: MobileWebPin
columns.summary: A hashed pin that is used for mobile web validation on eClipboard. Not used in OD proper.

columns.name: MobileWebPinFailedAttempts
columns.summary: The number of attempts the mobile web pin has failed. Reset on successful attempt.

columns.name: DateTLastLogin
columns.summary: Minimum date if last login date and time is unknown. Otherwise contians the last date and time this user successfully logged in.

columns.name: EClipboardClinicalPin
columns.summary: Pin for ODT. This is the hashed value of the pin. Not used in OD proper.

columns.name: BadgeId
columns.summary: A unique number that corresponds to the number on an employee badge. The last numbers on an employee badge. Will be 1 to 4 digits. These numbers are assigned to the badges by the factory. We order a specific range of badges, such as 1801-2000, which are assigned in order and not reused to avoid duplicates. The first four digits on the badges are not used by the Lenel OnGuard software, so we do not use them here either.

name: userodapptview
summary: Keeps track of the last appointment view used on a per user basis.  Users can have multiple rows in this table when using clinics.

columns.name: UserodApptViewNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.  0 if clinics is not being used or if the user has not been assigned a clinic.

columns.name: ApptViewNum
columns.summary: FK to apptview.ApptViewNum.

name: userodpref
summary: Typically just a few for each user.

columns.name: UserOdPrefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

columns.name: Fkey
columns.summary: Foreign key to a table associated with FkeyType.  Can be 0 if the user preference does not need a foreign key. Used for program, clinicLast, SheetDef.SheetDefNum, ImageCats

columns.name: FkeyType
columns.summary: Enum:UserOdFkeyType Specifies which flag is overridden for the specified definition, since an individual definition can have multiple flags.

columns.name: ValueString
columns.summary: Used to hold the override, which might be a simple primitive value, a comma separated list, or a complex document in xml.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to Clinic.ClinicNum, The default clinic for a User. This is duplicate info that's already available in userod.ClinicNum, but having it here might allow simpler queries or linq.

name: userquery
summary: A list of query favorites that users can run.

columns.name: QueryNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: Description
columns.summary: Description.

columns.name: FileName
columns.summary: The name of the file to export to.

columns.name: QueryText
columns.summary: The text of the query.

columns.name: IsReleased
columns.summary: Determines whether the query is safe for users with lower permissions.  Also causes this user query to be available in the Main Menu, Reports, Query Favorites Filtered.

columns.name: IsPromptSetup
columns.summary: Determines whether the Query Favorites window should prompt for query values via FormQueryParser/'SET Fields' popup when running query.

columns.name: DefaultFormatRaw
columns.summary: Determines whether the UserQuery window loads with the 'Raw' format radio button pre-selected. For a new userquery, this is set based on pref.UserQueryDefaultRaw.

name: userweb
summary: Holds credentials for web applications.  Each userweb entry should be linked to a table type or entity of sorts. E.g. Patient Portal credentials will have an FKey to patient.PatNum and an FKeyType linked to "UserWebFKeyType.PatientPortal".

columns.name: UserWebNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: FKey
columns.summary: Foreign key to the table defined by the corresponding FKeyType.

columns.name: FKeyType
columns.summary: Enum:UserWebFKeyType The type of row that identifies which table FKey links to.

columns.name: Password
columns.summary: The password details in a "HashType$Salt$Hash" format, separating the different fields by '$'.  This is NOT the actual password but the encoded password hash.  If the contents of this variable are not in the aforementioned format, it is assumed to be a legacy password hash (MD5).

columns.name: PasswordResetCode
columns.summary: A randomly generated code that can be used to reset the password.

columns.name: RequireUserNameChange
columns.summary: Set to true to require a user to change their UserName.

columns.name: DateTimeLastLogin
columns.summary: The last time when the user used their credentials to log in.

columns.name: RequirePasswordChange
columns.summary: Set to true to require a user to change their Password.

name: utm
summary: A UTM (urchin tracking module) code is a simple string that you can add to the end of a URL to track the performance of campaigns and content.

columns.name: UtmNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: CampaignName
columns.summary: Text that identifies a specific campaign or promotion identifying why traffic is being directed to the users website.

columns.name: MediumInfo
columns.summary: Text that tracks how traffic is getting to the users website, such as email or social media.

columns.name: SourceInfo
columns.summary: Text that identifies where traffic is originating from.

name: vaccinedef
summary: A vaccine definition.  Should not be altered once linked to VaccinePat.

columns.name: VaccineDefNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: VaccineName
columns.summary: Name of vaccine.  RXA-5-2.

columns.name: DrugManufacturerNum
columns.summary: FK to drugmanufacturer.DrugManufacturerNum.

name: vaccineobs
summary: Vaccine observation.  There may be multiple vaccine observations for each vaccine.

columns.name: VaccineObsNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: VaccinePatNum
columns.summary: FK to vaccinepat.VaccinePatNum.

columns.name: ValType
columns.summary: Enum:VaccineObsType Coded, Dated, Numeric, Text, DateAndTime.  Used in HL7 OBX-2.

columns.name: IdentifyingCode
columns.summary: Enum:VaccineObsIdentifier  Identifies the observation question.  Used in HL7 OBX-3.

columns.name: ValReported
columns.summary: The observation value.  The type of the value depends on the ValType.  Used in HL7 OBX-5.

columns.name: ValCodeSystem
columns.summary: Enum:VaccineObsValCodeSystem  CVX, HL70064.  The observation value code system when ValType is Coded.  Used in HL7 OBX-5.

columns.name: VaccineObsNumGroup
columns.summary: FK to vaccineobs.VaccineObsNum.  All vaccineobs records with matching GroupId are in the same group.  Set to 0 if this vaccine observation is not part of a group.  Used in HL7 OBX-4.

columns.name: UcumCode
columns.summary: Used in HL7 OBX-6.

columns.name: DateObs
columns.summary: Date of observation.  Used in HL7 OBX-14.

columns.name: MethodCode
columns.summary: Code from code set CDCPHINVS (this code system is not yet fully defined, so user has to enter manually).  Used in HL7 OBX-17.  Only required when IdentifyingCode is FundPgmEligCat.

name: vaccinepat
summary: A vaccine given to a patient on a date.

columns.name: VaccinePatNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: VaccineDefNum
columns.summary: FK to vaccinedef.VaccineDefNum.  Can be 0 if and only if CompletionStatus=NotAdministered, in which case CVX code is assumed to be 998 (not administered) and there is no manufacturer.

columns.name: DateTimeStart
columns.summary: The datetime that the vaccine was administered.

columns.name: DateTimeEnd
columns.summary: Typically set to the same as DateTimeStart.  User can change.

columns.name: AdministeredAmt
columns.summary: Size of the dose of the vaccine.  0 indicates unknown and gets converted to 999 on HL7 output.

columns.name: DrugUnitNum
columns.summary: FK to drugunit.DrugUnitNum. Unit of measurement of the AdministeredAmt.  0 represents null.  When going out in HL7 RXA-7, the units must be valid UCUM or the export will be blocked. Sometime in the future, we may want to convert this column to a string and name it "UcumCode".  For now left alone for backwards compatibility.

columns.name: LotNumber
columns.summary: Optional.  Used in HL7 RXA-9.1.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: Note
columns.summary: Documentation sometimes required.

columns.name: FilledCity
columns.summary: The city where the vaccine was filled.  This can be different than the practice office city for historical vaccine information.  Exported in HL7 ORC-3.

columns.name: FilledST
columns.summary: The state where the vaccine was filled.  This can be different than the practice office state for historical vaccine infromation.  Exported in HL7 ORC-3.

columns.name: CompletionStatus
columns.summary: Enum:VaccineCompletionStatus Exported in HL7 RXA-20.  Corresponds to HL7 table 0322 (guide page 225).

columns.name: AdministrationNoteCode
columns.summary: Enum:VaccineAdministrationNote Exported in HL7 RXA-9.  Corresponds to CDC code set NIP001 (http://hl7v2-iz-testing.nist.gov/mu-immunization/).

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.  The user that the vaccine was entered by.  May be 0 for vaccines added before this column was created.  Exported in HL7 ORD-10.

columns.name: ProvNumOrdering
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  The provider who ordered the vaccine.  Exported in HL7 ORD-12.

columns.name: ProvNumAdminister
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.  The provider who administered the vaccine.  Exported in HL7 RXA-10.

columns.name: DateExpire
columns.summary: The date that the vaccine expires.  Exported in HL7 RXA-16.

columns.name: RefusalReason
columns.summary: Enum:VaccineRefusalReason Exported in HL7 RXA-18. Corresponds to CDC code set NIP002 (http://hl7v2-iz-testing.nist.gov/mu-immunization/).

columns.name: ActionCode
columns.summary: Enum:VaccineAction Exported in HL7 RXA-21.  Corresponds to HL7 table 0323 (guide page 225).

columns.name: AdministrationRoute
columns.summary: Enum:VaccineAdministrationRoute Exported in HL7 RXR-1.  Corresponds to HL7 table 0162 (guide page 200).

columns.name: AdministrationSite
columns.summary: Enum:VaccineAdministrationSite Exported in HL7 RXR-2.  Corresponds to HL7 table 0163 (guide page 201).

name: vitalsign
summary: For EHR module, one dated vital sign entry.  BMI is calulated on demand based on height and weight and may be one of 4 ALOINC codes. 39156-5 "Body mass index (BMI) [Ratio]" is most applicable.

columns.name: VitalsignNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: Height
columns.summary: Height of patient in inches. Fractions might be needed some day.  Allowed to be 0.  Six possible LOINC codes, most applicable is 8302-2, "Body height".

columns.name: Weight
columns.summary: Lbs.  Allowed to be 0. Six possible LOINC codes, most applicable is 29463-7, "Body weight".

columns.name: BpSystolic
columns.summary: Units are mmHg (millimeters of mercury). Allowed to be 0. LOINC code 8480-6.

columns.name: BpDiastolic
columns.summary: Units are mmHg (millimeters of mercury). Allowed to be 0. LOINC code 8462-4.

columns.name: DateTaken
columns.summary: The date that the vitalsigns were taken.

columns.name: HasFollowupPlan
columns.summary: For an abnormal BMI measurement this must be true in order to meet quality measurement.

columns.name: IsIneligible
columns.summary: If a BMI was not recorded, this must be true in order to meet quality measurement.  For children, this is used as an IsPregnant flag, the only valid reason for not taking BMI on children.

columns.name: Documentation
columns.summary: A general note inside the VS window.

columns.name: WeightCode
columns.summary: Used for CQMs.  SNOMED CT code either Normal="", Overweight="238131007", or Underweight="248342006".  Set when BMI is found to be "out of range", based on age groups.  Should be calculated when vital sign is saved.  Calculate based on age as of Jan 1 of the year vitals were taken.  Not currently displayed to user.

columns.name: HeightExamCode
columns.summary: FK to ehrcode.CodeValue.  Also FK to LOINC.LoincCode.  Used for CQMs.  LOINC code used to describe the height exam performed.  Examples: Body Height Measured=3137-7, Body Height Stated=3138-5, Body Height --pre surgery=8307-1.  We will default to Body Height=8302-2, but user can choose another from the list of 6 allowed.  Can be blank if BP only.

columns.name: WeightExamCode
columns.summary: FK to ehrcode.CodeValue.  Also FK to LOINC.LoincCode.  Used for CQMs.  LOINC code used to describe the weight exam performed.  Examples: Body Weight Measured=3141-9, Body Weight Stated=3142-7, Body Weight --with clothes=8350-1.  We will default to Body Weight=29463-7, but user can choose another from the list of 6 allowed.  Can be blank if BP only.

columns.name: BMIExamCode
columns.summary: FK to ehrcode.CodeValue.  Also FK to LOINC.LoincCode.  Used for CQMs.  LOINC code used to describe the BMI percentile calculated.  We will use LOINC 59576-9 - BMI Percentile Per age and gender.  Can be blank if BP only.

columns.name: EhrNotPerformedNum
columns.summary: FK to ehrnotperformed.EhrNotPerformedNum.  This will link a vitalsign to the EhrNotPerformed object where the reason not performed will be stored.  The linking will allow us to display the not performed reason directly in the vital sign window and will make CQM queries easier.  Will be 0 if not linked to an EhrNotPerformed object.

columns.name: PregDiseaseNum
columns.summary: FK to disease.DiseaseNum.  This will link this vitalsign object to a pregnancy diagnosis for this patient.  It will be 0 for non pregnant patients.  The disease it is linked to will be inserted automatically based on the default value set.  In order to change this code for this specific exam it will have to be changed in the problems list.

columns.name: BMIPercentile
columns.summary: BMI percentile of patient, based on gender and age and the calculated BMI.  We will use the CDC numbers to calculate percentile found here: (http://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data/series/sr_11/sr11_246.pdf).

columns.name: Pulse
columns.summary: Recorded pulse of the patient. Stored in beats per minute.

columns.name: WebSchedCarrierRuleNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

columns.name: CarrierName
columns.summary: Name of the carrier.

columns.name: DisplayName
columns.summary: Set by the user. This is what is shown as a selection for the patient in the WebSched UI.

columns.name: Message
columns.summary: Return message sent back to patients through WebSched. Set by the office after a patient has made a carrier selection.

columns.name: Rule
columns.summary: Enum:RuleType Allow, AllowWithInput, AllowWithMessage, Block.

columns.name: RecallNum

columns.name: ReminderCount

columns.name: DateTimeSent

columns.name: DateTimeSendFailed

columns.name: ShortGUID

columns.name: ResponseDescript
columns.summary: Generated by OD in some cases and HQ in others. Any human readable error message generated by either HQ or EConnector. Used for debugging.

columns.name: Source
columns.summary: Enum:WebSchedRecallSource Where this row came from.

columns.name: CommlogNum
columns.summary: FK to commlog associated to this WebSchedRecall.

columns.name: MessageType
columns.summary: Enum:CommType The type of message being sent for this recall.

columns.name: MessageFk
columns.summary: FK to primary key of appropriate table.

columns.name: ApptReminderRuleNum
columns.summary: FK to apptreminderrule.ApptReminderRuleNum. Allows us to look up the rules to determine how to send this apptcomm out.

name: wikilistheaderwidth
summary: Keeps track of column widths in Wiki Lists.

columns.name: WikiListHeaderWidthNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ListName
columns.summary: Name of the list that this header belongs to.  Tablename without the prefix.

columns.name: ColName
columns.summary: Name of the column that this header belongs to.

columns.name: ColWidth
columns.summary: Width in pixels of column.

columns.name: PickList
columns.summary: Newline delimited list of options for the user to select from when adding or editing a wiki list item.

columns.name: IsHidden
columns.summary: Hide or show this column in the UI.

name: wikilisthist
summary: Rows never edited, just added.  Contains all historical versions of each list.

columns.name: WikiListHistNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

columns.name: ListName
columns.summary: Will not be unique because there are multiple revisions per page.

columns.name: ListHeaders
columns.summary: The contents of the corresponding WikiListHeaderWidths row converted to a string in format ColName1,ColWidth1;ColName2,ColWidth2;...  Database type text/varChar2(4000) (65K/4K)

columns.name: ListContent
columns.summary: The entire contents of the revision are stored as XML.  Database type mediumtext/clob (16M,4G)

columns.name: DateTimeSaved
columns.summary: The DateTime from the original WikiPage object.

name: wikipage
summary: Rows never edited, just added, unless the wiki page is a draft.  Contains only newest versions of each page and all drafts.

columns.name: WikiPageNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

columns.name: PageTitle
columns.summary:
Must be unique.  Any character is allowed except: , 
, and ".  Needs to be tested, especially with apostrophes.

columns.name: KeyWords
columns.summary: Automatically filled from the [[Keywords:]] tab in the PageContent field as page is being saved.

columns.name: PageContent
columns.summary: Content of page stored in "wiki markup language".  This should never be updated, unless it is a draft.  Medtext (16M)

columns.name: DateTimeSaved
columns.summary: The DateTime that the page was saved to the DB.  User can't directly edit.

columns.name: IsDraft
columns.summary: Signifies that the wiki page is a draft, and will only show in the Wiki Drafts form.

columns.name: IsLocked
columns.summary: Records if a wiki page is locked.  If it is locked, only user swith the WikiAdmin permission are allowed to edit the page

columns.name: IsDeleted
columns.summary: This flag will be set when the user archives the WikiPage.

columns.name: PageContentPlainText
columns.summary: Content of page stored without any HTML markup or wiki page links.  This plain text allows for easier searching.

name: wikipagehist
summary: Rows never edited, just added.  Contains all historical versions of each page as well.

columns.name: WikiPageNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: UserNum
columns.summary: FK to userod.UserNum.

columns.name: PageTitle
columns.summary: Will not be unique because there are multiple revisions per page.

columns.name: PageContent
columns.summary: The entire contents of the revision are stored in "wiki markup language".  This should never be updated.  Medtext (16M)

columns.name: DateTimeSaved
columns.summary: The DateTime from the original WikiPage object.

columns.name: IsDeleted
columns.summary: This flag will only be set for the revision where the user marked it deleted, not the ones prior.

name: xchargetransaction
summary: XCharge transactions that have been imported into OD.  Used by reconcile tool.  Keeps a history, but no references to these rows from other tables.

columns.name: XChargeTransactionNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: TransType
columns.summary: Usually "CCPurchase."

columns.name: Amount
columns.summary: Amount.

columns.name: CCEntry
columns.summary: Credit card entry method. Usually "Keyed".

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: Result
columns.summary: Result: AP for approved, DECLINE for declined.

columns.name: ClerkID
columns.summary: ClerkID. Open Dental username with a possible "R" at the end to indicate a recurring charge.

columns.name: ResultCode
columns.summary: ResultCode: 000 for approved, 005 for declined.

columns.name: Expiration
columns.summary: Expiration is shown as a four digit number (string since it may contain leading zeros).

columns.name: CCType
columns.summary: VISA, AMEX, MC, DISC etc.

columns.name: CreditCardNum
columns.summary: Usually looks like 123456XXXXXX7890.

columns.name: BatchNum
columns.summary: BatchNum.

columns.name: ItemNum
columns.summary: ItemNum. Starts at 0001 for each batch.

columns.name: ApprCode
columns.summary: Approval code. 6 characters. 72142Z for example.

columns.name: TransactionDateTime
columns.summary: TransactionDateTime. Is taken from the Date and Time columns in X-Charge.

columns.name: BatchTotal
columns.summary: BatchTotal. Stores the BatchTotal from XCharge. This is a cumulative value for all transactions up to this row in the same batch. BatchTotal from the last transaction in a batch should match the sum of all the Amount fields for the same batch

name: xwebresponse
summary:
Received as XML output from XWeb gateway. Not all fields are available for all method calls. This is a combination of all possible output fields. 
The fields that are available are dependent on which method was called and the given result. 
HPF (XWeb Hosted Payment Form) Payments and HPF CC Alias creations will each enter a row in this table. That row will be monitored by the eConnector and updated when the 
changes from Pending. 
 -- 1) Create the row and indicate the HPF/OTK. 
 -- 2) Poll the OTK (one-time key) until an XWebResponseCode is available. Update the row with information about the transaction. 
DTG (XWeb Direct To Gateway) Will enter 1 row in this table. 
 -- 1) Make the DTG payment using a pre-authorized CC alias. Create row with information about the transaction. 
Any fields prefixed with 'Gateaway output' come directly as XML output from the XWeb Gateway. All other fields are derived by OD. 
The class instance will created by eConnector by deserializing an XML string as received from XWeb Gateway. 
The fields names MUST NOT CHANGE for this reason. XML will not deserialize if the names do not match EXACTLY.

columns.name: XWebResponseNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: PatNum
columns.summary: FK to patient.PatNum.

columns.name: ProvNum
columns.summary: FK to provider.ProvNum.

columns.name: ClinicNum
columns.summary: FK to clinic.ClinicNum.

columns.name: PaymentNum
columns.summary: FK to payment.PayNum.

columns.name: DateTEntry
columns.summary: Timestamp at which this row was created. Auto generated on insert.

columns.name: DateTUpdate
columns.summary: Timestamp at which this row was last updated. Will be updated each time the OTK status is polled and one final time when XWebResponseCode changes from Pending.

columns.name: TransactionStatus
columns.summary: Inidicates which phase of the XWeb process this transaction is in. See class summary for details.

columns.name: ResponseCode
columns.summary: Gateaway output. Pre-defined responses generated by XWeb. Will be converted to strongly typed enum XWebResponseCode.

columns.name: XWebResponseCode
columns.summary: Enum:XWebResponseCodes Strongly typed representation of ResponseCode. Initialized by XWebInputAbs.CreateGatewayResponse().

columns.name: ResponseDescription
columns.summary: Gateaway output. Gives a more detailed description on the ResponseCode.

columns.name: OTK
columns.summary: Gateaway output. This is the One Time Key that is used to launch the Hosted Payment Form. he status of the OTK can be polled to determine if the end user has completed the HPF or if it has expired.

columns.name: HpfUrl
columns.summary: This URL will be generated as a result of the OTK. The URL can be browsed in an IFRAME to create a secure portal between a browser and the XWeb server. It is used with EdgeExpress now that HPF is deprecated.

columns.name: HpfExpiration
columns.summary: Timestamp at which this HPF will expire. The end user will only be able to access the HPF before it has expired. This expiration is set explicitly when creating the HPF.

columns.name: TransactionID
columns.summary: Gateaway output. Each transaction is given a reference for future use. This can be used to void the transaction.

columns.name: TransactionType
columns.summary: Gateaway output. The type of transaction that was processed. Must be a string data type because it comes from the Gateway as a string.

columns.name: Alias
columns.summary: Gateaway output. A credit transaction will return an alias which is now linked to the credit card which was used.  This alias can be used in the future to make DTG payments and circumvent the need for the secure HPF. Only applies when Credit (not Debit) data is submitted on the HPF.  CreditCard.XChargeToken is often set to this value.

columns.name: CardType
columns.summary:
Gateaway output. The card type used for this transaction.
"Credit" - for cards that support signature only.
"Debit/Credit" - for cards that support either PIN-entry or signature.
"Debit/ATM" - for cards that support PIN-entry only.
"FSA" - for Flexible Spending Accounts

columns.name: CardBrand
columns.summary: Gateaway output. The card brand used for this transaction. Possible values include "Visa", "MasterCard", "Discover", "American Express", "Diners Club", "JCB", "PayPal".

columns.name: CardBrandShort
columns.summary: Gateaway output. The industry standard abbreviation of the card brand. Possible values include "VS", "MC", "DS", "AX", "DCIDISC", "JCB-DISC", "PP" (order respective to CardBrand above).

columns.name: MaskedAcctNum
columns.summary: Gateaway output. Provides a masked format of the account number. The format will show the last 4 digits, the remainder will masked out with an asterisk character. End user will be presented with a list of previously generated MaskedAcctNum(s) when making a payment. These are linked to an alias which can be used to make a DTG payment. This ciccumvents the need to use the HPF.

columns.name: Amount
columns.summary: Gateaway output. Amount of credit card and check transactions.

columns.name: ApprovalCode
columns.summary: Gateaway output. A 6 digit authorization approval code.

columns.name: CardCodeResponse
columns.summary: Gateaway output. Response from the Card Security Code lookup. Only applies when Credit(not Debit) data is submitted on the HPF.

columns.name: ReceiptID
columns.summary: Gateaway output. An identification number assigned by the OpenEdge Gateway to the receipt.

columns.name: ExpDate
columns.summary: Gateaway output. Provides the Expiration Date of the account being accessed. Format is yyMM from XWeb gateway. Will be converted to ExpirationDate.

columns.name: EntryMethod
columns.summary: Gateaway output. Indicates how the account number was entered by the end user. Always 'KEYED' in our case.

columns.name: ProcessorResponse
columns.summary: Gateaway output. The response from the processor. It is only returned on transactions that are processed by the processor (Auth, Sales and Settlements).

columns.name: BatchNum
columns.summary: Gateaway output. This indicates the current open batch number.

columns.name: BatchAmount
columns.summary: Gateaway output. Net amount of Credit and Debit Card transactions in batch.

columns.name: AccountExpirationDate
columns.summary: The expiration date of the credit card that was referenced in this transaction. DateTime representation of ExpDate. Initialized by XWebInputAbs.CreateGatewayResponse().

columns.name: DebugError
columns.summary: Debug information regarding this response. Can only be set by XWebResponses.ProcessOutstandingTransactions().

columns.name: PayNote
columns.summary: Will be entered as Payment.PayNote once payment transaction has completed.

columns.name: CCSource
columns.summary: Enum:CreditCardSource The source of where this transaction originated from.

columns.name: OrderId
columns.summary: Generated by us but necessary for Card Not Present API calls. Used to link transactions together (e.g. for returns).

columns.name: EmailResponse
columns.summary: Email address used for a requested receipt provided by the user when making a payment via the patient portal.

columns.name: LogGuid
columns.summary: The GUID used in EserviceLogs related to this response. May be blank.

name: zipcode
summary: Zipcodes are also known as postal codes.  Zipcodes are always copied to patient records rather than linked.  So items in this list can be freely altered or deleted without harming patient data.

columns.name: ZipCodeNum
columns.summary: Primary key.

columns.name: ZipCodeDigits
columns.summary: The actual zipcode.

columns.name: IsFrequent
columns.summary: If true, then it will show in the dropdown list in the patient edit window.
